review: Everyone knows the excellence of GTA V. I could have got it for PS4 but decided to wait for the PC version for the obvious benefits (mod support community graphical improvements... the list goes on). So far I have had a great time in both single player and multiplayer. This is the first GTA game I have played since my younger years playing the top down retro version at the games beginning. The multiplayer aspect could so with some fine tuning in terms of match making and the levelling system which can be a bit grindy in places but this is countered by a huge variety in things to do to gain XP from which makes the grind much more entertaining. When you do get into a decent size lobby of a game or team up with your companions this game comes into its own and provides a unique sense of entertainment that is hard to come by in modern games. The single player campaign has a entertaining storyline mixed with a huge variety of things to do which keep you enthralled and wanting more. Graphics 9/10Gameplay 8/10Multiplayer 8.5/10Flying mechanics 4/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've had no issue with the Social Club application but I installed that way before buying this game. The social club launcher works then I get this error. ERR_GFX_D3D_NOD3D1X_4 No DirectX 10 or 11 adapter or runtime found. Please install latest DirectX runtime or install a compatible DirectX 10 or 11 video card.I have directX 11 installed (I triple checked and reinstalled) so the error is baloney. I'm also running a dual monitor display the main one using a GeForce GTX 760 and the other using Intel HD Graphics 4000. I tried disabling the second monitor. to no avail. Same error comes up. None of the websites talking about errors have any idea about this particular issue and I'm beginning to suspect I'm the only who has it. Either way until I can get ahold of support to get it fixed I can't recommend buying this game.

review: Pros Trevor.Cons The always online DRM practice is extremely annoying and inconvenient. I am not blessed with an amazing internet connection. Therefore many times I am unable to play the game. I understand the rational behind a DRM business practice but by disregarding the customer satisfaction for profit such a policy does more harm than good. I will not repeat the mistake by purchasing a game with DRM policy ever again.The game menu is a complete pain. For example it requires multiple loading sessions to simply initiate a friends only session which should be readily available on the main menu screen. Vehicle stats are not accurate. I suggest either looking online to see the true car speeds or purchasing them in single player before wasting time/money online. Moreover the vehicle customization options are very limited.Internal housing/apartment and garage layouts often does not correspond with the external structures. Yoga. NPCs and cops are inept.Cheating is prolific online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So I was doing these missions for a bounty hunter. They gave me a list of people to kill or pick up and bring to them. The last contract was the prettiest NPC I've seen so far. So I was like "maybe instead of killing her or delivering her to the bounty hunter we can marry and live a life of crime together." So I stole a moving truck on my way to pick her up (I wanted her to know I was serious) and as soon as she saw me she started throwing punches trying to beat my But I subdued her and got her to get in my van with me. I took the long way to the bounty hunter's house winding roads starry night Pat benetar on the radio the works. We got to the bounty hunter's house and i ased her if this was what she really wanted. She didn't respond. I turned her in. I cried. Then the bounty hunter told me she had a secret hidden treasure somewhere on the mountain I gasped. She left her fortune to me. I searched high and low but couldn't find it In grief I threw myself off the highest point of the mountain and died. 10/10 would play again.

review: Pros The game itself is good fun to play.Unlike Assassin's Creed it fulfills your killing desire you can just kill anyone you don't like on the street(beware of the wanted level).You won't get bored in the big map of Los Santos there are plenty of random events located in the big Los Santos.Your greed will be fulfilled by doing all heist jobs and playing around with the share market.The storyline is interesting.It has many collectables for players to collect.The graphics are stunning and excellent.Cons The handling of some vehicles helicopters and planes is rather a big disaster.The keyboard input lag is an extremely seriously frustrating problem. You press W to drive your car forward after driving your car like 1 min and you release the W button your car still keeps driving forward itself !! Although after some time the input lag stops(if you are lucky it takes a few seconds if not 1 minute or longer) but it totally affects and ruins the smooth gameplay.However as a big fan of GTA I still love and support Rockstar products.If you do too I would 100% recommend this game!

review: Rockstar hasn't figured out the anti cheat for its online service there's a lot of people getting banned for false positives recently in addititon to the people who are caught legitimately cheating. Rockstar's support is nonexistent and their bot will mark all appeals and complaints as solved without acknowledgement. Their support phone number won't even pick up.That said I will recommend this game's singleplayer which is extremely rewarding and incredibly fun. There's a deep story like in all GTA games as well as witty dialogue.Conclusion Get this game when it's on sale and only for the singleplayer. The multiplayer is incredibly broken and will ban legitimate players without notice.

review: Offline 7/10 Grand Theft Auto 5 is a visually breathtaking achievement with some phenomenal gameplay mechanics but the writing has me at odds with it constantly shifting from smart satirical commentary to borderline cringeworthy fart humor. There's enough room for the main characters to have fun and become memorable in the series but playing this game start to finish for the 3rd time recently I could see that there was a noticable drop in quality from 4 to 5. The plot felt more like a straight to video sequel than a step up. I'm a huge fan of GTA 4 so this purely bias and isn't a big of a deal for most playing this game. I get it some people just want to shoot some pedestrians or get chased by the cops and call it a day. You will find that here without question.Online 5/10 I have never been more spilt on my opinion of an online mode like this before. On one hand I love how addictive the structure of creating your own criminal underworld with your friends actually can be. The majority of missions and heists hold up remarkably well for how much time you spend planning them. Additionally the huge updates and DLC that has been added at no cost to the player is refreshing and makes coming back to the game more enticing. On the other hand the purchase price for in game items are a huge slap in the face made only to promote giving into Rockstar's Shark Card microtransation options (ONE high end car can sometimes cost more than $30). Not to mention the god awful amounts of bugs slow server loading times and the infamous hatred Rockstar has garnered from modding communities. This is a huge problem that NEEDS to be addressed.I enjoy my time with GTA 5 and I'm always happy to come back to it from time to time. But if Rockstar has plans to make another online mode for their next title in this series somethings gotta give.

review: Contra Most of the things in GTA Online are fun however that EXCLUSIVELY applies if you play with friends.With them you have the ability to wait through the horrible Nightmare of being stuck in a loading screen to join a Race Online Lobby or practically anything that involves the Online Coding of GTA 5. This also applies to the Time it takes to Start GTA 5.Sure if you are in a Session with your friends and you're messing around with randoms its fun because then there is no loading inbetween the fun you have. However even then you have to have an eye on the randoms that only want to you up.About GTA 5 Offline You play it once maybe twice together with friends (with the friends watching not playing coop (thats not possible) and then you never touch it again. Thats because GTA 5 Offline is almost the 1st day version of the game and the updates that did happen didn't aim to make Offline enjoyable they only made it barely playable. Pro However I do have some good things to say about GTA 5 Online (only Online). Like I said playing with friends is fun playing custom maps (which however sometimes are hard af or even virtually unfinishable and good maps generally being rare to find) can also be a lot of fun races just as much as the other game modes. Summary In Summary i sadly cannot recommend this game as it is. Also all of this will probably never change because for Rockstar its not worth the effort to make the game fun again. In my opinion the only option is to wait for GTA 6 and hope they learn from their mistakes especially in modding and online coding.

review: I WANT GTA VI
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Wow. I was on the fence about getting this game for a few years but I recently sold my csgo knife bought the game.Am I ever impressedWhy Buy?this game has so much to offer such a polished rich world full of potential. It is a racing game a FPS a golfing game a crime game...or as I call it a do whatever you want gameIt feels like RockStar spent a very long time making every nook and cranny of this map. You can spend hours exploring the map on a dirt bike finding things that you woul not have expected to have been there this game is full of easter eggs. I won't spoil any here because finding them yourself is part of the fun. There is just so much to do and the game DOESN'T TRY TO STOP YOU! You want to do something? Do it!I haven't played that much of the game but I feel that there will be much to do for a very long time and I don't see myself getting bored anytime soon.PROS Pretty slam dunk graphics if you ask me especially with mods Well optimized (60 70 fps on my mid range PC med high settings!) Plenty of missions heists races and COMMUNITY MADE MAPS Lots of options for customization of cars your player guns and now your appartment! Free online DLC (Lowriders executives and other criminals etc) Large well populated and put together map In game micro transactions with Shark Cards are completely optional and not buying them takes nothing away from your experience.CONS Many users of Hacks and mod menus make the game painful sometimes. Rockstar does seem to be pretty good about bans though. Loading times and connection to Rockstar servers tends to be slow and spotty at times. Maybe it's just my internet P Sometimes a very evident console port but this doesn't really take away from the game. Use a controller if you wish. I don't.In ConclusionI think Rockstar has done an excellent job with this game. It has endless thigns to do places to explore and easter eggs to discover. A great game to play with friends. This is something I reccommend. Buy it with a couple other people playing with people you know is much more fun.9/10

Inevitably people will skip the story and go straight to online. The online is jam packed with features new cars new guns new clothes new taunts new gamemodes you get the point. Online seems to get more love than story which is a shame. Online does have its fair share of problems though. Everyone leaving the lobby at once LOTS of modders and hackers glitches like invincibility etc. Did I mention you need a beefy computer to run it? If you want to buy this game go for it I recommend it. If you're not sure maybe wait for a sale.Score 8/10

review: Oh my god I'm so glad it's finally available. With every new release it gets better. Last gen to current gen consoles and now PC. I wish I had a 4k screen to really test my graphics card. 1080p is still pretty too.Keyboard controls take some getting used to. A few commands are slightly out of reach but you don't need them often enough to be a problem. Supports 360/One controller out of the box and it feels just like the console control.I'll probably use both to be honest. Mouse/keyboard for running/shooting and controller for driving/flying. Analog steering for the win.The load times are near instant for single player and the online is significantly improved compared to the console.First time I joined online I tried to get the high priority export car only to be met with explosions and fire. 10/10 will explode again.

review: EDIT Many are angry over the OpenIV scandal surrounding Take Two and GTA V. I'll give my two cents as well. It's a shame how low GTA has become. The previous entries had great modding communities and so does GTA V but with the death of OpenIV which allows modding (not cheating) of game files Rockstar and Take Two are basically screwing their customers over. I've been a part of the community for a long time. My friends and I played a lot in multiplayer sessions for San Andreas which isn't possible without modders. GTA IV although poorly optimized still had tons of mods which were made possible by OpenIV. Stop thinking the community's your competition. You're already screwing over your playerbase with terrible online mode and microtransactions. Let people enjoy the game that they bought. If cheaters are your issue go after them. Not the modders. Not exactly the strongest GTA story wise. Despite Trevor being memorable and Michael and Franklin both likeable none of the other characters felt developed. But it's still GTA with the same formula even more improved. It's still fun gunplay is the best yet in the series and the world of San Andreas is a beautiful place to explore. While the single player is great GTA Online is a mess. A major disappointment Online loads painfully slow jobs are difficult to start with sessions crashing whenever someone exits. All in all great game. I just wish Rockstar would improve GTA Online and start making single player DLCs again.

review: Grand Theft Auto V The world of San Andreas is huge and there is much to do.The graphics are fairly good but far from the best I've ever seen. There are many different vehicles ranging from small bicycles to huge jumbojets. You can climb up to the top of skyskcrapers or go down into tunnels and subways under the city.The PC version of GTA V also added first person (console probably has it too now) wich was a good idea.The Online mode is fairly good (especially with friends) but has quite alot of cheaters and small kids.I think GTA V is a good game. I give it 8/10.

review: One of the best games to ever happen. Then Online mode came along GTAV became something even better until a scripthook was made. Modders have ruined everything in the online aspect of this game stealing your money cars weapons etc. Even blowing you up until you decide to not play online mode anymore. Rockstar's anti cheat is a hilarious failure. Hopefully I will come back to GTA Online once modding is banned.Update 1/2016 Bully modders seem to have dissipated quite a lot since I had last played GTA online. I even come across quite a few modders that mind their own business and not throw money or kill you make an unfair advantage against them. I think the communiyt has imporved since the bullies realised that either the game is boreing and dont play anymore or have finnaly gre balls and decided to play with others. Rockstar has had to put down strict modding rules and even taking down onnocents along the way. I applude this to deter modders from atttmpting to go online with theri mods. However with the recent mod servers I feel they should be an expection. I belive rockstar should keep their no modder policy but have mod servers for those looking to use GTA's full potential of customization and the one of the best reasons to get into GTA. Rockstar putting support into seperating modders from the vanilla players can pull in a whole new crowd and save GTA from circling the drain.

review: The single player part of GTA V is pretty good. But when it comes to multi player the game is TERRIBLE!GTA Online is totally screwed up thanks to all the cheaters who call themselves "modders". They can easily download a hack just by typing it in Google and give themselves godmode infinite amount of cash blow up players (even when they're in passive mode) ruin every race/deathmatch/adversary mode.Sure all games have hackers but this is different. Rockstar isn't doing ANYTHING to stop the hackers. They don't even care enough to atleast blacklist the public hacks. Seriously for a game big like GTA V is a proper anti cheat too much to ask? A hacker has to be reported 10 times by 10 different people with proper video evidence to make Rockstar look into it. And when that happens they get a 2 weeks ban then come back hacking again messing with other people.The single player mode of the game is pretty good but if you want to play it online think twice before buying it.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Third time buying this game and to say i'm impressed is an understatement. This game was impressive back on last gen consoles due to the shear scale of the game and now the graphics and gameplay have been updated with first person controls and mouse and keyboard its simply one of the best gaming expenices you can get.First off the game was worth the extra wait. Rockstar really spent that time optimizing this game to its full potential. It doesnt take much horsepower to push this game at 1080p and you can get away with 4k on a single higher end gpu. The most impressive feature about this version of the game has to be the unblieveable draw distance on the world. In the past versions it was as if you were near sighted but in this version you have perfect vision. It completely puts you into the game and i found myself constantly saying wow at the geourgous landscapes. Graphics are the best period60fps is a game changer in itself giving the world increadable smoothness and fluidity to everything you do. Overall Definately worth the money you spend for the game. Over 100 hours of content Best graphics you can get today.Argueably one of the best games in the last decade.10/10 No brainer to buy. PLus you can run this game on basically ANY computer.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The absolute best of what gaming has to offer. Rockstar has outdone themselves on this one. This is the very definition of how optimizing a game properly will directly relate to increased sales and a company's reputation. Kudos kudos kudos Rockstar. Thank you for not rushing an unfinished product to us thanks you for the delays most definitly worth the wait. Game publishers take note it is worth the freaking money and time to optimize your games before launch. Rockstar has proven yet again what is possible in the realm that is gaming. i am running an old i7 860 gtx 660ti 8g ddr3 ram and a crappy 5200 rpm hard drive and I am able to play the game very comfortably at a higher resolution than 1080p. This is why I dont mind delays on highly anticipated titles this is why I have bought the game twice this is why I will not purchase anything from ubisoft ever again. This isnt just a game release it is a revolution. A declaration of war to all those greedy companies who think we the gamers are saps to be milked for every last dime no matter the quality of the product. This is why rockstar deserves their billions and an apology from all you trolls who were hating because they refused to release an inferior product and update it later.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: You shouldn't ask why you should own this game. You should ask why you already don't. In a nod to the multi episodic GTA IV Rockstar has three characters for you to use in single player mode Franklin a young crook trying to hit it big Michael an old crook trying to retire Trevor a crazy crook who will remain crazy. Unlike past GTA's GTA V lets you in on the planning process for your big jobs. Will you take a stealthy approach to robbing the jewlery store like Gene Hackman and Delroy Lindo in Heist or will you rush the front with guns blazing? Expand your empire through buying local businesses (that occasionally need the owner's Midas touch) or playing the stock market. Become a member of the Epsilon Program brother brother! And when you've finally think you've had enough there's GTA Online it's San Andreas YOUR way! Create your own races and deathmatches! Start your own crew! Will you emulate the rum running gangsters of old? Will your crew opt to hold down the 'hood complete with blue bandanas and a bad attitude? Will you instead choose to join the brotherhood of an outlaw motorcycle club as a virtual one percenter? It's all up to you! Get this game TODAY!

review: I was scared that it wouldn't work because I still can't get GTA4 to play because of windows live errors. GTA 5 makes you log in through social club but its not nearly as bad. I have all the recommended specs and then some. The game is beautiful. I have the game on PS3 but haven't played it in so long that I'm ok with starting over. There are some new features new cars first person mode and online heists. I love 3rd person but 1st person feels extremely immersive like you're in the city. I don't need to see the back of my character's head. Also shooting controls are great with a mouse. No need for auto aim. Driving is tough though. I do have a controller and its a lot better with that. To sum it up the game runs great. NVIDIA came out with a driver last night so I was good to go.

review: I fully recommend this game to any GTA fan. I have played every single one of them since #3 and this is one of the most enjoyable versions of the series. Some of the key elements of the game I appreciate are the checkpoints in missions different playable characters with special action skills save option on the cell phone and the random events. I have not played online so I cannot comment on that other than I wish Rockstar would concentrate on releasing additional material for the single player game and not the online world. while overall this game is very fun it did fall short in a few places. The ability to rob a drive thru should be in this game. They took away the ability to eat food at the fast food chains instead of expanding on it / I think the game needed a better way to earn cash other than stocks. I have seen at least one casino in this game but it is not a place a game character can enter. Next the PoI markers. While the point of interest option is nice it needs a lot of work. Labeling or color coding for PoI would be more useful. The limit of 10 hinders the functionality as well. Finally I really miss the turf wars from GTA San Andreas. There are several gangs in this GTA so that seems like a missed opportunity.I almost forgot to mention...Danny McBride from Eastbound and Down has a character that does a radio show. It is hilarious &gt http //gta.wikia.com/wiki/Duane_EarlFinal Judgment Buy it on sale
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I would easily recommend this game for the single player alone. That was the main reason I bought it as my last experience of GTA online was on the xbox 360 when I first purchased GTA 5 and it was underwhelming.Now though GTA online overshadows the single player element in my opinion. There is so much more to do that you can literally sink hundreds of hours into this game. Yes there are players that are tools online and yes there are modders that are bigger tools but its really only a small bug bear. They cant really take away from the fun you will have as you can just join another lobby.As someone who had no intention of playing the mulitplayer element I am very happy with it. I could liteally do stunt races for hours and im not a big bfan of racing games lol and heists with a team that is decent is a lot of fun.From my experience this whole thing that you get banned for nothing isnt true (touch wood). Im guessing that all these people that claim to have been banned for nothing must have done something to flag them up but i dont know.As for shark cards shark cards are for people who value their time more than their money. Thats it. It can take a hell of a long time to grind out the cash to buy certain things in the game and casual players dont have that time so they buy shark cards. Or they cant be asssed with the grind lol. Gives rockstar more money so they dont charge you for all the GTA online goodness they release so its win win. It doesnt give them an unfair advantage as they cant purchase anything that isnt available to everyone.

review: GTA V The game that had its release date pushed back so many times you thought it would never be released from the consoles glutches. Lucky for you the game was finally released for PC after 2 long years and it was well worth the wait. I have put many hours into the "Beta Testing" version of the game on my 360 and the upgrade to a superior system was well worth it. Here is why I think you should/shouldn't buy this game Why it's worth More beautiful stunning and atleast 2 times more "Cinematic" as the versions of the game released for the consoles. I can on high settings get an almost constant 60 FPS all well having the game look 10x better. This is a damn good port. Unlike R*'s previous GTA port GTA V is flawless from the start. Speaking of good porting this game has the most detailed and indepth option menu I have ever seen in a game. You can alter almost every aspect of the game down to graphical settings keybindings (for both Kb/M and controller) and way more. Has a VRAM usage bar in the options menu so you can know how far you can push the graphics till you start seeing performance drops. Gameplay is amazing and there is loads to do. But I'm assuming most people have already seen gameplay/played the game so I'm not going to touch on it so much The community is amazing and there is a smaller amount of "Caw a doodie" kids that you would see on the consoles (I wonder why there was never a WIIU version...?) Reasons why you might NOT want to buy the game Requires you to sign into R*'s social club to be able to play the game. Which I'm assuming that the game has been out for a day now connecting to this shouldn't be a problem. Speaking of this social club you have to use it to add friends/invite friends/ect. You are not able to use steams handy "Shift+Tab" to add or join a friends game. The game does seem to eat up A LOT of VRAM so anything above 4 GB should be fine for all max (RIP 970s) All around I would say this game is worth your money and time.Here are my system specs if anyone was curious!GeForce GTX 970Intel Core i7 4790k CPU 4.00GHz16 GB RAMAlso be sure to update your drivers!Nvidia http //www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx?lang en usAMD http //support.amd.com/en us/download
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Pros I can't get enough of playing this game. Storyline is well written and in depth. A lot of detail put into this. I would honestly say this is in the lineup for game of the decade. Graphics are nice too. So much to do on a large map.Cons Performance and graphical issues. A game that I should be able to max out on my Nvidia 970 gtx with no problems I sadly have to run on normal settings or it will crash. I can get lucky at times and run it on ulta/high for between 1 minute or up to 2 hours before it randomly crashes. But as of now I can only play it on normal settings without it crashes. I have googled this issue in depth and it turns out a lot of people experience the same issue.

review: In terms of gameplay? very good 100% reccomendedHOWEVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!finding online matches is difficult not because of a lack of player base but because of constant crashing and or failing to connect to a host. The obvious solution would be to connect/create a lobby with a friend right? Wrong. The social club makes connecting with friends difficult and sometimes confusing As well as some people simply not being able to connect to one another for various reasons. On top of that the game has alot of texture and enviroment issues that seriously affect gameplay periodically through the session. Long load times and simply staying idle at various screens also increases the frustration level of a player simply waiting to get into a game. Many times if started from the "play GTAV online" option the game will try and connect to a session for about 5 minutes claim it failed and send you into singleplayer. This means it is actually faster to get into online by just starting the game regularly rather than using their "shortcut"dont get me wrong it is a very fun game definitivly the best one in the series for me but with the age of this game these issues should be resolved. If anyone at rockstar reads this then i have one thing to say please fix the current bugs before releasing any additional content past this point just fixing the current bugs would be like all new content in it of itself.

review: I'm not going to defend or accuse anyone with this review and just get to the point. GTA V is fun. Just like other GTA games. You rob steal murder and lie your way into fortune in this game and that is a fun enough experience. In addition though there are tons of side missions events purchases characters and weapons that make playing through the game a good time. Are there problems with the multiplayer? Yeah of course there are. There may be some more in this game than in others but it all works I personally haven't had issues with it and even doing online play is fun if far less rewarding. It's a nice addition though. If you're interested in this get it for the gameplay and world you can play around in. Don't depend on the multiplayer for enjoyment.

review: Very impressed.While I was not able to run the game at max settings I was able to maximize the graphics to a point where they still exceed the graphics seen in the current generation consoles like the ps4.I am running an aging AMD Phenom II x6 1100T (Turbo Core/CoolnQuiet disabled) 16GB of DDR3 and 2 Asus GTX 760's in SLI (4GB VRAM total)with the latest nvidia GTA V approved driversWhat I was impressed with the most is that the fact that this runs better than GTAIV... on the same hardware! Rockstar did not screw this up and has redeemed itself from that awful port that was GTA IV. While it is disappointing to hear that many people with odd windows account names were unable to install and run the game I feel as though a bug as that should not eclipse what a great game this turned out to be.Graphics aside (but seriously... WOW!) the game itself has not lost any of its luster gameplay wise in the 2 years its been out. GTA games just never get old. The game will have you hooked it's got me hooked on my third playthrough and with mod support expect the game to be even better than the console experience.

review: This game has scored a perfect 10 from all the video game ratings back when it came out on consols 2 years ago. It won top spot in PC game of the year for 2015. And like a good franchise game such as world of tanks or War Thunder the creators have not abandoned it. They still keep it updated. And continue to add more content and more game modes to it continually. And with this game online you have virtually another life. A fantasy life where you can continually earn money build your wealth. Own property and houses and condos and a car collection that you can keep customising and an ever expanding wardrobe. You can always be changing your look. Haircuts to beards to clothes to cars to weaponry relestate and all. What other game can you live in a virtual city and stop in to visit now and then and change things up?

review: EDIT I have since found out that AMAZING mods such as "GTAV NATIVE TRAINER" mod WILL GET YOU BANNED FROM ONLINE PLAY FOR USING THE MOD IN SINGLE PLAYER. That they can not understand how essential modding is to every PC sandbox game (such as Skyrim) and not having prepared for this by simply allowing such things offline means I could NEVER recommend such a game for purchase.I was extremely hesitant to purchase a game whose PC release was intentionally delayed 18 months for $60. I feel that anyone with interest should wait until it goes on sale the early bugs are patched and mods are released for it. After all they made PC users wait 18 months for it already why not wait a few more so you aren't funding their poor business practices?The game runs inconsistent and barely smooth at 20 40fps but only on the lowest of settings. This same machine can run Payday2 at 75 120 fps Skyrim at 60+ and any other game from the past few years without any issues. Oddly changing these settings from being all on 'high' to being low/off only provided 5fps increase.The variety of game mechanics present in this world is phenominal. Definitely something that IF openned to modding could be the new Fallout/Skyrim of modding. They made their decision though. You WILL BE BANNED without warning and without recourse if you attempt to mod this game even cosmeticaly in single player. Seeing as how I couldn't read the RockStar EULA until AFTER purchasing the game these bans days after launch leave me feeling cheated and wishing for a refund.

review: I know there are a lot of people struggling with some bugs and I fully acknowledge how frustrating it must be having waiting so long after the console release then preorder then preload and then crashes. You have my condolences. When I loaded the game there were a number of nagging issues.. such as the benchmark utility being worthless since it starts the game while running the benchmark. When you are considerate to your settings the framerates are silk. I sat downtown and just watched things I haven't done that in a game since Skyrim. It's something to see... this is one of those games that will sell a TON of hardware. This and Witcher 3 have made it an exciting quarter for PC gamers. Paying $59 for a game I played on PS3 was a hard pill to swallow but it was worth it.

review: Grand Theft Auto V was pretty much that game that pretty much freed me of my bordem. Playing it on console was nice and all playing through the story a bunch of times but eventually I got bored of it. So once I bought this game on PC I was thinking "It's just gonna be the same process over again so why not spice up the experience with a few mods". So pretty much I was trying out addon vehichles trainers (Menyoo more specifically) and just simply goofing around. But one day I was planning on adding a favorite car in the game and OpenIV needed an update. I was actually hyped about it until I saw the message of OpenIV being forced to stop the project due to T2 cease and desist letter. I somewhat cried after seeing that mostly because it felt like my fun experience was simply taken from not only me but from many of the players who were also cranking up their fun on GTA V. So until I can have fun once again on GTA V I'm not changing my review and I'm not gonna uninstall OpenIV until justice is served.

review: Nie muszę się zbytnio rozpisywać. Polityka wydawcy GTA V zawsze mnie mocno dziwiła. Ostatnie działania wprawiły mnie w permanentne osłupienie. Złe idee zawsze spotykają się z negatywnym odbiorem. Moderzy to spora część społeczności graczy w ogóle a ponieważ Rockstar nie wspiera singla w ogóle mieli pełne ręce roboty. Zakazanie im działania jest niezrozumiałe.I do not need to write too much. Mod's policy in this game has always been weird and uncomfortable to me. Recent actions have stunned me permanently. Bad ideas always come with negative feedback. Moders are a big part of the gaming community in general and because Rockstar does not support the single player at all they had their hands full of work.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There must be a lesson learned here. One of GTA's most crowning achievements besides being an iconic franchise is its ability to have endless community support in modding. There are few platforms that allow the level of freedom to be expressed that GTA can have. It is something desired by a great majority of players... Usually after a vanilla completion or five... This expectation exists in all games of an applicable genre. As a business this must be accepted. A wise developer would embrace the community that feeds it. Personally I'm all for them cracking down on aspects that actually taint the atmosphere and market viability of their product. We've all suffered at the hands of people who blatantly seek to ruin the experience... But the OpenIV fiasco weighs in far worse than any hacker troll toxic ever could. I for one have tolerated the blatant cash schemes by the developers because of the amazing community and the clear disconnect between modded and pure versions of the game. I've even indulged in the scheme as a measure of good faith supporting the developers for the future. But if they're going to on the community because of their inability to target the true violators I'll no longer support the model. If you cannot find means to protect your interests without damning the community to labor intensive back channels then to hell with you... It was fun while it lasted. There will be others.

review: If you're going to release a game for PC you have to understand the PC environment. The main perk to dumping ons of money into gaming computers is the ability to mod great games in inventive ways while maintaining a higher level of graphical fidelity. Now there have been plenty of hackers using mods to get ahead in the multiplayer mode but that hasn't been nearly enough of a problem for people to be unable to just switch servers whenever somebody steamrolled through a playsession with a gamebreaking cheat. What this really comes down to is Rockstar trying to sell their Shark Cards (which nobody wants in the first place) but cmon that obvious of a cash grab is utterly insulting to everybody it's 2017 and this should be COMMON SENSE.So... even though I love this game and have always loved Rockstar games they've destroyed the PC experience with recent actions and do not deserve a good review. Right now you might as well go buy a PS4/Xbox One and play on those platforms for a better overall experience.

review: Grand Theft Auto V review for online and story mode!First off Story Mode is personally my most favorite part about this game. (even though they canceled the DLC for story mode for some GTA Online t.) The reason I love story mode the most because of how they re introduced you to the fantasized version of california San Andreas. Also with the characters. Micheal De Santa is an ex crook who "retired" and moved to the richer part of Los Santos from North Yankton to get away from his problems. But then he got even more problems when he moved away. Then comes Franklin Clinton who is hands down my favorite character just because of how much he develops through the game. He lives in the southern part of San Andreas around where Grove Street was in GTA SA. He went from doing grunt work by repoing cars to living in Vinewood hills in an awesome house givein to him by one of his friends. Then there is Trevor Phillips. He is a VERY interesting man. Trevor worked with Micheal back before he retired. When he thought Micheal was a dead man after he escaped the cops in the first scene in the game he moved to the hillbilly/redneck part of San Andreas. When he got settled in he still persued criminal actions and cooked meth. So I reccommend this game for Story Mode. I played it about 1 3 times because it never gets boring.Now for Online. I loved online when I had this game on the xbox. It was just so straight forward and not a grind fest. Do missions get money buy cars and around and have fun with friends. then the game got really cool with the vehicle updates and heists. Thats when the game was still really fun and not a grind fest. But then these new updates came around where vehicles bunkers hangars and etc. would cost over 1 mil. And by the time you got that and got the money u needed the new update would come out with cooler items and it was repetitive grindy and became p2w. Now for my final answer I like GTA online because of what you can do on it. But it sometimes get really annoying when you have to buy a sharkcard for something to be used or for something to be done.But overall I love this game and I reccommend it to alot of people. But dont let CEO/Bunker/MC/Air Freight work get to you cuz then thats when you get annoyed and would want to stop playing it.

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 is a beautiful and extremely immersing game. Everything about it is top notch with the exception of the story that I felt was very lacking and maybe dragged on for a little longer than it needed to. The gameplay on the other hand is perfect. You can mess around for hours (especially with mods) around San Andreas and do pretty much whatever you want to do. My favorites are jumping to my death out of planes and getting eaten by sharks maybe having a small war with the police... and of course tennis.Sadly when you've done all of that there's not that much to do. You can roam around endlessly do mindless things but it's not that fun anymore.That's where the online comes in. I've played a bit of it and there's pretty much no end to it and it's still being updated several years after release. It's much more fun with friends too.GTA V misses a few opportunities with the story the characters are not amazingly written but the gameplay makes up for it in the end. If you love driving at crazy speeds shooting and blowing things up and everything in between you need GTA V.And if you've got it on PC consider getting a ton of mods for it.8/10.

review: It is late 90's and a teenager is playing Grand Theft Auto on Playstation 1 (and on PC at a friend's since this teenager doesn't own a gaming PC "only" PS1 with GTA 1 demo that came with a Playstation magazine) and imagines "How would this look with great graphics and in 3D??!"Well... here we are 15 18 years later... this teenager is closing his 30's and has been playing all the GTA's to this date... Suddenly the teenagers "dry dream" comes true after a couple of days of pre downloading lots of swearing due to the process of de cryptation (and lots of data removing not all can have endless space on their HD apparently about 60 or so GB's apart from the original download of 59GB) not to mention the post poning of release dates (was almost sceptical about this game ever comming out).What more is there to say? this is the best GTA to date (great functions from previous titles) AND Rockstar has apparently learnt something from the pc release of GTA IV... It works at 60fps and 1080p in my case since Nvidia GTX 970 isn't really 4k ready (not to mention not everybody owns a 4k monitor either).But here comes the question do I recommend this game to everybody? NO I really don't... if you're of the type that is easilly offended overly moral person can't stand shady character stories and can't stand the idea of "total" freedom to do basically anything you want/can do in "the context of game functionality" (or whatever other fancy useless garbage you could come up with here) especially in the latter case THIS AIN'T YOUR GAME!But to all others be aware this is Grand Theft Auto. )

review: I've played about 4 hours of story mode and havent even touched online yet I can still say this game is truely amazing. I would have waited another month or 2 and paid a higher price had I known it was this good. When the game 1st came out for console peasants (ty for beta testing) I had no intrest in it becuase it wasn't for pc. Im glad I didn't watch youtube videos or twitch streams because that would ruined the story and "new feeling" to the game. As for performance I couldn't ask for more. The game runs like a dream (my computer specs are on my profile). Yes we waited over a year for it but IMO I think it was worth it. As we all know PC games have become this sort testing realm for developers consiting of partially developed games that require patch after patch when in the end these patches usually only fixes minor issues. I can truley say I am happy with my purchase though I have only played this game for a short perisod of time.The work Rockstar put in this game as compared to any other AAA title really shows. I applaud you Rockstar and give you 10/10. Not only for the decisions you made when developing this product for our master race but the quality of the finished product.

review: 1 2016Warning This title uses 3rd party DRM (Rockstar Social Club)Game is beautiful Single player is good very good even. Though i wont go into that because i'm too ticked off by the state of the multiplayer.Essentially it boiles down to the way rockstar has set up the networking part which seems to be very p2p based(both still in closed session while modem is out). They also appear to completely thrust whatever the client reports/does.With the lack of a mods system and with the ability to take mods into multiplayer/online you can guess what happens cheating.There were and are still countless times where people cheat in the public lobby not even shy to set a nice impossible speed record in public events.Things me and friends have experienced so far Getting blown up out of nowhere no name you died.quickly leaving after blowing everyone up so you cant report them.modders framing each other (one guy blows everybody up under somebody's else's name)caged within un movable propsforced out of any vehicleforced out of your car and explosion placed at you so you and/or(passive mode) your vehicle die.getting killed by explosive bulletsgetting my car thrown around while im inside by a invisible forcegodmode playersprops or people attached to youall weapons taken from youpeople teleporting around the placeThis ruins the game for anyone who just wants fair play.The only way that you can at the moment is a closed friends or crew session which do not give you the full experience and its pretty ridiculous to be forced to play privately to avoid cheaters.Passive mode disables a lot of gameplay and is not an excuse for cheating.Playing with friends who have not played online before is a disaster.The updates so far have not resolved anything of this only added very pricy content you can purchase online.Not Recommended.6 2017 Update 1 051 hrs on record not much has changed(in SP nothing at all).The updates that were added are just more vehicles guns or buildings that cost millions.now next to cheaters you have hydra griefers people who abuse the game mechanics to stay out of reach and ruin your gameplay.Basically they go into passive mode call for a hydra get into the hydra while passive fly away disable passive blow your up repeat if died.with the gunrunning update you might be able to stop it with the exposve rounds but as i pointed out earlier it costs millions to get there.People still blatantly cheat in your face with godmode and if you point it out people in the lobby start to beg for money.Take Two(not R*) tried to fix this by attacking OpenIV and Force Hax while i support this action it gives a mixed feeling as i support mods while Take Two also turned Gta Online in a Free2play like cashgrab where most of it is so far out of reach that grinding for it isnt worth it.So when money is acutally dropped upon you you cant really complain as it would validate Take Two's shareholders hunger for money.on the latest update alone i already managed to spend 30 million and still not own everything that came in the update.Outside of heists using the MC businesses its possible to get a bit more than a million a day on your own but that requires your whole day and if someone decides to blow your up for a neglegible reward while you're selling you get nothing. maybe even loss.you would need a month of non stop grinding to maybe earn it all and thats just this update costs for setting up MCbusiness(millions) excluded.GTA V costs 59 99Their biggest shark card(Megalodon Shark GTA$8 000 000) costs 74 99.8 mil gets you 1 useless yaught or a building with garage and a few upgraded cars.let that ing sink in.

review: This game is worth the price tag. You will never run out of things to do. From buying your own luxury real estate to starting your own bank heists. Acquisition of guns cars and plenty of your own businesses. They even let you buy your own chain of weed shops. I already have more than 2 days worth of game time and I haven't even scratched the surface of this game. I'm less than 5 percent progressed through the main story line and I already own a sports car and a house in the hills. I have a million and a half and I'm saving for a golf coarse priced at 150 million dollars. This is basically a RPG based in a gangster film. Even better you have an offline single player profile and an online one. Which basically means the same endless game play you have offline you also have online with your friends. I can't even edit it manualy through the file browser in windows where it's installed. I love the cut scenes and story mode but if the game isnt optimized I can't even play it! Rockstar please fix this. I know its all softwear sided. Many PC gamers have been waiting forever including me for this game to come out and the least you could do is make it run smooth.

review: I last played this for about a year fairly solidly on the 360. It has definitely evolved a fair amount since then. Love the extra filling out of details and the 1st person mode. Took a long time before I could get it cheap enough to justify getting it again but glad I did eventually. Online is great fun with a friend but can be very frustrating with the large amount of hackers and trouble getting certain match types started. Also can be a time and money sink for a lot of unneccesary but fun items. I will always recommend this game despite all it's issues. The single player is fantastic immersive and detailed the controls are gnerally pretty solid for driving and shooting and there just isn't anything quite as good in the open world genre as this.

review: I have played this game since 360 I have liked this game for a while and putting in around 1k on xbox 360 to around 800 on PC this game has a awesome single player story about a washed up hiester to about the new blood hiester and the crazed manic hiester. Its well done and the re play ability is there since this is the PC verson you have the ability to mod the game singleplayer whitch gives it more re play ability. i just love trying to 100% the game from time to time it's really fun to do and worth the grind. now my views on the online part of the game went to getting real board of the game things kept getting more expensive and grinding the same thing made me just not care for it anymore But there is free DLC and this is beacuse of the mircotransactions in the game. you have access to everything and if you are a new player you will not have to worry about the grind as much do to you playing all the missions for the first time and if you save all of it till your hiesting missions and do all the challages you could get around 14 million to spend on what ever you want. the game online gets stale real quick when you become max rank and own all the OVERPOWED stuff. just going around to kill other players is fun for like 1 hour then its not that fun and gets stale. The game modes are fun for like 30 mins and the freemode jobs get boring quick aswell and even could make a player mad if he/she is not good at PVP do to the fact that you need to be in a public online game to do the CEO or MC work. To be real the game is Fun to new players but if you just got a PC and already had Gta for Xbox 1/ PS4 then its only worth for the mods and the Five M stuff if you want more of the New kinda fun apart from that its a good game online gets stale if you already had the game but if you are new you will like it.

review: I can't speak for the online portion of the game as I haven't played too much of it. However the single player aspect gets a thumbs up from me. While the story itself is nothing to write home about the missions itself are mostly fun and varied. What I truly love about this game though is Los Santos itself. I actually enjoy taking a relaxing long walk through the city often times exploring the alleyways and hoping to get mugged (Sadly not possible). The con for this game is also the city itself. Even with its great attention to details Los Santos can feel empty at times. I always wish things would happen like uh getting mugged. Anyway if you're looking for a game that's not too hard to beat and offers a lot of ways to relax I totally recommend this game.

review: There are many aspects of this game to consider so I will break it down into two obvious catagories pros and cons PROS 1. Extremely entertaining2. Massive community3. Tons of content4. Large but static map5. Very complex6. Very diverseCONS 1. By no means is this game PG 142. Heavily a Pay to Play game or a lot of grinding3. Many modders to screw up your day4. A bug here and there that resets your entire account5. Faulty cheat detection system6. Normal difficulty is quite difficultAll in all with the five years it took Rockstar to make the game it is very professional. It has quite literally THOUSANDS of hours of content while keeping the controls and UI simple. Great leveling system minus the matchmaking system. In my opinion the game is worth the full $60 and even more at that but the game goes on sale frequently. So if you are wanting this game just wait a couple of weeks and buy it on sale. Also do a little looking on what the best way to get money is because it is a definite grind!

Because it takes so so long to make any money unless you play for around 4 hours everyday for 3 weeks. Nerd³ did a brilliant video on this its long but it sums up what I want to say way neater and way more entertaining than I could ever write down. So I'd say watch this video and see what you think.Also yes I know this video is nearly 2 years old but with more content added and no changes to money earnings the video is still vaild. https //www.youtube.com/watch?v hF85m_5lWXM&amp feature youtu.be

review: As this game is still being maintained and updated my review changes too... 26 Mar 2018 I do not recommend for now Singleplayer is fun but Online with friends is better. However I do not recommend playing this Online right now because everyone is getting banned for no reason. R* clearly has a problem with its anticheat system however they do not seem to fix that any time soon since it goes on for over 3 days. Another great thing from R* is their "customer support" where some bot closes your ticket with no solution and predefined message after 3 days of waiting.TL DR you pay 60 for game patiently grind money for hours never cheat get banned for that and tech support is non existent. 19 Jun 2017 I recommend Gunrunning update and mods banAfter some time Rockstar gave us new update which added some new stuff and missions. Some content which was in past few years added to multiplayer is now available in storymode too. And even vehicles which were exclusive for returning players (Dukes Duke'o Death Blista Compact ...) were made available for everyone. Altough these new bunkers and vehicles are still expensive it's not that bad as it was in Import/Export update. You still have to pay at least $1.2M for bunker and similar amount for a truck. Most expensive vehicle comes at $3.5M which is still better than $6M as in previous update.Also if you figure out how NPCs and missions work you can avoid much trouble. For example as I described in second update of this review (see lower) how NPCs keep shooting or ramming a car you try to import or supplies you want to deliver you can avoid damage by killing them off (not in case of cops coming after you). After you travel approximately 400 meters (1/4 mile) the game generates 1 6 waves of enemies. You simply park your car somewhere off the road go far enough so it wont be damaged wait for the enemies and shoot them down.Next point Rockstar must have had a weaker moment. A few weeks before update they gave us double RP &amp GTA$ bonus on contact missions. We made some nice money. But what no one expected they set potential takes from heists to double. Based on this I expected much higher prices for updates content.And finally to the ban of the mods There were times I played GTA SA and SA MP and I can't imagine these games without mods. Then the GTA IV came and it was somewhat hard to mod it (in 2009 ofc). After some time I get used to original game. And in GTA V I never felt any need to mod this game. It's perfect as it is. Sometimes I look at some mods on modding sites and youtube but almost everytime quality is not there. And mods 'just for fun'? Nothing was that awesome I had to have it. Also there is that factor I am primarily Online player.Of course this is just my opinion for mods. But I don't understand behavior of majority here. You are reviewing and judging whole game just by one single point ability to modify. I think that this step was unnecessary and is not fair by Take Two however don't tell me you bought 60 game with rich story great voice acting awesome graphics big open world with many details various people vehicles animals biomes and even somewhat great multiplayer just to install crappy mods. 4 Jan 2017 I do not recommend Import/Export updateActually story mode is great. Nice story lots of fun many side activites a lot of details.However online is not so great anymore. Someone will say there are free DLCs but the truth is that any new content is made to force people to buy shark cards. Since adding Yachts the game was transformed to R* money extractor.Yeah new missions are being added but what is it for? You play it 3 times and it's boring then. Additionaly you get paid only + $20k. And then you get 10 minutes cooldown for it and every other mission in same category. Well that's something like $100k+ per hour. So if you want to buy some of the new stuff (approx. $3M 6M) you have to grind for money at least almost 30 hours. Great huh? Or you can buy a card more expensive than game itself that will give you $8M. And you can buy another when next DLC comes out.Last DLC Import/Export brought a new element which "pays". After you buy Office ($1.5M) and vehicle warehouse (another $1.5M) you can steal selected vehicles. You have to pay for all the damage the vehicle have taken on route from the place of theft to warehouse. And here comes the nonsence created by R* to prevent players from getting some good money. NPC know exactly where you are and go after you. Yes there is a tracker in stolen vehicle but why do NPCs damage the car and keep ramming into you? Another thing when exporting vehicle you remove tracker and change completely appearance of vehicle including license plate. NPCs still know where you are and where you are heading. I know there should be some challenge for player but this is just frustrating. And if you still do not think R* is money milking players. Ask yourselves why there are no new heists? Vehicles "missions" adversary modes etc. are still coming. 19 Oct 2016 I recommend Pre Import/Export updateIt's ok...
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A great game I really liked it.In comparison to any other GTA game you have more than one playable character (as you should already know) which is a real nice idea You have an explorable map! You unlock every part of the map by being in the place this is something which surprised me and I REALLY liked it because it makes a lot more sense than having everything from the beginning. and the game becomes some sort of exploration.I liked as usual that it's Open World and stuff you are free to do whatever you want. I really liked the car customization here and it's better than GTA San Andreas which are from what I know are the only games where you can actually customize your cars and not just respray and all that stuff. The NPCs here are smart finally they actually try to dodge your car when rushing towards their car but sometimes they by "dodging" actually hit my car sometimes I mean they're dodging in the wrong direction but it isn't that bad. The Heists! of course it is a real cool thing they added here you can rob shops and prepare for heists. I still didn't touch the Online game so I won't say anything about how it works there. I also really liked the way you have to avoid cops. It is a lot more realistic but if you drive into a "Los Santos Customs" and wait there for a while the cops won't look for you or wait for you to come out. It is something which should be fixed (here I'm not sure maybe I got it wrong).The overall gameplay is pretty hard for me it took to somewhere 25% completion to really understand how the game works and the 25% took me around 8 hours of gameplay which is a long time for an average gamer like me.There is one thing which just has to be added to the game Remote Detonator for Sticky Bombs! (Here I'm also not sure if there isn't but I was searching the web and the keyboard assignments and didn't find anything useful)Overall I'll give this game an 8.5/10 mostly for the hard time I got understanding how the game works.

review: Story Los Santos is gorgeous and fun to just cruise around and look at. Beautiful lighting. Music is great. Great voice acting. Game runs good. Good vehicle dynamics handling and selection. Story was very unoriginal with unoriginal characters I completed 70% before I lost interest. Online MMO play style with an economy. Peer to peer netcode. No server browswer or community servers. Endless connection issues freezes and session timeouts. Matchmaking is terrible for races deathmatches etc it's very hard to find a lobby with more than 5 people. Repetitive gameplay. DLC is extremely expensive and requires lots of time grinding the same missions over and over or buying sharkcards. They released a car that was $60 in shark cards! Every update has lots of bugs. Are currently banning players for no reason and the customer support is non existent. No community engagement or communication. Not mod friendly.It can be fun to just mess around in freeroam with your friends but that gets old after awhile.I spend most of my time racing with a group of people which I do enjoy. I like the vehicle dynamics there are lots of vehicles to chose from and they all have unique handling. And vehicle mods are pretty damn solid. User created tracks are awesome. But we still have constant connection issues where the entire lobby will freeze because one person dropped for example.Even though I have 2 000+ hours in the game and there are many positives about the game there are too many negative aspects for me to recommend it universally. Particularly with online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Very underrated game with excellent combat. I love the hack 'n slash elements with warrior. The only game i can compare the epic combat goodness to is Vindictus which in my opinion is very repeditive. The artstyle in this game is very beautiful and with a level 40+ character on the europe server i can guarantee you that the maps are very unique to eachother. The terrain combined with the enviroment and monster designs I'm truly impressed. You do see some enemies that are recycled BUT they differ ALOT from their other models. As you progress in the game you see variations of the mobs you have met before. Depending on the environment and level they have their unique style. There are only a few monsters that get evolved like this and they are iconic to the game. The rest of the mobs are also very detailed even though you only see them for about 30 minutes 2 hours. That can be said the same about the environment. The lighting + the art and particles really makes you drop your jaw when you travel through the landscapes. There are all kinds of environments but one thing I really wish to see is a little bit more modern factory of some sort. Other than that you see all kinds of enviroments. Mines forests with unicorns fields underground dungeons cathedrals grasslands woodlands you name it! Some people might think that this game is repeditive and in the start i think so too! But once you get started and get your own mount and get past level 25+ the game really shows it true beauty.I'd give this game a 8/10 but it's FOR FREE AND THERE'S NO PTW SYSTEM (except for cosmetics but that ain't PTW) SO I'LL GIVE IT A 10/10 THIS GAME IS AMAZING AND ITS LITERALLY 500+ HOURS OF PURE EYECANDY NOT TO MENTION IT'S MULTIPLAYER AND YOU CAN PLAY THIS GAME WITH ALL OF YOUR FRIENDS MAKING IT SO MUCH MORE FUN.10 OUT OF F*CKING 10

review: Finished the game on PS3 a while ago but for the PC version + I expected first person mode to be a gimmick that wasn't really functional but it works well. Even taking cover during combat works in first person mode. The movement controls also become "standard FPS" controls e.g. your character moves at a running speed by default and sprints when you press shift whereas in third person mode your character will walk by default rather than run.+ Performance is surprisingly good. On a single GTX 970 I am running the game maxed at 1920x1080 and the frame rate has never dropped below 60 FPS. If I remove my 60 FPS frame rate cap it's usually hovering 70+. Seems like Rockstar learned from GTA4's poor optimization on PC. The graphics quality performance ratio is very good.+ Lots of graphics options.+ M+KB controls are much better than GTA4. All menus work well with the mouse.+ High frame rate support for high refresh rate monitors. Mouse input seems to have no acceleration but is tied to frame rate so you need a constant frame rate for consistent mouse input. If your frame rate changes your mouse speed can become stupidly fast or very slow. Rockstar Social Club is still a thing rather than being fully integrated with Steam.Haven't had any crashes or issues yet but I've just started. Overall seems like a high quality port especially compared to the last one.

review: Once again rockstar's inept publushers have turned post launch "support" into a posthumous beating just as they did to San Andreas the precursor to this game Take Two Interactive has made this steam game inferior to the pirated alternative. By declaring war in the courtroom on the only parts of the modding community that matter for not only this game but GTA IV the publisher has chosen to attack one of if not the largest draws to their janky PC ports in the name of microtransactions on their pet freemium MMO GTA Online. The moment to moment gameplay is both fantastic and totally wasted on the online component single player especially with mods is where the loving detail and dynamism of this game really shines. But thanks to the publisher it is now actually a bad idea to attempt to reward them or the people who actually crafted that awesome work. I must reiterate pirate do not buy. You'll wind up a few nonsense non updates behind but you'll be in the hottest most underground modding scene around and you'll get to mess with a fantastic game that the owners thereof clearly do not appreciate.

I had the same kind of problem when I bought GTA IV two years ago except it wouldn't open at all. I didn't even see a loading screen for that game. So after spending 90 dollars on 2 games that I can't play at all I want my money back. I know someone who had issues with GTA V running and got a refund through Steam so where's mine? I understand if GTA IV isn't refunded due to how long ago it was (and I can deal with losing 20 dollars) but there's no reason I shouldn't get refunded for GTA V.

review: TakeTwo s recent actions have been appalling where Rockstar have actively engaged in the Modding community for nearly a decade going so far as to showcase many mods on their official blog their parent company in TakeTwo have just destroyed all that hard work and effort and forever soured the relationship between the modding community &amp Rockstar Games.This has nothing to do with game hacks and even if it did there are other ways this could have been dealt with and the OpenIV team would have certainly treated the misuse of their program as a priority &amp worked to patch any exploits hackers may have found to misuse on GTA Online. The unsurprising truth is that it boils down to TakeTwo not making enough money ($700 million from Microtransactions alone GTAV has made over $3 billion and counting since release on a budget north of $250 million) and it seems that they believe that through this heavy handed approach that they ll somehow safeguard microtransactions. The worst part is this has done nothing to stop hackers at all because most (leaving as most until evidence to the contrary has been provided) hackers don t use OpenIV.The game is good mods made it better and TakeTwo is run by Satan.Edit Rockstar have finally convinced TakeTwo that prohibiting OpenIV was a bad idea and they have have now reversed their cease &amp desist order. This is a great victory for player controlled content &amp modding and as such I will be amending my review to reflect this. The game's still good mods make it better and TakeTwo is remains to be run by Satan. But good job Rockstar.

review: As someone who had never played a GTA game before I can say that this one is worth the money.Graphics pretty for when it was released realistic and well optimized (the game doesn't let me run in native resolution on my machine for some reason but it looks fine and still looks better/runs smoother than Fallout 4)Gameplay rewarding fun and versatile. You can hire a hooker then beat them up and take a selfie with their corpse or chase down a purse snatcher on foot and return a handbag to a sweet old lady. The coice is yours.Mechanics easy to pick up doesn't really feel like anything is missing and there isn't aything that feels unnecessary either.Environment the world building is excellent. It sort of feels like the opposite of Saints Row whereas in that game you have a wacky cast of characters amid people trying to go about their daily lives in GTAV you play as an array of deep realistic fleshed out characters as they navigate a world of ridiculous cliches.Really my only complaint with the game (apart from the fact that the online mode is a little buggy) is that some of the controls are confusing. What a certain key does can be totally contextual every type of vehicle has a different conrol scheme and when the game mentions a new control it basicappy tosses it up on the screen briefly then assumes you'll remember it forever. Thank god for the key map in the settings menu

review: I said I would and I am one to keep my word. Rockstar you've somehow managed to turn my view of ya around in a single year. Getting Take Two to back off only solidified my respect for Rockstar.. and only Rockstar in this case. Now if only everyone else will follow suit that participated in the review bombing to change their review to a more honest one. Rather than just leaving a review to spite Take Two.As for an actual review I couldn't give a less about the story. Everyone I know enjoys it but I just can't be bothered to go through it again after going through most of it on the 360 God knows how many years ago. I know just stick to Online with friends and flying around because the flight mechanics are ing brilliant. They aren't Flight Sim levels but it strikes a perfect balance for me in being mechanically thoughtful while being forgiving enough to be consistently fun as would be expected in a GTA game. The recent updates to GTA Online have been nothing short of amazing. The Gun Runner's update is solid though I wish content like this would have been added months ago I can't complain too much as they are still supporting the Online component this far down the line. The Online may be difficult to get started with. They make it exceedingly difficult to get worthwhile amounts of money without farming heists. If you have friends like mine that don't have the patience or care to grind out heists for multiple days then progress will be far less than stellar. GET UR TUNA CARDZ HUR! I never review games. I think this is the first I've ever done and this really isn't even a review.This is a ing amazing piece of work. GTA Online has it's flaws but for those like I that have a passion for growing numbers and or ing around in the vehicles this is perfect. But... TAKE TWO! I don't even use the mods created by or in part by Open IV but this turn of events is ing insane and the publisher can very much get a sense of the community's reaction with this and many other reviews. If and when this show gets sorted out I will then change the review to postive or even remove it and leave a genuine review.

review: Nowadays I'm mostly involved with playing online rather than the story mode if only because so much of the content that was released online was never released for story mode. That said unless you have hundreds in disposable income to spend online or you have at least six hours a day to spend just grinding for the next vehicle/property I really can't recommend GTA online. It's really unfortunate because I do think that if there were only a few improvements on the game shorter loading screens missions that didn't end if even one person leaves or disconnects and cutting down on the excessive cost creep of new additions to the game this would without a doubt be *the* best online multiplayer out there bar none. GTA has the unique attribute of being whatever type of game you want it to be a flight simulator a racer a builder an fps you name it. The developers did all of these things well. In the single player mode you have a damn good story the only downside is the lack of new content that ended up going to online only.The online community is somewhat deprived invariably because of how difficult it is for someone with less than half the day to play this game to make progress at a steady clip. In general I very rarely see subjects pertaining to whether there's a modder in the lobby who can give cash not part of the conversation in the chat. There's just enough of a thrill in killing and griefing in freemode for a lot of players that ends up making freemode a crappy place to be in most cases. If you find this game on sale get it for the single player campaign. It's a beauty. But as for the online multiplayer I would be wary unless you have friends that play this game with you.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Graphics are still quite good. The single player is good fun (just like the other gtas) and humorous.The multiplayer is where it really shone out for me as I loved playing gta 4 on multiplayer admitedly no team mafia work but lots of crazy special races survival and businesses to run as you slowly accumulate hoardes of wealth and real estate (it's a long grind but great with friends). Heists are probably the best part of multiplayer I've found so far at level 89.The loading times to get on servers can be a bit frustrating at times (5 seconds to several minutes) but then they have a rather large online player base for the servers to cater for.There aren't many games I can play for more than 300 hours and still come back for more! Totally got my moneys worth out of this gem for 20 given the time I've had out of this I would almost pay full price for it!It is a bit cpu intensive my old fx6350 struggled to run this in 1080p at 60fps while my new ryzen handles it well.Highly recommend this to any gta fan.

review: Rewriting review because of update on OpenIV situation and some things I had wrong in the previous review.Singleplayer OpenIV is now legal again! Along with that ScriptHookV was updated! This game has so much you can do to the single player with mods and the mod loaders (such as OpenIV and ScriptHookV) actively prevent you from going online so nobody using said loaders can mess with other people! The story is great and mods let you do SO MUCH MORE once you've completed the single player!Multiplayer It's a really REALLY long grind to get stuff unless you buy shark cards (don't... just don't. It's not worth it). Once you get to higher levels and get a lot of money it's a lot easier to get what you want and to get new cars/weapons as they're added to the game. That being said there is a major problem with cheaters in online (note this is not due to OpenIV or ScriptHookV as those mods prevent you from going online if they are installed). This wouldn't be a huge deal if R* didn't ban some users for picking up money cheaters drop and leaving others alone (including the cheaters /). People also care VERY LITTLE about you and your vehicles in public lobbies. In private or friend only lobbies though online is pretty enjoyable! Had some funny things happen in a friend only lobby that I doubt would happen in a public lobby.Overall GTA V has an amazing single player that is infinitely expandable with mods and a multiplayer that is pretty grindy but lots of fun once you get yourself going.

review: I originally couldn't play due to bugs and crashing and started with a negative review that I said I would update once it would play consistently enough. At first it was the refresh rate setting in game causing constant crashes. Since I have a 120 hz monitor i set it to that in game but it kept crashing. When I tried leaving it at 60hz or 99 hz the inital crashing stopped. Then i started getting intermittent ERR_GFX_D3D_INIT crashes to desktop sometimes combined with nvlddmkm error telling me to reboot or reinstall the game every 10 minutes to 2 hours. Also I was seeing a lot of screen tearing with or without v sync no difference. After looking around for troubleshooting advice I found a solution that worked for me here https //www.youtube.com/watch?v TjEQmZrRmtEIt turns out that some cards' max boost clocks don't match the standard boost value being reported. Since I adjusted the values low enough I've been playing crash free for 15 hours or so.Now that I have been able to enjoy the game a bit it's turning out to be a real work of gaming art. Plenty of memes humor subtlety action variety graphics and so on. Can't wait to see how it develops.
title: Grand Theft Auto V
