title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V (Or GTAV whichever you perfer) is the new console ported entry to the GTA series. Given that GTA was a predominantly PC first series the console only focus of GTAV really shows in its various buggy or poor implementations of graphics and controls. For one thing cursor movement speed is usually inversely proportional to the actual framerate which means that a workaround involving VSync and various other settings (usage of TXAA is recommended if you have Nvidia) are needed to lessen this effect. Technical issues aside the game has a few new things like improved physics engine (still as funny as GTAIV) and the like. In the grand scheme of things these features are not important. Let's get to the real part.GTA V Solo You act out the life of various shady characters trying to make their way up in the world starting with Franklin an ethnically black American who is sick of all the gang violence and wants to become big in a legitimate way. At the player's behest Franklin can do such things as make his dog fetch live grenades cap supposed 'OG's with his pistol (not a glock not held sideways thankfully) and do repo jobs to make some dosh and get involved in an exciting police chase. This part is kind of fun and has a decent storyline. You can find the story elsewhere this isn't what most people go for.GTA(V) Online This is what most people buy GTAV for. If you were expecting it to be like the older GTAO implementation then you are d e a d w r o n g exactly right. A lot of players who play GTAV have never played GTAIII or any of the classic GTAs and are liable to be the same people who bought Payday 2 when it was on sale a year ago a year after its first release from beta. What does this mean? Well...Some players think they're 'all that' and try to do drivebys on unsuspecting players in their armored car. If you see one of these wanna be gangsters do everyone a favor and launch a rocket at it. Anyone not being a jerk with an armored car will thank you for it.Older players a r e p r a c t i c a l l y n o n e x i s t a n t m o s t l y d u e t o t i m e c o n s t r a i n t s . T h e y t e n d t o b e m o r e r e a s o n a b l e a n d t e a m w o r k o r i e n t a t e d b u t d o n ' t t a k e t h i s f o r g r a n t e d . are sometimes the same people who griefed others with jets and kurumas (the armored car) sometimes repeatedly spawnstrafing/camping the same area nonstop for hours. They might also call you a noob if you used the Homing Rocket on their fancy jet.Passive Mode is supposed to be a counter to random deathmatching in the streets but given that Passive Mode also means cops can shoot you to death for nudging their patrol car this is a terrible idea and makes no sense whatsoever. Why R* felt the need to disable weapon usage against NPCs is l e f t t o s p e c u l a t i o n probably something to do with how vehicles work in game currently.If you use a microphone somewhere in a public match keep in mind it's not restricted to your friends alone. Everyone can hear you and there's no proximity limit for this.Do not DO NOT play GTAO without friends. Doing heists with pubs is exactly the same problem as doing heists with pubs in Payday 2. Why the comparison? It's not the crime related focus of both games it's because both have the same kind of players. Playing GTAO without friends is like having a social affair (pun intended) with random people who broke into your house. Chances are someone will start the blaming game for why the heist went wrong or someone will get the wrong idea and kick other players to get ALL THE DOSH Done only in PD2 does not work anyhow or some stupid misunderstanding will occur and nobody will have fun. Don't play without friends. If you have to buy 3 other copies and gift it to your friends and make them play it with you because playing GTAO alone is a dumb idea. You've been warned.In short GTAV plays well it looks nice but it has a huge slew of problems. If you're not easily swayed then don't buy this game. If you have friends who would actually play with you the result might be enjoyable. It's only by 'similar socioeconomic factors' that I actually have friends who own GTAV so the experience was quite fun apart from the punks who keep shooting me when i'm trying to get an apartment invite.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Original Review "This game is only a success on PC because everyone was excited about the modding community since GTAIV was full of great mods but since Rockstar are now against mods and are banning people for fixing small things like the FoV I can't recommend getting this game at all. It is okay on its own but not worth the 18 month delay."Since this review Rockstar have came out and said the Mods are welcome on the singleplayer part of GTAV but they wish to protect the Online portion. Install as many mods as you please but remember to remove them before heading online. Forgetting to do so will more than likely result in a ban. I still feel this game was not worth the 18 month delay and it is okay on its own but it is still a quality game a good port and is open to singleplayer modding. Changing my review to Recommended.

review: Your looking at a review of GTA V? really? its GTA its the same basic thing of the lest few.Its a very average game as far as GTA games go. the story is fine a bit of challenge here and there nothing too extreme nothing too bland. however there is one thing you may be looking at the reviews for and that could be online play.Online to me sucks more than the other games. there are more things to do sure thats fine. but there is one thing that i hate. the money. putting a limit on my gun use a limit on my car use if i crash them the list goes on. The way i play is i like to cause as much mayhem as possible by blowing things up shooting cops and seeing how far i get before dying. but now i have to manage ammo make sure my car is not impounded and when i die i lose a good hunk of any money i have on hand. i understand that in order to have most of the fun things in online the money has to exist but its just a bummer having to manage my finances while blowing up cop cars.Edit (1/5/18)My veiws have changed and its a beef with the company not the game. GTAV is still the recycled title its always been. Rockstar needs work. Im sure ill get tons of and hardly anyone will belive me but here it goes.Around july last year i think I decided to join my friend on an empty public server. we normally play on private only and i personally hate the public scene but it was the only way to play those corprate missions the ones were you own maze bank tower or something. so he invited me to the company. this was also around the time this monstertruck that tied in for xbox owners or something like that i dont care he had a monstertruck that was exclusive. we drove that around and ended up at his company building. we walk inside and he was looking through warehouse missions. i sat in the chair on the other side of the desk and changed positions. i did it rapidly because it looked funny to see my guy spaz around in a chair. then i got suspended just cut to black "you have been suspended". i dont mod the game dont even know how if i wanted to. i have never come into contact with a cheater nor have my friends.now i tried to contact rockstar i had worked on this character for quite some time and did not want to lose it all because i was finding a grain of fun in desert of meh that is this game. i naturally went to the fourms and filed a dispute. i was instantly and with no human involvemnt denied. ticket closed they wont even give me a reason. i called number after number i filed more tickets under diffrent catagories all getting the same genaric response. rockstar needs to remove the golden in their and at least give a reason provide a small bit of proof on why people get banned. rockstar is a huge comapny with billions and yet they can find the funds to have a quality system in place to resolve issues like this. i lost everything and now me and my 4 friends dont touch this game. GTAVI can come and go and i wont even pay it mind.TL DR I got suspended and account wiped because i spammed chair positions rockstar wouldent even give a reason.

review: To start with I purchased this game solely to play it online with friends and while private sessions are ok and the general idea behind the game is great it does not work as intended due to the overwhelming number of hackers and abusers.GTA Online requires the player to grind for money so they can unlock stuff and a neat feature I thought was the CEO missions which you can do once you get a CEO office and warehouse. Sadly though the missions require you to be in a public game to do and they missions are designed so that other players can attack you during them to earn money for themselves and this is where the entire issue comes into play.So I have to invest money into a mission and if it fails I lose that money but if it succeeds then I can make profits. Since every game lobby you go into has a hacker running around slaughtering everyone this becomes impossible. There is no way to get any of these CEO missions completed in a profitable manner and the game forces you to join public games before you can do them. This means you are forced to do boring events like the slashers game or races over and over just to earn money and to me its just no fun.It would of been much better to just have actual NPC driven missions the player has to complete for the CEO missions and then allow them to play them solo or with just a group of trusted friends.This game had potential but there doesn't seem to be enough being done to stop the abusers and hackers.

review: A good open world game but a very dissapointing GTA game. My expectations were a little to high after waiting to play this game for almost 2 years. The online got boring quick for me but thats because all of my mates played it on the console when it first came out so i had noone to play it with. The game is way too casual and hand holding just to appeal to the lowest common denominator. Missions feel so streamlined and scripted game is way to easy no challenge at all game prompts every 5 seconds telling you what to do so you never have to use your brain overpowered abilities aim assist on controller is literally press fire button to win you don't need to move that right stick at all and the game actually lets you skip missions if you fail over 3 times. It's still a good game it just lacks the depth of other GTA games.7/10 (Good)EDIT Played through it again with new PC specs. Great looking game maxed out but opinion on the game itself hasn't changed and probably never will.

review: Grand Theft Auto of course is a great game that I have always enjoyed. First got it on PS4 and really loved it but started to get bored by the vanilla content. Also seeing users on youtube playing it with mods really made me decide to put some extra money into the game to get it on PC. Now if you haven't heard recently Take Two has decided to get rid of Open IV which is the foundation of lots of these GTA V mods. The only reason I bought this game on PC was to mod. I don't play online and I don't plan to. Them getting rid of Open IV will just stop me from playing this game. Give me long enough and it will be a distant memory that I couldn't give two about. I no longer support this game and I will NEVER reccomend this game or any other Take Two games. Thank you Steam for your time.

review: The graphics are just gorgeous they did not lie about actually running it fine in 60fps. The map is just huge and it is very time consuming to explore the whole thing but that is only just the beginning. There is just a large variety of missions and activities to do as 3 completely different characters. It will take a long time to get tired of this game. Then there is the online portion of it which is really fun with friends and has tons of different character customizations to make yourself unique from the rest. This is a dream come true for any GTA fans out there even if you owned GTA V on previous consoles the PC version just makes it slightly better.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V is one of the most revolutionary games I have played yet! GTA V shows everything that grand theft auto has been so far and more. It is an excellent example of combining different gaming experiences to make the "perfect" game. I have not experienced GTA V at its maximum but I can imagine the 4K resolution with the realism of 60 FPS and first person to create a realistic and fun yet difficult game for everyone to enjoy. And best yet GTA V has also got open world functions making this game full of possibilities.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This...game...is...AWESOME!Rockstar has lived up to its name of providing us with some great gameplay experiences. The wait was well worth it. Controller support is great for those who like to use controllers. The graphics are stunning even not at their highest. The options are very customizible so you can change things to what your graphics card can handle. Mine can handle most stuff on high and even at that setting I am blown away.GTAOnline provides a great experience where you can meet other players from around the world. Having seen the failure of GTAIV's limited online play I must say that Rockstar outdid themselves to make improvements. I like that so far the updates to Online have been free. Way to go Rockstar! Also there is no fee needed to play Online. I would recommend using a microphone with GTAOnline. It allows for certain jobs to proceed smoother when you don't have to type out communication. This is especially important for Heists as teamwork is key. There are a few glitches that happen ocassionally but they don't ruin the experience and Rockstar makes sure to address them after they are made known. I would score this game at 10/10 5/5 5 stars... or whatever other scoring system you use.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A definite upgrade from its predecessor. Rockstar took a massive leap forward with GTA V. The storyline is a non stop Hollywood act of explosions and chaos in the best form. The characters all carry unique personalities and their reactions to the environment is well versed to match their personas. The online though is where GTA V truly shines. I've never had a dull moment in game when I've played online and it's the best experience I've ever had even when I achieve nothing besides a hospital trip and a hilarious story. With world events adversary modes heists and a huge list of missions I've yet to run out of things to do in that alone.However there's quite a few things wrong with the game in my opinion. The police's reaction to your crimes is horribly exaggerated and while often it's humorous it's mostly just annoying when I can't drive a few feet without instant 3+ stars. The hackers are a hit and miss in the servers and often they're causing rampage and just trolling because they're bored. Which this has led to several incidents of spontaneous death while I'm trying to do simple things like turn my cash into the atm and such. There's also the issue with the servers themselves. Lag is frequent even on hosted games involving only a few friends and I've yet to hear anything about a fix lol.Overall though a great game and a wonderful experience. Nice job on that.

review: Okay for the mature audiences of course let me start by saying that this game is truly amazing. The graphics on this game are amazingly beautiful and I am not even playing it at 1080p. I have a whole 720p resolution and still think that this game is gorgeous. The gameplay is smooth and highly addicting. This game though has two complaints from me. A.) I play this game with an Xbox One controller and from time to time I have to unplug it and plug it back in because it will begin to not respond but simply stick as if I were holding RT or LT. It's minor and something that a patch down the road will probably fix so no worries there.B.) The only other complaint that I have in this game is that when using the self radio feature (note that I have the music option turned all the way up) the music is very difficult to hear it isn't as loud and nice as the other channels I am not sure if this is just for me or anyone else but that is just a minor complaint. I give this game a 9/10 only because of my two complaints. Strongly recommend one trying this game out because I can almost guarentee you will greatly enjoy it with great satisfaction. And if you are wondering if you can run this game probably so. When I asked everyone said "you will only get low seconds 30ish fps even though it is at 720p. Well I can prove them wrong because for me this game is running at 45 50ish fps at high settings at 720p. Here is my system specs if you want to compare to if you can run this game. I strongly recommend you have something close to this at a minimum.SPECS AMD FX 6350MSI GTX 750ti TF OC EditionMSI 970 GAMING MOTHERBOARDG.SKILL RIPJAWS X 8gb (2x4gb)320gb WD CAVIAR BLUE HDD

review: At first I had rated this game poor due to constant crashes and lock ups with it. I had thought it was the game itself but after some trouble shooting I found the root cause was an outdated bios on my motherboard. Seems GTA V is the first game to push the CPU hard enough to expose the issue with the older bios. After the bios update the game has yet to crash or lockup.If you have an ASUS Maximus VI motherboard with a bios older than rev 1603 installed and have lockups / crashes. Install rev 1603 it will fix the lockup and crash issues.This is by far the best GTA game yet and the PC version was worth waiting for. The graphics are insane. Being able to jump between mouse and keyboard and 360 controller is awesome. Drive a car on the controller get to a roof top then jump to mouse and keyboard and use a sniper rifle.My PC can run this on max settings and rarely see FPS drop under 52 fps i7 4790k16 GBGeForce 980GTX500 GB Samsung 850Windows 10 Pro
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: As I promised I am changing my review from a negative one to a positive one following the reversal of the decision to order a cease &amp desist to OpenIV's modding team. I'm glad they have rethought this decision and made the right call. I do enjoy this game but I did get a little bored with it after a while. I really do need the mods to stay interested and even then it gets a bit stale. The online portion is a hellhole filled with microtransactions and people doing annoying stupid things so I say stay away from there unless you're into that. But I would recommend the single player game for sure.Below is my previous review I referenced above.Take Two has made a very consumer hostile decision in deciding to issue a cease &amp desist to the OpenIV team who make (or I guess made) a platform for modding GTA for the past ten years. The only reasoning that can be pointed to is that Take Two has decided that they have not been getting the in game micro transaction revenue they want from the multiplayer portion and so are actively trying to cripple the singleplayer portion to drive people over. This move essentially disables the majority of mods made for the game and their future development. I know I am not alone in buying GTA V on PC in part for the ability to mod the game. Modding is part of what makes gaming on PC intriguing and is something that should never be made illegal which is what Take Two has done in their attack on OpenIV and their own player base. Shame on Take Two. I love the game but it's better with mods. I am leaving a bad review of this game in protest of their actions and will gladly change it back to a positive review if Take Two reverses their decision.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: At this point I can only be angry at rockstar for their online support. Don't make an online game if you aren't going to do it correctly. I mean people being banned for being in the same session as a hacker? And on top of that you decide to wipe out players that you have any suspicion of hacking as well asnot allowing you to even try to get your account back. You'll get on the phone with rockstar support and they will be like "Hello this is rockstar technical support how may I help you?" Then you say something like "Hello I would like to ask about my player's ban and would like to understand why you banned my account" Even in a nice and polite way (Depending on the person you talk to) they will be completely angry at you for no reason. Another issue that really makes a lot of these innocent people mad is when you post on a forum and you have these stuck up people that think they are too good for anything that tell you that you shouldn't even be playing the game and that rockstar doesn't ban people for no reason. Technically there is a reason but that reason is completely and it pisses me off to see that rockstar allows this crap to happen. I just would like to let anyone know who is looking at this review if you even had the time or interest to read it all to take these words into consideration and don't fund these money greedy scumbags even if you think the game is cool or whatever. People need to see this and understand that rockstar may make cool games but they really need to be hit hard in the support industry to try and make a change.

review: Great port of GTA V to PC. Graphics are absolutely stunning gameplay is pretty solid for GTA (except for some combat bugs like the AI firing 10 rounds into you in the span of 0.3 seconds.) and the customization is decent. Other than that its pretty much run of the mill GTA. Story mode is buggy and stutters a lot on my 980 SC but that was fixed with some files from the GTA V modding site. As for online typical 12 year old nihilists plenty of non english speaking people and griefers microtransactions youll probably end up buying if you don't have time to grind and HACKERS ARE RAMPANT. Expect to be blown to bits at random intervals along with everyone else in the lobby from some random with a mod menu. Menu's for reporting and kicking are hard to get too which means no one ever gets kicked from the lobby for hacking because half the player base doesn't know how to get there to kick. All in all worth picking up IF you have friends to play with.

review: I have played hundreds of hours of GTA V so clearly I've enjoyed it but at this point I can't recommend it.Rockstar and Take Two have finally gone off the deep end. They keep adding content to online but to enjoy it you either need to make grinding the game your life or (their preference) hand over all your cash for Shark cards. Then you have to partake of the griefing murder party that is so much of public online if you want to engage in most missions as they are unavailable in private servers. The peer to peer structure that enabled so much easy hacking of online is part and parcel of GTA a deliberate design decision made by Rockstar that sacrificed player enjoyment for Rockstar's convenience.Now adding insult to injury Take Two have shut down the offline modding that allowed the community to continue to add life to the forgotten single player game. They would have you believe it was because the modders were enabling griefing in online despite the tools being expressly designed to prevent such use but the real reason is clear Take Two want to destroy the remnants of single player and drive everyone to online where they can be squeezed for Shark Card money. Greed destroys another game.

review: I've personally bought two copies of this game possibly even three. While I've loved every minute of it I cannot stand idly by while 2k s over their community in the name of capitalism. I haven't used a single mod on GTAV. But a modding community sends games into the stars such as Kerbal Space Program just imagine CSGO without mods. If OpenVI dies so will GTAV. RIPThey've allowed OpenVI to continue so I'm going to change my review from negative to positive. As I still think this is a good game. As long as the modding community remains there's a single player to enjoy and online doesn't require you to pay real money for ingame currency.

review: For all the fun GTA V offers and it's worthy praise I'm going to be critical about something this and other open world sandbox games have a bit of an issue with.They made the landscape and environment quite vast but also very empty. There really is only so much to do and interact with in the game and it actually would have improved things to condense the area you are playing in. I started to get rather bored because of the wide distances and stretches of time between events for you to engage in.And some of the structures are just there for show. Example there is an entire sports stadium that just seems to occupy space. They put in the time to design this thing in detail... but there is zero to do there. I mean there's a random baseball bat laying around but... overall it was another example of a lot of work being done on the background scenery that could have gone towards more important elements of the game.I'd love to see game developers tighten up their focus and stop with unnecessary window dressing that crops up in open world games.

review: Late review but it still stands. I've played GTA III GTA San Andreas GTA IV and of course the most recent installment GTA V and I have to say it's just.. not as good as the others. Infact it's not even close to as good as any of the others. It's not a terrible game but it doesn't do much for me. Grand Theft Auto V is a great game with an exciting cast of characters! . The single player along with it's three main characters are extremely boring. They're not interesting at all and I feel nothing for them. I don't care that Michael's family is falling apart I don't care about Franklin at all (I genuinely forgot his name because he was that boring and had to look it up) really and Trevor's physcho/crazy/evil character has been done so many times before. The missions are boring and repetitive and aren't really motivating. There wasn't anything pushing me to keep playing. Mods are pretty much the only reason I know that people play singleplayer . Might I also add that you can go in about 5 ING BUILDINGS outside of a mission. The whole game is outside with hardly any indoor segments aside from the heists and some other missions.Now you might be thinking the multiplayer surely makes it atleast a bit better. That is only the case if you have a friend to play the game with and I myself enjoying messing around in Los Santos with my friends but I only do that in an invite only lobby because GTA ONLINE IS RIDDLED WITH HACKERS. It completely ruins the expierience when some retard comes along and drops you money and you get banned because Rockstar doesn't know how to handle hackers so they just say 'ah screw it ban him'. One good thing is they do update GTA Online a bit and they sometimes even make the expierience a tiny little incy wincy tad bit better. This game is absolutely nothing compared to previous titles. I would actually prefer to play GTA IV with my friends and I would have 1000x more fun than in this. PC Gamers had to wait nearly 2 YEARS for this.SUMMARY IT'S NOT VERY GOOD

review: This game is obviously one of the best GTA's ever created. Rather than tell you what's good about it (because the list is WAY too long) I'll tell you where the game is lacking. The story for this game is very cliché. There are no exciting twists to the story and it's very predictable. Think of an action movie from the 90's and that's your story here.The story started to pick up in the middle but then it seemed like they forgot about the buildup and they just went straight into the game. I didn't feel that transition I always felt with other GTA's. Another thing that this game forgot was activities. There are no police car missions and not as many interior buildings that GTA IV had. I personally enjoyed walking into a Burger Shot and I was disappointed when I realized you couldn't visit any food places. Sprunk machines are still there to give you health but I prefer eating at an establishment like in San Andreas or GTA IV.The map itself is a decent size but one thing it lacks is dead space. I'm talking about the empty desert we experienced in San Andreas that feeling of being lost in the middle of nowhere. You don't get that with this game. Every single part of the map is populated with roads buildings or people. The only secluded areas I could find were the mountains (which weren't that big to be honest). The way the map was made removes a bit of the realism for me it's just a big island in the middle of the ocean. That and the lack of dead space was unfortunate but one thing they did right was the underwater segment of the game. Ever wrestle a shark? When you can in GTA V!Don't be dissuaded by my pessimistic review. Keep in mind that this game is freakin' amazing. So amazing that I just HAD to point out some of the flaws of it. The flaws are few with this game. GTA Online is still somewhat buggy but if you can get past that you will enjoy another 50 100 hours off that. 8.5/10 a technical and artistic wonder of the gaming world on par with Skyrim.

review: This is a fun game really both on PC and on console(got it on PS4) GTA online mostly. But given the publishers' stance on mods though my current PC can just barely run this game I cannot recommend anyone to support this publisher at this current time unless they change their stance. So here's my laydown of this game...Pros Very fun multiplayer Very diverse and 'interesting' single player campaign(looking at you Trevor) Endless hours of entertainment just tormenting the NPC's.Cons Currently the publisher has banned all mods for this game Sometimes the GTA Online aspect gets tiresome with most players in public lobbies just wanting to kill you non stop. The money publisher makes things way too overpriced in game making sure you buy the GTA Shark Cash cards for in game GTA Online(much Pay 2 Win microtransactions I hate)All in all great game bad publisher.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game is pretty decent ok but really not something I think I'll go back to play. My playtime is split between two playthroughs and I got bored at the same part of the story each time and stopped playing. The online function seemed pointless to me because it takes WAY too long to load in. Seriously expect a 10 minute loading screen just to get into a game. It seems that this game is riddled with micro transaction greed especially now that they have gotten rid of Open IV and the modding capabilities that came with it. This greatly upsets me as modding was one of my favorite parts of the game. I wouldn't recommend this to new buyers.

review: In Los Santos there are many spectacular views. You could soar miles high in your own private jet surveying the vulgar billboards mocking American society. You could sit comfortably on your private yacht enjoying the vulgar billboards mocking American society. Or drive your 2+ million dollar sports car 130 mph through crowded city streets while calmly listening to the vulgar radio mocking American society. Or if you re feeling especially eccentric you could pay Pegasus to deliver you a private fighter jet and fly around the city blowing up cars police and people who just wanted to be your friend all while mocking American society yourself! This game truly is a creative masterpiece!

review: Amazing port. really good optimized. The singleplayer Dont expect an interesting story its kinda funny but overall gameplay is the real treat of this game. Solid driving shooting flying running indept customization and great pretty open world. The multiplayer Its full of hackers/cheaters 30 percent of the time you are not playing game is loading you get kicked out by the servers load some more. This games biggest issue that it doesnt have a menu too many loading screens to deal with and uneccessery questionable design decisions. Online portion of this game DOES NOT RESPECT your time and no amount of free updates can make up for that. They need to fix the core game first. But there are some fun to be had in online it just sucks that you have to deal with alot of crap to get to that bit. GTA 6 is gona come out and its gona have 10 times better online and story I guess the reviewers need to give it a 11 out of 10 because gta 5 got 10 out of 10 from most reviewers. Its overrated a little but I am sure you will enjoy this if you like games.solid 9 out of 10 from me.

review: What can I say? It's the game that I've been waiting ever since I finished it on PS3 1.5 years ago and Rockstar didn't disappoint me. The game is obviously great which we already knew since it's been out for so long but the way they made it for PC just stands out. It looks fantastic runs smoothly and should run well even on some mid end PC.If you have not yet played the game on the consoles then I'd suggest you to buy it. And if you already own the game on one of the old generation consoles then I would still suggest you to buy it. Not only it looks and runs much better but you also get the first person view and quite a bit of exclusive content that's only available for the returning players.I have not tried the GTA Online on PC yet but I'd imagine it's better than on the consoles where it's already great.

review: Usually I wait for a game to be out for a while so I can buy it at a discounted price but I made an exception for this game. I should not have done that. The game keeps crashing and as of now there is no fix. I have researched online trying to find a fix however the internet is simply filled with people like me who cannot find guide that actually fixes the problem. I will say my system is not the greatest however it gets the job done. I have read plenty of reviews of people with computer specs that far exceed those of my own who have the same problem as I do and they cannot find a fix either. For those who are wondering I have a i5 2.67 ghz processor 6 gigs of ram 500 gig hard drive and a gtx 460 graphics card. This is the only game that has actually caused my pc to crash so this is not a common problem with other games only this game. I suggest you wait till summer time because this game will mostlikely be fixed by then and will probably be on sale as well. As for a game review I cannot really say since the game crashes before I can really get into the game. Hopefully Rockstar can fix this issue so I can change my review to a more positive one... Do Not Buy! (for now)
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Where's the 'it depends' button? GTA V for PC is very akin to GTA V for console. Owned it on 360 playing PC with an xboxone controller which intergrates perfectly. the first person mode may delight keyboard users but the applied vingette effect and what I'd call clunky positioning of the characters hands means it's a less than desireable experience. 3rd person with controller works as expected. People online never change on platforms. good players trolls idiots. they're all present.Honestly if you have this game for a console and aren't playing with friends. don't bother it doesn't bring much to the table. if you've never played the console version but have a PC compatible controller sure it's a good story. if you have friends to join with it's a good enough experience just make use of the private sessions in online.For a game delayed to 'add polish' my mid range PC can't make use of it. looks no better nor worse than the 360 version. the rockstart matchmaking system still loves to mis match parties and friends into different sessions. and the smallest niggle that I want to really whine about Vanity plates / license tags in online. fix the app or let us do it in the mod shops rockstar. ignore perfectly unique plates filtered by a moderation system let us type what we want and fit it to any car we can shoehorn into those sheds. c'mon.overall 7/10. a solid game with a lot to do for new players but hardly a standout for returning customers. edit 21 04 2015So the iFruit app ( Android / IOS ) has since been updated. you can now change your cars license plates / tags / rego it's a little fiddly but works. did they mention it's 100 000 in game dollars to do it?

review: This is a great game. Definetly needs the CPU requirements or you'll be playing with some lag and some missing roads. I can't say it's not interesting though. But I would definetely recommend a highend PC or gaming laptop to get the full enjoyment of the game.I have to say that I was not happy how long it took to load just based on it crashing and I constantly had to re load the installation which I'm glad it continued in the same place each time. The Social Club issue is best to reinstall if you have it already and if you don't have it it's best to install that off Rockstar. The installation basically is the huge stress to see if it actually goes through or not but in the end it should work. There's many ways to fix this launch problem. There's definetely installing the game then set up and updates that must be taken care of before launching. The graphics are nice as always. However this is much more fun than GTA 4 because it's more of an open world map and it's fun to see places in real life that are modeled after the game once you start playing if you live on the west coast.I say it's worth it.

review: The game is great! The story is solid and having three characters that you switch from keeps it interesting to the end. everything runs smoothly from the vehicles the gunfights to the cutscenes. Iaughed out loud (a lot) and im only 30% through the story. Tons of stuff to do aside from the story giving the offline a decent replay value. Online is a lot better when played with people you know. Otherwise it feels like you're being raced to the objective and left behind. Instead of an empty free roam like IV. You can take on missions and other activities throughout L.S. giving you an actual reason to play other than just messing around. Speaking of just messing around... you will get a lot of people trolling players trying to complete certain activities. for example i was holding up a store for some quick cash. The clerk emptied the register and i exited the store. Little did i know a player had been waiting the whole time to kill me as soon as i stepped out. He didn't get anything for doing it other than the satisfaction of killing a distracted player. there are repercussions for doing this. the more you kill civies or damage property a mentality meter will rise. the higher the meter the bigger the price for your head. players can hunt you and gain xp/cash for the kill. Continually killing other players (other than competitive matches) will earn you the title "bad sport". As long as you have this title you will only be able to play with other "bad sports". Having the "good sport" title will earn you rewards randomly. In other words... Don't be a Online matches are very diverse. from all kinds of racing to deathmatches tennis darts arm wrestling and the list goes on and on. If you are returning from the PS3/360 version. There isn't a lot of new things so if you played the game thoroughly theres a good chance you will get bored fairly quickly. If not than this title will surely amaze you.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto VThe PC version of GTAV took me by surprise not only was it an absolute pleasure to be playing the catching storymode once again but to witness the amazing graphics. I was fortunate enough to be able to max the graphic settings out on my PC and whilst I walk across Vespucci (Venice) Beach killing helpless civilians with my golden minigun I daze off into the beautiful sunset.For me personally there were some buggy moments throughout the game but honestly I didn't mind them as they were very minor bugs.Of course however I had to install some mods to see if Rockstar had kept up their standards (as well as the modding community) and sure enough there was no let down. I had so much fun as I flew across the sky as Iron Man or testing out custom ramps on a 'Dump Truck' and changing the Adder skin to a Bugatti Veyron.$75 may be a little extreme for a game thats 2 years old now but it was worth it. And the online community is even crazier on PC than they are on XBOX/PSN.Pros Astonishing graphics Mods are no let down Gameplay and thrilling story modeCons Too expensive for a 2 year old game?Rating 9/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The single player is yet again an amazing journey like it has been with all the previous GTA. HOWEVER GTA Online is at a PATHETIC state simply because Rockstar completely IGNORES the players. There basically isin't ANY server WITHOUT hackers. HACKERS HACKERS and more HACKERS. Its actually amazing that there are THAT many of them. And even more amazing that a AAA title can completely ignore this and let them just every single person on the server. And ofcourse regular players cannot do a DAMN THING. No kick/ban system theres not even a report system. At the current state its unplayable.

review: Honest Review Review is based on current state of game.Game Pros Open World Beautiful graphics In depth character customization Passive mode option (So players cant kill you online) Long intricate storyline (Single Player) Weather System Multiplayer Vehicles (Ground/Air) Purchasable Apartments Day/Night Cycle Mini Games Grouping System Car Customization Game Cons Hackers/Scripters (Have the ability to get you banned by the anti cheat) Ability to use real money to buy in game money (Shark Cards) Some GPUs have trouble rendering in all objects (They all load in eventually)ConclusionGrand Theft Auto V is beautifull crafted game. With such a big game there is bound to be issues but nothing that breaks your fun. Create your own gang on the Rockstar Page and start play with all your friends.

This does not mean that the online is still infested with microtransactions and a pay to win hell hole but at least modding in the single player campaign is now posssible again! review: Honestly I used to think of the "publishers" of the GTA series "Take Two Interactive " as a great company allowing many freedoms to the players. Hell I even wanted to contact you guys for an opportunity for a job. But on behalf of the Cease and Desist letter sent to the OpenIV Team I am determined to never buy another Take Two game. They are also completely ruining somewhat half of their income because practically all of the fans of GTA buy the game for PC for the sole purpose of modding. Nonetheless OpenIV isn't at fault for GTA's online security (Which was why the C&amp D letter was sent) as there are multiple precautions from the modding application itself to not let players with mods onto online mode. An idea that could possibly save OpenIV if Rockstar ever gets around to reading this is to make an asi scanner so if the OpenIV.asi file is found during loading you may only enter singleplayer. What's next Take Two FiveM GTA5 Mods.com etc...You ban our mods we ban you income...Save OpenIV Petition is here OpenIV Petition www.change.org (BTW don't hate on Rockstar IK we are downvoting the game but Take Two is still reflected by this it is Take Two Interactive's sole fault for this. Rockstar emphasizes the creativity of the community.)

review: The single player is fun to mess around in and the multiplayer is repetitive and pay to win. I would suggest waiting until Take 2 revises their stance on modding. The Multiplayer is the weakest link. Take 2 and Rockstar are unable to properly moderate their game this leading to hacking. This is caused by the pay to win nature of the game. The jobs heists gun running and biker gangs are all inadequate. The only realistic ways to make money is to by shark card or to hack. I do not condone hacking not do I partake. but the game requires an unrealistic amount of grinding with little meaningful payoff. I would suggest you refrain from buying the game for the foreseeable future. Nerd cube made a fairly good video on the subject https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 0gKlBIPR_ok&amp feature youtu.beThe CEO of Take 2's stance is clear. "We are convinced that we are probably from an industry view undermonetizing on a per user basis. There is wood to chop because I think we can do more and we can do more without interfering with our strategy of being the most creative and our ethical approach which is delighting consumers." strauss zelnick.

review: Finally made it to PC! With improved draw distance and textures this game doesn't need another review. However I like it so much here we are. I'm not sure if it's because of the 60+ fps or if they further refined the controls but the controls feel better than previous versions to me as well. Of course any PC gamer will love the fact they can now use mouse and keyboard when gunning down their foes. I still use my old trusty 360 controller for driving but this series has never felt better on mouse and keyboard. I would ignore any minor issues with online play at release as this is fairly normal for AAA releases when the servers are flooded. Rockstar has a great reputation for patching and improving their products well after release. Last but not least the new editor is a blast to play with. You can set scenes record and edit footage all right in GTA. With a little creativity you can basically become your own movie director. I'm currently working on some fun content for my own youtube channel. If you're reading this stop now and buy the game!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I used to love Grand Theft Auto V. Both story mode and online. Now it sucks. I used to want DLC for story mode but that didn't happen. Whatever moving on. Online however absolutely sucks the utmost crap EVER. Nothing but more adversary modes and more dumb missions to make little money. I stopped after the Import/Export stuff. Just nonsense to have people lose money by destroying each other's crates. As most know you can only do these missions in open sessions. There is always someone coming in to blow your crates up after many hours of grinding and hard work. Rockstar did that cause that would be a decent money making method if it could be played in a closed session and they of course don't want you NOT buying their shark cards.They really try to force shark cards upon everyone as everyone knows by now. I might have bought a shark card if it wasn't the worst rip off I've ever seen. Paying $100 for 8 million dollars in game cash. That's ridiculous! I will NEVER pay for that! Anyone would blow that in like 15 minutes tops. Maybe if they increased it to 50 100 million dollars in game but I think 50 million would still be a rip off. I give Rockstar credit where they're due though. They've gotten players so hooked to the game to want in game money so bad that they'll blow their money on tons of shark cards. I was one of those people who wanted all the new stuff Rockstar came out with but could never afford. I never was dumb enough to buy one of those cards though regardless of my desperation for in game money.The next thing I hate is the character creation. Really Rockstar? Really? After all this time you would think that you could get the character creation right. Everybody is skinny. Females look like men no matter how hard you try. I made a decent female but wow was it hard. Still has some manly features. They saw all the npcs but were like "Screw it we'll just make everyone the same size and height for the character creation." I have a male character as my first. Maybe I want him to be fat. Maybe muscular. Or maybe I want to be shorter. Same with my female character. Why can't my female character look like them strippers? Why can't I make one of them fat short ugly ladies? Anything but the same as everyone else. Poor design Rockstar. Poor design.Last but not least police stuff. I was waiting so long but they added everything else from lowriders to biker DLC. Why can't I own a cop car? Why????? A tank yes. A jet yes. Armored vehicles and military ones yes. But not a single police vehicle. Not even a police uniform. You had to do a glitch to get a police uniform permanently. People like to say "Well it wouldn't be realistic " or "You can buy a tank in real life." Oh really? Buy it maybe. Do you see civilians in tanks going around in real life blowing stuff up around the city though? I didn't think so. How is that realistic?I also started modding in story mode a few months back. I come from the xbox one where all my stuff is on. I was dumb enough to buy it on pc for modding. I had some fun where Rockstar hadn't impeded yet. Then I recently learned they took down Open IV. I understand not modding online but wow. Rockstar eventually makes sure that as long as they aren't milking every last drop of money from us the gamers can't have fun. I even found out they patched the Pacific Standard heist glitch where people used to use Kuruma's during the final part. Rockstar really doesn't want people to make good money do they? I'm done with this game. I might replay story mode again in the far future but forget online. I'm done with the game altogether for now. Time to get back into Skyrim.Kudos to Rockstar for making a great game (that they still make money off of) and then taking a long hard dump on it (which they still haven't stopped doing). There's plenty of other complaints I have but I think that's good for now.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: &gt One of the top selling videogames of all time&gt Devs still insist on milking every last dime out of playersPerhaps the worst example of "micro" transactions run amok to date.Almost all of the interesting vehicles are online only and locked behind large paywalls. Normally this wouldn't be a problem (just mod them into singleplayer ) but the developers have chosen to shutdown modding altogether.If you want to access anything in the "free" updates be prepared to spend half a day grinding for a single vehicle. While you're grinding you can enjoy 1. Server problems2. Multiple long loading screens3. Instant failure conditions should one of the players in your group get killed4. Griefers...or you can pay Rockstar/Take Two $50 60 for that vehicle.I seriously regret buying the PC version of this game (so I could play around with wacky mods.) The developers can go themselves for ruining a perfectly good singleplayer game.

review: This game is the best pc game iv'e played by far it's got everything guns hookers cars planes trains bikes the lot i cant put it down iv'e played all the GTA games even played the 2 D one years ago the GTA games have come so far im getting a solid 60 fps 1080p on very high settings initially i couldn't get the game up and runing im playing on my MSI GT60 Dominator core i7 4810MQ haswell 12 gig of ram paired with a GTX 870m the 3 gig variant FHD matie screen 60 herz linked up to a BEN Q monitor 1080p so who ever has this gaming lappy and cant get GTA 5 up and runing the fix i used was to open up device manager go to display adapters disible the gtx nvidia card the run gta from steam directly as soon as the game starts to open give about 3 seconds before turning the nvidia card back on you have to be quick but not to quick or it wont work it worked for me its a fix in the meantime hopefully Rock Star north should get a patch out for this problem i tried for ages to get working the launcher kept crashing but as i said the workaround i found is a short term saloution so hope this helps . if any one has a question on this send me a message .

review: This review doesn't cover single player GTA V.I have played only multiplayer version. And all I can say it's useless waste of money.Almost 40 EUR been paid for countless amount of cheaters which set you on fire spawn loads of vehicles onto your head and explode you as soon as you respawn if you are not quick enough to click multiple buttons to find new session. And constant connection problems.About sessions system it's completly undeveloped. You can't choose the server you want to play on. The only difference is if you get into server with cheaters or not. If not then they will come sooner or later.Multiplayer gameplay is extremly tiresome and monotonous.A whole gameplay inclines towards 1. Long loading (althought I have top end PC)2. Waiting for players.3. Mission itself.4. Someone died loading.6. Trying again and again... and AGAIN.7. Finnaly mission complete so you choose if you liked it or not... Waiting for others so they press the button if they liked it or not.8. Voting for next mission and waiting.9. Loading waiting loadingwaiting... Endless process of waiting for others.10. Repeat.Missions or you race in a bike car plane parachute or you rob something.The rest of time you just run/drive around kill red dots and buy property.Graphics physics interaction with NPCs and optimisation yes it's at highest level.Gameplay versatility hell no.This game doesn't worth even more than 15 EUR.These series died after San Andreas.I'd like to get my money back but can't because spent too much time for nothing.

review: I will score the game based on a rating system.Let me explain GTA V is a GREAT and I mean GREAT game. There is a lot of activities to do in the current stage of the game. Personally I do kinda remember the price being a little out of hand when it was the steam sale. But I did already own the game by then so there was no need for me to look at the store page. Yes it was a stupid decision on Rockstar's point. The game is still amazing. I do hate the condition that GTA Online is at now. I will just say...HACKERS A LOT OF THEM. I do love online when i'm playing in a private match with friends. Also singleplayer is a great part of the game as a whole. The game doesn't need online for a $60.00 price tag. You could just buy the game for singleplayer if you do try online I would do a private match instead of the normal servers. Graphics simply amazing. Gameplay is fun and weirdly relaxing. Online fun only on private lobbies.Online score 7/10Singleplayer Score 8/10Story score 9/10OVERALL SCORE 8/10

review: This game is amazing! You can do sooooooooooooo many things in this game! The graphics are awesome the solo mode is ING FANTASTIC! But then... there s is this horrible online experience.. The game has a various amount of game modes missions and a few heist which some are more fun than others BUT you will have to wait in a lobby FOREVER!!If you try to do a heist you will actually need to scrape together players (if you re not playing with friends) to do HARD missions that require a degree of teamwork and patience Something people dont often have after being in a bazookafight with each others in freemode And there are missions you have to do before the actual heist missions that pays bad and may even be longer and harder than the actual heist. AND if someone leaves the heist you re threwn into freemode having to set up the heist/mission ALL over. but from the mission you ve come to! Which is a MAJOR pain in the . Now if you re actually trying to join a gamemode thats not in freemode (the open world with players) you will enter a loadingscreen.. Which not only takes long but if something goes wrong You ll be tossed into another loadingscreen loading Singleplayer.. Then you have to load online mode again from singleplayer!! REALLY?!Oh and did I mention hackers?

The game runs excellent on most hardware and there is very little latency.The player killing is pretty intense for multiplayer fortunately you can roam innociously offline from everyone else.Fly jets helicopters parachute massive airplanes supercars bicycles boats submarine and yachts. It's got everything you could think of. My only complaint is the difficulty of the heist jobs. Without a solid team you are doomed to fail.

review: Listen to everyone don't give R* your money. Back in 2013 this was one of the best games of the 7th generation. Now? This game is just a dead horse that the devs are squeezing as much $$$ out of as possible. I will say it's worth getting on sale for the single player and mods but try to stay away from GTA Online.PROS R* put much more effort into making sure the game functions on PC after the awful GTAIV port Great performance Huge map filled with life Lengthy single player campaign Multiple characters to play as with their own personalities More universally friendly driving and shooting Plenty of modding potentialCONS Map can get boring after so much playtime (a bit too many hills/deserts) Single player (and Online) story isn't written very well regardless of how good missions can be The 3 characters aren't very good from a writing standpoint and their gameplay is basically the same Modding the game outside of single player (common in the previous game) gets you banned from Online Lack of promised single player content (new content from Online isn't even available for the campaign) Devs focus solely on making money off of microtransactions instead of a solid experience with overpriced items and getting players to buy their way to getting them with $$$ Very inconsistent amounts of players online leading to dead lobbies for any modes that aren't the latest Plenty of players using mods to cheat and getting away with itSeriously don't bother paying full price or buying Shark Cards. Play with friends if you want otherwise just find a better game like Nicktoons Unite or Sonic 06.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Do not buy if you are planning on the multiplayer. Newer players will have to grind. A LOT. This is not a joke. It's comparable to a part time job. Do not waste your time on this game. It is only enjoyable if you play with friends.The prices on vehicles are stupendously expensive. The payouts on jobs are extremely low. Therefore you'd have to spend real money on Shark Cards that give currency in the game in order to buy the items you really want.If you only want to play the story mode I'd have to say it's a great experience. The three protagonists are a great addition in the series.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There's a lot of games that I've played over the years and really just enjoyed being in the world set before me. GTA 5 is a game that I bought on Xbox 360 Xbox One and now PC. I've played a ton of it on all three platforms and it's only gotten better with time. The PC version is by far the best version of Los Santos. The jump from Xbox One to PC is actually bigger than the jump from 360 to Xbone. If you like liked or even thought about liking this game on console then the PC version is a must own. Beautiful visuals smoother gameplay and for some reason an even better sense of scale makes it the Pinnacle of Rock* creation. I've played 200 hours and can't wait for the next 200. Enjoy!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I think 500 different people worked on this game. And no one had any expertise outside of a car game. Because the menus are atrocious lack streamlining and are often redundant and difficult to navigate. You load join the hub world load to host a lobby load to vote for a map load to pick prematch outfits load to start the match load to end the match load to return to the hubworld but since GTO servers are you'll time out and then load singleplayer so you can reload everything to attempt to rejoin multiplayer. Then you have the awful deathmatch layouts and getting spawn killed from behind boring missions with useless checkpoints and failed heists because someone disconnected right before the last objective marker.GTO only has a small portion of content worth checking out aside from the freeroam emergent gameplay experience left entirely to the player and it carries an otherwise unplayable 60 gigabyte anchor.

review: I have returned to the world of Grand Theft Auto after about 5 years away and boy am I pleased to be back! It has been such a long wait for this title but to be honest it was worth the wait.First off if you don't have a decent graphics card I am afraid you will have to stump up the cash to get one. Secondly you do need a decent PC to run this as this isn't your second grade port from a console a lot of work has gone into the PC version of this game and it does show.As I have a 360 controller connected to my PC it has been very useful. However there are very few hints to help you master the controls from the start of the game. You have to fumble around and experiment for a little bit to ensure you know what to do and how to do it when the time calls for it. It took a few goes on the first level of the single player part of the game to get used to the controls. However once you master the controls on a gaming pad it is a very engaging game and it really does pay dividends.The single player version of the game is incredibly engaging you can play a number of different characters and work your way up the ranks (just like any GTA game). The cars are beautiful and the AI characters are wonderfully unpredictable. I do like the way you can stumble into a fight or pickpocket and you can save the day. It is great and you do feel part of the GTA world. The story keeps you hooked and the way you can interract with the other characters is fully rewarding.The multiplayer part of the game can be a bit hit or miss. You join servers with people from all over the world and you can see other players stutter across the map. However once you find a good server you can either join various missions and games or you can explore the GTA world and shoot the other players that have joined. Once you work your way up the ranks more things are unlocked and you can do various other things. The multiplayer version of the game is really geared up for players to connect and help each other. You can join gangs and cause a lot of chaos.To wrap up this review a lot of issues that PC gamers may have could be related to inferior PCs or operating systems but to be honest I have had very very few technical issues with this game. It is a solid console port and I am really glad that I waited for Rockstar to deliver a fantastic game which I will enjoy in years to come.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Finally game works. Some patches were made and now my game runs perfectly. I own a gaming laptop MSI DOMINATOR GT70 8GB Ram Intel i7 4810QM 2.8GHz Nvidia Geforce 870M 3 GB VRAMGreat game. Good response from Rockstar. For other rigs configurations I dunno.

review: Even with my 5 year old Radeon HD 6950 2gb card this is STILL amazing.Pros In 1080p even without AA or any advanced stuff this game looks greatWith my extremely old card I can get 37 45fps averaging 43fps ish.Game is better than ever with mouse and keyboardCons The account integration is horrible. When you get this game MAKE SURE that you have the right rockstar account all sorted with a username you like and with any previous version data on it such as from PS3.Your account will be PERMANENTLY linked to your steam account unless you do some ass support ticket and your game will PERMANENTLY be linked to your rockstar account.I do not like this DRM crap at all and I ended up using the wrong rockstar account because I couldn't be bothered to wait for their support.This shouldn't cause you any problems if you're not an idiot like me but be warned.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Currently 9/10Some users are having issues with rockstar drm and slow downloads so steam version seems the better choice for downloading the actual game. The DRM allows for character transfers and is required.The game itself is very fun. Has good optimization for highend or low/mid builds.CPU phenom ii x4 970 at 3.9 GhzGPU sapphire 69508 gb RAMI get 60 fps inside most buildings but 30 40 while driving at 1080p at normal settings and fxaa.Currently has bugs some are minor while some cause frequent crashes (d3d error memory leak albeit slow leak for some and fps stutter for some online) The d3d error was fixed for me by reinstalling beta drivers for vcard. Then every couple days its bugs out again reinstall then it's fixed.Easily could be a 10/10 if online ran smoother between stuttering and how job system should back out to the lobby instead of kicking to free roam if someone leaves during a heist.But overall it is a great game and hopefully the bugs get worked out.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I LOVE this game. It is a piece of ART along with all the other GTA's. Everything about it is absolutely incredible. So much so that I have replayed the story 3 times and have well over 500 hours. But TakeTwo the publishers of this game have ed it. They have now taken to banning single player mods which have NO influence over GTA Online. I can fully understand and support the removal of multiplayer mods as they're annoying as hell but when you take to destroying the community of this wonderful game you have f*cked up TakeTwo. Even Rockstar the people who made this masterpiece like modding it really brings this game to life. It is purely out of petty greed and spite that TakeTwo have attacked the hard working and loyal team behind OpenIV the mod in question. I cannot let this stand and because of this I am joining many other in protest of TakeTwo exploiting this beautiful game as a cash cow and not recommending this game. Join us and show TakeTwo that they cannot do this to such an amazing game. Downvote it and flood their support emails and media contacts. And for the love of god do not buy any more shark cards and allow them to profit from this. Thank you Rockstar for your work on this game and f*ck you TakeTwo for ruining it. Thank you for your time. EDIT Rockstar have since convinced Take Two to drop their legal action against OpenIV and are in constructive talks to improve the future of the game. OpenIV is back! I have altered my review as such and now RECOMMEND this game stronlgly so long as you don't buy those damn Shark Cards! Anyway if you haven't bought this game yet what are you doing? Its on sale right now!

review: Grand Theft Auto V is a beatiful game with a great storyline and even better characters. The map is top quality and is a great improvement from Grand Theft Auto Four. I bought this game last Sunday the 17th of December and only racked up around 25/28 hours of ontime. Although I have played this game throughout the years throughout many different types of systems. So I have quite an understanding on the game.The story mode is great very good in fact I have played it many times and still in love with it.Online.. that's another story. Pretty decent just go there to do some setups and grind some money and other times just play in private sessions with friends etc. Grand Theft Auto V is full of modders so be ware. Also online to me now feels like it is pay to win. Sadly..The add ons to online are AMAZING but I don't recrommend buying any Shark Cards don't let those tempt you.All and all game is very great and very well made. Would recrommend just be careful online. )

review: Edited the review because Rockstar decided modders suck. The single player portion of GTA V is damn good way better than GTA IV and very well done. No annoying cousion calling you every 10 minutes to go bowling! Anyone buying this game for GTA Online is simply an idiot. As someone who bought GTA V at launch on PS3 and then again when it launched on PC GTA Online looked like a pile of back when Rockstar delayed it. And what do you know it's turned out to be a horrible grindfest designed like a mobile game. Sadly given how much money Rockstar made off the Shark cards you can be assured GTAVI will either be entirely online or at the very least the online porition will be a terrible grindfest designed to part money from a gullible idiot's wallet. Also screw Rockstar for thier terrible DRM that obviously doesn't stop hackers but just like all DRM only makes PAYING CUSTOMERS miserable. It's a huge stain on an otherwise excellent PC port. Overall I'd still recommend the game to people as it's well optimized and runs very well I'd discourage people from using the ripoff microtransaction hackerfest known as GTA Online and don't be an idiot and buy Shark cards.Update 12/25/2017 GTA Online is still a pile of junk!

review: *****EDIT*****Rockstar is permanently banning people without any appeals process and without warning. This is unacceptable and is a disgrace to what is a solid game. Not to mention they are getting super greedy with their micro transactions. Get it together Rockstar.Grand Theft Auto V is a masterpiece. The story of the game is thrilling easily followable and very developed. Along with the developed character structure and impecable voice acting its also really fun and enjoyable. Player choice adds a great level of depth to the game and the open world is pushing the entire industry forward. Rockstar left nothing untouched in this amazing world the level of detail is unmatched and very well done. Although it originally was a problem Rockstar has done a great job patching the engine and allowing GTA V to run on less powerful systems while maintaining an amazing graphical standard. This is the only game I have ever bought full price and I don't regret it. This game deserves every penny of the price. Rockstars constant updates also keep the community and the content thriving. Overall GTA V is one of my favorite games and it reflects what I look for and anticipate in every game I review. It serves as a model for what publishers and what the industry needs to live up to. If Grand Theft Auto V defines the future of gaming I am excited.

review: The definitive GTA V experience which for me was the ultimate multi player game of the last generation. Granted it's been a bit of a wait for the PC crowd and the online facet of the game is not without it's glitches (Abominable lag despite having a +100 Mbps connection jumping into a car and not being able to drive for some reason weird vehicle damage modelling loops just killed enemies coming back to life due to disparity between local and server side assets etc.) but when you compare it to similar games in the genre I still think it's way ahead of the competition. Yes the delays should have meant a more stable launch and I agree that the whole Windows Username thing whilst not affecting me personally is a pretty big oversight but a quick patch or two later and it should all be rectified.Then again I'm one of the jerk's who's been playing it on XB360 and PS4 for the last year and a half so I'm probably a whole lot more forgiving than the average PC user.Either way it's a 09/10 from me now we just gotta wait for a PC remake/sequel to Red Dead Redemption.

review: Really love the game played single player before I even touched Online due to all of the negative comments about hackers. Great story and plenty of stuff to keep you busy for about 50 70 hours if you do everything. Online play is still alot of fun has it's own storyline and a rediculous about of extra and random stuff you can do. Hackers are only an issue if you let them be if you find someone spamming vehicles or killing a lot of people at once or with godmode on just press "esc" go to online and find new session. Hackers will always be in games that don't have the entire game on servers that R* controls and moniters. To do that though they would more than likely have to require a monthly subscription or a ton of microtransactions. Even with hackers just driving around and chasing players whether they be higher or lower level than you and doing anything you can think of from getting and killing hookers to going to the strip club to punching random pedestrians until you get killed by the cops to riding on the train or Tram off the cops and having helicopters chasing you the game is still a lot of fun. It's worth the money especially with it on sale for 40% off right now. GL HF

review: OpenIV is back ScripthookV has updated and the modding community is mostly back on track! We did it! Now for my real thoughts on this game.Grand Theft Auto V is fun and addicting and mods extend the experience tenfold. The story is good albeit a bit short with main characters who are pretty shallow in my opinion but overall an exciting adventure. Compared to Liberty City Los Santos and Southern San Andreas is vibrant and colorful packed with diverse settings and rich detail. Like any GTA game fun can be had just by driving around aimlessly getting into police pursuits and gunfights with various gangs. However I've found the money is pretty hard to earn once you've completed the story and I also wish that things like car insurance would be brought to the singleplayer from GTA Online. But many of my problems I have with the singleplayer can all be solved with mods.As for GTA Online it's a boring grindfest where the only real way to get ahead is to spend real money on microtransactions or be given money by a hacker. Although once you've achieved CEO or MC President status you come the the realization that you've come all this way just for a higher tier boring grindfest. Freemode is usually fun save for the few players that go around trolling and killing for no reason but I've met some actually friendly people in GTA Online. For me racing in Online is great fun and the lobbies are populated around the clock. Heists are another way to earn big money but only really if you've got a group of dependable friends otherwise they and other multiplayer missions can take forever waiting on one person to stop immediately getting shot to death. All in all GTA Online can be fun if you know exactly what you want which really isn't a good thing.In conclusion I recommend GTA V but on one condition moddability is a MUST.

review: I'm sure everyone knows what GTA is so I will skip right to it. The PC version is extremely well optimized. I have been running it with barely over minimum system requirements and although the graphics are pretty limited with my crap computer the game still runs smooth. I may update this after I install my new GPU. I love the Self Radio station where it allows you to import your own music playlists into the game and listen to them either as a regular playlist or as an actual radio station with DJ commentary in between songs. The Rockstar editor tool is also amazing allowing you to film your gameplay and edit yourr clips into a movie for uploading on youtube and you can upload your clips directly from the in game menu. You can seemlessly switch between using your game pad and your keyboard/mouse without needing to change any settings. This helps with navigating menus and editing your Rockstar Editor clips. I can't say much about the graphics for reasons I have already stated but i'm told it's amazing with a proper GPU. If you don't already have it on your console I highly recommend it.That said if you already own this game on a console I would not recommend buying it on PC. The main reason I say this is because honestly the PC community just really sucks. You can easily spend 20 30 mins just trying to get people to join a job. And then if you are lucky enough to get people to join chances are someone is going to quit as soon as you start it. If they don't quit as soon as you start the job don't get too excited because they are probably just trying to waste your time so they will wait until you are almost finished and then quit or fail on purpose. To top it off it seems like 3/4 of the PC community are communists. What I mean here is on the heists missions you have say 4 5 setup missions that you have to complete first before you get to the main mission and you do not get paid for those. So the way Rockstar has it set up is that the host of the mission gets 55% of the reward because the host completed all the setup first. Each person who joins on the final mission gets 15% but the game allows you to adjust the take if you want. Well most people will demand at least 20% if not 25%. If you pay them 25% you also get 25% which means all your work is really for nothing you would be better of doing regular missions. If you pay them 20% that means you are getting 40% of the cut for doing 80% of the work. If you don't raise their cut they are probably going to quit as soon as you start the mission. If you do raise their cut you are getting screwed and they are probably still going to quit. I'm not sure what makes these people think they are entitled to 20 25% of the heist rewards they are only participating in a small part of the overall job and even at the default 15% reward for them they are already making 3x the amount that they would get from a regular mission.
