review: A really fun game.IF YOU PLAY THE SINGLE PLAYER.And mainly the reason behind me stating it's only fun if you're on singleplayer is because of the support Rockstar gives it's customer base. It's ironic when a company treats it's customers like the criminals after paying 40 (how much it was when purchased) and then having the nuts to add microtransactions for cash in a game where you play as. "Criminals".Rockstar support consists of 1 of these few replies 1 "I have a problem perhaps i could get help?" (Their reply) Insert extremely generic restart game and make sure you save page filled with other generic "fixes".2 "I have a ban How come?" (Their reply) Insert "You obviously cheated and all bans are final" comment and give generic "It's your fault it's final" ban reason page.3 "Rockstar support is bad" (Their reply) Goodbye to your post! Cos dat just got deleted son!Anyways Rockstar support is a awful joke and it's great when you can't support your customers so you get the community to do your job for you.Now lets commence onto the actual issues of online shall we? BUSINESSES! Biker business I'll just say best to not invest if you're doing it for money if you're just doing it for the fun lil side missions then all power t'ya. But for actual money and business? No. You can spend about 2 mil or more getting a business and find out it was a massive waste. Weed business is not worth the time/money ratio and delivery missions often consist of being high as a kite and attempting to drive a van full of weed ONLY worth about $50 000 swerving in a uncontrolable drive whilst players try to kill you. Fun right?Document forge? Nope. Just. Nope. Yet again. Money to time ratio it's a waste.Only business i can reccomend is going into cocaine or meth. But problems with the cocaine industry consist of selling missions glitching and rendering half of your product undroppable via plane and failing you the whole sell losing everything unless you quit fast.Resupply missions are tedious and often result in tons of death and annoying sidequests like "KILL ERRYONE IN DA BAR WID YA BEAR HANDS" oh wait... they have weapons... like bats and bottles. Well you're screwed! CEO business Sinking 2 mil and more into CEO is the only business i can reccomend grind crate buying and selling fill warehouses sell. Repeat. Oh and lose product when yet again. Selling product fails to deliver or drop. Losing your whole sale. Keep grinding till you can get a car warehouse for import export. That way you can make tons pretty easily. However import export is tedious at times too with awful AI enemy spawns in the middle of the roads cutting your sale car up and of course players loving to tw t you out of the cash you spent modding the cars before sale as lets face it specialist buyer is the only profitable way to go. ONLINE IN GENERAL it's not a nice world. On online be prepared to be killed a lot for absolutely no reason as players aren't punished for being d***s and people who are friendly and don't kill one another constantly get a joking $2000 for being a good boy. Being a random deathmatcher pays off via a bounty or killing players with businesses selling cars or crates or simply resupplying and players being good only get $2000 nothing more. And of course. The part you've been waiting for. CHEATERS.Yep hacking and cheating after all this time is still rife whether it be superjumpers godmodders aimbotters teleporters money cheaters and general nuisance hackers who fill your appartments with objects or somehow manage to delete or modify your vehicles in a way that makes them permenantly broken. Don't worry. They're still here! And rockstar's best retort?We'll remove the hacked money. Reset people's accounts. Commonly get innocents involved and give them bans. And that's about it. Working on anti cheats system? You're dreamin kids.But there ya have it folks.My 5 penneth.

review: This game is in fun af. Open world good story good gameplay and somehow the graphics look beautiful and at the same time. I don't know how that's possible but apparently it is. The only thing is that the online mode sucks. It's infested with s who will kill you for no reason over and over again and hackers are everywhere. Online can also get repetitive and irratating at times... and yet somehow I still love both online and singleplayer. This is the worst game of all time with a company that can scam you but at the same time I have never not had fun playing this game. There is a reason there are thousands of bad reviews of this game (all of which are on the top of the list for being most helpful) and yet it still says "very positive" (81%) on steam.Greatest and iest game at the same time.10/10 would get angry at this game a million more times.

review: What can I say that wasn't previously said? An amazing game that brought me hours of fun The realistic feel makes it a trully nice experience. I have played it on PS3 since it was out and I was glad to start the adventure again on PC. With my own custom radio!I just regret that the FPS mode wasn't that good. Don't get me wrong it's not bad. For example there aren't many FPS giving the option to see your own feet (it's something that is always nice to see in a FPS in my opinion). However the feel of some weapons is just horrible (rifles) compared to other FPS. Most weapons are also not looking so good. So the FPS is definitely a plus but it's not giving the game as much as an FPS. Could have been done better.But I'm just nitpicking. Everything is nice in this game. Except online. Only stick to your friends.

review: Edit as of 24/06/17 OpenIV is no longer under threat by take two. While this is great news we have to remember that they did not do this willingly and their actions to take down OpenIV in the first place are inexcusable. Personally I cannot reccomend a game whose maker puts their monitization of the game so high above that of the enjoyment of the consumer that this would even happen in the first place.Original review *Strauss Zelnick says that consumers are a bunch of stupid money pits for their business and more microtransactions need to be added to GTA to further monitize the game**Take Two sends cease and decist to OpenIV the GTA mod that allows for modding in GTAIV and GTAV during E3 probably so they can further take money from the consumer and so this won't get much attention in the press because of E3*The creators of this game Take Two them. They're money hungry bastards who don't give a about you and will take away your enjoyment of the game and push unethical business practices to "further monitize the game but not to the nth degree because then the consumer knows they can feel that they're getting ripped off and we can't have the consumer knowing that" (paraphrased quote from Strauss Zelnick the CEO of Take Two). I feel bad knowing that I gave my money to this company twice for this game once for the Xbox360 version and once for the PC version. Don't buy this game and don't support these and their business practices.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've purchased GTA 3 VICE CITY LIBERTY CITY STORIES SAN ANDREAS (twice) GTA IV (twice) and GTA V (twice). I loved the GTA franchise since I was 10 years old but I do have to bring up that I do not like the practices that Rockstar is keeping with mods such as Fivem nor the faster updates for bug fixing (stuttering issue). You've accumulated billions of dollars off GTA V but cannot invest it to hire more workers to help fix the issues? I understand game programming is difficult but it just feels like we are being ignored and frankly being defecated on when it comes to how we would like to play the game we purchased for. I planned on buying this game partly for dedicated servers to mod around in but if you do not support this to the point of banning mod creators I may be unable to support rockstar games or even any Take Two games until these issues becomes resolved.I cannot recommend the bad behaviors of taketwo/Rockstar but can recommend it if you just want to play a vanilla GTA experience with better performance than console.edit eh it has been a year since I left this review but seeing T2/R* take back the OpenIV stuff I think I'll turn this into a recommended game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Okay this. I know a lot of people LOVE GTA Online. I however find it to be a repulsive sesspool full of minors on their parent's computer and I avoid it like second hand smoke. However I have been playing the single player with graphics mods added cars and some realism mods/ weapon tuning. Rockstar for breaking mods using the exscuse that it's to prevent people hacking their online lobbies. Maybe you should find a way to Police that on your own without breaking mods for people who play single player. This was a lazy solution from lazy devs. And to the devs What's the matter? Jealous that an ametuer coder can make your piece of game look better than you could? Bummed out that a 16 year old improved Police A.I. or driving physics or weapon handling better than your team of dozens of qualified professionals? Or that some random can tune an ENB package to make your shader work look like a joke? Lol!I'm gonna with you the only way I can. Enjoy this anti reccomendation from YET ANOTHER dissapointed user. We're going to drag your rating down to the level it deserves. And there is no WAY I will even CONSIDER paying money for your next title. Learn from developers that embrace their modding community. Go have a look at how many people are playing Skyrim on steam right now. Do you want a game with staying power? Embrace your modding community. You want a game to fizzle out into nothing? Keep doing what you're doing. Think about the thousands of people you've already put off regarding your next game release.

review: This is a great game with great developers that support offline modding. There should be a clear unspoken rule that you don't go online with mods installed. That way a community uprage like the one that happened with the C &amp D of OpenIV won't happen again. The game has an intriguing story with lost friends having each others back or bad behaviour. You should definitely not buy this game if you want to play online but you should buy it if you prefer not to be spawn killed and exploded but you should buy it when you want to play great and creative mods made by the modding community

review: A constant mishmash of button smashing and aimbots. At least it feels like button smashing aimbots. I'm sure some of the players are actually that skilled.Most of the DLCs are of no value. The only decent one in the entire game is the CEO update and that one requires far too much grind to enjoy without wasting actual cash.The only good DLC is the car theft one as you can actually have a few moments of Zen driving around. The moto DLC is only good because of the bikes picking up product and managing the business is entirely garbage. Only the deliveries are enjoyable and you need to spend so much time to get to them that they have well worn out any glimmer of the hope of fun that they once held.Bikes are fun choppers are fun. Most of the cars aren't terribly impressive.You people need to take the grind out of this game and a lot of the trash. The torture scenes were a joke it was like a shill piece for the waterboarding 'debacle'. As if to convince me that well sometimes torture is just a necessity. It was a petty bald face attempt at desnsitizing people. The whole game is like those scenes white washed garbage with a little bit of fun thrown in.Shills make your game great. It is possible.

review: This is a well done game. The single player campaign was not ridiculously long and was interesting and entertaining. The online is great and provides a great time with fellow criminals.All I have to complain about single player is how far they went with some of the missions. You will witness a gruesome torture scene several sex scenes and other things that may make many people uncomfortable. If you can overlook these things you should have little issue playing.In GTA Online I do not understand why Rockstar felt that words that the non player characters use consistently are not allowed in the in game chat or when naming things. It also blocks words like gay from being used anywhere.Overall this game is worth playing but all I can say is player discretion is advised. (6/10)EDIT Game lacks updates cheaters run rampant it's just not that exciting anymore in multiplayer.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Shockingly Poor!As a huge fan of a stunning GTA4 I had high expectations for #5. Yet despite 5 years work by 1 000 developers the game which seems potentially large enough for 300 400 hours of content has at absolute best 80. The content that there is feels....rushed and slapped together. Most of it consists of 'go to this place as fast as you can.'The story script unlike the rather tight and compelling GTA4 script was again weak as if scribbled together hurriedly and without much concern.There are many inconsistencies in the game as well. Worst was the police reaction to player actions sometimes they were on sight instantly other times they wouldn't even react to a crime. There seemed no rhyme or reason to it.I never thought it possible but I actually have to give this 2 out of 5 stars. It's actually somewhat unlikely at this point that I'll plunk down money for a GTA6.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: What can I say it's been my favorite open world game since GTA liberty cities came out. With GTA V it has one of the greatest single player stories ever imo. The gameplay is awesome there is so much to do you will never get bored. I'm on my 4th or 5th time through the story I just can't get enough. Multiplayer is great too with heists tons and tons of other modes and robbing gas stations is always fun. The updates online are very frequent it never gets dull. The graphics are one of the best. There is a ton of mods for it too. If you are into open world games this one is a must! I highly recommend it to anyone. Just make sure you have a decent computer. I run this with a FX 6300 o/c 4.5Ghz 8gb ram and a GTX 750ti 1080p mostly high settings and I barely ever dip below 60fps unless I'm in a very crowded place than it dips to 55fps. Other than that it's very smooth and never had any problems playing it.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: UPDATE 9/17/2017 Since the Smuggler's Run update the game is practically unplayable. More than half the time the (incredibly boring and time consuming) missions don't reward you with any payment and instead give you an error asking you to contact Rockstar Support. Support in typical Rockstar fashion are either completely unable to help you or are outright rude to you if you contact them. Of course events that cost you money such as respawning car insurance and utility bills all go through without any issue. UPDATE 8/30/2017 GTA Online is basically a freemium phone game at this point. Everything is so expensive it takes dozens of hours of gameplay to afford and that's assuming you are never messed with by griefers or cheaters or run into any gamebreaking bugs all of which are unlikely. This is by design. Rockstar want you to get so frustrated with the grindy monotonous gameplay that you buy Shark Cards but if you do that it means each "free update" actually costs you several hundred dollars. Of course you could just cheat the money in Rockstar doesn't seem to stop anyone from doing this. On top of all that Rockstar Support is absolutely useless even when they aren't being blatantly rude.UPDATE Game is currently unplayable online. Modders are now capable of adding and taking away any of your money at any time and they are absolutely everywhere.EDIT I feel like I should put this first. Modders online can edit your characters stats and get you banned. They can crash your game. They can bluescreen your computer. This game has been out for years and these problems have not been fixed.*I don't often write reviews but I feel like I need to after just finishing up with a Rockstar support ticket.Before I get into that let me just say the singleplayer is great. Great atmosphere the city is cool writing is great charaters are memorable and fun. But surely by now you've heard all of that.Online is absolute garbage. Rockstar treat this like they're some indie studio making their first Steam Greenlight beta except they've got decades of experience and this game has now had two releases on multiple platforms. Balanced gameplay does not exist. Even without the rampant cheaters and jerks you can not possibly have a fair competition with anyone else. Players who have been playing longer simply have better stats getter gear and more money than you. You are completely helpless unless you hate yourself enough to whether the storm of nonesense for dozens of hours and level your character up and all that awaits you at the end of that is the realization that you have wasted a tremendous amout of time.The game really shines in the cooperative missions but no proper browser exists for finding people to play with so if you don't start these missions with friends you can end up playing with anybody. Some level 1 nooby a guy who doesn't speak your language some troll just joining sessions to intentionally mess you up a horde of blatant cheaters these are all more likely to join your missions and heists than competent cooperative players and you can do nothing to stop it.You can report the massive mount of cheating modding and hacking all you want. There's even a button in the menu for it. But it doesn't do anything. Years in it's still a problem and isn't getting any better. And if all that cheating ends up costing you a ton of in game money Rockstar isn't going to care. But they will offer you some Shark Cards to buy. That's all this game is after all. An enticing hook followed by a pile of frustrations and then a promise that forking over more money will make the torture end. Except it never does.If GTAV goes on sale for $20 or less buy it for the single player story mode. Don't buy this expecting a lot out of multiplayer unless you have ten or more people you can regularly play with.Do not buy Shark Cards. Period.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Rockstar themselves seem to treat Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft Auto Online as separate games despite being inextricably linked to each other. As such I'm going to treat them as two separate games for review purposes.Grand Theft Auto V is a very solid game. It's that GTA formula we're all familiar with 'shoot guys and drive cars and shoot guys while driving cars'. The gunplay is engaging and doesn't feel arbitrary the driving combines a realistic sort of physics with the arcade y driving of a pre GTA IV era a world that stays true to Rockstar's attention to detail missions are fun and interesting with only a couple exceptions the heists are engaging and encourage multiple playthroughs to experience the alternate routes characters that are interesting and interact in interesting ways (or they're funny at least) it's got it all basically. The PC version is essentially the definitive version especially with a robust modding scene it's an extremely good game that I would personally recommend to just about anyone who's got even a passing interest in video games as a whole.Grand Theft Auto Online... not so much. The same mechanics are there for the most part but the core focus shifts towards an interminable grind. The player is going to spend a lot of time grinding for the next vehicle or business that they're going to practically need in a public session unless they purchase one of the Shark currency cards. The problem with these currency cards is that they are valued extremely poorly since many things in Online are going to be out of the price range of the $50 cards with a few even out of range of the $100 card (a yacht will run most of the $100 card and leave little room for upgrades). Combine that with a community that's rife with hackers/cheaters/modders (whatever you call them they're basically just 'guy with mod menu and a scripthook that runs in Online') and Rockstar's bizarrely opaque banning practices (if someone else runs a mod menu and drops cheatmoney on you it's possible you'll be banned this rule seeming to change with every update) and you've got a recipe for disaster. Online is (evidently) more fun if you're in it for the PvP aspect but I can't attest to this personally.Basically if you want a solid single player experience this game can't be beat. If you want an online experience that lets you simulate the dreary grind of a 9 5 job GTA Online is the game for you.

review: Watched the pre order deals until what I wanted was available. I F***ing love this game. I know a bunch of people have been upset with the sales tactics and I get it but it didn't affect me. Also a lot of people are going on and on about how it's a 2 year old game. It really isn't. You can't compare PC to console. I played GTA IV on console and then on PC. I will never do that again. I should have just waited. It was sooo much better on PC (despite all the critics). Hence why I waited for GTA V to make it to PC and I'm glad I did. Online Yeah I see the reviews. No I haven't played online yet because of the reviews. Besides I have a job and a wife so I don't get to play that often as it is. I haven't even beat the story yet. I won't be spending any additional money on this game until the complaints are addressed. The game is exactly what I was hoping it would be since GTA IV. If you've played previous versions you shouldn't be disappointed. I love the detail on everything the size of the map the stupid mountain lions and the random police chases (not involving me) that I follow to watch the resolution and then collect whatever is dropped. I hope to see more random events in the next title but for now there are a ton of great MODs to try and expand the already awesome game that is Grand Theft Auto V.

review: I can't say I'm all that happy with the current state of this game.To iterate my issue with it I'll state teh recommended specs and the specs of my PC and what is wrong.Recommended OS Windows 8.1 64 Bit Windows 8 64 Bit Windows 7 64 Bit Service Pack 1 Processor Intel Core i5 3470 3.2GHz (4 CPUs) / AMD X8 FX 8350 4GHz (8 CPUs) Memory 8 GB RAM Graphics NVIDIA GTX 660 2GB / AMD HD 7870 2GB My PC Specs OS Windows 8.1 64 Bit.Processor Intel Core i5 3570k 4.0GHz (4CPUs) and boost to 4.2GHz.Memory 8 GB RAMGraphics Gigabyte GeForce GTX 760 Windforce 3 4GB OverclockedAs you can see the specs of my PC are definitely ABOVE the recommended specs.So what's the issue(s)?I have 2 issues currently which I cannot solve. I have tried EVERY SETTING UNDER THE SUN.Issue 1 CPU usage GTA V is using 60% minimum of my CPU at any one time and yes it maxes out my CPU.I have tried setting every single graphics option to the lowest setting including populations and car density and distance scaling. It doesn't matter what settings I use the results are the same at MAX settings and MINIMUM settings.I don't know why this is happening but I want it fixed. It only happens with this game.Issue 2 Memory Leak GTA V has a huge memory leak. It's affecting a tonne of people yet there isn't a solid fix anywhere.Appart from this for the 15 minutes I get to play the game runs beautifully on any setting.Unfortunately since I only get to play 15 minutes (the length of the mission I have to do) and then crashes due to maxing my memory out losing all progress I cannot in good consience recommend this game until these issues have been fixed.TLDR CPU usage is too high on minimum settings and there is a massive memory leak.If and when these issues are fixed I will re evaluate my review.

review: Alright where do I begin....Oh wait I don't have to begin anywhere other than the fact that this game has a massive ing issue with modders.See .. this is what gets me. Everything script handled must go through rockstars servers so why in the hell can we use scripts without administration priviledges? It's painfully obvious that they care only about shitcards I mean shark cards.I'll be honest I modded all of my wealth because online is a grind. Not a good grind but the type of grind that feels like your face is being pressed against a belt sander. Anyways I never hurt the players and when engaged in battle I would play normally. But because I do that doesn't mean others will. I heard they started handing out bans and have not modded in over a year. The real issue is blackhat modders or asshat modders as I like to call them. They will attach to you blow you up aim hack god mode ... the list goes on.Online is trash I'm not afraid to admit it. I have over 500 legit hours played online and the only thing I can say is Boring grind fest. When the grind is over you can subject yourself to killing randoms over and over because you may be better than them. OR you encounter an asshat modder and die a lot. You can switch lobbies but that doesn't fix jack for the player base. I still play online but only in a sandbox manner as I have everything unlocked and I enjoy the character creation and DLC vehicles that stuff is great.The main game is forgettable as with all grand theft autos. These games were never meant to be taken seriously. From the time I was a child it was the thrill of playing it at the behest of our parents and once we could all we did was gun down hookers and hit jumps in vehicles. Generic sandbox gameplay.Now I know this review seems like I am slamming the game and that's because I am... however that isn't to say it's not fun. It's simply this Grand Theft Auto.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Honestly for the price this game is complete trash and considering it took them an extra year to get it to PC it's a crashing badly coded peice of This game is so poorly made that it crashed ans freezes all the time and sometimes things just don't work. Rockstar has not stopped the problem of actual hackers in Online lobbies but focus on single player modders. Everything in this game is ridiculously expensive and all the buisnesses that make it easier cost so much that a lot of people will never own them before they stop playing the game. Especially because lower leveled players are constantly getting ed in online lobbies. If you don't have all the armoured and high damage vehicles the high levels do they'll just constantly kill you when you try to do anything. You need to grind heists and activities endlessly to buy one of the buisnesses/buildings that give you access to more funds and even then it takes even more money to work them. Rockstar wants you to buy the incredibly overpriced shark cards for 11.99 I can get 1 250 000 in game dollars. Sounds like a lot right? No it's jack That will barely get you anywhere in game and it's not enough to buy anything that will give you a return on it. I bought a bunker when they first released and I STILL haven't even got to HALF what I spent on it. Don't get this game you'll get addicted and it's a game and a massive waste of your time. Play the older GTAs or Saints Row. You can get from them all the good aspects of this game at a fraction of the price that is still 39.99 after being out on PC for over two years when it's riddled with bugs and issues. They expect you to pay so much for in game money like this is a free to play game. Rockstar you done ed up. Don't buy save your money.

review: It's not worth not reccomending this game due to the Open IV event. It's a great game and has an amazing single player that will go down in history a true revolution to the GTA franchise and I can't wait to see what they do next. As for the online yes it's fun there's lots to do but if you want to buy nice cars start a business or buy anything over one million. Then you may as well either quit your job or drop out of uni and never leave the house because the amount of free time you will need to be able to afford expensive items in this game is beyond what most people over 18 have. If you want those things prepare to purchase "sharkcards" which are in game microtransactions in which you pay certain amounts and get GTA cash.You either need to have more free time on your hands than you know what to do with or have lots of money. Honestly GTA Online is the only game where I would say it is justified to accept free money from hackers not that I have done it myself which is why I still don't have enough money to afford nice things despite selling some cars that weren't even that expensive to begin with.With all that said I would reccomend this game as it holds one of the best single player stories I've ever seen.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's absolutely horrifying how Rockstar managed to turn this once great game into such a pile of garbage. Where do I start? First of all the in game economy is so poorly balanced that you have to grind missions for days upon days to earn any money for the new DLCs. And what happens after you do that? Rockstar applies a blanket money sweep to remove millions of dollars from tens of thousands of innocent players under the false pretense that it is illegitimate money. I myself lost 2.6 million that I grinded for several days due to this moronic decision made by Rockstar. This was cleverly done right before an expensive DLC. Then they great you with a screen that desperately advertises the all new pricing of shark cards (pay to win MTX). This is pathetic for a game that I paid 60 dollars for. The new DLC is a horrible unoriginal and buggy copy paste of so many past DLCS (pick a crate up deliver and sell it for pennies).Also all of my new aircraft upgrades that i paid money for are now gone due to yet another ridiculous bug. Please save yourself some money and avoid all of this headache.

review: I pre ordered this game when it first came out on PS3 played it forever and LOVED the game. Loved it enough to purchase it again on PS4 and then twice on PC. $60 + $60 + $60 + $60 (not including the many shark cards I've purchased). The game is beautiful and amazing. The open world is like no other and before T2 shut down OpenIV I would have stood by this game no matter what. But now I am so disappointed that I don't even want to buy future games such as Red Dead Redemption and GTA 6. Before they shut down OpenIV I would have told you Grand Theft Auto V is my favorite game of all time. But as the Steam reviews show people are not happy with the shutdown of OpenIV. The modding community is important to this game without it I would have never bought 2 times on the PC I would not even be playing the game anymore. I would have never bought GTAIV in 2017 when the game released in 2008. I support the effort to rid GTA Online of mods but OpenIV does not even let you load Online with it installed. I don't want to see this wonderful game become negatively reviewed on Steam but If you don't support the modding community and bring OpenIV back it will happen.

review: Edit Take Two have decided that single player mods are now to be allowed. Good on them about time. Open IV is on it's way back into developement and we can all go on playing a great game the way we want to. The whole reason I even bothered buying this game on PC was for the mods. Take Two decided that it "hurts their cash cow" that is GTA Online. However the mods being targeted are guaranteed to be Single Player only with safeguards in place to insure there is no cheating in multiplayer. I personally will not be buying another Take Two published game until they reverse this decision and apologize for their stupidity.

review: This game is something that i cannot say on a public forum. So for a lack of a better term I'm going to call this game the Carl Wheezer of my life. Holding me down making me wonder why i have it in my life but still there haunting me with its monotonous prescence and making me crap my pants knowing i paid a decent $36 for it when i could've realistically bought 40 games with that much money as steam usually does have decent prices for good games. This game is just not what i expected to get with $36....... Now for the record. I have not even fully installed the game it has been 4 millennia since i have begun my journey into the realm of downloading GTA V but i cannot but think to myself why i wasted 4 enternities on this large and daunting game. If i wanted to go and steal peoples cars feel like a bag and take money and other valuable items from other people i could've joined the bloods a long time ago. Meth mixed in with Grand Larceny and many other things just doesnt need to take a entire chunk of human history to be installed onto my computer. Rest assured once i play this game i should be able to actually take back everything i have just said about this game being crappy because of how awesome it will probably be. But still i wait. I wait for the dark ages to end in my downloads and for the light to come again as i await my ascension into virtual crime and pleasure of running over old ladies and not feeling a single negative emotion because it is a video game. Ah i have waited for that moment. Guess i have to wait for a few more life times. Buy this game however if you do not care about anything i have said because that is probably the case. It is a good game. That is all you need to know.

Game play wise i haven't gotten far in the story yet as most of my time has been spent online with friends but from what i have played it is fairly entertaining so far and i can see it being more entertaining as the game progresses.Online however is a blast and if i was to recommend any part of this game it would be...the whole thing the single player is fun enough but when you add friends to the mix and random people it gets a whole lot more hilarious

review: The base game is very good! It delivered most of what it promised. First person is pretty good physics is very good flying school was fun and the story heists are awesome! I would've wished that the story mode was longer and contained more missions than it did.Multiplayer drove me crazy (metaphorically)! Loading time aside you cannot play online missions alone or with AI and some heist missions require 4 players when only 2 could do it fine (I get it since it's a team from start to finish and the heist finale needs 4 but that wouldn't be a problem if you can actually get players to join in your session). If Rockstar updates the game with an add on where you can use the people you have in story mode (heist characters) within multiplayer then I would probably increase the rating.The life invader and social and crew pages are a nice touch to the game. They are well made to the point that if you go to the right places on life invader you'd get discounts in game. Crew emblems pent houses garages and the lots are a great add on as well.Rating 9.32/10

review: You all already know what this is it's GTAV. It's the biggest video game like... ever. We're here to talk ports.tl dr It's good.I'm running an i7 4770k and a EVGA 4GB Superclocked GTX 770 and I'm running at a consistent 60fps at 1080p on a mix of high to very high settings. I have not tried them but from what I understand 4K 3D and triple monitor support are also in and unofficial fan made VR drivers are looking like they're coming along well. The game also natively supports the Dualshock 4 without any need for an XInput wrapper. Here are some tips for performance Install the latest graphics card drivers. This should really be obvious but I see so many people complain about the game's performance without having done this. They help so much. I remember friends reporting weird stuttering and black lines on characters before installing the drivers and now everything is butter smooth. Leave grass on High not Very High. Lighting is affected by grass so adding more of it stacks performance issues exponentially. Turn off MSAA and rely on FXAA for your anti aliasing. 4x MSAA is similar to essentially playing the game in 4K. No bueno unless you have a Titan X or something.You're probably also wondering about GTA Online. Yes it was when it first came out. It's not now. Honest. Heists are the kind of mission that GTA Online should have had since the beginning and require honest to God coordination and teamwork to get done on a reliable basis as well as massively alleviating the grind. Unfortunately there's only five but running the regular missions and races/deathmatches/etc. inbetween help alleviate the repetitiveness. The regular missions unfortunately are mainly GTAIV quality of "go here kill these guys take this thing back here " but the heists are VERY well put together and the roles of the four players are utilized very well. The added quality of life updates also make just about everything about GTAO's general gameplay well... not a pain in the like it was at launch.I've had no issues connecting to GTAO even on day one and I still have connectivity issues on the PS4 version sometimes. Driving cars with the keyboard is better than I thought it would be but still not as good as using a controller but helicopters and planes are damn near unbearable on M+KB. I'd definitely consider switching to a controller on the fly when you enter those the game supports it. I've also had no issues with Rockstar Social Club and the entire thing is fairly seamless inobtrusive and has some neat stat tracking stuff. Still would have preferred Steamworks for GTAO connectivity but... whatever.The PC additions are pretty great on their own too. The video editor is well implemented and has a ton of options and Director Mode doubles not only as a way for staging your own GTAV video fanfiction but also as a general around tool that lets you play as Flying Lamar With Explosive Punches. You can also use your GTAO character in single player with it for maximum self insertion.Is it worth $60 if you haven't played GTAV yet somehow? Oh Jesus yes. Is it worth it if you have? If you really love GTA like I do yes. If not that much waiting for even a 25% or 33% off sale would probably work best. It's a great port for a great game and it and Max Payne 3 show how Rockstar is really turning it around in the PC department.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Spent hours murdering an increasingly furious child online. There was a crack of thunder a flash of lightning the heavens opened and his bullet riddled corpse was drenched by the fresh cooling rain a glorious HD rendering of his tears crossing from the real world into the game.11/10 would buy again just to relive that moment.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After years of waiting a GTA game finally comes to PC after a very long time. The question is it good?Short Answer YesLong Answer When I heard that Grand Theft Auto V was gonna come to PC I was really happy. The console version in my opinion was good but didn't have any potential to expand sure it will have various DLC's such as Heist the PC version in the other hand will have a lot of potential copared to consoles for instance PC will have modding tools that will allow the community to make changes to the game brining custom changes for example there will be various car mods which will make the game more realistic but there can be other things such as funny mods where you can be superman and there will be realistic mods where you can be a police officer or a medic. Another reason I have bought GTA in the PC is because of its graphics the PS4/XB1 have very limited graphics power the PC in the other hand has a "next gen" change every year heck every month. This will enable Rockstar to make the game more graphically better and be more appealing towards most PC gamers and I am happy to say they have done that they also have made the game very optimized my PC which might not be the best in the world can run this game over 90 fps+ in high very high setting. Their is many other reasons why GTA V is better in the pc. If I had to give it a rating out of 100 I would give it a 97

review: Majority of negative reviews are just modders who finally got caught one way or another.Majority of people still playing are modders as well.What ive been doing the past few months when i want to play online is keep joining a new server until i find one with less than 10 people. and dont play on weekends. Just like COD most people who play this are just kids who get no attention at home and are being babysat by the tv.Im WELL over level 200 achieved it legitimately and get called out as a hacker every time i join a new session. But i know not to feed the trolls talking to clearly mistreated children only gives them what they want. what they cant get from their parents.The game is amazing. I have very little complaints about the product R* is selling us. The community is whats plaguing this game and destroying is legitimate player base.Less and less legit players come back because of modder trollsIf R* took away All the mods that seep into online gameplay it would become a more enjoyable experience.I cant recommend this game to new players. It is extremely difficult to level up online since most like to kill the low level players since they probably dont have decent weapons or armored vehicles.It would be nice to see R* do something about the game but we all know its never gonna happen.The game is like 5 years old now? Devs have made billions upon Billions from this game. If they havent spent any of that money on repairs to the few bugs or removing exploits then they never will.Posting negative reviews such as this wont make a difference. Coming together as a community and no longer paying for their product will finally wake them up. when the money runs out.

Rockstar's Solution to modding shouldn't be to remove on of the biggest SIGNLE player mod providers. It should have been to rework there online so that people had to work for the items but didn't have to work as hard. One more thing a Triple A title should rarly have microtransactions and the player shouldn't need to pay almost double the games value just to get about twenty minutes of fun.$8 000 000 for $100 is not a good ratio.

review: It's hard to sum up what makes GTA V the amazing experience that it is. I've played very few games that I would call perfect but this is easily one of them. It sets open world games to a new standard from the buzzing city of Los Santos filled with stuff to do to the amazing graphics that are displayed as you skydive from a plane in the skies of the wilderness in Blaine County. Even something as simple as driving from one end of the island to the other is filled with tasks to accomplish in any way you wish doing whatever you want on the way. All of this is topped off by an endearing story that explores the life of criminals and a Government conspiracy truly something everybody who plays video games should experience.

GTA V proves promising and I've already played for 200+ hours without loosing interest. Needs more mini games and such for just screwing around with friends online.The FOV slider at max akin to a 90 year old lady with binoculars taped to her face. It's abysmal without the FOV mod and makes 1st person completely non functional for a large sector of the PC community.

review: Games don't get better than this one!Seriously guys this game is a gem! I bought it yesterday and I've been playing it for ten hours straight. It's amazing. I can't think of a better game in this industry. I'm not that fond of free roaming do anything games because sometimes they grow thin in scope and script but men this is the quintessence of videogaming!Maybe is just because I can run it flawlessly (no technical issue whatsoever) but the amount of details they crammed in it are overwhelming I really can't wrap my head around how much time people money making such a game must require. It's monumental! Skyrim is empty in comparison (and I love it too).Depth script acting missions collateral quests graphics... everything is astounding! Never have I seen such a vivid breathing replica of a whole town where you can do almost anything to anyone. And holy cow first person! Some scenaries are actually moving I feel like buying a ticket and fly to somewhere in the US now!The acting in particular is superb. Those characters for how obviously exaggerated they are still look real! Voice over is of cinematographic grade. Trevor sounds like a terminal state Scarface while Michael looks like taken out from the Sopranos while his family comes right from The Osbournes... Lot of fun! But again details are everywhere. Wherever you look whatever you do you always discover something new. Apart from the "usual" stuff (pimping car buying clothes food weapons...) there are tons of other cameos everywhere.There are cinemas where you can see actual movies (10 minutes each one) there are TV where you can watch whole shows there is an Internet you can surf (and tons of activities inside like watching videos buying stocks...) there are rides you can...ride sports you can practice strippers you can touch... And you can smoke some weeds just to find yourself in a minigame where you must kill "aliens" (hallucinations) with a minigun!And on and on and on...Boy can't I say how I'm glad I forked out these 60 bucks. If anyone is still on the fence about this one well he should go for it now.

review: Story ModePros Stock market Fun campaign Great gunplay Car control is exellent References to older gta gamesHilarious characters Engaging storyline.Cons No story dlc.OnlinePros Lots of customization Tons of free dlc Returning characters Constant bugfixing.Cons Money is exessively grindy and is barely worth the grind Shark cards are worthless despite large price Anticheat Cons (yes I did need an entire section for this) Insane amount of cheaters Non cheaters get banned if they recieve cheated money (don't belive me? google "gta online bans" and see the results) Banwave is always harsh (it sometimes permabans you on first offense) R* never fixes their anticheat bugs R* ignores their fanbase on singleplayer dlc and anticheat Almost nonexistent customer support (Probably not their fault there aren't many people there. With all of the calls they get I bet it's a hard job) Money is exessively grindy and is practically worthless Gta 5 Story Mode mods get you banned from online if you have them installed when going into online.Verdict Story mode 9.5/10 Online 5/10 only buy for story mode online might be more popular but it sucks.Overall 6.8/10 amazing game at launch but Rockstar needs to do a lot better with online mode and customer relations.FINAL THOUGHTS Buy this when R* gets their $hit togetherP.S......................./ /) .................... / ../ .................../..../ ............./ /'...'/ ........../'/.../..../......./ ........('(... ... .... /'...') ......... .................'...../ ..........''... .......... _. ............ ..............( .............. ............. ...

review: UPDATE Open IV is back and Rockstar has taken a better stance on mods. This will go back to negative if this ever changes but as long as mods are available it's well worth getting.Original Review below so you won't forget what they tried to do It pains me to do this but I can no longer recommend Grand Theft Auto V for PC. GTAV is a great game. So great I bought it 3 times. PS3 PS4 and finally for PC. Why did I buy it for PC? Mods. That's the only reason. And now Take Two is killing mods. I suspect they're killing single player mods to try and push people to the multiplayer where they can proceed to try and sell microtransaction to people who want content with no grind. Well I never liked GTA Online. So I'm not going to spend money on it. In fact until this is fixed I'm not spending another dime on a damn thing Take Two does.

review: &gt Edited Review 06/24/17&lt I originally posted this as a negative review in response to take two's decision to send a cease &amp desist order to the dev of the openiv mod. while writing his site still states that openiv has been shut down. i am also turning this into a positive review.openiv site http //openiv.com/If that has changed look for the "Take Two vs. Modding" post on the above link.the download site ( https //www.gta5 mods.com/tools/openiv ) has a comment from a moderator stating that "it seems openiv will be back and updated..." I am no longer "thumbing down" this game. it's a beautiful game to see &amp experience if you're not being spawn killed or trolled by script kiddies...and if the corporations don't wage legal wars with modders.in relation to the new policies that take two &amp rockstar have made / are making for mods i'm not sure that i like it. however i'm glad that they are undoing their c&amp d on openiv. thank you take two &amp r*. to the idiots on here that liked to troll other reviews i say eat your words. it would seem that giving feedback to a company actually has a result. &gt Original Ranty Review 06/19?/17&lt i am recommending *against* gtav. i played this game a lot. despite the grind oh God the grind i enjoyed playing this game. so why would i thumb it down now after almost 200 hours of playtime?...thanks for asking. the owners (or co owners or whatever) of Rockstar Take Two Interactive have taken a stance against modding. they do so under the guise of "protecting" the online version of gtav. but they've gone about this in an ignorant and foolish way they attacked singleplayer mods. google "openiv" and check out an article or two. yes scroll past the ads and popups. good. openiv is a modding tool...for singleplayer. see the problem? if you want to hack on gta online you don't use openiv. you use something else. you use a hacking menu like force that lets you spawn moneybags teleport anywhere or give yourself godmode... and teleport me into a warehouse so that i can blow up over and over again.should take two (or R* or WHOever) ban hackers who grief and spawn money in?yes. should take two ban singleplayer mods that didn't have anything to do with online in the first place? no.what are take two doing?banning singleplayer mods. i can't accept this. i don't accept this. i won't play this grindy grindy game now that i know about this fiasco of anti modding. maybe one day _if_ they retract their cease &amp desist on openiv i'll reconsider getting killed over and over again by hydras. but today no. i write a review in disappointment and go to bed tonight.oh and here's a link below. the video is not mine but it's informative. and there are *sources linked* in the guy's description. don't blindly swing one way or the other on this. educate yourself (aka google . good night.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v Kgd7AfbYyI0

review: The sad thing is it's not that the game is bad it's the actual game infrastructure and servers that are apparently so easy to hack and mod. Take Two and Rockstar have already taken down the most widely used cheat/exploit providers which have nothing to do with openIV. OpenIV specifically gets you to create a mod folder that will only be used in single player. As far as I remember trying to mod the game files within openIV without a mod folder for single player means the game won't even launch or it will crash on start up in online. I was also speaking to a modder on the gta online chat the other day asking him not to give me money etc and I asked how modders could mod online so easily and he told me it was script injection which I'm pretty sure has nothing to do with openIV. If you want to add scripts you need an asi loader and so on and those files go into the game directory manually not through openIV. I've only ever modded single player and not for a while but that's how it used to be. Yes modders are annoying as hell but how much money do you really need to make? I bought gta5 on ps3 and pc specifically so I could mod single player as i had done with gtaIV and san andreas for years. Plus the pc community for gta5 is surely smaller than the console community who have no option but to buy sharkcards and so on so your revenue isn't going to exactly fall off a cliff. I think last year gta online through microtransactions alone had made over $1bn since it's lauch without taking into account purchases of the game. As a short term solution this might make sense to take two interactive but the ammount of negative community feedback will surely hurt them long term especially since they don't exactly have many big new games from big ip's out at the moment. Sad times.

review: Only a few things that blow.IMOThe storymode missions feel pointless and a bit lame most of the game. You will play all 3 guys and that also kinda sucks for alot of reasons you will change their clothes save cars etc log on to play they will be in their starting clothes and the car is gone.Happens alot and its random cause they have random things that happen i guess while you are not playing? no idea.Also its another bad guy turns good guy kinda lame game. With end game being running Legal shops. YAWN This is easy mode gta.The easiest gta i ever played.I did beat the game and found it not worth 60 bucks.Cause story mode was garbage. Annoying playable guys imo.Playing as mike and cant play him till the intro of his family and kid mini intro almost everytime you log in is annoying.Same goes for the crazy dude being chased by police or waking up in his panties is lame.etc Storymode is 3 guys fighting and bickering in every cut and threw out the story it becomes like playing a nagging wife simulator.I would say get it on sale or for less then 40 bucks and yeah then it would be worth it.Almost all my time is played online hanging out in the stripClub getting lap dances or driving around at night picking up hookers for 70 dolla jobs.&gt and that is a bit better but i feel bored and burnt already.Online mode is a hackfest or a total grind that becomes very very boring pretty fast.If my bro did not have this game i would have less then 100hrs easy.The gfx for this game MADE this game. Driving is very well done aswell for the pc vr this time around.I just did not like the story mode at all.Bad acting total garbage charecters.And to the fanboys...................../ /) .................... / ../ .................../..../ ............./ /'...'/ ........../'/.../..../......./ ........('(... ... .... /'...') ......... .................'...../ ..........''... .......... _. ............ ..............( .............. ............. ...only think this game is worth playing online till you're burnt of all its problems.Can't make a playlist of real missions only races and deathmatches etc.Nothing to really do in the "lobby"that is the whole city but cheezy mini games and robbing of stores for 1500 to 2000bucks a pop. kinda lame..online is menu mode.Killing people who kill you well if they are in a kuma or truck it is almost impossible unless you blow the car up then YOU have to pay to repair their car...so really online mode sucks.it also is so hacked out you will laugh.With a over flow of unkillable trolls just really killed the online part for me...so i been playing in a closed session with my bro till the burn out of repeating missions cause missions do not just unlock at a current lv or anything you can be like me lv 102 and have like 50 mission and only 2 or 3 that pay enough for the time and ammo wasted...its a pretty garbage system. Heists are cool if you know 5 6 ppl if not expect to wait hours and hours to get one done.I mean its a game for kids i played gtas as a kid.Picked up gta 4 and laughed and uninstalled half way threw(pc version total garbage imo) this one i picked up cause my bro wanted to play it its a huge city nice looking gfx but very boring imo.I will still get hours in cause i do like driving around and picking up hookers and such and shooting gangbangers with a shotgun in the face and i like the police shootouts...that is all.

review: UPDATE Rockstar seem to have convinced Take Two to retract their legal threats against OpenIV. I'm now happy to recommend this game again!Great single player experience that's worth the price of entry with a great story and characters but also set in an expansive open world sandbox that lets you do whatever you want between missions.The online mode can be fantastic too when you can find a game that doesn't have any cheaters stick to Private games with friends if you can because running the online heists with a decent crew is . That said many have complained about the need to grind for money with expensive vehicles and other items to try and coerce you into buying "Shark" cards with real money.Previous review Take Two/Rockstar actively attacked the single player modding scheme by taking down OpenIV rather than opening dialogue with the OpenIV team with their concerns regarding online cheating or heaven forbid spending some of their impressive profits from the game to implement an anticheat system to prevent it as they've failed to do since its release means a negative review from me.Sorry Rockstar you done goofed.

review: This review will be speaking of GTA V from a PvE perspective as I am not a particular fan of going around blasting other players heads off surpsisingly.Yet it will not be a review of the 1P Mode as i still play this game with friends.GTA V as an online PvE experience is worth the purchase at least. You get dozens of quests as well as several heists each unique in their own ways. You have a reasonable amount of customization via clothes weapon choices and parental choices (Base Character design could have been a lot more intuitive however)Along with quests and heists you have Horde Survival. It's for the most part very basic but still fun and has enough variety to use your entire array of weapons.The Pros of multiplayer PvE is it's a fun mindless experience. Pick a quest pick horde pick a heist...drive somewhere and go guns blazing. You can choose a variety of weapons and cars and in most missions more powerful vehicles will be hidden throughout the city.The Cons of multiplayer PvE are a lack of things to do once you've gotten bored of these things. In partciular as you get more money these experiences can become painfully easy as vehicles can make certain quests and heists almost effortless and impossible to lose in.After a certain point it becomes one of those games where you need to challenge yourself rather than have the game challenge you.If you still find the game fun then more power for you. However don't get me wrong. For the single purchase price the experience will last for for a good time and perhaps you will find more fun in the 1P and PvP than i did. There's enough to hook you in for a good long time.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Hello Folk this is my personal review of GTA V and Online.First of the Story side of the game is SPOT ON perfect with no major issues.Just on occations i've had pop ins and a few graphical glitches yet nothing major to ruin the game.However the GTA V Story is standing above the horrific part known as GTA Online.Not only does online have alot of hackers and modders using godmode everytime they want to kill you or using instant headshot hacks.Passive mode is there wich sets you back to not being able to use weapons yet hackers can kill you by causing explosions around you. I have a recording that is very faint of a guy talking to another guy that he BOUGHT his mods or hacks on a website wich grants him the ability to spawn money set their level Godmode instant teleport fast travel unlimited ammo and so on.GTA Online has suffered from these idiots ruining other peoples experience of the game more often then not they try to frame legit players.Personally GTA V Online reminds me of the hell that was APB Reloaded full of hackers and non stop t all over.GTA Online is becoming this unless Rockstar decides to spot these people.I know that Rockstar is not an MMO based game developer by far as they don't have the needed parts for it to work seems legit ? What do i base this on you might ask ? well let me explain First of they don't have Anti Cheat or Hack software yet most modders and hackers use a third party software that runs in the backround of the game so it can't be deteced directly. I suggest a software that scans a users PC and banns them that way.Second Most modders and hackers spawn cash and a bunch of useless crap all over the map.Such as UFO's Swat with stunguns and so on. On occation it's fun when they spawn animals to run over with a moped or something. Come on ? who doesn't like a fresh cow beef ?Reguardless if they do harmless stuff i don't care as long as they don't ruing the gameplay for others.Rockstar has said that they are WORKING on something to catch cheaters and hackers.Well i call that A load of t why ? cause this kind of system should be IN THE GAME to begin with.As i did mention Rockstar is not an MMO developer yet they try and fail.But the content they bring out is mostly clothes and cars no heists no missions. i do understand that it takes time to program these things but if you aim for an MMO fan base you need to be ready to STATICFY. Giving content catching hackers cheaters and modder. but nope they bite the dust.If you play in a solo inv session with your friends sure the game works and you might have some fun but not the full experience as you lock away people from the outside as well as hackers.To be fair play APB Reloaded instead of GTA V Online as it stands right now.Don't get me wrong i love the GTA Series of games ALL of them but this ! This takes the top cake for not being a solid product as the MMO portion of the game.Graphics Exellent.Sound Good sometimes it flips out.controls Awsome for keyboard and controller.Content bad two things to do mainly 1 Missions and 2 heists.Anti cheat of any kind Doesn't exist it's based on player report other player with proof and nothing else.If you want a singleplayer experinece to blow you away ? Go for GTA V Want a good multiplayer experience ? Stay way from it and play APB Reloaded it's just as fun if not more now since they got rid of cheaters.My personal score GTA V (Story) !0/10 GTA Online 6/10 duo lack of content and full of cheaters.My judgement is based of singleplayer so i vote recommend but if you want the game for multiplayer ? become a cheater and it might be fun for you. You judge that portion.

review: This game is the pinnicle of gaming at the moment. There's nothing awful I can find about this game. The story is engaging and interesting the multiplayer feels great (although the community doesn't but I won't deduct anything because of a community) the guns are all diffrent with their own strenghts and weaknesses. I'm a big fan of the GTA franchise and this is obviously their best installment of the game. You get warmed up to each of the characters because of their personalities they each posess. They don't feel cookie cuter cardboard cut outs etc they feel like genuine people which is something many games have. I have an absolute blast when I play this game. The long download is well worth the wait and hard drive space.10/10

review: This is very poor on part of Rockstar Games and Steam. I have been waiting for this game from such a long time. I bought this game with such a hope and excitment. Today I had the worst day firstly I have problem installing the game. It crapped out my hard drive had to increase the partition space so that the game could be installed. What is this ? It needs 150 GB to install 50 gb game. What compression or decryption are you guys running. Now that the game is installed it wont start. It just keeps crashing. Now I read these articles about User account names WTF is that. Why cant my game start in my windows account. So still I create a new user name then again try to start the game. Still crashes. I reboot my system around 5 times. I updated my graphic card gave all the exes Admin right. But nothing works. The launcher keeps crashing. I am bloody well not a developer but is this is what you call a product. Creating a ton of hype for the game and then you finally deliver it this poor execution and sell us this What is wrong with you guys cant you guys test it better. I am really dissappointed. No point of pre ordering. This is a real shame. BTW I wanted to gift this to myself on my birthday. Thanks rockstar and steam for ruining it for me.

review: Storyline is great and the PC version plays excellent. Now I've already beaten this on the PS4 I bought this purely so I could play online in full 4K at 60FPS. Game performance is excellent and my single 980Ti runs this beautifully maxed out in 4K while achieving well over 60FPS consistently. Now the down side online is completely useless and unplayable unless you're playing on a friends only server. Every single public server is riddled with hackers/script users that will utterly ruin the experience. Because of this the game ends up being a letdown. Rockstar has seemingly no plans to combat the widespread cheater problem and seemingly only cares about removing player's in game currency.

review: While the game is good the service for GTA online is very poor. The game regularly crashes the "cloud servers" are unavailable and you just are blocked from playing. I find that very disappointing considering how long it has been out.Wait a couple more months (maybe) and perhaps then they will ahve the online side of things sorted. The single player is fun with an interesting story but Trevor is... uncomfortable to play. Updated review The service has improved over the past number of months and now it is much more stable. There are still some very strange quirks with the interface (load automatically online into a public game with no option to default to a friends only or crew only game) but the game has been very well supported and is very fun. I find I can now recommend the game.

review: Anyone who wants to buy this game for GTA Online should DEFINITELY reconsider. Folllowing the Gunrunning update I was caught in a massive ban wave and my account was suspended for seemingly no reason at all. All of my progress and characters will be reset meaning that everything I have done in the game will be erased. If that isn't bad enough I reached out to Rockstar Support to seek help and find out why exactly I was banned. All I got was an incredibly vague and generic response that sounded like a default copy and paste answer. In conclusion do not play GTA Online on PC as there is a higher risk of being banned (even if you are innocent) and Rockstar support will only give you the cold shoulder if you try to reach out. If you want to buy this game for GTA Online I would definitely advise against it. Just stick with the current gen consoles if you have them and if you don't well it's not worth it since GTA Online is kind of a boring grind for money now.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Thank you Take Two you did the right thing by letting the development of OpenIV continue.http //www.pcgamer.com/gta modding tool openiv receives an update signaling development will continue/((Old negative review I liked playing GTAV when I had it on the PS3. I bought the PC version so I could play with some mods. Unfortunately Take Two Interactive decided to be and sue mod makers for making mods. I didn't take notice for a while but then they crossed the line and gave OpenIV a Cease and Desist. Grand Theft Auto V is a great ambitious game but as of right now if you want to mod the game I'd recommend against this for now. If things change for the better I'll remove this review and see about making a good one.Sign this petition https //www.change.org/p/rockstar games save openiv Also everyone's thinking Rockstar was directly involved but it was really Take Two Interactive that's responsible for all this so direct all hate to them not Rockstar.))

Nvidia graphics cards are the best for this game at the moment in time as they have releced a dedicated driver for GTA5 (AMD have a beta driver). Online sometimes crashes for me this may be because of my slow internet or just my setup. The game has an option for multipule moniters and other graphics settings. the only real complaint from me is that it is 60gb and with my internet it took me 1 week to download but aside from that i would recomend this game to anyone with a 350 setup or more

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I LOVE IT!!! Just wish we can decorate our apartments or have the ability to purchase our own furniture! As well as being able to design cars more personally like in APB character creation is limited. Wish there were more attributes to choose from. The chicks are UGLY! ha ha And Just because I am a gamer gal doesn't mean that I am fat and ugly. lol. Other than walking all stupid in the game I love it! Very realistic love driving the wave runners. I mean the effects are TRULY out of this world! ha ha I feel every wave when sailing a boat or driving a jet ski. Too cool! I even get sick when I am going too fast! Oh yeah and I love how realistic the game is. I mean I can go ride a ferris wheel or jump off a bridge and use a parachute sailing in the wind like a kite! HILARIOUS too! I never laughed so hard when my toon stumbles over a car or trying to get out of the car I forget to stop the car completely and my toon falls out of the car skids across the pavement and well...I am just a mess! ha ha Love the graphics like the blood being so realistic spraying all over the cop cars! This game should be recommended for all the people in the news of late...aka #riots. If people want to vent just log on to GTA5! ha ha ha At least it is MORE SAFE and you won't go to jail? ha ha ha LOVE THE SCENERY!!! Love how I can be in the city then go to the mountains then take my ugly toon butt to the beach to the BOARDWALK! WOW!!! THe detail of this game is PHENOMENAL!!! The helicopters and the flying of airplanes and TANKS!!! Total chaos! So much fun! Even code breaking skill games well...mission code breaking skill games which is in the game. It totally took me by surprise and I was like "what the heck am I supposed to do?" It reminded me of a retro game. Simple game but not at first cuz you are like "whuuuaaat?" then you go...."oh." ha ha ha Too cool! Really! MOST IMPRESSED! Lot of SMART people made this game and it is really really cool. Is there a safe mode for kids? My kids like to fly the airplanes and helicopters. And when they like to drive my car that is fine too. But I fear for them finding the stripper bar. I know that there is an age requirement for this game but being in a household with children where your pc is in a common room it is hard to not allow the kids to try. Please no judgement. So it would be cool to able to have a Safe Mode for just in case measures when you have to leave your game to go flip a burger on the grill and come back to your game to see your kids flying your airplane off into the sunset! I GOT HIGH JACKED by my own kids! LOL Fun for the WHOLE FAMILY! Like how we all can play on a server together too! And like the PASSIVE mode if you dont want to be shot by other players. Nice!!!Good times in GTA5.Thanksgamergal273
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Great port onto PC of a cult game. Very well optomised for PC games decent spec machine is easily looking at 50fps+ and a high end maching will push out closer to 100fps without sweating too hard. Game is playable at 25fps which is where you'll be pinned initially with the VSync set to 50% in the settings. Untick that and you're good to go. Plays exactly the same as the console version would highly recomend getting an XBOX 360 pad to play on PC with game switches effortlessly between pad and mouse/keyboard for the best of both worlds. My console playing buddy is highly jealous that I can plug in the 50" TV and kick back with the joy pad on a game that looks like it was meant for PC!Buy this buy a XBOX controller. Bacon all the way.

review: I enjoyed every bit of this game. Stunning visuals realistic gameplay amazing landscapes and the prostitut*s! Action packed with touches of humor during every mission and the music (my favorite radio station is The Lab). Rockstar has really improved the property system. GTA V feels like a combination of San Andreas and IV with fresh technologies and techniques. At some points I felt the need of getting on top of the car/truck while in motion to create some extra fun like in Just Cause or Sleeping Dogs. Sea life is also glorious.I'm not really having so much fun with the GTA Online as I was expecting but Singleplayer was totally amazing.

review: I still do not recommend this game. Even after the whole mod fiasco I don't. ONLINE It's been a grind from the start. To even get a car and modify it it'll cost you big. Shark Cards are too overpriced too. Almost a hundred dollars for eight mil that barely buys you a yacht. (No wonder people hack the out of it.) Their anti cheat bans innocent people for just playing the game and even if they try to talk to support for it it won't ever help. Children are all over and you'll probably get kicked from heists if you're low level by the most toxic of players. Two thumbs down and a blown raspberry to that.SINGLEPLAYER &amp CAMPAIGN If you are considering buying GTA V for SP mods I'd suggest it*. Personally the campaign was a little slow for me looking back and also quite grind like again. (I've played it fully through on XB 360 and then some) Money in the SP is a bit easier to get but of course half of the stuff that is actually fun is on the online. Unrelated to gameplay but the graphics are pretty awesome if you're able to afford a good titan of a PC but even mine (Cyberpower Thermaltake with a 1060 GTX) slugs with FPS on recommended settings.OVERALL* Unless you're buying this for the first time or buying it for mods I don't suggest buying it for full price. And even at that don't buy it for full price at all. Buy when sales come on or maybe a third party. Online is crappy on many points and Singleplayer depends on the player's style and mindset. A solid 7.5/10 from me.

review: I've never owned a Rockstar game before two weeks ago... I'm not a fanboy saying this F Rockstar.I got the game as an early Xmas gift... two weeks I played up until Xmas... put in the grind loving it racking up 700K in game and a couple low level properties...Then on Christmas Rockstar offers everyone a free "Hermes" muscle car... all you have to do is order in ingame from the dealer "free" on the site and it will be delivered... well myself along with countless others clicked for the free car... YAY!But then the game deducted the cost of the car 535K (70% of what it took me two weeks to earn)...It's a cool car but I would have never spent that money on that... 500K in game is 10$ real life money in their microtransacrtions... I wouldn't have paid 5K in game for that car cool as it is... Well now Rockstar is apparently making it right for some and not others... I sit here days later waiting along with many others for the refund that they said on their support site was coming...Well it comes for some and not others... as I type this people are posting screen shots of their refunds...I don't know why this is so hard... If I drop 10$ on a card shark that money would be in my account right now... why can't they do the same for a refund?And is that refund ever coming at all?Did they somehow determine that only some of us actually deserve the refund? Did they determine I did something wrong? (I don't mod clean install and have a perfect VAC record in many years on Steam)...This whole things is BS...This is no way to run a company.Again not fanboy anger... this is empirically wrong.It's a fantastic game... I've loved every minute of it... I'll keep playing it... but I'm not spending any of the other Xmas money I have on steam on these guys...I won't give Rockstar another dime. Ever. Fantastic introduction you guys made to me... On December 28th Rockstar corrected my account for the amount that was taken for the 'free' car... some people are still waiting... It's absolutely BS to be working so hard on a mission only to have some kid destroy your cargo from the safety of his office with one button...Stupidest mechanic in the world... there is no defense for it. Just a blatant griefing tool. Still playing it a lot a month plus after getting the game... I love the game but You have to do things to make a session conducive to playability... griefers are everywhere on every server... so you have to fudge the game to get a private server for you and your friend to get 20 minutes of grief free play...You can save up all your money or spend on sharks to buy that tank to attempt to slow down the griefing only to be met by some kid with 134253561 billion hacked dollars who can destroy you instantly with the game's legit magic button...I'm sure you will think someday I'll have the toys and beat those griefers... but you won't... unless you hack too. It's unlike any other game it's absolutely a blast when it goes well... but you're going to have to bend the rules and research tricks just to get some decent play time in. And don't fall for any of the "we'll give you X amount of money if you do this..." promotions... I'm still waiting on the 200k I was supposed to get for signing up for their mailing list... and I'm still waiting on the 1.25 million I was supposed to get for buying a single 20$ shark during an exclusive promotion that was available to me in a loading screen...They're a clumsy company with a great product... unfortunately the company is entrenched in the gameplay so does affect you.I play this game a lot... more than any other game I own right now... but I only enjoy it because I bend the mechanics of the game to play without grief. If you cannot do this or if this is a pain for you you will not enjoy this game.Unless you like grief I cannot recommend this game. I did end up getting the promised promotional money after I sent in a ticket and a little wait... but by then I just didn't care anymore...I'm not really playing the game anymore.

They will not respond to countless emails I have sent to them about how their Social Club launcher will not let me play my game if this was one of the cheaper less new games I probably would not be so passionate about this but for this I feel completely jipped and ripped off. My experience with Rockstar has been one with months of not being able to play the game I spent a lot of money on and after this awful experience I will more than likely be searching for other games to spend my little amount of time one. Social Club is complete garbage and I'm shocked that such a well respected company treats their customers in this manner. Will more than likely not be purchasing another Rockstar product that I cannot even play.
