review: Before I start this review let me make one thing clear. The game runs fine good graphics and everything. The single player is just as fun as always. This review is focused entirely on the multiplayer. I ve also heard about the shady business practice of bumping the price up adding a shark card that gives in game money putting it on sale . The shark card caused you to not be able to refund it. However I want to talk about the multiplayer in general. For starters good luck getting a good server. In most cases you ll get into a server with maybe 2 to 3 people. The loading times are unreasonable. One time I counted (no joke) 10 minutes to join a server with only 1 person. Most of the time it would just kick me back to single player but it didn t. Then there is the people themselves. Yes I know the game is rampant with hackers right now but that s not my issue. Seriously people when they made the PC version you should all have expected this to happen. Anyways the online for GTA V encourages you to be a jerk. No really I mean it. You gain more XP for killing other player than playing with them say robbing stores together or going on a cop massacre. It s okay to kill people but once you attack their car then YOU are the bad person not the guy killing you. Then you have the issue with matchmaking. Want to play a regular team Deathmatch? HAH! Good luck. Ever map is player created with an exploit that allows the original creator of the map to escape the initial zone and kill people without retaliation. The heists are cool but trying to get into one with random people is a chore and almost not worth it. However the biggest offender is the racing. In order to get car upgrades you have to win races. Simple enough the issue is YOU HAVE TO PLACE FIRST. So this means that you have to win tons of races in first but here s the issue it isn t balanced. In most scenarios a person will have a decked out vehicle far better than my noobish car and leave me in the dust while I struggle to keep up. This means if you don t need skill just a good car.Almost every issue in the multiplayer could have been fixed with a little thinking but there was none. Rockstar if you read this or better yet even care about us here is some suggestions (once this hacking problem is fixed). 1 Matchmaking with Rockstar ONLY maps and an even playing field. No level requirements for specific maps and no bonuses to higher players. Everyone is treated the same and everyone can play the same map. And having only Rockstar maps means people can join matches quicker rather than having to dip in and out of matches looking for a good server.2 Allow 2nd and 3rd place winners in races and the same rule as number 1 so people with no vehicle upgrades can have a chance to win rather than get slaughtered by the high level players.3 Have a reward system so when players play together in free roam they earn more. Not the stupid 100 xp for cruising with other players. I played GTA V online to play with people not avoid them.4. Enough with the being a bad sport. It s GTA V for God sake. Being put down because I blew up the jerks car that has killed me repeatedly over the past 20 minutes is ridiculous.And finally number 5.Try and see if you can work things out with loading screens like a single screen for matchmaking and so on so we don t have to constantly go in and out of loading screens. (I know this one is more complex and probably can t be fixed but it is an issue.)Again if you want the game for Single player then buy away. But the online is a mess. I wish I could get my money back then I d go back to the PS4 or 360 version.This is just sad.

review: GTA V Singleplayer 8/10Pros*Amazing graphics*Good performance on all machines*Very interesting characters*Huge world with many different areas*Good story that reminds me of many movies including Heat*Varied missions*You can make your own sound track using Self Radio*Directors mode*Heists*Strangers*PlanesCons*You start the game in Canada which is infinitely more interesting than any city in America but then never get to go back there outside of one more mission!*Cognitive dissonace between story and gameplay*Having three characters means that the story is a lot less focused then in GTA IV*Civilians go into the exact same animation and die every time they're shot in anything but the head*Car physics are too light and are overall a downgrade from GTA IV*Cars don't get damaged like they did in GTA IV so again a major downgrade*FOV too low*Sound is way too quiet on Self Radio songs*Shooting is way too arcady in my opinion there's no recoil your accuracy is pin point and they sound like BB guns!*For a game set in the same city as GTA SA there's almost nothing gang related in story nor gameplayGTA Online 6/10Pros*Characters from singleplayer gives you missions*HeistsCons*Grindy gameplay*No honor amongst thieves in this game...*Microtransactions*Nothing to do other then race or deatmatch

review: When a young street hustler a retired bank robber and a terrifying psychopath find themselves entangled with some of the most frightening and deranged elements of the criminal underworld the U.S. government and the entertainment industry they must pull off a series of dangerous heists to survive in a ruthless city in which they can trust nobody least of all each other.Grand Theft Auto V for PC offers players the option to explore the award winning world of Los Santos and Blaine County in resolutions of up to 4k and beyond as well as the chance to experience the game running at 60 frames per second. The game offers players a huge range of PC specific customization options including over 25 separate configurable settings for texture quality shaders tessellation anti aliasing and more as well as support and extensive customization for mouse and keyboard controls. Additional options include a population density slider to control car and pedestrian traffic as well as dual and triple monitor support 3D compatibility and plug and play controller support. Grand Theft Auto V for PC also includes Grand Theft Auto Online with support for 30 players and two spectators. Grand Theft Auto Online for PC will include all existing gameplay upgrades and Rockstar created content released since the launch of Grand Theft Auto Online including Heists and Adversary modes.The PC version of Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft Auto Online features First Person Mode giving players the chance to explore the incredibly detailed world of Los Santos and Blaine County in an entirely new way.Grand Theft Auto V for PC also brings the debut of the Rockstar Editor a powerful suite of creative tools to quickly and easily capture edit and share game footage from within Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft Auto Online. The Rockstar Editor s Director Mode allows players the ability to stage their own scenes using prominent story characters pedestrians and even animals to bring their vision to life. Along with advanced camera manipulation and editing effects including fast and slow motion and an array of camera filters players can add their own music using songs from GTAV radio stations or dynamically control the intensity of the game s score. Completed videos can be uploaded directly from the Rockstar Editor to YouTube and the Rockstar Games Social Club for easy sharing. I just copied this from the description of the game. Soundtrack artists The Alchemist and Oh No return as hosts of the new radio station The Lab FM. The station features new and exclusive music from the production duo based on and inspired by the game s original soundtrack. Collaborating guest artists include Earl Sweatshirt Freddie Gibbs Little Dragon Killer Mike Sam Herring from Future Islands and more. Players can also discover Los Santos and Blaine County while enjoying their own music through Self Radio a new radio station that will host player created custom soundtracks.

review: Would I recommend this game? Well yes. It's good very good. Rockstar did a great job with optimizing it. It runs smoother than I could have imagined! GTA Online is very fun especially seeing as in most online PC PvA games like DayZ for instance the first person you meet shoots you in the face. This does not happen unless you meet someone who's player icon on the map is red for if that happens your gonna have a bad time.One gripe I have though and it isn't just me and it's not limitted to this current GTA either is the Vehicle controls. Car controls (Keyboard and mouse) Your standard WASD system with Spacebar to use the handbrake. For some strange reason though E is not the "Activate Car" button as it is with EVERY OTHER GAME ON THE PLANET. It is instead F and E is the horn or fire weapon/activate boost. Slightly petty I know but still.Plane controls (Keyboard and mouse) Took a bit of getting used to but once you have got the hang of it its livable. WASD makes you accelerate brake and turn. The NUMBER PAD makes you do all the special plane stuff like pitching and rolling etc. Now that would be acceptable if they gave you a tutorial on "How to fly a plane for Dumbasses" like myself. But they don't. Instead you are left to repeatedly crash into the mountains until you work it out.Helicopter Controls (Keyboard and Mouse) Ah the Helicopters. I'm not gonna lie they are PHYSICALLY IMPOSSIBLE to use with a Keyboard and mouse. When I first tried to fly one I spent most of the time crashing and saying "I just want to go forward why wont you let me go forward?". There is no clear button to go forward. W makes you gain altitude while 8 (on the numberpad) makes you pitch forward. Holding these two together and you hurtle forward uncontrolably. Why you can't JUST go forward is beyond me. The rest of the controls are not much better.So to round off. The game is great there's no denying that. Just please for the love of God and your own sanity get a controller to fly aircraft otherwise that computer you got in order to run the game might just find itself on the ground outside in small pieces.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This was a good game.Key word "was"Rockstar is a fantastic developer who created a masterpiece with grand theft auto V. Diverse enjoyable gameplay great characters wacky story and a vast alive open world to explore with thousands of easter eggs and such to find. Even the online was a good concept. Put thirty people into the already wacky world and just let them do whatever they want.But then we get to Take Two.Ahhh Take Two. The worst ever thing to happen to one of the best things ever. The greedy scummy money grabbing of TT had a licence to print money in their hands. The most profitable video game of all time on 5 different platforms and it was all theirs.And boy did they ruin it.The history of GTAV since its release has been a long line of screw ups one after another leading right up to today and probably going on. And all because someone decided it would be a clever idea to add micro transactions to GTA online.This lead to many problems. First was the cancellation of any single player DLC in favour of purely multiplayer expansions. This meant that there would not be any expansions on the rich engaging world of GTAV instead focusing on the shallow world of GTAO.Then there is the GTAO expansions themselves. Rather than adding to and enriching the gameplay (which is riddled with awful load times lobbies and player dropouts resulting in automatic failures of missions) they instead just kept adding more content which players had to pay for with in game money and forever increasing the cost of this stuff (which is mainly just vehicles and properties) meaning that to continue players would either have to grind for hundreds of hours or purchase the microtransactions.Then when players were fed up they instead understandably just modded in the new content into the singleplayer to enjoy it. Of course this meant less income from micro transactions so of course TT had to put a stop to that. So now if you do mod in any of this content into the single player it is automatically removed.But the icing on the cake came just a few hours ago when TT issued a cease and desist against OpenIV one of the main programs for making GTAV mods and basically made modding illegal somehow stating that Open IV allows "third parties to defeat security features of its software and modify that software in violation Take Two's rights" which is bulls***.I don't really have anything else to say. If you have even a shred of decency then you will not buy this game nor any other that has any link to take two (i.e. any rockstar or 2K game). Please do not allow things like this to continue. It is harming the industry we all love and will only serve to further the ever worsening reputation the gaming world has.TLDR F*** Take Two and F*** this gameEDIT Rockstar seem to have now overruled TT and allowed openIV to operate. HOORAY. However these business practices cannot be allowed to happen so my review stays negative.

review: I'm recommending this game it's awesome. What's more fun that an open word with fast cars guns planes money and hookers. However here's my beef.To those of you that will say "You don't get banned for nothing." You're wrong.(bitly because removes links) 2aSildIHere is a video of me minutes before receiving my first ban email. Dropping out of plane into the middle of the ocean onto someone's yacht just screwing around. At 30 seconds everyone on my server leaves/is kicked at the same time. The exact same thing happened the second time I was banned. The second time I was just driving around aimlessly. I wasn't harassing or interacting with any other players including friends definitely not spinning some slick mods to people off no offensive chat to get me reported just banned. I hate hackers as much as the next guy.The worst thing is the next time I'm banned I ve read it's an 18 year ban for a third offence. Okay well 2/3 of the last times I've played I've been banned running a totally vanilla game. One month of no GTA online that sucks but essentially permanent ban that s a problem. What do I do online? Nothing really. I'm low level and mostly do racing if anything outside of free play. When racing I always finish in the back because I have crappy non custom cars. Best hacker ever."But you probably took money from a hacker". No. The only money I have ever received from outside of jobs/races/etc I got 1.x mill for buying the game during a promotion through Steam."But you probably modded the local game" No. Never done anything but click play and...play."You probably have other modding software on your computer" Only if Skyrim workshop counts but I don't think my extra high detail grass would trigger a GTA V ban.What's the point? Don't waste your time calling support. The following is part of an email I received from support rockstar.com. We generally do not overturn temporary bans nor can we guarantee individual responses to any temporary or permanent ban appeals however we will review any evidence you submitted and take it into consideration. No further information is required from you at this time and this ticket will close on its own. I've called them 3 times because I kept trying to come up with new evidence of me not hacking. Asking them what I can submit to them to prove I was not hacking. It was the same experience every time and they wouldn't even consider looking at my evidence. (For those of you reading this saying Look at this hacker noob just wants to get back online and hell with us. This is way past my effort threshold if I personally knew I had done something wrong)So anyway here's what WILL happen when you call Rockstar Support.1. You'll sit on hold for 45 minutes while feeling like EVERYONE has to have the same problem as me.2. A person reading from a script will pick up the phone.3. You'll tell them your sob story while they do a terrible job of sounding like they care that you've been on hold for 45 minutes responding to an email that came from support rockstar.com. (But let s be honest these guys have a tough job)4. You'll be put on hold while I'm guessing they take a swig of schnaps from their coffee cup and hyperventilate into a paper bag. (tough job requirements)5. Your friend the support guy gets back on the line and will repeat over and over again as you ask more specific questions that..."GTA Online bans are triggered by a number of factors including modding in GTA Online exploiting or abusing game mechanics manipulating protected game data and code or otherwise interfering with other players gameplay experience."(Thank you I understand but I'm being persistent because apparently you refuse to understand that I have never done anything but PLAY this game)(repeat step 5 8 10 times)6. You get transferred to a manager the only difference is they (probably) have the ability to hang up the phone after you continue to be persistent. No matter what evidence tried to provide even the manager would just repeat the same line over and over.7. The manager (or other) will try to push the conversation to ask you if there are any other support questions not related to banning they can assist you with.(Well Sir your security scripts banned me while playing a totally completely unapologetically vanilla game. TWICE. That sounds like a solid support issue. Maybe it's my fault. Maybe I do have some software on my machine that is causing this. Probably not but that sounds like something you should help me troubleshoot. Instead just repeat your scripted answer.)8. (I wasn t actually being a just persistent) Thank your support engineer/person. Make sure you use their name and understand that they have done all they can for you. I m telling you right now they can t do anything. Apologize for that time when things got heated and you called them a filthy (you not me I didn t do that). Clearly this issue is out of their control. They do not have the power to fix your ban or the scripts that caused it and they are not allowed to connect you with anyone else that may be able to fix this. Don t waste your time calling support when this happens to you because they just can t help. Stir up the community and see if you can get Rockstar s attention. They make great games but as someone who has never violated their terms of service in any way but yet am one wrongful ban away from permanent ban and a loss of the money I spent on the game I am pretty disappointed with them. I am seeing these same stories all over the Steam community so I know I m not the only one and it just sucks.Tldr Got banned from GTA V online 2/3 times of playing a totally vanilla online and offline game. Dealing with their support summary.

review: GTAV runs great on my machine. I enjoyed the game back when it released on last gen consoles but as a PC gamer myself I found the experience was hindered by low framerate low resolution and screen tearing even on the most recent Xbox 360 model not to mention a online fee for a console I rarely dust off. All the qualities missing from that experience I now have on PC 1080p60 running on my personal rig configurable settings to hit that perfect quality/performance ratio and FREE ONLINE MULTIPLAYER. The only negative comments I can make about this game regard the tedious and inconsistent menus. Some GTA Online menu items are missing in the online menu when compared to the single player menu and there are seemingly three avenues to accept and manage friends and game invitations. Loading screens are long partially because it is too large to justify installing on my SSD but it is made worse by the fact that one must load into a random online session just to join a friend's session and load again. Thankfully these issues are easilly forgotten while reinacting 9/11 with fighter jets.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: 3 years ago GTA V came out on console and I was sure I'll never get to play it as I'm a PC player exclusively. When it was announced on PC and next gen I told myself that a simple port of the game was coming like many other games and that PC players will be once again treated like something that don't matter with minimal options and improvement. How wrong I was. The amount of work that have been put in this release is phenomenal. The optimization seems top notch and even the Next gen console version looks bad versus the 4k beefed version. I'm not playing in 4k few people can but I have enough horsepower on my rig to play it on ultra 1080p and I have to say that it's amazing. Mouse &amp keyboard controls are good (mostly for shooting!) but are a little clumsy in vehicle phases. Good thing I have an old x360 pad at hand.Technically speaking I dont know what to say. I'm speechless. There's so much graphical option than even the best PC games pales compared to this. For once we have a true PC version and not a quick cheap port with few to none options for us PC Master Race Overlords who loves tweaking everything D I have only played 2 hours but I can already say that I don't regret one bit to have paid full price for this game. And considering how much copies have sold already I hope more editors will be willing to make true PC version of their games in the future seeing the huge potential it represent.

review: Since upgrading from the 360 I can say the graphics are greatly improved and the first person mode is fantastic. The storyline mode runs well. Having done the prologue I wanted to jump online and sync my account. This is where the trouble starts.This problem is Social Club.It took a while to finally sync my characters over which is perfecly understandable. I tweeked my character and jumped in. Crashed and got a message saying I was logged in elsewhere. After reloading i had to re tweek my character again then the same thing happened. After what must be 20 attempts i was finally on long enough that it saved my character. However the longest ive been online is 3 minutes. I've attemted it in safe mode to no avail. I also attempted to submit a ticket to Rockstar which wouldn't submit.I know I could play the campaign but I've already done this on another platform and just want to play online. However this is impossible in the current state.1/10 untill these issues have been resolved.Fx8350 black 4.0GHzCrosshair V Formula zR9 29016g RAMEdit Been a couple of months since last time and still the same bull****. **** you rockstar you are getting no more money from me!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Despite having issues getting the game to work the first weekend this game is great. I'm over 100 hours in and I still have things to do. The single player was amazing the story and missions were some of the best I've seen from the series. The main reason for this are the heists. The game hypes you up using setup missions and lives up to it with intense escapes from the scene. Personally the Paleto Bay heist was the best with tanks and helis at every corner (Strongly suggest doing the whole thing in first person). The ending to the story was great and was completely worth the two year wait. GTA Online provides more content to the already amazing game. Missions are slightly bland and easy to cheat with the Karuma but enjoying the open world with friends and cool vehicles is great. One of the greatest additions to the series to give it the respect it deserves.10/10 Would watch that lawyer get ripped to pieces by a turbine again
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I love this game however there are many many many many problems with it and it's community. I am constantly recieving social club connection errors and crashes. The community is also very unfriendly on the most part with many modders/hackers and trolls who love to constantly blow up you and your vehicles and ruin your heists. The game is fun but these problems are making it hard to recommend this game to others and to continue playing it. as an example of the hardship I deal with I just got off the game after spending hours trying to do a single setup mission and constantly having to restart because of players who decide to leave halfway through or purposely suicide right before the mission's end causing me and my friend to get nowhere in our heists and to waste hours upon hours of hard work.

review: Short Review. Will elaborate when I can put the game down for more than a few minutes.Excellent port minus a few hiccups. The first person aspect really turns it into an entirely new game. RDR WEAPON WHEEL OMG TY ROCKSTAR.9/10 Best GTA V To Date

review: As a Grand Theft Auto V player who transferred from Playstation 3 I would definiately say that this is worth the second purchase. From the new immersive first person mode that allows you feel like the world of Los Santos is more personal to the highly detailed and sophisticated graphics that the PC version has to offer I would definitely say that this game was able to do more than what a remaster can do. It truly shows the best possible way to play Grand Theft Auto V which was still significantly better than a lot of games on PS3. The best game just got better. 10/10 (again)

review: The single player is one of the most entertaining gaming experiences I had in awhile.You have brilliantly crafted characters within a world that trolls reality. The multiplayer though is mixed between great and horrendous so I won't purchase this just for multiplayer. Performance/visual wise it runs and looks well enough on low/medium settings for a mid/low range pc.There are tons of mods available unfortunately Rockstar does not support mods for this game. So never use mods when in multiplayer or you will risk getting banned. Installing mods is quite technical (Do your research before modding!). Using the OpenIV tool will save your life/time.Basicly an excellent story multiplayer is a bit mixed and modding is technical but worth it.

review: Rockstar promised to give us a smooth launch. They took two years to make the PC version and hell they even delayed the game three or four f****ing times on top of that. My high end gaming PC handles mostly everything in max setting so I was expecting nothing less with this game. Instead I've had FPS drop from 60 40 and sometimes from there to 20 . I can't stand this stuttering and those FPS drops so I'm a bit disappointed with how this turned out.I suppose I'm lucky I even got to launch the game at all since people seem to be having issues with that.In this current state I cannot recommend this game.P.S I will update my review once Rockstar releases another patch.

review: So what can I say I love this game the world is immense and on numerious occasions I have found myself just exploring it. Both in the single player and online. Getting some friends together robbing a store for litterally next to no cash at all then finding some bikes the pedal type so you know what lets head down to the beach and do some sweet tricks at the park. Oh hey reckon we can get to the top of that mountin over there on push bikes.... "30 minutes later" TTTT police helicopters chasing us as were on the back of a train. And its moments like this that kept me going back to multiplayer. Now have I ever bought a shark card nope that. I still have enough cash to get along half the fun is saving up for a couple nights to buy that brand new super car which will be outdated in the next update have not touched my adder in years. So when I hear Take twos CEO is complaing players arent paying enough I think hey thats me. Shark cards I only paid for the game twice cause I wanted to move from xbox to PC but obviously thats not enough. And now theyre trying to kill off the modding scene which is one of the best parts of GTA ahhh the carmageddon mod good times. Dont forget these mods are for single player. Who cares if you spawn in cash there or get the hydra becasue its not accessable in the single player. And if I just want to run around as the hilk who are you to say I cant!!!! Oh you legally can well yes thats true but its a move.So hats my review move son.

Why?One half of the game is nothing short of genius. (single player)The other half is a money grab of epic proportions not even surpassed by most free to play games. So if you want this game for single player by it. Do not expect any form of DLC or expansion or anything they throw all their effort into making new stuff for multi player to grab more money from you.If you wanted this game for the multi player stay the hell away from it! Unless you are a millionaire and want to go bankrupt within the next few hours of playing that horrible part of this game.Be aware of companies that sell you in game items for hundreds of bucks and still publicly state that they think they are "undermonetizing" you.

review: High Priority TransmissionTo Rockstar Games and Take Two InteractiveWow just wow Rockstar and Take Two Interactive..........................................You were off to a rocky start at the begining now you have desecrated most if not all of the PC Gaming crowd trust. I cannot speak for the console crowd but I can definitely speak from a PC gamer viewpoint. I get that you do not like the PC for your games since you can't control peoples hardware like on consoles. That is the reason you most likely will not release RDR 2 on PC.Its so obvious that your actions speak for themselves. And to add insult to injury you have the audacity to lie to our face about it. Open IV was not a threat to your online portion of the game people could still hack in to you game and will continue to do so. You used Open IV as a scapegoat to justify you actions to coax players to jump on to GTA Online and squeeze every penny you can from them. I understand you need to generate revenue for your product to keep your ship afloat but greed can only get you so far before it destroy's you from within. You have made a pretty penny from this and enjoy it while it last............... Because you have lost the PC market with you draconian policies and behavior. Stick to the console crowd if that is your attitude towards mods. Because that is the main selling point of PC gaming its MODS!!!!!!!Most Publishers and Game Studios support mods for their game. You are solo on this stance well of course if its developers that develope exclusively on console and or EA then you have some folks behind you. You will regret this decision for a very long time. Kiss goodbye to a lot of your fans including me whose been playing GTA Since 2004 First game being GTA Vice City for which I adore alongside San Andres GTAIII and GTA IV etc. Rockstar I bid you farewell from my life...................... It was a good ride while it lasted.Goodbye!Adios!さよなら!P.S. If you were to revert you Anti Modding Stance then you might be on the path of redemption with the PC crowd. For which i highly doubt. But feel free to prove me wrong.End Of Transmission

review: As a player with over 500 hours on this game (because I used to play on disc) GTA V is a somewhat decent game to play. Story is great 3 playable characters each with rich backstories and unique personalities. The build up to become a multi millionaire is exciting. However the story is a bit short. It took me just about 5 days to finish the whole story and probably under a week for most players. If GTA V starts to get boring you have two choices. First choice is for you to know that story mode of course is also mod supported so you can add as much herbs and spices as you want.GTA Online however is where it's at. This mode is very well developed and still developing with customizable characters levelling system missions weapon upgrades property heists adversary modes free DLCs and much more. The downside to GTA Online is the community. Expect griefers flying in jets driving tanks flying motorcycles called oppressors modders and salty players (my favourite). Once you have a fair amount of experience in GTA Online it will begin to get boring unless you play with friends.Overall it's a 6/10 for me throughout my play time there has been a lot of dissapointments here and there but not enough of one to ruin my day.

review: I have over 800 hours in GTA V only about 4 or less of those hours were with the online portion which might I add I was not impressed by. Probably around 50 of those hours were playing the vanilla storyline the rest playing singleplayer with mods. 750 hours of my life I have spent having fun enjoying playing this game all thanks to mods if it was not for the modding capability I would most likely have spent very little time playing the game. Now i'm not one to write a review or complain about things however Take 2 Interactive's latest and foolish act to ban modding in an attempt to forcefully press their microtransaction hacker ridden online portion of their otherwise fantastic game has left me fuming. Up until now I would have reccomended the game to anyone looking for a quality piece of entertainment however thanks to Take Two's latest action I can no longer reccomend the game or any Take 2 products for that matter. I can not reccomend the game whilest Take Two attacks the very community that makes up a good portion of their playerbase and the only reason I have continued to play their game all in the name of profit.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA Online In open world most people are constantly running around killing each other. Missions most people rush in and get themselves killed or they stand back and leech XP or it's disorganized chaos. It's only fun if you can talk your friends into playing with you otherwise it's a mess. There are also a lot of non English speaking players people who keep their mic's hot or people who scream and cuss almost constantly. But with friends doing missions it's one of the coolest online experiences I've ever had and that's the honest truth. So playing with randoms? 3/10. Playing with friends? 8/10. The missions are still a little repetitive until you level up.Character creation is okay but I've seen it done better. You choose a lineage mother and father and you can slide over from one to the other to choose which one you take after more. That's okay but the character models are pretty ugly for the most part. After that you can adjust a few sliders like chin jaw eyebrows cheeks mouth nose but it's still nothing even close to the options in games like The Sims or Saints Row. Outfits are unlocked as you level up but even the starting options aren't too bad at least once you manage to get to a clothing store.I'd still pick Saints Row 3 or 4 as better games overall but you can only do 2 player co op in those. If you want to play with 2 or more friends GTA Online is just about the best you can do. You do have to be level 5 before you can unlock PVE missions but it doesn't take long to get to 5. You can either join missions you get invited to (and you get invited to stuff constantly) or you can just do PVP missions or races until level 5. Beware though if you see a deathmatch type mission advertising unrealistic amounts of RP (rep points basically XP) or money most likely it's an exploit. You'll go in there and end up getting killed over and over like fish in a barrel. Just stick to the normal missions.GTA 5 The story is a little better than GTA 4. At least in this case you can kind of sympathize with some of the characters. It's still a sausage fest no strong female characters and overall a very "dudebro" tone. The world is amazing though very well crafted. There's just so much detail everywhere it's like nothing I've ever seen before. It's practically a simulation very immersive.I haven't experienced any of the crashes hitching or technical glitches like others have described. But I'm running an i7 3770k with 24GB RAM and a Geforce 670 w/ 2GB VRAM. I have to run textures on Normal high or ultra high requires over 2GB of video ram. It works seamlessly with gamepad for driving/flying or kb/m for shooting. It doesn't seem to have aim assist like GTA 4 did when using a gamepad.Collecting and customizing cars is more intuitive and you can upgrade weapons too. They took a page from the Saints Row series here but I still think it's better done in Saints Row to be honest. In that game you have more granular options for vehicle and weapon upgrades both functional upgrades and cosmetic ones.Overall I'd give this game a 7/10 but that's just my personal taste. The online experience is very hit and miss and the single player mode is a little too gritty and depressing just like most GTA games. If you enjoy PVP and games where you play evil characters this game is an easy 9/10 I think. But if you're more of a carebear like me and you enjoy a more lighthearted tone Saints Row 3 &amp 4 are still the best open world urban mayhem games ever made.

review: Been playing since the initial release on PS3 and Xbox 360 played on Xbox One and came to PC had to start completely over due to the player transfer function being removed but oh well. Lets get started.The Pros Very well optimized Fun experience with many hours of gameplay The great GTA experience everyone loves GTA Online is funThe Cons GTA Online It has seriously turned into a massive cash grind costs to afford even small things have gone up so dramatically you will need to grind a few days to get something small incentivizes shark card purchases or the starter pack both of which will honestly not get you far. The community is very bad comparing to the console versions I've seen very few modders on the console releases however they run rampant here as if R* care very little for the PC community it can make gameplay unplayable at times. Especially when you may not even know if they are modding and just make it look like they are superior to you in any way Controls Some controls are good lots are bad even with adjustments being made. I had to use Synapse to get the sensitivity even close to usable combine this with the fact the gamepad has more options than the KB+M for example the ability to change accuracy between aiming mode and looking mode. Operating helicopters was awful however it was fixable. The jet however I was unable to fix I have auto center mouse activated for jets and my mouse refuses to follow the jets POV making it nauseating to operate a jet and almost impossible to actually combat enemy players in one. Overall I reccomend this game because despite its problems I continue to play it even though I hate it with every fiber of my being.

review: Grand Theft Auto is a fairly fun single player experience and you will likely enjoy it however you like many people are hoping that the multiplayer is good I can assure it is not while playing in a closed friend session it is very clear that rockstar wants you to spend mroe money as almost vehicle of any value is priced at a range where you will have to grind way more than you want to as shown by teh fact that 95% of my hours in GTA online is just grinding the fastest way I could find. However if you can get past that closed sessions can be quite fun wiht your friends. The real problem with GTA online is public sessions which you often have to be in for certain jobs and such. Almost every single public session has at least one hacker that goes pretty much completly unpunished unless they hack in money and if they don't ruin the experience then the griefers will people that will almost never be punished because they didn't hack but will work as hard as tehy can to use all of their resources to kill you over and over again. You may try to report hackers as that will at least increase the chance of one being punished however GTA follows a premise where you cannot report more than one person every at least 10 mins in my experience so if you are dealing with multiple hackers you canreport one of them and leave the server or stay in the server getting killed every 30 seconds for 10 minutes while you wait to be able to report the next person.

review: Update They have recently come out with a patch that fixed the fps problem by a huge ammount for the most part. The bugs are still there though. The content packs that they keep adding are keeping the game alive and I can respect that. I'm also glad they're free. Yes it's a given they should be but with many other companies they wouldn't be.There are many unsolved problems with the launcher and little bugs that just happen from time to time. I'm not the only one having them either as R* forums would prove (when I have gone to R* forums looking for answers it is a pretty terrible experience only to find generic responses like "Uninstall and reinstall." or "Have you tried restarting?" which hasn't fixed anything and with a game this big! that!). With the money gouging stunts they've pulled in the past (lowest of the low BTW) I'm skeptical about the next rockstar game being added to my cart anytime soon. Rockstar was on my "evil/corrupt" list for a while but now they're just on the fence. Get rid of those nasty microtransactions and you've earned my trust for the most part.

review: It's a Ronseal game does exactly what it says on the tin. That's not neccessarily a bad thing but aside from a few nifty gameplay mechanics it's fairly weak sauce compared to earlier efforts.The switchable three characters work and work well. The script and story is excellent. And the world is... sublime.But... so many buts. The single player campaign is really all there is. Once that's done so's the game. Oh you can be all completist and collect bits of scrap or bits of letters and the like but that's kind of rubbish. You can do some races if you like. Maybe visit the 10 or so locations in this vast sprawling city that you can actually go into. You can buy different shirts. Cars. Surf the net and get all meta. Superficial crap abounds.But other than a whole lot of diet coke there's not much there with caffeine and sugar you know? Also Rockstar still can't make flying as effortless as it is in say Far Cry which is baffling. You can go online but if I wanted to associate with my fellow man I'd go to the pub. Oh you can do that in GTA V too.So yeah recommended but it's nowhere near as good as FC4 and that was basically just a copy of FC3 with a Tuk Tuk and ridable elephants so it's not like they raised the bar into the clouds.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

But don't count my word for it there are hackers that are nice and will give you money.I personally use to be a hacker but I only used it to give my self money and turn off cops but not bother anyone else's gameplay (maybe some rude poeple). I personally never played the story mode so I can't give my opinion on that.and a word of advice if you want to play GTA Online but don't have money to buy Shark Cards and you don't want modded money don't even start to think about buying this game because the items in the online part of the game are rediclously expansive. In a short sentance money is king in this game. And when rockstar was developing GTA Online money making was their main intention (real money) not the player experience.

review: Ok so in the light of Take Two essentially banning mods from the game by sending a cease and desist letter to OpenIV (the modding tool used for all mods) i'm going to write an actual review on this game.Singleplayer Single player is genuine fun and has loads of content to actually play. Not much to hate there. If you want to get this game for it wait till it's on sale you would just be wasting money.Multiplayer Multiplayer is the reason I bought this game for the third time once on XB360 second on PS4 now on here. I don't regret my first two purchases for I've had a load of fun and met some nice and interesting people but I am starting to regret getting it for the third time. The height of GTA Online was when they released the heists update. People started playing the game due to the availability to get enough cash to buy the new vehicles and toys to play with in a fraction of the time it would take to do actual missions. After that it's been going down hill. Almost every new update comes with ridiculously overpriced vehicles apartments and to start some of the new missions they could've added comes a nice pricetag that if you were to try and get the money for would cost you around a minimum of four end game heists. These updates come with such ridiculously overpriced items so you would be tempted to purchase a shark card (wich I admit to doing and to those who are feeling like they would by one for the new update DON'T. It is genuinely NOT worth it). This marketing scheme feels way too much like a Clash of Clans scheme where you can get the stuff the hard way and use up alot of time or pay $100 to take the next step foward. This kind of marketing needs to stop it's an unethical buisness practice and it's an attempt to get the people susceptible to buying overpriced sharkcards so they can get just one of the new cars (most new vehicles cost from $1mil $2.5mil but the newest ones cost from $1mil $5.7mil and you can just look at the price of the shark cards to give you an idea of how much you could spend). Not to mention the bannings of random accounts (from reviews I saw when I bought it on here) and accounts who have received money from hackers either willingly or unwillingly.Modding As most people browsing the reviews here would know Take Two Rockstar's parent company has sent a cease and desist letter to the lead developer of OpenIV to stop the distribution of OpenIV. If you don't already know what OpenIV is it is the tool used to create mods for many GTA games. Modding is what I would say as the backbone to a game and it's community. Mods keep games and communities alive for years after the game as come out (e.g. Fallout New Vegas The Frontier mod which is STILL in development even after seven years of the game's release). Seeing Take Two take it down is horrible and a real scum bag move. Overall If you want this game for singleplayer wait till it is on sale. If you plan to play this online don't buy it it is a huge cash grab. This is a petition to save OpenIVhttp //store.steampowered.com

review: SP is freaking amazing. The world characters and dialog are so superbly developed. It all feels so genuine. This game has the most consistently entertaining missions of any open world game I can think of. None of the frustration and repetition you find in most open world games. My favorite part is that Los Santos is so varied from one area to the other you get a real feeling of travel and exploration. From the bottom of the sea to the top of Mt. Chilead Los Santos trumps every virtual world you've ever visited in almost every regard (unless that virtual world has dragons and stuff that's kind of an unfair advantage). Seriously if you like exploration this game is a must have. The story and missions are just a bonus. That said screw the MP. I do play it and enjoy it to an extent but it is riddled with problems. Matchmaking is a joke. The open world has very little to do beyond shopping and robbing convenient stores. Much of your time will be spent respawning after some knucklehead runs you down with his car. If you choose to fight back it will cost you a good bit in money and ammo for absolutley no reward. Freeroam fights are a waste imo. Sadly if you go into passive mode you can't rob stores or shoot cops. So you either take the greif or stand there with your hands in your pockets. Missions take forever to fill. The unexperienced can cost you the whole mission since your team is only allowed a single death. Communication is rare. I've only ever heard a few souls on a mic. A few more people type. Most people don't communicate at all. The missions especially heists are set up in a way that makes team work pretty important. So obviously playing with randoms that don't communicate can go south pretty fast. Unfortunately teaming up with friends is a chore unless you set up an invite only session. That said the missions can be VERY fun even with some randoms.The biggest issue here lately is the lack of mod support and the subsequent banning of many players. On one hand I totally agree with banning the people who add money and use godmode and all that. Maybe R* should allow private sessions to be used that way but since they currently do not I don't feel sorry for the people who used those cheats. They should have known better. On the other hand being banned for a FOV increase is completley idiotic and unjustifiable while any kind of mods/cheats used in SP should be fair game for everyone. R* definitely needs to be more selective about what they do and do not allow. All in all it's an amazing SP experience well worth the $60 I paid. The MP will surely be worth it for many gamers expecially ones with a regular group of friends they play with but others may be left feeling pretty disappointed. Of course if you are planning to mod the hell of this game so you can ride a BMX as a cow or Gaben forbid play in first person without getting sick don't waste your money. Not yet at least.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: An excellent game which has been ported extremely well. You can tell that Rockstar has taken care to ensure that the PC version works as it should. I picked it up immediately on release and it felt solid. A blessed relief in this world of shoddy console ports and massive day 1 hotfix patches. Those delays were worth it.The storyline is very well written and probably the best in the GTA series so far the characters are well considered and memorable (the acting is v. good). I got approximately 60 hours out of the main story mode missions alone and many more after they were over. The game is typical GTA an exaggerated take on the real world that while crazy never seems disjointed or overly far fetched. It all fits and feels right.Add to this the built in mission replay features (something the series hasn't had until this point) and a well executed online portion which possesses a level of quality in its missions that is on par with the main story mode content and its very hard to find fault with this title. Only the magic vanishing 'Dukes' problem I seem to have with Trevor has annoyed me in any measurable way other than that its me sucking badly in online deathmatches. Not Rockstars fault. )Pick it up you'll at least get your monies worth even if you never touch the online portion. However be aware that the download is around 60 gigs so be prepared if your internet connection is based on wet string.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is the definitive game of Rockstar's series in the world of GTA. Although their release schedule upset a few people due to the huge time scale difference between PS3 to PC I can assure you it was worth the wait. I've personally had this title on PS3 PS4 and now PC and it is clear that they've spent a lot of time (and money) improving each release.Whether you want to cycle down a moutain photograph wildlife cruise along a beach or skydive from the heavens this game caters for all needs without forcing you to partake in everything it has to offer. However if you decide not to take up all this game offers then you're missing out. The storyline is well told but does lack a little edge unlike the story of Nico in the last installment of GTA but what does make up for that is having multiple interlinking stories to play through from the hoods to the highlife. You will encounter 3 characters who you'll learn to love despite their flaws and at the end the future of the open world is in your hands with specific storyline decisions. If you're thinking of getting the game purchase it. If it's not your type of game try it still.

review: GTA V is the ULTIMATE open world game. Or WAS.Have a look at this. http //openiv.com/?p 1324OpenIV was a modding tool which allowed people to enjoy new creations and do whatever the they wanted. Be a policeman? You can do that. Make an armada of planes chase you down and actively hunt you wherever you were? You could do that too. What about add additional scripts to emulate actual physics behavior? You could even do that.And now Take Two wants to bury that in the sand and consider it "Illegal."You know what? The base game wasn't that fun either. It got old FAST. This game is stripped of many of the nuances GTA IV had and GTA Online is a ing joke riddled with microtransactions. So basically the modding scene was the only reason I ever played this game after I finished it. I liked playing around with what people came up with. And now I guess that's illegal? Modding is the ESSENCE of PC gaming. It's what defines us as players while also being creators in our own right. If you want to consider that illegal go right ahead. You can be DAMN SURE I will never set foot around any Take Two game ever again PERIOD.

review: This is not a GTA title this game should be renamed to "Working for the cops". The storyline is totally screwed. In the beginning you get the feeling of actually playing GTA but as it turns out all you have to do is work for government agencies and the charakters ingame seem to really like it because they get good paper. Well they could've become investment bankers in the first place but they chose the thug life until the story gets turned around completely and all you can do is subconciously accept that there is no way to get past the Govrnment. The same Government whose cops you constantly escape from which is actually no gameplay part at all anymore.While in San Andreas you were able to steal stuff from the military and use it later on in GTA V you actually have to return the stuff you stole from the military. You as trevor a libertarian Dominant sadistic white trash male have to fly a police helicopter to perform facial recognition on people and he doesnt have a single problem with that. That is just not authentic at all and it leaves a very bad taste in your mouth.

review: The best of the GTA series by far and I highly reccomend it. It runs smoothly it's fun to play and an actual challenge when you get cops on you. However I do have one complaint the keyboard controls stick and up. Sometimes when i try to shoot I get this "windows error screen" type noise and nothing happens. then five seconds later the character actually fires or im walking and will never stop. It's not because of playing online because I've had it happen more in single player than online and I'm positive it's not because my laptop gets too hot because sometimes it runs better when warm. Anyways the pros are fun with friends fun by yourself and an all around goot game. Cons are if you use the keyboard your controls might stick. I don't know if that has to do with the fact I'm using the keyboard or what but it tends to annoy me. especially when some prick in online mode targets you for no reason and you can't do anything because you're stuck in an eternal walk.

review: This has been one of my favorite franchises since I would sneak out of class in eigth grade to play GTA3 at a friend's house. I saw Rockstar and Take Two as developers that had earned my respect and loyalty and I looked forward to everything new that they put out. But the direction GTAV has gone has disappointed me. I played it and beat it on PS3 and I bought it for PC because I wanted to try it out with all the mods created by its loyal fans. I was also looking forward to the the single player DLC we had been promised. Now the game is nothing but a swamp of microtransactions and cheap content updates designed to milk more money out of players.Rockstar's actions against the modding community was the last straw for me. Mods give games unlimited replay value and help create a thriving and loyal fanbase. If their goal is to push people away from single player with this move it has backfired in my case as I'm uninstalling GTAV today. I'm going to skip future titles by these companies as well unless they change their stance on this issue.

review: almost 200 hours on record (not as much as many byt stull decent). I will be reviewing both the Online and Offline expirience.(Online)Majority of this has been playing GTA Online and I still have hardly progressed. I own a good apartment and thats it. If you are looking into buying this game for its online its too late you will join as a new player and either get kicked from the lobby for being too low rank and no one wanting to play or if its a race you wont win because you dont have a good car you dont have a good car because you dont have money which you wont get much of if you dont win. Forget about all the Online additions like Bunkers Airstrips and insurgents etc. you wont ever gain enough money to buy them and if you do spend all you money you had saved (Like i did) on a bunker not only will rockstar release a much better DLC for the online later but you wont actually be able to do anything in your bunker unless you have an extra million lying around. Not only are the items in game overpriced (online) but the shark cards also are so if you plan to say "screw this grinding" you cant buy shark cards without cutting off you own arm. So overall the online is a hectic mess thats if it even works in which case you will have to play offline.(Offline / single player)So most people (like me) will buy this game for the mess that is the online play. But you will come across your computer not being able to connect to servers for no reason every now and then leaving you to play the offline. I have been playing the offline single player for quite some time (2 days over the weekend literally doing nothing but playing the single player) for the fun of it. It must be said the campaign is amazing interesting funny exiting and overall and enjoyable experience that is of course until the game start to glitch out for god knows what reason leaving you no choice but to close the game of which you cant even go to your house to save the game because of how rampant the glitches are with roads disappearing and of course this game decided to turn auto save off for whatever reason and left me unable to turn it back on making me loose all my progress in the single player game and thus me finishing the weekend with no progress whatsoever.(Overall)Overall GTA V is fun exiting and enjoyable but only if you have a beastly computer and a miracle of an internet connection at all times and god help you if your game just decides to hell with it and just glitches / breaks / crashes for no reason what so ever. Leaving you to wait through the minutes long loading screen as you boot the game up questioning if your progress has been saved or if you have been banned for leaving online during a mission. Only to find that exact thing happening to you (note i have not been banned off online yet nut right now i am just sick and tired of pouring hours into this game and still have bugger all in online and only be past the Prologue in single player)
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: MODDINGthis is a game where you can do all.. to those who say R* havent done anything concerning cheaters.. title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I buy GTA games exclusively for the Story Mode. While I might give the online mode a go it is at best an added bonus. Rockstar have once again delivered an improved version of their GTA series with GTA V. The graphics the city the landscapes the vehicles the characters the story the soundtrack the mini games all improve every time. I was initially skeptical about the whole 3 playing characters thing and switching between them I found it gave the whole story much more depth as it allowed Rockstar to develop more characters further than if the extra 2 had been NPCs. It also allowed the right missions or roles in missions to be given to the right guy rather than doing a lot of stuff that was out of character.Already looking forward to GTA VI or to some nice DLCs for V.Edit Disappointed that all development is focusing on GTA Online and the single player mode is neglected and without any DLCs to date. I know Online is a cash cow but a large section of the player base would love a single player DLC.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The single player is great it's what you expect out of any GTA game. A lot of action a lot of rampages and a huge world you can explore on your own.I would reccomend this to anyone who just wants to play the single player campaign and aren't too into the online scene or don't really care for it in the first place.Though if you really enjoy the multiplayer like almost everyone around here I'm sure I would not reccomend this for you. You're going to need to hope that your friend's list is filled to the brim with people playing this game online because doing anything with random players in this game is really annoying. Especially the waiting times in online missions I completed my whole game of Legned of Zelda Ocarina of Time on my 3ds through all the waiting I had to do.Though to be fair Rockstar put a lot of time and work into this version of the game and it's a great change from the 792p and 30 FPS I was used to playing with on the last console generation and I was more than happy to replay and re explore the world GTA V had to offer in 1440p and 120 FPS.

review: A great open world game.A lot of game hours will be dedicated to this game and this game alone guaranteed. The in game activities are quite tremendous when it comes to "making you lose track of time". The heists are especially profitable for earning in game currency or just having fun alone.But a big game always comes with a few downsides. For a small example the loading screen takes way too long to load both when u start the game and when u join new sessions. Another common one is players randomly being kicked out of heist lobbies just after it has started.Rockstar should really get their game on when it comes to online maintenance.None the less I would still recommend this game overall the downside shouldn't stop you from playing a great franchised game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: By all accounts a good well optimized game.The UI controls are fantastic.The graphic options and graphical quality is exceptional especially for the performance I get on low end hardware. They REALLY put A LOT of work into optimizing this and tweaking the engine to perfection. Far more than any company has anything else released in years.That is if it runs at all.They're dragging their feet about fixing the myriad of issues which plague many players. At this time I do not recommend buying it with a 50% chance that it'll just crash repeatedly either during the intial launch of the launcher itself or during gameplay.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After watching the positive PC Port Report video TotalBiscuit made I figured GTA V would be a great pick up but unfortunately I ran into so many issues rightaway that I ended up requesting a refund which was still an option due to the other problems the game had.Issues I had Jerky/laggy mouse movement in the menu. Changing vsync or mouse input didn't help. Settings didn't save after quitting the game and restarting Display calibration screen on every start Benchmark crashed to desktop after a 3 minute black screen FPS tied to sensitivity (not this crap again sigh)I run a i7 4790K 16 GB R9 290X machine and from what I could see from my short experience the actual framerate ingame is fine so performance seems ok otherwise. This is the first refund I've ever requested and I'm glad it was still an option. Fully priced games in this case even more should always have an option for refunds to avoid these sorts of things. One thing Steam could learn from Origin. I hope they patch the game and fix all these issues because I am certain the underlying game is brilliant but I just can't support it while there's so many problems before even getting to the actual playing part.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Then it got worse and worse first they became between 500k 1milion after that it went up to 2.5 mill to right now with a car of like 10 milion and above... the game is a greater grind fest then those F2P games that let you play the full game but youll need allot of time to even get 1 new gun with allot of missions you barely make above 20k. you want to do heists? oh thats fine first pls get a appartment of like 200k then we'll talk. So now you have heists great right? *trump voice* Wrong. you will never have enough money to buy and upgrade the most expensive car in the game hours upon hours you will have to play just so you can get a descent supercar.i do not recommend this game it has become very and to Rockstar and Take Two get your greedy asses of this money laundring fest and GTFO with your screaming for money.its a game people pay 60$ for why should we buy your shark cards just so we can get the car we like.utter t.

review: The physics in game is AWFUL compared to gta4. Gta4 had understeer brake lock visible weight transfer and so on while in 5 every car handles the same and supercars are better on offroading than those proper 4x4 offroader which is ridiculus. Crash deformation is HORRIBLE you can crash cars into a tree at 100mph and it barely takes any damage at all they are like ing tanks. Suspensions on cars feels non existence. Tyres pops and donezo instantly when shot where in 4 you can see the tyres deflates slowly. At some places the texture of the ground isn't even matched up properly with the model so it makes the car look like floating in air. Water and explosions in 4 also feels more realistic and there can be disintegration of planes in 4 where in 5 you brake a single part the whole plane explodes. Fog in 4 when raining was so much better as it can be dynamic (cant find the correct word here) like gust and you can see water vapor breathed out of the character's mouth. To make things even worse unlike gta4 where all the interior of buildings are accesible in multiplayer only stores and barber shops can be entered. I do like the graphics and the map and heist and the huge number of different vehicles in 5 but there are so many bad things about it. Physics engine is inferior online mode is filled with cheaters and COD kids less details than previous gen stupid AI and LOTS of bugs. An off topic story Last week I spent a good amount of time describing a server bug me and many encountered in game and reported it to R* hoping I can get a response of them looking into the problem. However it seems that their staff didn't even bother to read my complaint and just copy pasta'ed a tutorial of reinstally directX driver to me. I love it.

review: So GTA V. It's pretty good. Still I have a fair amount of problems with it.First of all I am banned from online for no real reason. I was playing it for 3 4 months and I played a lot got to level 243 and had it rolling. CEO Bikers all that and then I get a ***king ban. I was banned until March 23. I then sendt an email to Rockstar about it and they refused to help me. Then March 23. came and I got back into GTA Online drove arround town robbing the kiosks and doing small jobs for an hour while I waited for my friends (also after the ban my character had been reset). About 45 minutes after I launch the game again I get a sudden disconnection and the game crashes. When I then boot it up again I se one message on the screen "You have been permanently banned from GTA Online". Thank you Rockstar and Take2. So I contact Rockstar support and again they refuse to help. I send them 3 more emails and they are completely ignored. I can not play GTA Online anymore but this also brings me to my next point.Since I can't play online then I might as well start modding the damn game so did. And guess what it was fun. Although I couldn't play with my friends I had fun just going arround and essentially being silly (and a bit perverted if I am honest). But now Take2 have anounced that the modding will go to an end. So again thank you so much Take2 (and Rockstar) you've lost yourself a customer.

review: It's GTA only more so so what else is there to say? The single player campaign is fun and the mechanic of switching between 3 characters was actually well implemented for the most part. The only problem is that the solo campaign is too short and there has been almost nothing added to it since the game came out. There is also a notorious bug in single player that makes many of your purchased and modified vehicles just disappear. Rockstar has known about the glitch for a long time but has done nothing to address it. Kinda sucks when you spend a million or so on a car getting all the mods right and it just up and dissappears on you. The multiplayer is very fun once you figure out how to do much of anything. The cheif complaint I have against download only games is the lack of any serious attempt at an instruction manual and the tutorials are woefully inadaquate. I've had this game since the day it released on the PC and I'm still learning new controls every day!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've had the worst experience with GTA V I've bought the game for the Xbox 360 Xbox One and for PC. I have over 27 days played on it and recently they have banned me from GTA Online. Rockstar dosen't care about their customers they care more about the money and like that. GTA Online is not stable at all there are hackers all over the GTA servers and rockstar are banning the wrong people. I then contacted rockstar support by via email and they have never responded back. review: Review only concerns the Single Player Even if you've already played this on console I feel it's worth it to experience it again on PC with lovely mouse controls and a framerate that isn't a dipping 30 FPS. I myself succumbed to being rekt and bought this game 3 times once upon its inital release in 2013 again for the Xbox One in 2014 and AGAIN this time for PC. But I don't regret it.The story is a blast if you can suspend your disbelief for a couple hours at a time and ignore the utter ridiculousness of everything that's going on in this otherwise very "real" city. Follow the A plot story missions religiously saving the side missions for after the main story or exhaust every side mission before continuing the main story it's up to you (I also admire the way the side missions are written in such a way that they can be played at any time during the story and still make sense dialogue wise but I guess this is standard for open world games.)Do keep in mind if you're an 100% completion type of person that this game's idea of 100% is not in fact 100% at all. There are a LOT of things you can completely ignore and still get the "100%" achievement and still see 100% when you check your in game progress tracker.(PS I'm gonna chalk this up to the fact that I am just awful but I absolutely can't use KB+M to fly in GTA. Therefore I always switched to a controller in these parts because I was too lazy to learn.)

review: Edited review after getting some much needed help getting the game to run at full resolution without killing my graphics card.+ Amazing graphics on both laptops and desktops but be sure to spend a good 20 minutes setting up your preferences or you could see FPS drops or shoddy graphics when you could be running on higher settings.+ Still has the best selection of "radio" music in any game to date. There is a genre station for all tastes.+ Classic tongue in cheek humour remains keeping that classic GTA style whilst still feeling fresh and new.+ Has controller support but a PS4 controller also works as well! Button prompts still display as XBOX controller but it is easily excusable.+ Very wide selection of mods (though not officially supported so don't use them if you plan on using GTA Online).+ Multiple characters each with their own personality and styles plus customisation for each one.+ The missions are fun though some feel repetative. Heists are the crown jewel of the list of missions though there are not many unless you engage in GTA Online.+ You can play locally in GTA Online so you don't have to play with strangers and can enjoy the experience with just friends/family. Takes a while to set up preferences in graphics.ect to allow it to run at its best without FPS drops. Mods have great community support but not much in the way of useful installation instructions. (You will need to be adept level or higher to know how to install many mods.) Update sizes are huge and only add to GTA Online...which is no good to players who don't plan on using it. These updates are not optional. GTA Online is notorious for bannings and character resetting. Do not use mods that edit RTF's on GTA Online or a ban happens instantly.Overall it is good on a laptop but I recommend it more for a desktop. Laptops can run it even those with Intel HD Graphics but be prepared to have it run only in windowed mode.8.5/10 (I love the game but still find myself playing it more on console than PC.)

review: I'm gonna start off this review by saying that once the singleplayer has been completed (i.e. to 100% game completion) the only real reason to ever return to it is because of the mods. Speaking of the singleplayer the campaign in this game is definitely 10/10. The missions are engaging fun and at times challenging (especially playing through the entire game in first person). But yeah once the singleplayer is done the only saving grace (and I use that term very lightly) is the Online. Since this game has been out for coming up three years now the rest of this review is more for the Online part. So...The Pros A wide range of vehicles to unlock and customise Penty of apartment space to store your collection of vehicles A variety of activities to play with randoms friends or crew members If you have a creative mind you will never find yourself without something to doThe Cons At least 3 in 10 players are hackers Rockstar Made content (missions races etc.) do get repetitive after multiple playthroughs Earning money in Online does require a lot of playtime Only three of the Heists are worth playing (the first three)There's probably more detail I could go into but for the moment I'll leave it here. If you're looking for a game with a good campaign and fun online mode this is almost definitely the game for you. Although I gave the story a 10/10 the game as a whole falls to an almost solid 7.5/10 (maybe higher if a singleplayer DLC is ever announced for release).
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Singleplayer is super recommended but Online? Hehehehe... yeah that's what we get for Christmas boys and girls!Simply not recommended.Unless of course you don't care about the CEO missions and just play with your friends then that's fine. Enjoy it that way.

review: Before I start let me say that I have a 100 Mb/s up and down and a pretty good pc which should be more than enough to play this game.As it is now GTA Online is a pile of Heist missions races and more are for the most part unplayable unless you get really lucky with who you are matched up with. My friends and I have been trying to play this game but due to horrible lag and sync means that driving in the same car is impossible as the driver and the passengers are apparently not even in the same dimension for most of the time which is a problem when you are evading cops. The passengers will on their end be stuck in one place (If they can even get in the car) and then suddenly (not frequently) teleport to the driver five blocks away. If you do a mission together it is near impossible to kill the AI as the sync is It takes clean headshots as no amount of bullets anywhere else will drop them. On top of fighting immortals the enemies can also insta kill you since the game has problems registering damage. Races are okay but you keep getting dropped all the ing time. And it's a pain selecting "fun" user created stuff if that's what's float your boat. Now this means that Free roam is where the game is at for my friends and I. And yeah that's actually very fun. If the servers let us play together. Which never ing happens. If by chance you manage to get in a game with whoever you want to play with there is a considerable chance you be dropped by the game whenever and you'll be put in a server by yourself. So unless Rockstar get of their lard asses and fix this piece of then GTA Online will die down by the end of the summer. Cause I'd rather jerk of with sandpaper than go through a heist with my friends in this piece of Play Payday if you wanna heist. That game ing works.Also singleplayer is good.

review: YES YES YES YES YES FREAKING YES! This game is a masterpiece. Now I know everyone says that but this game really is amazing. Not only is the game well designed extremely detailed and as fun as this kind of game can be it is also a perfect PC crossover. This game is amazing and should definitely be played. I am not going to give much away about the game but yes play it. The three important reasons to own this game on PC are Graphics performance and mods. The graphics aren't as big of a jump between the consoles and this version unlike the jump between the previous gen to next gen however they are still improved especially the textures which are BEAUTIFUL. Performance is obviously a lot better on this version as well I own a GTX 960 and I can have all of the settings on very high (including textures) and I can have some of the advanced settings turned on as well. This keeps the frame rate at a level I am happy with and there is no obvious pop in memory leaks frame drops or stuttering which interferes with gameplay. Mods are also even more fun and will keep you coming back to this game after you have completed it. For example the mods allow you to change into a cat spawn 50 airplanes and then blow them all up with a rocket launcher. There are also texture mods the famous carmageddon and Tsunami mods and even a zombie mod available for this game. So yes you should pay for this. If the story doesn't interest you give it a try anyway you might be surprised. But even if you don't like the story mode you still have tons of mods and a beautiful detailed world to explore which is not locked off in any way at all unlike the previous games. If you are put off by the fact that GTA IV was not that great don't worry this one is much better. Hell I am someone who didn't enjoy any in the series all that much until this one not even San Andreas. If you are put off by the fact that this may be a crappy port like GTA IV was don't. This is actually an example of how PC games should be made. Unless for any reason you cannot run this game on your computer (which may be a few people) BUY THIS GAME!

review: RIP OpenIV and GTA modding in general. Take Two Rockstar's publisher has sent a cease and desist order to the OpenIV crew in order to shut them down. Why? To funnel more people into the microtransaction hell that is the multiplayer. It's about time we did something. Do not buy anything from Rockstar. Do not buy anything published by Take Two. It's time we showed them what's up. And if you've already bought this and you're just reading the reviews post one yourself to let people know. Negative press will show them. Let's see them launch their next installment of GTA with all this hell and negative precedent.
