review: Take Two Interactive. Rockstar made a great singleplayer game with cancerous multiplayer put in place by Take Two. They focused entirely on multiplayer not releasing a single thing for singleplayer to the point where to get the new vehicles in singleplayer you had to mod them in. This is ridiculous. They tried to push us towards the micro transaction laden hellhole they call GTA Online. But it is a mess and it's not enjoyable. Singleplayer however has mods. Mods which have exponentially increases the enojomyent of myself and many others. Now however Take Two has decided to target one of thecore tools for GTA modding OpenIV. This is clearly attempting to shut down singleplayer modding and continiue to push the terrible Online. This is not even mentioning them strong arming a couple of alternative multiplayer developers into stopping. Take Two is a vile company that I will never support.You can see that I have played GTA V a significant amount. But that will not increaase much further if at all unless take two changes their stance.

review: I bought this game solely for the modding and now that OpenIV was given a cease and desist letter this seems to be the next step (and boldest so far) in anti modding. I am outraged by this and urge anyone reading this to take a stand against this now before companies think they can get away with more of this. Companies should encourage modding as it keeps the games alive played and enjoyed far beyond the amount of time that they would be vanilla. Take a look at skyrim and minecraft just to use two examples. Anybody that has put as much time as I have into those games can vouch that they would have gotten bored with them FAR before had they not supported modding. The only reasons I can possibly think of to be against modding is in competitive games where exploits could give one player a massive advantage over others or in a system that relies heavily upon microtransactions. This one fits in the latter category and if anyone tells you otherwise they are a fool. In a game that most people play for singleplayer getting rid of mods is a terrible idea that can only possibly be justified with the shallow excuse that you then won't make as much money off of the microtransactions. Say what you will but I say that in a full price game microtransactions that affect anything other than cosmetics do nothing but negatively impact the community. Microtransactions belong in free to play games or for purely cosmetic changes. They do not belong in full price games and they CERTAINLY do not belong in games that need to sacrifice their long history of supporting great mods and enjoyable experiences just to make the company even more money. Making money should be a goal for a game company but they should not have to sacrifice morals gameplay or fun to do so. This all being said I strongly urge you to not purchase this game. If you are looking for an open world sandbox game you can have extensive fun with I cannot recommend this game without mods. If you need an alternate game I would recommend saints row 3 as the developers aren't trying to get rid of the vast majority of their fanbase.

review: (This is a review for GTA Online).TL DR broken garbage with little to no customer support genuinely disgraceful title move on.GTA Online is riddled with game breaking bugs. You WILL lose your whether it's hundreds of thousands of dollars mysteriously being eaten by the void or your precious business shipments lost due to crashes. When that happens you have to fight for days to get the support team to even read your messages instead of sending you an automated reply and the chances of them refunding your property EVEN WITH A VIDEO are extremely slim.The following is one of many examples from personal experience.You spend an hour retrieving four top range cars for your vehicle export business. That'll net you about $500 000 enough to buy that armored car you've been eyeing up! You get a group of four players to export them all at once and you pay up the $80 000 to fully upgrade the cars to maximise your profits. You start the sale but wait! GTA has decided that you don't get to sell your cars today. Your screen goes dark then it comes back and the map disappears. You float in blue hell for a while. Oh you think. The game crashed! But this is GTA Online the most unpredictable AAA title you've ever played and to your relief the game recovers a few seconds later. It seems your hundreds of thousands of dollars are saved you and your friends have loaded in outside your garage ready to export the vehicles. Except you can't move. Your friends can't move. Everything looks normal other players drive past you but you can't move. You can't drive or get out of the car or answer your phone or interact with the world in any way. You spend a few minutes struggling with the game trying to get the cars to move with no success but you're a smart guy. You had Shadowplay enabled so you record the bug in its entirety and then you close the game. Confident that this AAA title has competent support you send the recording to Rockstar politely requesting that your cars be returned so that you can retry the sale (hopefully without the game having another meltdown)."We are unable to verify your claim.""What? Which part of my claim aren't you able to verify? It's all on the video.""We apologise for any inconvenience. We are unable to verify your claim."You're in disbelief at this point. It's hard to wrap your head around the idea that a company with as much money as Rockstar cannot afford to set up competent customer service. "Seriously? I lose hours of work and hundreds of thousands of dollars and all you'll give me is "We are unable to verify your claim?" This isn't customer support at all. Can you at least tell me what aspect of my claim you are unable to verify?""We apologise deeply for any inconvenience. We will escalate your claim to the proper department"You experience some relief hoping that you'll get passed to a thinking breathing human rather than an underpaid customer support drone who clearly barely speaks English.... 1 day later ..."Hello. We apologise for any inconvenience. We are unable to verify your claim."Please give me my GTA$360 000 (

review: "There are times when I look at Los Santos and think 'why would you even think to build that?' This is appropriately a thought that I often have about Los Angeles. In GTA 5's case the tone is different baffled wonderment as opposed to baffled y'know despair. Rockstar have created one of the most extraordinary game environments you will ever visit. I look at it and I wonder at the vast expense of effort required to render every trash bag in every back alley just so. I marvel at the care evident in San Andreas' gorgeous sunsets in the way that sunglasses subtly alter the colour balance of the world in the artfully chosen selection of licensed music designed to accompany your experience. Everything about Los Santos demonstrates the extraordinary amount of thought and love poured into it by hundreds of developers over many years. The abiding irony of Grand Theft Auto 5 is that everybody who actually lives in Los Santos hates it " (PC GAMER)

review: Overall it's a great game.. But it's not without it's issues. Firstly the Banning issues.. Sure I am to blame for this but whatever I used FOV online and that's that. But the online issues are more than just bans.. For some people (myself included) You join empty lobbies.. You D'C from every game.. etc etc.. some other online issues are insane amounts of error messages with no clear fix.. even when contacting rockstar they can't help. That with the size of the game can be very very annoying.. as several errors when accessing online are only fixable by re installing the WHOLE game.. I've made backups now &amp I'd suggest you do too. But overall it's a good game.. a very good game actually. I mainly play it for the single player now with mods as that's stupidly fun! But online is a hell of a game too.. when it actually works that is. If you're on the fence about buying this I'd 100% suggest you do. It's worth it for the single player alone and that doesn't have any errors getting into that.. at least from what I've seen.

"Oh you'll need a CEO building! Oh now its a motorclub headquarters! Oh wait we can add bunkers too that then need dumb trucks!" and price it all at millions.They already tore the newer DLC vehicles from singleplayer making it so you can only play them online where you have to buy them. But then to actively ATTACK the Mod Community to cease and desist such an integral part of the modding community one that doesn't even have anything to do with multiplayer hacking?They have basically ended the modding community. No more mods for GTA V. This is a disgusting move. this company. this game. They do not give a about you. They only want you to bleed money for them.

With many awsome heist missions it tells us another badass communist story You have to work but your job is robbery. You and your friends will enjoy this job and become millionaires together ! But later SharkCards came out they pull players back to real world a little bit This is a video game and R* need your money in real life.As "Shark" grows bigger thing goes worse . R* stop produce PVE heists because they let players get money fast and stable so they push players to play PVP harder then ever In 2016 CEO DLC and MotoClub DLC came out Want to be a millionaire ? I hate hacker and don't care about Mod so I don't protest.But if we hold back and review the whole story the "dream" is still dead. title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Game Of The Decade?Put simply I'm loving this game. The graphics are excellent as is the sound. Much work has gone into creating a convincing environment and there are times when it's hard to think you're not driving/walking around Southern California.That setting has then been used to craft a superb story and some excellent player characters. At first I was sceptical about changing around between the three different protagonists but it actually works very well. In Trevor Phillips R have created one of the best ever entertainment anti heroes ever seen.Gameplay has been streamlined. The classic R* curved ball missions which offer a sudden big challenge or time limit are still there but if you repeatedly fail players are now offered the opportunity to skip forward to the next checkpoint or end of mission and thus don't miss out on the game. Some elements of the character building from GTA SA have returned such as driving and flying skill development or maxing out physique. There's also a simulation within the simulation as players can enjoy a tennis match or play a round of golf. You can jump on a moving freight train and take a tour of the area or even board the Metrolink tram for a tour of Los Santos itself. (Shame the trains/trams can't be driven without a mod).Any downers? Just a couple. As noted install off 7 x DVD's takes around three hours plus patching time but honestly it's worth it. Just do something else in between changing the discs. Fans of Liberty City Stories might be shocked by a plot event when you first encounter Trevor but I won't say more than that. You need good hardware for this to run well. I have a 1Gb GTX650 graphics card and have nudged my settings up beyond the recommended most of the time okay but the odd bit of lag. Finally this is very much a male orientated game. Some of the criticism aimed at R* for how they portray women is not quite justified but in a game where it is easy to pick up a hooker or have a topless lap dance at a strip club you're not going to find many ladies playing this.Nevertheless as a piece of entertainment it's stunning better than many movies IMHO.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: First day playing online. About one third of the lobbies were ruined by hackers I CTD for no reason once and CoD kiddies can beat me with weapons I can't even get yet because I have to grind to unlock them. Single player no question is a masterpiece but the online continues to be lackluster. Not only that but the amount of hubris it takes to add cash transactions to a full price one billion dollar game is absolutely mind boggling. The greed and cynicism involved in turning the online into a pay to win type of deal simply to make MORE money is just... ugh. Rockstar has become the worst example now with GTA V of a company not giving a about its fans. Worse than EA even. The developers the long time employees I'm sure are not at fault. It's the suits who are not caring who refuse to place any additional resources into fixing the glaring issues because why would they need to when poor unsuspecting souls continue to purchase cash transactions only to then discover the Online wasn't worth the money OR time investment. The passionate skilled worker bees that made GTA V possible can do or say nothing because to even make an attempt would probably see them working at a Wendys within a few days.The horrors of Hollywood have started to seep into the video game industry and this is the first big example we must all pay attention to. Head honchos will do whatever they want and nobody under them can affect that. Especially not us unless we all decide to not allow this by not playing the game or at the very least not giving them MORE money.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

First the free aim mode is atrocious you're basically force to use auto target mode to feel like you are in control. Driving with a steering wheel or joystick very responsive and satisfying. Driving with WASD wtf? The car just jerks back and forth the entire time. Finally not sure if I like the multiple stories blurring into one plot line. Really think a create a character would have been nice. Overall 9/10 stars

review: Revised Disclaimer......... Seems like most of the modders have been eliminated as of late everyonce and awhile one pops up connection issues are terrible with the P2P nature of the game but it's definately not as frustrating as it once was.Disclaimer.................read past the first sentence.PROS Wonderfull game best game ever made never lacking in things to do or a place to hang out with friends.CONS Online is nearly unplayable with modders everynight UFOs campfires and xmas trees are spawning on your head The entire server is peppered with explosions people teleporting across the map to objectives just as you almost take 1st place modders forcing you out of your vehicle or remote exploding or spawing a neverending stream of clones of your own character on you untill your game CTD merely because you dared to beat them to a target or objective. This has been a recurring problem since the beginning and the only reason i stick around is due to the time i've already sunk into it and the people i've met. You can solve the problem by going to a private lobby with just yourself and your buddies..........but then your denied half the experience and the chance to meet new people. Rockstar is woefully negligent in the way they slapped the games multiplayer component together............DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!! Not until Rockstar has made some coherent effort to clean up the Multiplayer component.Then to top it all off on rockstars own support message boards modders have the gall to insult you and insist you abandon your platform and software purchase......................... "Go to PS4/Xbox ONE ya ******* if ya can't stand it" is a regular response.I'm really surprised rockstar has the gall to continue selling this product as is without any widespread outrage..................Have you ever seen a harrier jet with machinegun turret limousines "voltroned" onto the wings like the fantastic 4 mobile????? well if you want that to kill you 20 times in a row CTD then wait for your loading screen simulator to reload..................PLAY GTA online.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Good single player I like the 3 character system it's especially fun in missions that use two or three characters at once. Not much to say there it's just good. Fun driving fun gunfights fun flying. Lots of little activities too if you're in the mood for them.The online on the other hand is the most convoluted thing and unless you have three friends who are always free to play it's really hart to enjoy online some times. People use freemode as an open world deathmatch which wouldn't be a problem if it weren't for some of the other issues in the game.It's surprisingly hard to start heists and missions with public players because multiple things happen. 1. You buy a heist nobody joins/everybody leaves as soon as they join.2. You join a heist but not enough people join.3. You finally start a heist or mission but a player leaves as soon as it starts causing all the other players to automatically fail the heist or mission which often forces you to load freemode (and most likely get killed once you finally load in which is .)Another problem is if you get killed while in the pause menu it closes the pause menu so if people kill you fast enough you won't even be able to exit the game. This is luckily rare. I don't hate Online but it definitly has LOTS of design flaws. Another issue that for more information you should probably look at GTA V forums is the fact that Rockstar doesn't deal with cheaters well and hands out bans to a lot of people who don't actually cheat buy sharkcards or are forced to take money from cheaters but I personally have been able to avoid that. To sum up great story mode. Very grindy convoluted online that can only be great with friends and has a sometimes less than fun playerbase.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I have completed single player on console and am now starting online on the PC. The scale of this game is beyond anything any gamer has ever seen in the past. There is no other title that even comes close to GTA5. I cannot think of any reason why someone would speak ill of this title. Unless of course you just do not like the genre and if that is the case why would they be here buying and reviewing in the first place? The fact that there is no paid expansions and all new DLC is FREE is amazing. Compare that to the business model of Ubisoft EA Sony or Blizzard. Rockstar aims for quality and fun and GTA5 hits both on the head many times over. This game is well worth $60+ if you break down your timeplayed/moneypaid.If you post a negative review of this title please also post all the games you have created along with your review.

review: I bought GTA V not only because I liked the game but also because I supported the developer's ideas.No built in malwar... Denuvo no game ruining microtransactions no on disck DLC an actual single player mode that's not just an excuse for the price tag of a multiplayer game. Indeed what made me buy GTA V was the need to encourage the developers to show them that it pays not to treat your followers like cows to be milked who didn't interfere with the community to further stuff their pockets.But now I'm disgusted with myself. The microtransaction deal was already a turn off from the multiplayer but now they kill off modding? The showcase of either utter ignorance or (most likely) absolute greed that this whole OpenIV business has shown puts Take Two (and Rockstar too honestly) in the ever growing pile of worthless developers and publishers that have helped to further drag the games industry into the rotten hell of greed created by the likes EA that's ruining videogames."It's a one off happening" you can say "At least they are not doing mention here heartless greed driven action taken by EA Bethesda Ubisoft or any publisher or developer that calls their games 'product' and has not even a semblance of interest in their creations ". Conformity is what lets those people get away with what they do. They don't deserve a second chance until they have suffered the repercussions of their actions and those repercussions should come from you.And the lesson for myself has been never trust a triple A developer ever again.

I had some graphics mods installed (fov mod for that low fov default) and now I cannot use them because I'll get banned. Even on single player. Rockstar for what they've done. Great game overall. However the real and main reason for getting this game on PC was for modding and now we cannot. I'm willing to bet you'll be able to mod the game again once VALVE comes back with paid mods. I want to give thanks to the console peasants who alpha tested the game on the PS3 and 360 as well as the rest of the peasants who beta tested the game on the PS4 and XBONE. Seriously thanks to your long testing we on the PC were able to get the best version of the game. Thanks D

review: A really really good game. I've played 47 hours and in that time I've just completed the story mode (no side quests yet). I've got to level 15 on GTA online. For me you should buy the game for the story mode. It's the best story mode i've seen in a game ever. You can choose when to do missions you can free roam all you want and you can approach a lot of the missions the way you want to approach them. The graphics are amazing and it runs quite well even on some older PCs (Very High settings on a 750ti smooth 50 60 fps) The online is fun but can get quite repetitive and a bit boring after a while but that really depends on how you play the game. It's not that hard to earn money in GTA online and purchasing Shark Cards isn't really needed if you have enough time on your hands to play and earn the money that way. Modding is also a big thing in this game and since openIV is back I don't find the need to give this a negative review. TLDR It's an amazing game great story mode fun online mode. Has great graphics is moddable a game you can put lot's of hours in.

review: GTA 5 review Optimization This game has great optimization and runs great on mid to high end PC. I have even seen some people claim they run it ok on a low end PC. All in all they did an amazing job with optimization.Story I myself loved the story of GTA 5 and it is very interesting. Sometimes it gets very funny but other times it can quickly get very brutal as well. I just love the connection between the main protagonists and at times there is a proper drama going on because of the tension between such a different people that are brought together by mere coincidence.Gameplay Gameplay is absolutely fantastic I love it. It has some cons but I will mention these later. The cars drive great and the shooting and cover mechanics are amazing so its a lot of fun.Sounds Music and audio in this game are great. Rockstar always suprises with how much music is there in the game.Cons These are things I personally have a problem with but this doesn't mean someone doesn't like these the way they are. You can flip a car around if you are on the roof. I loved it how in GTA 4 you could make a tiny mistake and get your car on the roof and you knew you were in trouble when you had to crawl out of it and find a solution on foot. In GTA 5 that problem doesn't exist you can just flip it and I find it so boring and arcady. It feels like the game is holding my hand and fixing everything I do wrong while driving and I hate that. I as a player should pay for the mistakes I make. You can turn the car while in the air. When you jump with a car in the air you will land on the same spot where the gravity will take you but you can adjust the car rotation while in the air so that you always land on the wheels.. I dislike this as well. It is not realistic and what happens in the end is you just don't give a damn about jumps and take any jump at any time because you can always get away with it. You can fail and land on the roof which will blow you up if the jump was high enough but once you get the hang of it you will land 99.9% of the jumps so when you drive at full speed towards a cliff you can see it as an easy shortcut down and I don't like that at all. I would prefer if players would have to either take the huge risk of jumping to get away from the police or find another way.. There just isn't much risk vs. reward in GTA 5 when driving a car. Kuruma (Armored vehicle). Kuruma is a vehicle that you can buy in GTA 5 Online that is basically the easy mode or god mode. I have played GTA 5 Online for quite a while and no vehicle is as good as the Kuruma because it is incredibly hard to get killed in a Kuruma and at the same time the vehicle is very fast. I did a test once and I tried fighting the police in a tank and then after that in a Kuruma. Let me tell you this the tank lasted less than 10 minutes and in a Kuruma I lasted much longer than half an hour and I just gave up after that because I proved my point and it was just boring. I think Kuruma was one of the worst ideas and hurted GTA 5 Online quite a lot. You only need 1 person in a kuruma to win any mission without any problem. It just sucks the fun out of the game when there is 1 played with a Kuruma which happens often. GTA 5 Online missions are too easy. It barely ever happens that a group of players lose a non heist mission on Hard even without the Kuruma or any helicopters or jets. They need to make challenging missions when the win to lose ratio would be 40% 60% or 50% 50% because most missions are 95% win 5% lose. And the lose part is mostly because people blow up the mission objective and not because of all the players dying. Mentioning this I remember a great mission from GTA 4 called Hangman's Noose and it was much harder than any mission in GTA 5 and most missions should be at least as hard as that to make it at least challenging and because of that quite fun and exciting. The police should be used a lot more (5 stars) to make the missions harder. Money spending. Gta 5 Online has cars weapons and vehicles to spend money on and while that is fun I have a feeling it needs something more. I myself strived for the best appartment and best vehicle and it didn't take me long to have both because I didnt need to use any other vehicle then the one I had at beginning. Don't get me wrong this is a new thing in GTA the way it is done now and it is brilliant but because it is something people will be playing for houndreds of hours for many years it needs something more to keep the players in the game. Because of this it is a minor or a petty thing to mention. GTA heists GTA Heists are great but I have a feeling it creates some tention and bad mood sometimes because you get to play with 1 individual out of 4 that has problems staying alive and he feels bad himself while also others get annoyed with him. It can become annoying instead of fun pretty quickly so right here is one instance where R* could make a new game mechanic to still keep it hard but not as annoying. For example it would be great if the player shot wouldn't die but be unconcious and you would have to get him out of the combat zone (drag or put his body in a car and get him out of it when safe) and a lenghty revive would take place or some other procedure to not punish the whole team so quickly for the mistakes of 1 individual and create some bad mood just because of that. Games are meant to be fun. GTA 5 Online needs a few new modes or mission ideas. Preferably missions like Hangman's noose from GTA 4 with heavy police response I loved that mission. Hackers. A lot of people seem to have problems with hackers but I myself had a problem here and there but nothing a quick change session couldn't fix. Rockstar needs a better protection against hackers because at the time it feels like protecting this game from hackers is the community's job. I have reported a hacker and it didn't take me long to get him banned. With a system like this every player that sees a hacker should report them and we would have a much cleaner game. Of course Rockstar needs to step up and find a system like "PunkBuster" to make it much harder to hack.This game didn't have a perfect launch so I believe that the number of positive reviews would be at about or over 90% if the launch would be better.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: TL DR The people who made this game have destroyed it to wring money out of you. Stay far FAR away.If you in any way enjoy using mods enjoy watching modded content view lets plays with modded content or prefer single player to multiplayer do not buy this game.GTA V is an excellent game that is very well built created by innovative brilliant developers who geniunely love what they do. You can see it in their work. Last week the publisher of GTA V Take Two Interactive sent a cease and desist order to the developer of the most commonly used mods in the game. A mod which thousands of other mods and hundreds of thosands of work hours depend upon. A mod which has existed for ten years and has only now become the focus of legal action due to Take Two's efforts to increase monetization. This move came on the 5th of June in what appears to be an attempt to hide this action from public attention as the gaming community is occupied with the E3 conference. This game has recieved a continued level of attention and constant exposure to new audiences through the way in which modders have continued to create new and interesting content that is related to this game. Despite this being of net benefit to their sales Take Two is now betting that they will be able to make more money by cracking down on mod development in order to further monetize the existing player base. In short they are actively destroying collaborative works and content they have previously allowed making the singleplayer experience of their game LESS enjoyable in an effort to wring more money out of players. Considering that a significant percentage of their sales from the PC release of this game (i.e. this version) has come due to interest in using and developing mods this move is unconscionable. Take Two's recent actions represent the very definition of corporate hackery. They are choosing profits over people. There are plenty of other game developers and publishers that do not do this. Go spend your money on their games instead. This decision has utterly ruined the game in my view.

review: UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE if you interested in the old update scroll below. I believe this update was long overdue as there as been several changes to the game from the last time this review went up. I'm going to make this short and sweet should you buy this game? That's up to you. Lately or for a few months now I stopped playing this game as it feels like a constant grind (I had tested this on my console) from dodging and weaving through obstacles like your bussiness get disrupted by other players who just wanna watch the world burn in almost every lobby there is a someone who wants to you kill for sport and for no reason now with the new planes and vehicles. You sometimes can find a peacefull lobby where people actually want to do car meets play together and is not a PvP enviroment. I understand it is to compete but when you'r trying to earn money when your level and people keep killing you due to low level. There is also the problem with Take2 and the microtransactions in this game (I wont go into full detail as to why because you'll see most reviews already talking about that). Overall I dont find this game fun to play anymore even when you have money it isn't fun it just gets dull and boring. NEW SCORE 6.5/10 It's the next instalment in the GTA series. What more can you want? But I know you are here to see if you want to spend your hard earned money on this game. So today I will be telling you the pros and cons of this game. Pros Graphics are amazing and very detailed A.I is good Trevor Motherf***ing a' Phillips Fist Person gameplay mechcanic (optional) Interesting and colorfull characters Single player has lots of events missions. sub goals challenges and Hiests Small addtional content for returing players from the last gen consoles Addtional content ever month or a few months Various popluar songs and cool beats to listen to No problems with fps game is smooth Multiplayer hiests are great and feel natural Great character customization (overall great customization features) You are able to meet great and frinedly people when you find them Many jobs to do in multiplayer Are able to do private sessions with friends (but saldy arnt able to do vip nor ceo missions when in a private or invite only sessions) You can run a company Cons Lots of modders cheaters and hackers but are rare to find Many high leveled ***** destroying low leveled and new players Kids using their mics but are rare to find Random people killing you for nothin (even you tho you are a high level person random people will still kill you for no reason) If and when you a nice car that you want to buy you either have to grind for money on hiests or jobs which can get repetitive and annoying or buy shark cards I had no issue with Rockstar Support but when I go on the forums I see people getting banned for no reason and still are banned without an expilnation I get what Rockstar was trying to do with the ceo missions but when some one destoryed some one's crate that they paid for around 2k to 18k and/or destory a shipment that can cost the person up to 2.2 million (yes that much money) that person will most likely get upset and wanting revenge on you. (Trust me I seen it happen and it ain't pretty). On hiests or missions like in Lamar's lowrider missions when teamwork is needed people would be afk on purpose and cause to the mission/hiest to fail Another thing remember how annoying but lovable Niko's cusion Roman was in GTA 4? In GTA 5 we have Lamar franklins best mate and he is like Roman but he dons't wanna go bowling oh no.... he want's to score some drugs and in the process gets kidnapped/ or starts being shot at. Also during the lowrider missions he can be annoying as your character is not voiced acted and he goes on ranting about something which is annoying not to hear some one tell him to shutupOverall I recommned this game for its ups ofcourse but you really need to think about buying this game before hand and decide if you want it or not I personally enjoy this game to bits and I'm sorry if there is any grammar mistakes in the review and I would also would want to thank you if you saw my review read it and made a choice about buying GTA 5 or not OLD SCORE I give this game a 9.5/10

review: I've played every single GTA game and completed the majority of them. I've unfortunately never completed any of the 2D GTA's (but I did put a hefty amount of time into them!) and I didn't complete GTA 4 for a variety of reasons but I did get close. All of that being said for a long time GTA San Andreas was my firm favorite for a very long time but GTA V has thoroughly dethroned it after many years.GTA V does so many things right and very few things wrong. The whole game feels cohesive and comes together in a great way with very few gameplay problems. Most of the issues I had with the game stemmed from the disappointing story or how some of the side missions work. The story starts off strong and has a ton of potential but quickly fizzles out and sort of forces you along rather than giving you a reason to continue. The heist missions you encounter are well designed but too few in number and most of the other missions involve driving long distances so characters can talk with each other. On the topic of side missions some side missions are triggered by just being in a random area and if you're on the way to one spot it can be a little frustrating to get somewhat forcibly side tracked to complete a quick little side mission. Most of these side missions end up just turning into collect a thing quests in the end.Playing as three characters presents some unique challenges. Each character has some kind of special skill one allows you to drive in slow motion one lets you shoot in slow motion and one makes you take less damage and deal significantly more damage. During some missions you can switch back and forth and take advantage of the unique skills of each characters and a lot of the time everyone is in a different position during the mission. It's refreshing and interesting to be able to approach a mission from two or three different angles all at once. I will say that it is very annoying to outfit three characters with powerful weapons and armor though and most things don't carry over from one to the other. Los Santos is full of detail and has multiple environments to explore and screw around in. You can play around in a dense downtown or drive out to the desert or even head to the woods. The entire area feels real and believable even though the characters in the game mention that there are apparently hours of roads between some of the locations. It is easy to get lost just driving around and checking things out and even after 70 hours I still find new things to explore. GTA V retains the right amount of grittiness from GTA IV while also sharing the somewhat whimsical gameplay tone of the first three 3D GTA games. Playing as three unique characters is a lot of fun and overall it is tough to find problems with the game. I really enjoyed my time and I can see myself replaying the game down the road.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA 5 was so strong on release. I enjoyed it played through it a few times. Played through it a few times with my gf on console too.Right now? Wouldn't recommend anyone gives Rockstar any money... The single player has been left completely in the cold while content streams into their buggy non existant multiplayer mode it's gotten to the point that they don't even bother adding the vehicles to single player in a token way.If you prefer to enjoy GTA 5 as a single player game you will only get a small fraction of the games content. If you actually enjoy multiplayer good luck finding a people to actually do anything with.It has me deeply worried about GTA 6 and any sequel to Red Dead Redemption. And what form they will take it's easy to assume at this point Rockstar will focus on money and multiplayer completely forgoing the core single player fan base that made them popular.I'm all for multiplayer if they find a way to keep the game consistent. A world where you can enguage the game and all of it's content either through single player characters (with extra abilities that don't make sense in multiplayer such as michael's bullet time). But also play online should you choose.But I can't help that feel Rockstar will simply release more and more micro transaction powered online only content.In fact at this stage i wouldn't be surprised to see GTA 6 be free to play and online only...

review: I wrote a Review a year ago highly endorsing this game. However while I still play it. I can no longer support or endorse this game. Rockstar's Parent company has earned a reputation for being legal bullies and are quick to harass anyone modding their game (Open IV as an example). Take two crossed the final line when they went after a extremely popular singleplayer modding tool with their legal thugs. Therefore I officially pull my endorsement and join the thousands who will not support this game in recruiting new people to. Nor will I support them financially through shark card purchaises. Singleplayer however still offers the legendairy storylines that rockstar has made themselves successes out of. I would recommend the game only for this. however multiplayer it is advised to be avoided just on the sole grounds of the rampant level of cheaters and I will emphasize this That the cheaters are not because of openIV. many hack makers use their own clients and injectors.Support for the game is a living joke. you make a honest request and all you get back is a lawyer approved letter giving you the politest go to hell letter I have ever seen.As it stands now until take two gets their crap togather and stops bullying its population Improves it customer service and actually does something about the rampant modders (other thain attacking honest entity's like open IV) I do not endorse this game. it would be a poor choice to buy it. OR Support it with shark card purchases.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: OpenIV is now back and with Rockstar's blessing. This is fantastic news for the entire GTA community and for gamers as a whole. I had originally purchased this game for modding potential and had no intentions of playing the online component. It was quite frustrating when Take Two Interactive declared that OpenIV was no longer allowed as it was the main thing that keeps me playing the game. Modding in new cars and player/pedestrian skins keeps the game fresh enough to make it worthwhile long after having finished the single player campaign. I am fixing my review at this point because Rockstar openly proved they do care about the overall community and aren't just out for a cash grab by selling Shark Cards. They have earned back my faith in them by speaking to their parent company on behalf of the community and as such I will not only continue to play their titles I will definitely be picking up future titles from them without hesitation. Heck I may even finally break down and try the online component again in the future (after I've had my fill of mods for single player). Who knows I might even buy some Shark Cards when the time comes.Thanks for putting your faith back in the community Rockstar. It will be returned in kind and you proved that not all huge developers are going to just bow mindlessly to the will of their overreaching parent company. I applaud your decision.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The base game on the consoles was great and I couldn't wait for the "definative" version on PC. The game looks and runs amazing provided you have a pretty decent rig. I only brought the game to mod its single player portion no interest in the multiplayer but Rockstars pain in the social club wrecks my fun with its constant updates and checks. Now with Take Two shutting down the mod tools that dream is over. I just want to mod it damn it! Its my game I can do what I want with it or not aparently. Let the people have a non social club version for single player to mod and save it for the multiplayer to restore some good will. Until then this game and all other Rockstar games gets buoycotted its not like we don't have a million other games to play. Sorry about the whiny self entitled rant but this stuff is important for the preservation of the best element of pc gaming modding.

review: There is no doubt that I'm in love with what Rockstar brought us throughout the years and of course the guys before them with even the very first GTA. Grand Theft Auto V is huge it's amazing it's unique. A lot a people do prefer GTAIV I can understand that but there is a lot to love with GTAV with new stuff Rockstar is trying such as having three main characters. They expended the world once more in a city we all know Los Santos (and its surroundings). We're not locked up in a city again (GTA IV!). The story is to me very solid and very enjoyable. There is so much to say about GTAV but you must play it to have a real opinion. About the PC version Rockstar did not let us down this time around (unlike with GTAIV). Yes the game is playable with very good framerate it looks good it is moddable.. It is awesome. There are some updates they are messing up a little with them time to time but it's still very very good.If love GTA you will not be disapointed. GTA Online is its own thing I won't review it here.Please buy the game (it's selling very well) support Rockstar and let's hope they will not forget us PC gamers for next Rockstar titles (A new Red Dead? etc...).

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: TL DR Don't buy this game for OnlineThe Story Mode GTA V AKA What you SHOULD buy this game for)The story mode is a quite long well written tale of three men who decide to set themselves up for life by getting into the high stakes crime game. It's better than any previous GTA game and if you enjoyed previous GTA games why haven't you bought it yet? The only complaints I have are with the way some of the cheats are implemented or missing (that were in previous GTA games) but those are all secondary issues really quite irrelevant to enjoying this game.As an extremely open world game GTA V is second to none. This is both the cause of its success and of its downfall. Because it's so open world GTA V is a technical masterpiece of engine optimization and gameplay opportunity options. However there's so many different things to do that you know you'll never actually 100% the game without resorting to mods. It may be heresy to say this but GTA V is just too big for its own good. Now if you're not a completionist (and I envy you if you're not) you'll be able to enjoy GTA V much more easily than me and I absolutely recommend that you buy it.Story Mode Worth the buyGTA Online The Cancer That Ruins Your LifeGTA Online was good enough when the game launched but it's gotten to be pretty terrible for the average unmodded player nowadays. I absolutely do not recommend Online mode anymore.The first and most visibly annoying issue in GTA Online is the amount of players (many of them with mods) who do not heistate to ruin your day killing you time and time again as you struggle to grind for a measly $10k or so. With all the DLC vehicles Online has become so unbalanced that some players just quit out of sheer inability to play the game without being repeatedly slaughtered. I almost always put myself in a solo public session by suspending GTA5.exe from Windows Resource Monitor for about 10 seconds to avoid this exact plague.Back when GTA V was new within the first year or two of its nextgen/PC release online mode was a massive community and was really quite enjoyable to play with. There was only a single incentive to get money for a high end apartment for heists. The jobs didn't pay out quite as much as the newer modes do but with only one thing to save up for that wasn't really a problem. Every other purchase just made the gameplay more fun.Since then Take Two have discovered that their Shark Cards (microtransactions for GTA Online $) are extremely profitable. With that discovery they altered the course of GTA Online to become pure painful grind. Every DLC expansion that has come since while free to download is in no way free to play. With almost no exception each GTA Online expansion has cost more in game currency than the last to buy into meaning you spend more time grinding than ever before.In the early days of GTA Online a single of the most expensive Shark Card ($100 when not on sale) would fetch you $8 000 000 in game more than enough to buy almost everything in the Online mode. Years later the Shark Card still costs the same and still gives you the same amount of in game currency but that $8m in game is worth so much less. Here's a list of some purchases you can make in GTA Online today (all USD are based on $100 USD/$8m in game). While all of them can be purchased with in game currency without spending a penny the grind to get that much money is tens or even hundreds of hours and Take Two expects you to buy Shark Cards to buy some of this stuff 1. Office A necessary purchase to enter the special cargo business vehicle import/export business or special vehicle missions. The base office cost ranges from $1m $4m ($12.50 $50 USD) with almost purely cosmetic upgrades that can total up to $2.65m ( $33 USD) on top of that.2. Bunker to get into the gunrunning business you need a bunker. Typically placed far north of Los Santos they slowly manufacture weapons cargo you can sell. The base bunker costs between $1.165m and $2.375m depending on location though the cheapest bunker is an absolutely terrible buy as the drive to/from it is almost as bad of a grind as the special cargo missions. Personalization options for bunkers can total $1.695m. Part of weapon manufacturing is buying/stealing supplies which can total $75 000 for a full bunker. If your bunker isn't upgraded (separate from the personalization purchases upgrades cost over $2.1m/ $26 USD total) the net payout from buying supplies then selling them to Los Santos (for an additional 50% payout) is exactly $0. And to add insult to injury you need to pay $4700 in fees every 40 minutes to keep the bunker running. So the only way to make the bunker profitable while paying minimum price is to do horribly painful grindy missions with excessively OP'd AI trying to kill you.3. Cars Boats and Planes In the early days of GTA Online the most expensive cars were all less than $1m. Now some individual cars cost as much as $2.7m (or $34 USD). The current most expensive plane is $5.9m ( $74 USD) and the community all agrees that it's actually complete garbage. And the Lazer fighter jet is coming on sale soon for $6m ($75 USD) and it's beaten in every way by the Hydra a plane that costs 1/2 as much. The tugboat (while not the most expensive at $1.25m ($ 16 USD) was absolutely terrible being unable to take even the slightest explosion and having a top speed of 2.4. Warehouses Cargo warehouses are necessary to do special cargo missions and can range from $250k for the cheapest small warehouse up to $3.5m ( $44 USD) for the most expensive large one. Vehicle warehouses cost $1.5m up to $2.85m ( $36 USD) with cosmetic upgrades of almost $300k additionally.5. Yachts Yes you can buy a yacht. Cost ranges from $6m to $8m ($75 $100 USD) depending on which base yacht you buy with cosmetic upgrades totaling $2m additionally ($25 USD). And these yachts are almost completely useless for gameplay. They're just there to look cool. Yes that's right you can look cool in a video game for the low low cost of up to $125 USD REAL WORLD CURRENCY.I ended up logging about 100 hours in GTA Online in the past month or two but I'm done. I'm completely done never coming back to Online and I've already uninstalled the game for this reason GTA Online has become a PC equivalent of a mobile app. You don't realize it at first but playing GTA Online is exactly like playing Candy Crush Saga (or any of King's other games that should go die in hell). You get in understand the gameplay and think things are in reach. Before long you're playing hours on end for a single achievement that actually isn't worth much at all or your're shelling out a good chunk of real world currency to get the unlocks in any sort of timely manner. And regardless of whether or not you realize it GTA Online is an addiction. It's been designed over the years to become the most effective moneymaking machine Take Two could lay claim to and engineered to ensure players keep playing even when they're not actually having fun anymore. I finally woke up to what this game has been doing to my life and now that I'm aware of it they won't keep me playing anymore.GTA Online is not fun. It's a grind that's been engineered to be addictive and strip your life and/or wallet away from you all for the sake of Take Two making more money. If you buy this game buy it for the single player only. Don't let Take Two get you with the online. You'll regret it when you wake up.

Something that I don't like though is the fact that there is a ton of exclusive content only for online that means that because I decided to mod the game and not go online with hacks exclusive clothing and masks are withheld from me which kind of sucks. Still though it's a good game which I am currently redownloading so I can play online (for the first time!) meaning that my internet is nothing for a day. Oh well It is still as earlier stated a good game in most regards.

review: Great game. Played a bit of single player on my 360 and got bored a few hours in but playing online almost never gets old (especially with friends) Love That the game is constantly being updated with tons of bonuses for doing certain activities I might not normally do. Complaints Constantly getting kicked out of sessions while playing with friends is super annoying. We're at the point where we only go to public sessions when we have to sell cars or coke (while constantly being terrified that all our hard work could be destroyed by someone getting kicked from the session).I have seen many complaints about being banned and hackers. Personally I have never been banned and luckily I rarely come across hackers but they obviously they still need to do some more work on their end. I would still recommend this game but be aware that it is far from perfect.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: My review is more of a comparision between my take on the PS3 vs PC versions. I personally love this game and feel they did a great job improving on everything that made GTA4 not so great.So i started with the PS3 version sence release and going from that to this is breathtaking unbelevable and just plain awsome! so the possitive +way better graphics compared to this first counsole ports like the PS3 (unsure how it looks on PS4/XB1 but im sure those arr not on "high" settings ether)+First person mode! +your own personal custom radio station (nothing like blasting metal killing gang bangers!)+far better framerate than counsoles (my ps3 looked capped at 30fps?)+keeping your GTA online progress and getting that preorder money added to that account!Negative (VERY hard to find much) Driving in 1st person is a little crazy maybe if they add oculus rift support this will be a possitive ) obveous few glictches and bugs but its all minor stuff that will probably get fixed asapSO as you can tell there is basiclly nothing negative over this massive overhaul of the game. And yes it was worth every penny of that $60.... so yea you can say i paid "$120" for this game but it is what it is. and with how amazing this is it feels like a whole new game.

review: Before I start. I have played this on X360 and X1. You may also ask why did I buy it again? was it worth it? Simple Answer. YES. Now everyone recalls the terrible port GTA4 was unless you had a decent CPU and GPU it was still slugish.R* have finally redeemed themselves. This is "THE" GTA we have all been waiting for. Smooth Fast Fun. Graphic Options and settings in general are VERY well done. GTA Online is smooth as hell. Fun. AND if you have a console character you can transfer it to the PC version and enjoy it from wherever you left off and vice versa.I run this at the upscaled 4K ( nvidia setting ) and 1080p on a i7 4820k 780Ti 16GB DDR3 2400 Win 8.1 in 4k all settings on highest possible ( no need for aliasing ) I averaged 50 60fps and minor dips in the 30s on very very heavey dense scenes but very rare drops tbh.in 1080p maxed out fxaa msaa 4x msaa water 2x TXAA enabled maxed out settings average of 60 65 fps with a dip into the 50s once in a while but unnoticeable.I have been away from my PC for a very very very long time with no games to really enjoy since I have been busy with other console games but THIS ( even if its a port ) game is making me enjoy what #PCMasterRace is all about.Worth the Pre Order buy it you won't regret it.

review: This game keep crashing on my new pc (i7 4790k with noctua nh d15 asus z97 a corsair vengeance pro 16 gb ddr3 1600mhz r9 380 4gb 750 watt psu). No stuttering at all and really smooth on very high. But I always got random crash. I won't recommend it until these crashes has been fixed.Edit I found out that my new R9 380 is the one causing problem and i have to rma it. Currently using my old HD 5670 and it runs smooth enough on lowest setting. Recommending this game to everyone even those who use old gpu like my current gpu.P.S. Due to Take Two recent action on single player modding and also all the problem bug glitch that I experienced on multiplayer I'm changing this into not recommended.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Pretty good game. Huge campaign with three different protagonists plus a massive amount of side content and things to do like golfing and skydiving and riding bikes. Some things specifically aircraft and the submarine and bicycles have terrible mouse and keyboard controls so keep a controller plugged in and switch to that when you get in those vehicles (or any vehicle really). Story it's pretty generic and average. The dialogue and performances are all pretty spectacular though. Additionally the character Trevor is probably the most try hard edgy t character that I have ever seen in a video game and I can't see why people like him. As a supporting role he's great but as a main playable character Rockstar ed up. Michael's pretty whiny too. Franklin seems like they actually put effort into him so no complaints there. The endings are all terrible too.It also has a multiplayer mode and it's certainly great if you enjoy games with terrible character creators bad communities annoying messages and pop ups and a ton of grinding. Despite the flaws in the writing and the mistake of a multiplayer it's still a solid game and I don't really regret my pre order. It's undoubtedly worth the money spent. It also runs great and looks great and has content that other versions of the game do not (such as The Lab FM). Pick it up when you get the chance especially if you're a fan of the franchise.EDIT I should note there is always online DRM for singleplayer and multiplayer. And the unskippable startup video is ridiculously long.EDIT 2 After the fiasco involving OpenIV I've returned my review to normal. However I can no longer recommend the game after seeing the state it's in. Online is terrible and mismanaged singleplayer is totally forgotten so the developers and publisher can cash in on the terrible practices exercised in the multiplayer and the modding community is still crippled. Don't buy this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: EDIT With what's happened recently I no longer support ANYTHING Rockstar does. Don't buy anythign from them.This game is both great and terrible. That is the quickest way to summarize. Do not buy it at $60. It's not worth it. The graphics are really nice and there's some good characters but te way the game forces you to switch between three different protagonists means you spend the game not really giving a about anyone in particular. This is not the Los Santos of CJ in GTA SA. I don't know how that smaller and less detailed game managed it but it seemed to have more interesting environments and story. GTA should go back to single character stories and save the extra characters as more fleshed out DLC later. The game was surprisingly short for having three characters.I give it a recommendation but only because it was fun to play. It is NOT worth the full price. Online play was just pretty terrible. There's no reason they couldn't have done a co op mode like Saints Row 2/3/4. This game would have been amazing with drop in/out co op. The online play though feels stale and meaningless. A big world to roam around in that ultimately doesn't mean anything. It's all just a massive lobby.

review: Best game so far.I like how rockstar handle their games.The most importand thing that keeps the game apart is its brilliant AI and the events we come across during the gameplay.Like roberry people being kidnapped etc and all these makes the game's open world the most lively gaming world that has ever been created. I think most of the other games failed to achieve this . we will not be feeling that we are play a game that is what all other games are missing.When we play the game we can see how much time and effort the developers have put into it.One of the things that make us want to play GTA is its crazy explosions and ragdoll physics which they have done very well in this game.Also it would not be right if we do not mention about the sound effects which give life to the visuals. The story line in the game is moving like a mixture of fun.The drama between the three main charecters of the game is actually kind of fun. the Drawbacks that GTA IV has had was its story line it had which was not suitable for a game . But when we play GTA V we are like having a tour in a very pleasant and positive environment.Which is the kind of thing a game should have. GTA ONLINEThe main thing that makes people buy GTA V and not to go after cracked versions is its remarkable online experience . Rockstar has been releasing and planning to release more updates for the online.Heists were one of the updates for GTA ONLINE.And I think it was the best idea that Rockstar ever had .Overall i really enjoyed the game and its worth buying .

review: UPDATE So I decided to get myself a more updated laptop and the game runs great. I dont know if the game just has an issue running on Windows 7(what my old laptop runs) or whatnot but Its the same game ive enjoyed for so long on console. Now i need to get my profile caught up...PAST REVIEW SO... I currently own three copies of this game on three different systems PS3 XBOX ONE and PC via STEAM.I have never had any real issues with my other two systems when i comes to playing or starting this game. I've probably logged a few thousand hours playing the game in Story mode and Online mode on the other two systems. However i am stuck at a place where the game is unplayable for me.I've spent at least 40 hours between installling checking to make sure all files are installed troubleshooting with Rockstar Support(for some reason STEAM wont offer support for the game) and reinstalling the game in an attempt to get the game running. I am continually stuck in the "OFFLINE MODE UNAVAILABLE" screen at startup. I have also been unable to sign in to my Social Club account. I have asked for refunds thru STEAM multiple times but they cite thier "2 hour rule" as a reason for not refunding me my money spent on a game they are not willing to give customer support for. I am also curious as to why i am unable to link my Social Club account with my STEAM account? This is done thru PS XBOX Microsoft LIVE and other services. But not STEAM? I wish i could give it a good STEAM review but im too busy playing the game on XBOX ONE to care about that.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Epic Car Robbery 5 a.k.a. Car Stealer Racer and Trader Simulator 2015After 1 and a half years of waiting for the PC release it's finally here! And is it worth it? Yes it is!GTA 5 runs very smoothly at around 60 frames per second the world looks a lot beautiful and the textures don't look that muddy compared to console versions. Rockstar definitely put a lot of time and effort into optimizing this game for PC despite preloading and unpacking the game on day 1 of release. I'd say this was the right decision to delay the game and further again.However the game still uses the Rockstar Social Club DRM which is still frustrating to sign in(since I forgot the password for the service) but at least it's way better than the abhorred Games for Windows Live (which was used in GTA IV) right?Overall this game is definitely worth checking out in a new perspective. Also having played GTA Online before on consoles ALL the DLC (so far) is FREE! So how can you hate on that?

review: Well I think most people interested in this game will probably have played the previous GTA titles including Vice City San Andreas and IV and already know if they want to buy the game or not. However there may be those who are unfamiliar with the game so I'm going to split the review in 2 for those who are accustomed to the GTA world and those who are new to the franchise I'll try to keep both as brief as possible ) Just one word before that this is large game both in terms of size and also computation/graphics power required so make sure you have enough storage space and a good CPU and GPU setup before trying to play this game. Players unfamiliar with previous GTA titles This is an open world game meaning you play a character (or 3 in single player) and you may roam around freely among shops drive to the desert sky dive onto a boat walk up a mountain etc...it's quite a large space to explore both above and under ground so you'll pretty much always find something new to explore.Of course the game isn't merely about exploring the world...it's about making as much money from criminal activity as possible. In single player mode there's a focus on heist planning and actual heist missions with side missions such as stock market manipulation that you can turn to your advantage. The multiplayer mode GTA Online could be considered as an entirely separate game since there's so much more things to do more races challenges missions and content such as vehicles and customisation options such as clothing hair cuts tattoos etc. So keep that in mind if you think the price is a bit steep ) It's also a nice place to meet new people and have fun with them. See more comments about GTA Online in my second review hereunder. Players familiar with previous GTA titles Make no mistake this is a good game. It has some elements from IV a game which I didn't like IV very much to be honest (although I do know there were quite a few people who did actually like it) which could have potentially made V disappointing for me. It's sufficiently different that it is not disappointing on the contrary it's quite fun and refreshing. Of course a big change is the use of 3 main characters instead of one which enables more variation in missions encountered. The graphics are breathtaking and the game keeps you motivated since there's always something to do especially if you like unlocking achievements. I will say that there is limited car garage space and that the physics of some vehicles is a let down (e.g. unrealistic crash deformation and suspension characteristics) but overall I'm nit picking. One thing I would like to point out is GTA Online. It is an entirely different game in its own right...so if the price seems steep for you consider that you're getting 2 games here. There's even more stuff to do Online and R* are still adding new content regularly. It's also a nice place to meet people and have some fun with them although in almost every online game you will find 'trolls'. I will also say that Shark Cards are not necessary sure it'll be tough at first but you'll be able to get along soon enough (try to rank up as fast as you can otherwise more experienced players will discard you)...if you put in a few hours a day and don't spend every penny you earn you'll soon start having a few millions in your virtual bank account. It's also not a perfect system sometimes players randomly exit from a game (either intentional or due to connection/R* server errors) and there have been a few complaints about players being banned for no reason. To be honest I have never been banned (so far) so I can't really comment on that but I have no complaints in general about Online gameplay. Conclusion A must have for GTA aficionados and a game that you should seriously consider buying if you've never played GTA games but you're intrigued at what you're reading and seeing. Not without its faults...but what human made object *is* perfect? )

review: While GTA V has a great engine for single player it's lacking key features once offered in previous versions of the franchise. These features being character movements and animations making the controls feel lacking in areas where players could once navigate. Other features lacking are the overall AI from the police and peds acting unnatural in certain instances and vehicle damage being almost non existent compared to GTA IV. The game looks great and has tons of customization options but because the game was ported from console to pc and not the other way around I feel the game suffers to some degree due to the limitations of certain platforms.

review: I will definitely still play GTA V as I've invested a lot of time into building up my character. I jumped in on 360 right after Online launched. However the continued monotization of the game by Take Two has been incredibly frustrating as a Rockstar fan. I sincerely hope that they heed the calls of the community for less money grabbing more community engagement (just for the love of all that is holy and destructable give us the single player content you've teased for literally years) and provide us the tools to mod the Single Player experience without interfereing with Online. Both aspects of the game are amazing sandboxes because they allow us to live out our own criminal fantasies better than any other game out there but it is only going to turn more people away the longer the community is ignored. Rockstar should look to how Bethesda handles the modding community for guidance. Embrace us and we will keep your game alive for years to come. Until this happens I cannot recommend the game to new players. I sincerely hope I will be able to write a new review in the coming weeks talking about how Rockstar listened to us and engaged and didn't just give the shareholders everything. We are your business. Please listen. Rant end. Review negative overall.

review: The online is a grindfest where every new thing over the years gets more and more expensive while the missions pay the same or less than they used to. Obviously this is done intentionally so that people would buy shark cards which is absurd for a game that is Pay to Play in the first place but beyond that the shark cards give ridicolous value. Add to this Rockstar's complete disregard for cheaters and hackers and modders running rampant on their client based multiplayer and the unkept promises for the story mode and GTA V as a whole is simply a great game managed in the worst possible way. It would take so little to make the multiplayer a fun and enjoying experience just take away the greed. Considering how much money R* made off of it already it's about time they readjust the prices and the mission payouts so that the game is no longer a painful grindfest. And then there's the whole issue with the lack of dedicated servers but I guess it's just too late to even bother now.Update two years of DLCs later and the cost of properties and vehicles skyrocketed so high that it would take 60 to 100 hours to grind enough dollars for one vehicle or 75$ of shark card. Microtransactions and pay to win done wrong best example right here. Love the game hate the grind and the shark cards based economy Tood bad.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's the best open world game I've seen thus far. Tons of fun.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The singleplayer campaign is good enough for one playthrough with the true draw of the game being online multiplayer however the content can run dry after a few hundred hours. Easily the largest downside of online has been the insane pricing of new content but other than that it is really fun with a couple of friends to run through heists or even just in freeroam.TL DR If you haven t played this game before it is absolutely worth it. But if you ve played it on a console not much has changed beyond a few new events and mildly faster vehicles I d have to say it s not worth the price.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is amazing... if you have money. The bare minimum is having a friend with money to help you get it but this game is still amazing none the less. As every other living soul on this chat mentions i've clocked in near 1k hours (specifically 934) and ive loved every minute. I HAVE ONLY DONE THE MANDATORY MISSIONS ALMOST ALL MY HOURS ARE SPENT IN ONLINE THEREFOR THIS IS AN ONLINE ONLY REVIEWPros Driving physics are the best out of any arcade like game EVER. Third person is perfect First person (although not as good) is there and functions as it should The amount of stuff to do is beyond my knowledge Looks better than games coming out in 2017 despite its 2013 release dateCons No money means no fun The more money you have the more money you make... the less you have... you get the point This game is its most fun with friends without them its not as good Takes a pretty good computer to run LONG LOADING TIMES The community can only be described as cancer... unless you like to troll in which case buy this game NOW no map expansion yet Conclusion without money friends or time invested this game is just a pretty looking game that is really tedious. But investing a couple hundred hours and with friends as well as heists in mind this game will keep you occupied until gta 6 or star citizen comes out.11/10 good meme
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've been playing this game for a while now. Whereas within the past several months (i.e. 10+ months) now the game has become such a crappy experience for online players due to (1) Excessive number of modders online ruining your gameplay experience or heights with other players (2) Excessive disconnects via online gameplay with every player leaving/disconnecting during your gameplay or during a massive heists via Hard Mode and (3) Being told jack squat from Rockstar Support about issue number (2) after other players have submitted numerous tickets created various forums of troubleshooting measures and provided transparent videos on YouTube my honest advice for everyone is to not purchase the game but instead Torrent the game. Mind you I do not have problems disconnecting or connecting in any other games except GTA V Online. With that being said my advice is to go back to playing Halo or some other open world FPS as you're not going to get your return or "fun time" if you spend money on GTA V. Because apparently this is a very common issue and there's nothing that can be done about it on the player's end. In other words it's not you but a problem with Rockstars Servers (that will more than likely never be fixed). So I hope this helps everyone.

review: This review has been needing a change since release so what a better time than now.The Grand Theft Auto 5 singleplayer experience is enjoyable and intriguing the amount of interesting and diverse characters draws the player to conversations and the world that the game takes place in is also constructed perfectly all the encounters and attention to details help create an magnificent enviroment. But lets face it you are going to make a purchase of this game based on the online experience rather the singleplayer and thats the problem.GTA Online is terrible the countless amounts of hackers horrible connections to servers and the constant grind blends to create a sour taste in the mouth. All these problems lie on the shoulders of the developers Rockstar Games and Take Two. Rockstar create beautifully immersive and complex universe but that missed the ball with this one without proper servers users are unable to play a constant match with DCing with the hackers users cannot complete free roam missions and with the grind users cant have fun and have to shill hard earned cash from their wallets just to gain a measley chuckle with friends isnt worth it.You should not purchase Grand Theft Auto 5 as the developers do not care about your experience or the community in general. With the addition to removing OpenIV they do not care for the PC experience either.

review: I'm going to make this quick and simple with the pros and cons (and neutral) Pros It is a nice port. Certainly a change from GTA 4. Many activities you could join in SP. MP? You'll find more of that in MP (but it does have its cons. I'll list it below) Free MP DLCs A change from your usual GTA game with not just one protagonist but three of them (you can customize their looks as well though the SP customization is surely lacking compared to the MP one). The three are colourful in personality and one should atleast find a character that is to their liking. I liked Michael the most. Semi realistic shooting gameplay that I found to be enjoyable San Andreas is lively. So much livelier than Liberty City.Cons the MP although fun if you have some friends to play around can be cancerous. Griefers are everywhere cheaters roam free and the stuffs are very expensive. You would need to grind to have money and money is everything in a MP game like this. All cars handled the same. There are minor differences sure but because of engine limitation you'll see that the minor differences meant for nothing. Dead MP jobs. I said from before that there are lots of activities in the MP. Sadly these jobs are often devoid of players. You want to do some MP race? You better be patient because not many players like playing the races. Convoluted storyline. You got three protags but the game did not do justice to their stories. The guys at RS once banned me for playing fair so I guess you can include bad admins into the fray (lucky for me I got my account back).Neutral No more than one strip club (Only found one. If there's another let me know). The colourful city. Some may not enjoy it but I prefer the new Los Santos to Liberty City. All in all a good game for you if you enjoy this particular type of game.But what do I know? I'm just a lifting rat.

review: Love this game but there have been no more Heists added (which I would say is one of the most asked for things) and even though I don't use any mods I fully encourage game dev's to allow the modding of their games. This almost always results in the game being better overall due to the variety of options available to them that mods allow and can also result in those mods being added to the core game and the mods developer being paid for or even joining the dev team. So due to the fact that Open IV is now banned (resulting in pretty much no more mods) I've gotta say NO!!!!!!! Do not buy this game and do not give in to the money grabbing scumbags who don't care about their players and only care about making as much money out of an amazing game before they burn it to the ground.

review: I loved the game until Take Two stepped in like a communist leader. The game was great upon release in 2013 but as we get further into the game's age we run into the cancer of microtransaction and it is just getting far more worse at a very quick pace. There is a reason why all the DLC content has been "free" from the start. Because sooner or later you can't keep up with the release of these DLC and you will soon start buying Shark Cards that is more expensive than the game. Any further with the forcing of microtransactions on the players of Gta5 I would consider a scam. This company has turned money hungry with a farm where they can milk your wallet like a cow. You can consider me the South and Take Two &amp Rockstar Games the North if this is a civil war and believe me the South will rise again because not many of us want to put up with the t.On behalf of the anti modding policies that your company believes in I would love to say to your faces "Come and take it because you are not getting it !"This game has earned the negative reviews and the backlash of the modding community because this company is technically scamming it's player base. I cannot even write a full review of why I chose the negative button because I simply do not have the time to waste.
