review: I used to like GTA 5. I used to like it a lot.Even though I haddn't played its multiplayer I was still thinking of having a go. now I won't though. now I won't play it anymore at all or buy any future rockstar games even though I was really looking forwards to Red dead redemtion 2.Why? because take 2 the companny in charge of rockstar games has banned modding in the game. in SINGLE PLAYER.they apparently done this because the modding software was sometimes used by hackers in GTA online to cheat. That's the key word though SOMETIMES. Not all the time and not by everyone. why ban every single player from using mods in single player just because of a few bad people? its a tottaly stupid move and its why im going on a boycot against Take 2.the reason why Take 2 did this was because of shark cards. little micro transactions that allow you to buy more in game money in GTA online for real life cash. The problem Take 2 has though is that people cheating in GTA online have no reason to buy shark cards since they can spawn in more money. So to wrap it all up this why I'm quitting gta 5. I'm not ok with playing a game that sqaushes my creative freedom for such a stupid reason.

review: Modding the online multiplayer portion of any game should always be met with heavy penalty and all proactive efforts should be taken to remediate such actions. This type of modding is often toxic and usually has a negative impact other players' online experience.Modding the offline/singleplayer portion of games makes gaming what it is today. It allows players to express their creativity by taking a game and putting their own unique spin on it generally enhancing the experience. There should absolutely never be a situation where a game developer should punish those seeking to mod this portion of the game. It restricts creativity and is a slap in the face to anyone who wants to get the most out of their gaming experience.The recent news regarding Take Two Interactive's cease and desist letter to OpenIV is a blatent overstep of their authority. Unless their decision is reversed and they take no other actions in the future that punishes ethical modding players will unite and make a difference.Good luck trying to sell another game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Well then I am now changing my review since apparently Rockstar and their publisher have changed a bit to work with modders (iirc haven't checked on it don't really care to check on it as of late other things going on in my life) and I have a... newfound moral disagreement with reviewbombing. My qualms with the game as of the last time I played (gun runner update) would be more objective to lay claim to.As much as I don't particularly like playing the game anymore it would be a lie to say that I did not enjoy playing it. The story mode is as fun as ever and the online multiplayer was fun for a while. On the aspect of story mode it's fun and would definitely recommend snagging it if you haven't gotten the chance to experience it.Now however comes to the part where I'm somewhat iffy on recommending this game. Up to the point that I had played there hadn't been any updates to single player as far as content goes that I was aware of so at this point if you play GTA mostly for the single player GTAV is fairly dead in that regard from here on out. If you are interested in the multiplayer and don't have a well developed millionaire character... it is quite flawed and very unfun at points. Firstly the entire thing is pretty antagonistic towards newer players. You don't have as good of guns you don't have access to the good armor initially and more experienced players have a considerable advantage in health. With the gun runner review a whole new level of imbalance was added. The vehicles that are available to players with the in game currency to buy them or get them through the gun runner DLC and previous to that are unbalanced and unfun to play against unless you have those very same vehicles. While yes some of it can be overcame with skill and fancy shooting and tactics it's not a particularly fun environment to play in. Since one of the big ways of advancement is through the open world content via the biker gang and CEO missions/activities it can be quite drull when you get firebombed by a pair of guys on a pair of extremely nimble rocket bikes with rocket launchers on them for the umpteenth time in a row when you're merely trying to make money and succeed.So TL DR Single player is good as ever but has had a halt in development.Multiplayer is about as fun as if APB had turned off the free for all protection that is to say that if you want to merely get on an even playing field with those who make you miserable you are going to have to put in dozens and dozens of hours to merely not have a substantial gear and health advantage going against you.I really wish Steam had a "meh" option for recommending the game because on one hand I do think it is a game worth experiencing then on the other I really don't feel particularly keen on playing it or personally recommending it to someone.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After reading comments you guys are right. Take Two has ruined their own reputation by attempting to shutdown OpenIV. Whether they apologize or not it still happened and that should never be forgotten. Modding will never die no matter how hard you stomp on it. The haters are right too. "This isn't a legit review it's abusing the review system." Fine.GTA Online is garbage and is full of cheaters who's only goal is to make you angry. The only way to get money is to grind for hours and then spend it all on a single car or buy shark cards which is what they want. Single player is horrifically boring once you 100% it which doesn't take long. Where is the single player DLC that has been rumored and teased over the years? It's not going to happen. GTA Online is Take Two's cash cow. They won't release SP DLC because then people will stop playing online which will stop shark card purchases. Mods are the reason I still play this game. Playing LSPDFR is the most fun I've ever had in this. Playing in my world is what I enjoy not playing in a microtransaction filled fest.GooD NTS has not released a statement about OpenIV so far other than the initial one when this happened but OpenIV was updated recently to remove the "Uninstall Later" message. It has also been updated on gta5 mods which can be found here https //www.gta5 mods.com/tools/openivWould I recommend this game? Depends on how you want to play it. If you want to play Online or the single player stick to watching videos on YouTube. If you want to mod it and play it your way then yes. It's great for that purpose. This is just my review on the vanilla game for all those whining about me abusing the review system. )

Or 3) just quit.1&amp 2 are rhetorical. So 3 is the only real option. So don't buy this game.

review: Great game in all honesty the singlepalyer is one of the best I've played in the recent years (Mostly On Console as I just moved onto pc) But I have played The Last Of Us Most of the CODs campaigns Battlefield 1 and Battlefield 4) They all had me immersed into the game really heavily I just couldn't live without them. but as soon as you hop into online in GTA 5 it started to frustrate me as there were modders on every god damm server I went into. And some of really did frustrate me hard as one time a hacker had stolen all my money. So If you have friends Heists and Races are really fun and if you dont want to have modders the good thing is that you can make a invite only session were you can only invite people that you know or just play by yourself. Driving is really fun in this game (Personal Opinion)Pros Great Singlepalyer Great With friends Really Imersive Great Vareity Of Amerpartments Cars Heists Etc Great Visuals Amazing DLC Free DLC DrivingCons Microtransactions (Shark Cards) Modders Online Conections (Peer To Peer) Horrible support Toxic Community Horrible Anti CheatIn all honesty this game is great but it has been ruined by modders coming from old gen (Xbox 360 PS3) the same problem is on console I heard so. But if you like singleplayer games or any kind of those type of games this game is your go to.But if you are considering to Buy it for multiplayer please wait till Rockstar patch thesse bugs I mean go ahead if you want to but I would say spend money on another game for the time being because the game right now is full of modders that will ruin your experiance

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Recent updates has probably made this game unplayable on my system. Neither I nor Rockstar know why. It's a shame since I've been looking forward to playing this game since its launch.Apart from that I think that this game is inferior to Saints Row 2 in most ways but two online multiplayer activity and vehicle customisation. There are other things I like about this game (if I could actually play it on my system) and that is the diverse game modes and the ability to customise them.Even though I think the customisation on this game is crap compared to that of Saints Row 2's and the Sims games' it's still within my taste and I'd still want to keep playing because unlike many other games with customisation it's actually pretty decent.I wish that Rockstar would make interiors accessible throughout the game not only just in the missions in which they take place in. For instance in the Humane Labs and Research building I have seen a Twitch streamer using an exploit in the console version of the game just to access it on GTAO for a non competititve game he made up. Saints Row 2 doesn't require exploits for a similar feature.As always I love how easy it is to mod the game but I'm annoyed that modding for online gameplay is not allowed and will result in bans. Even then modders might not think of the mechanics that I would like for this game.

review: Singleplayer was abandoned in favor of multiplayer to push Shark Cards. They're essentially harvesting money off people dumb enough to buy GTA Bucks. Its painfully obvious that as a result mission rewards have been tailored to provide insufficient payout to encourage their purchase. Plus all the new content added to Online isn't in singleplayer and they even have made it difficult for people to spawn any of the content in SP through mods indicating they are desperate to funnel people into Online and thus towards their contemptible currency. Given that they supposedly make 250 million a year off this it shouldn't be a massive surprise. The fact of the matter is Shark Cards shouldn't exist to begin with but Rockstar is a den of greedy console peasants pushing a massively anti consumer business model its simply another step down the stairs of corporate hegemony given past actions.With persistent connection issues and terrible performance on the lowest to highest grade PCs this game is a glorified Rockstar money farm. Get millions from a hacker or play something else. Unless they show a massive turn in mentality Red Dead's sequel is bound to be a game riddled with ways to suck money from your wallet. Don't give Rockstar a dime.

review: Played GTA V just thought a quick review on graphics and playability Have been waiting for this game and preoredered it I am not dissapointed the game runs smooth haven't encountered any difficulties in playing the game this is my data if it helps Alienware 51 R2GPU Geforce GTX 745CPU Intel(R) Core(TM) i5 4460 CPU 3.20GHZ Memory 8GB 7.92 usable Hardrive 1TBInstalled the updated driver from nividea Gforce released for grand theft auto V operating system windows 8.1 Frames rates are stable no massive spikes in difference have to say first person mode adds much to the world level of this games quality and gameply cannot be disputed seems highly polished.Have played this on PS3 and can definately tell the differnence.Account issues with rockstars social club seem to be apparent you must create a social club account its just a peice of bloated DRM software designed to look cool and interesting reccomend you go to rockstars web page and create an account before loading GTA V same goes if you have forgotten your password because you haven't used it in years to avoid any issues.It links to your steam account so you can only have one rockstar club account and it's permanent no going back so as I said if you create an account before hand you can forget about it after the DRM stage from rockstar.personally I think steam needs to ban these practices in future third party DRM has a lot of issues.Thankfully have had no issues with this created account months ago with another game forgot the password through.One thing you can count on is rockstar patching anything this game needs so don't give up if you can't play I know its frusrating through have games in my libary like that unplayable becasue of a silly issue this is there pilot into PC gaming they ve learned the mistakes of the past and have built a lot of new systems so the game can run on medium to high poewered pcs not just released a port this is a game version in it's own right this wouldn't run on consoled well anymore.right lets play GTA time to enjioy myself after all the waiting glad you did rockstar

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There was a time where I'd recommend this game to friends. "It's fantastic! The singleplayer is great the online is fun! There's more than just killing people!"Not anymore. I've bought this game 4 times now. First on the Xbox 360 with the super fancy best edition whatever that was then on the PS3 normal edition then on the Xbox One normal edition and then on the PC normal edition. That's over $300 to Rockstar and Take 2. I knew PC would have more modders online than the new gen console versions. So I got the PC version purely for mods and to never play online. I've sunk over 1500 hours in the Xbox 360 Version and then another 900 or so in the Xbox One version. A good amount in the PS3 version and a good amount in the Steam Version. I wouldn't recommend this game any longer. Since those first days the last few major DLCs and the end of DLC coming to singleplayer has turned me off of it. There are no ways to get money fast playing this game. When the game came out the most expensive property was $400 000 and the most expensive car was $1million. Now it's $4million in the form of a basic office in a skyscraper downtown. Then of course there's the $2million optional garage for the skyscraper the $6million Yacht (a base model Yacht may I add these can cost up to $12million) a $2.9million underground nuclear bunker and multiple small side businesses for up to $900k each don't forget the warehouse properties for up to $1.6million.Oh and the cars. When the game came out an Obey 9f which is an Audi R8 (a car costing the real life equivalent of about $140 000) was priced in game at about $120 000. Fairly reasonable. Since then there has been a Jaguar F Type added to the game in the form of the Ocelot Lynx. It's a sports class car and in reality shouldn't cost too much more than the Obey 9f. In real life it's about $100 000. In the game it's $1.7million.Same thing happened longer back there was a Subaru BRZ lookalike car added to the game. I have never seen someone own one you know why? Because it costs $700 000. I wouldn't pay that. Not many people would. What you may not know upon reading this review is that Rockstar and Take 2 also have "Shark Cards". In game currency that can be bought with real life money. $100 buys you $8million. $20 buys you $1.25million. You get the idea. These weren't initially available at the start of GTA Online only a month or two afterwards. And the $20 card was the most expensive. Now there are even more expensive options. The increase in cost of living in Los Santos has no doubt in my mind been because of these Shark Cards. Rockstar and Take 2 have been trying to squeeze money out of this game as much as possible. And online is their way to doing it. Singleplayer DLC news was promised in 2014 however it is 2017 and there hasn't been any word on it at all. Presumably this DLC has been cancelled for online content. When the game was marketed before release Rockstar also said there would be stock trading in Online however 4 years down the line this has not come to fruition. Presumably because the concept of free money or stock manipulation has them scared of a loss of potential earnings. This is how games work right? This is why PC has mods for those who don't want to play online or can't or don't have the time to. Well it's not going to be this way much longer if Rockstar's parent company Take 2 has their way. Earlier this month the creators of OpenIV a modding tool that blocks the multiplayer aspect of GTA so that the singleplayer aspect can be modified for mods such as vehicle mods (turning the Lynx into an actual Jaguar F Type for example) singleplayer functions such as LSPDFR and more received a Cease and Desist letter from Take 2 during the height of E3. Take 2 believed that the flood of gaming news during this time would stop this story from getting out. It hasn't. In the letter they cite that the creators of OpenIV are violating Rockstar's property and that they need to stop distributing copies of the modding tool or face legal action. The creators of OpenIV have been doing this for 10 years. And their mod does not affect Multiplayer in fact it has measures implemented so this can't affect Multiplayer. But precisely this is the problem that Take 2 sees. If less people play multiplayer less people will buy Shark Cards and less people will spend money on their online game. So they want to stop a gigantic modding community. PC isn't even the largest platform for this game. In fact I would suggest it is the smallest. With the largest platforms being PS4 and Xbox One there is no reason that some people playing singleplayer could pose a threat to Take 2's earnings. Yet it does to them. And that's enough for all of us to stop playing their game and start fighting back. I'm not the first negative review today and I certainly won't be the last. Take 2 you've gotten $300 of my money in games and $140 of my money in Shark Cards. I'm not buying them again. And my preorder of RDR 2? That's been cancelled.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's GTA!The gameplay is the same as every other game in the series the only diffrence is that it is more refined and 10 million times better. Rockstar have been using the same core gameplay since 1997 and have built upon it and made it hugley improved. That doesn't mean the gameplay is bad it's really fun to go on rampages drive through the city or through the desert. This game gives you a lot of choices and that's why it appeals to so many people. You can be whoever you want to be. You can either play as just a normal person obeying traffic and doing crazy activities. Or you can kill everyone and everything which is 90 percent of people. "SPOILER'S AHEAD"!!!!!The story.....what can I say. The best story Rockstar has made yet. You play as three different characters which you can switch between whenever you like. Franklin Micheal and Trevor. 9 Years prior to the events of GTA V Micheal Trevor and their friend Brad try to pull off a heist in North Yankton.Everything goes well until their car gets hit by a train and they get ambushed by cops. Brad and Micheal are both shot while Trevor escapes with some of the cash. Micheal fakes his dead and flies to Los Santos while Brad dies.In Los Santos Micheal meets Franklin. They pull off a heist which attracts the attention of Trevor who then goes to meet Micheal.At one point the trio starts working for Devin Weston a rich and famous guy. Then Devin Weston offers Franklin 3 choices but I will not spoil them.*SPOILER ALERT OVER* The singleplayer has 69 missions and 58 "Strangers and Freaks" side mission. The storymode can be completed for around 30 40 hours if you aren't hurrying.The game offers a lot of side activities such as hunting racing playing darts and much more. This alone will get you tons of hours of fun.Now onto the multiplayer. The only negative aspect of this game. Multiplayer is on the base a fun greatly made place where you can do whatever you want with your friends. BUT...don't get too excited because each lobby is filled with at least one hacker ruining the game spawning in money etc. The game is unplayable becasue if you are new then it's basically unplayable becasue everyone else is 100 percent going to be better than you. In addition to this it has microtransations you can get kicked for no reason and every purchasable item is overpriced to A lot of people have been unlawfully banned including myself for doing nothing wrong. Hopefully in GTA 6 multiplayer can be much better.Should you buy it. YES. Singleplayer is filled with tons of content and mods increase this multiplayer is fun putting negatives aside and worth the hefty price tag. Buy it before I hunt you down......
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game is good and has the potential to be great but that potential has been squandered by Take Two in a quest for even more money from microtransactions in a full price game that is still full price even four years after release.The GTA series stands as a landmark series in videogame history it's a series that most people have heard of even if they don't play videogames before GTAV I would say that reputation was well earned. In fact considering the sheer detail of the world and how much there is to do in GTAV I would even agree that the work that Rockstar put into these games is deserving of a lot of praise still.But the problem is that it's too big of a name and the publisher knows it. They know that they can charge full price for the game when they release on consoles and then full price again years later when they release on newer consoles and PC effectively selling the game twice. They know they can even increase the price of the game just before the 2015 summer sale so that even the 'on sale' price is the same as the regular price. Worse still their justification for that particular stunt was that the game package came with a 'shark card' a satirical credit card in the GTA universe that serves as the name for packages of in game money that Take Two will sell for real money. This is worse not only because selling in game money is scummy but also because that shark card is considered by Steam to be a DLC meaning the purchase of the game + shark card is non refundable.I still have trouble believing that the shark cards are real. Everything in GTA is a parody of real American culture they even have jokey adverts on the radio about how the macho credit card shark names make you more of a man for owning them. So when I heard that you could buy in game cash for these things I didn't actually believe it until I got in game and saw it for myself. Even if you're someone who buys into micro transactions in other games like I do buying shark cards is absolutely not worth it. I'm usually happy to spend a bit of money in a game even if it's not F2P because I won't have bought the game full price I'm enjoying it and I like to support the devs. The thing is though everything in GTAV has slowly become more and more focused on getting people to buy shark cards and there is no division between optional micro transaction content and regular content.I wasn't really too thrilled about the GTAV story for a number of reasons but I did like the thought of making my own criminal dude and running about Los Santos driving sweet cars and flying planes. You might think this was good because GTA O is the only aspect of the game that receives updates anymore but you'd be wrong. I've put a couple hundred hours into GTA O and still have virtually nothing to show for it. There have been countless 'free' updates to the game since I started but it doesn't matter because EVERYTHING they add is exorbitantly expensive. Never mind the fact that a lot of it is just very samey super cars they're super cars that my character can only dream of driving because he is and always will be dirt poor. The simple reason that I never have any money in GTA O is that all of the money making methods are incredibly grindy so you get bored and put your credit card details in for some shark cards and the methods often have high up front costs so you justify putting your credit card details in for some shark cards just to get you started on making money. I've never done this however and the reasons why are thus A) The game was already expensive enough even on sale and I cannot justify spending more just for in game money.andB) GTA O is a nightmarish hellscape full of hackers and connectivity problems.Yeah don't let my 200 hours in online fool you into thinking that all of those hours were like logging into any regular MMO. Free play had virtually nothing for you to do for years until they finally adding free play events which even now are often complete wastes of time when veterans can and will completely dominate them. Hackers and griefers are everywhere you might just be minding your own business miles away from everyone else riding a motorbike across the mountains like I have done many times only for you to suddenly blow up or get off your bike and lose all of your momentum while your bike flies away or turn into a god damn carousel while the hackers pin props to your character model. And if you're thinking well I'll just report that hacker and continue playing. Good luck with that. Rockstar have proven to be somewhat indisciminate with who they ban and even accidently receiving spawned money can leave your account banned for weeks and your in game bank account drained of all funds even if they were legitimately earned. Don't get me wrong there's a lot of cool in GTA O and GTAV but unless you like spending hundreds of hours doing the most menial tasks you can imagine in a game or you can just open your wallet you won't ever get the play with them. The tasks are menial by the way. I once worked for an 'organisation' a group that a player had created because they had the right property to launch organisation missions and it was my job to drive a dump truck around a neighbourhood 'delivering' packages of coke on the sly. The money I received for doing that wasn't even enough to buy some of the coats they sell in the clothing stores.I spent maybe half an hour of my life that I will never get back being a virtual bin man for an ill mannered twelve year old.Don't support Take Two and what they've done to this series.Oh yeah they also legally attacked some modders in Russia recently for helping people make SINGLE PLAYER mods for their game so they can play the way they like. Horrible bastards.

review: Thanks to Take Two the entire modding community for both GTA 5 and future Rockstar titles such as GTA 6 and RDR2 will be negatively affected. One of the major reasons I bought this game for the SECOND time for PC after playing on consoles was due to the modding community that has existed for GTA games for many years now. Modding for GTA 5 was just now hitting its height of stability and fun while online has also grown to have many ufn game modes.Just because people are playing single player with mods does not mean that the vast majority of players stil play online. There are still thousands of people who have great fun in GTA online and purchase cash cards. Part of the GTA franchise is the fact that players have the option to play through the game in various ways. Just because some players decide to not play online does not mean that the entire modding community should be negatively affected. If T2 rolls back on their terrible decision to restrict OpenIV I will gladly chnage my review back to positive for this game and the community relations between Rockstar T2 and the community will greatly improve.

review: Somehow runs very smoothly on my potato. I rate it a 10/10.UPDATESo I got a new computer with an i5 3470 and a GTX 980 SC and for some reason I keep getting a stuttering issue so much that the game is unplayable. The loading screen has choppy music playing for 2 seconds pausing for 5+ and playing again on a constant loop. When I get in game the stuttering continues. I get one second of playable time until it stutters again for 5+ seconds. When I check my frames it is way more than playable so I don't know if this is a driver issue but I have uninstalled and reinstalled them multiple times. It would be great if rockstar can fix this issue.UPDATE #2I figured it out. For some reason having some of my playback devices disabled causes that issue. I fixed it by enabling all of the audio devices and making my headphones the defaults.

review: This game is great don't get me wrong. The single player campaign is a fantastic criticism of the extravagant consumerism and late stage capitalism of the United States and is indeed very fun. What makes this so ironic is the fact that while the single player campaign is a beautiful well written satire of capitalism and consumerism GTA Online is too but is very much real. For Take Two to smash the game's vibrant modding community in a pathetic attempt to get people to buy more "shark cards" is incredibly disappointing and ironic given the story single player campaigns throughout the franchise. It's almost as if they haven't played their own damn game. Modders have added so much content to the single player game while Rockstar/Take Two haven't released a single DLC for offline mode since the game was released almost 5 years ago.Take Two's argument for their cease and desist order is that OpenIV enables hacking. That's t and here's why. When OpenIV is attached to a GTAV installation it disables GTA Online completely. Attempting to go online on an installation modded with OpenIV will crash the game. Instead of going after the individual hackers who would abuse this tool Take Two has shown that they don't care about the consumer by issuing a blanket demand to stop development of OpenIV.This is not the only time Take Two has been hostile to modders. Around the time of the game's release many members of the modding community were unfairly banned from opening the game in both single player and online mode simply for installing a mod to use in single player mode or experimenting with the game's code nothing wrong with that outside of Online mode.Rockstar as well has lost both my money and my respect. They used to feature mods all the time and were incredibly supportive of the GTA modding community. For them to be completely silent on this whole mess regardless of whether or not they are Take Two's subsidiary is absurd and reeks of rent seeking corporatist behavior.In short you Take Two. You've Taken Two GTA Vs worth of money from me both for the Xbox 360 version and the PC version. That will be the last of my money that you'll ever get.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I only play the single player haven't touched the online as it doesn't interest me.This game is amazing. By far the best of the GTA franchise and that's saying something. It's an epic crime saga with a racing game and a flight simulator built in. Three characters provide better variety than just one tons of beautiful vehicles to steal and modify an entire island that is unlocked the moment you start the game (unlike previous GTA games). The gun selection is stellar as usual (sticky bomb heists on armored cars easy money). Not to mention this is easily the greatest video game soundtrack of all time. The radio stations in this game play better music and have more variety than the city I live in. If you played this game at first on console but happen to have a better computer since that time try this game again. When you can crank everything to max video settings and run it it looks like a 2017 game. It's that polished.10/10

review: The below statements about the game are still true in my opinion however the shutting down of OpenIV is unacceptable and the player needs to voice their opinion at the storefront so this will be a thumbs down for now.Grand Theft Auto Five is hands down one of the best sandbox games ever. The best thing in my opinion is the optimization. Even on my low end PC it runs really well about 30 40 frames per second. This was not possible for games like The Witcher 2 that came out years before. the second best thing is the editor currently exclusive for PC. Think the Theater mode for Halo. The rest of the game is just like the current gen consoles. If you are satisfied with your PS4 and XBONE experience and don't mind much for editors then you might stay with those versions. The keyboard controls are pretty good for on foot and driving but as far as aircraft it's pretty bad. The planes fly with the numpad on the right by default and I think the helicopters use the mouse. The other bad thing about this game is the drain on my CPU. Again my computer isn't very good at running this game in the first place but skyping with more than one other person will break either GTA or Skype so watch out.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: OpenIV has made a huge mistake that I don't think it can ever recover from. It's straight up called a cease and desist on ALL modding. Yes including all of the fun single player mods that did no harm at all to the online community.Now not only has this NOT worked at all it's making online hacking worse than before. Before you'd only run into a hacker every couple sessions or so and now it's EVERY session. Goes to say something about how seriously Rockstar and OpenIV are taking this huh? I'll never support Rockstar in the future for how they treat their PC users. all of them. Ubisoft hasn't even screwed up this hard.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Banned singleplayer mods because it's "competition" for your multiplayer even though the people with that do mod singleplayer probably play online on console. review: &gt Load In&gt Error&gt Loads in (Again)&gt Spawns in Online&gt Dead&gt "GTA Online is currently not available"&gt Loads in (Again) x2&gt Spawns next to Fort Zancudo&gt Gets blown the F*** UP&gt Ran over by a clown&gt Stabbed by a hooker&gt Hit by an invincible train&gt &gt &gt Quits*Serious Review BelowDo I recommend GTA V Online as a good multiplayer game for friends..?A No. There are many other games on Steam and through other PC clients that can fill the gap in paid multiplayer gaming just fine this game's community is an absolute pile of heated dogsh*t.Do I recommend GTA V Online as a good F*** around game?A Yes. As long as you don't mind paying for car insurance in a game based on Grand Theft Auto Murder and Larceny anyway. There are some mechanics in this game I just do not agree with though and make it impossible to be a good simaritan or a complete tw*twaffle at times.Is GTA V worth retail pricing or should you wait until it's on sale?A No. No. No. GTA V overall while it's campaign and it's openworld enviornment are astounding the game itself is not worth 60.00 USD and should be purchased on a Steam sale. The game just doesn't offer enough playability to consider itself a game worth of AAA pricing.***NOTE I don't have many hours total on PC but I do have at least 3 000 hours totalled on console/s. Don't rag on me for 9.8 hours played.

review: Wait for Rockstar to fix their First off the game crashes the graphics driver OPTIMIZED FOR THE GAME when you tab out of fullscreen so don't do that. Secondly when the game tells me to restart after tweaking the graphics settings (which has to be done every time) it closes then the game crashes on launch leaving me helpless with a black screen hoping to god Alt+F4 works otherwise I have to hard restart my computer. Third when I run the game quit through the menu then try to run any other Steam game the other game crashes off start as well leaving me with the same effect. I've been fortunate though because these are the only major problems I've had with it. Other people have had countless more. If anyone wants to message me back with solutions to any of these I'd be all for it. As a side note the NVIDIA GeForce thing has a recommendation for all of my settings. I hit the "Use Optimal Settings" button and it says it works within that but whenever the game starts it runs at 800X600 with all of the lowest settings. I've yet to find a solution to any of these besides Alt+F4 restarting my computer and just tweaking my graphics every time I launch the game. When it works it's a ing brilliant game. It just doesn't work.

review: The main reason I bought the game was to be able to play around with mods in singleplayer. But now that's illegal because it was "Under monetizing" the game. But let's just look at the facts. Grand Theft Auto 5 took $325million to make and as of August 2016 they've made well over their initial budget. Over 12 times their initial budget in fact. They made over $4billion on this game up until August 2016. Who knows how much they've made just in the time from then to now. T2 Interactive has ruined this game. If you're looking for a sandbox world where you can do what you want this is not the game for you. T2 wants you to not play the story. They want you to jump straight online and buy shark cards. This game USED TO be good.

The ONLY THING WHICH CAN BE USED FOR MODDING IN MULITPLAYER ARE Trainers which give a negative impact to the players in ONLINE. review: Rockstar and Take Two's business practices have been absolutely despicable and have seemed purely in the intent to build revenue. This also ruins the overall experience of the average player making them dread the horrific grind of the GTA Online career and the even more horrific waits for more interesting singleplayer experiences. The player turns to their community to build mods and create experiences to improve the lifespan of these Grand Theft Auto games. I believe that if people are going to expect great experiences from Rockstar or Take Two's games they should brace themselves for an overwhelming amount of both dissapointment and self hatred for purchasing fifteen copies of every game (on every console) and for buying any of the in game credit expansions. One of the worst business practices from a major game creating and licensing companies I have ever seen.

review: The way they do these "updates" make me kind of sad. They are clearly put out to make players want to buy shark cards since spamming heists with randoms really isn't an option. Even if you do manage to spam heists all day you'll have to go a few days of doing it with a consistant group to afford any of the new content making you feel like the only viable option is to buy shark cards. To make it even better the multiplayer for the most part is peer to peer with some server side assistance and a very bad ant cheat allowing anyone to cheat when ever they way basically with little risk to their account. I'm level 128/129 and have enough money to do what i want. This isnt a whine because i can't afford it it's a critisim because the way they've designed the online economy is similar to fremium phone games and I'm really disapointed. However if you just want to play for the single player it's worth the purchase. IF you are buying for the multiplayer.. Don't expect to become a CEO or MC leader anytime soon.

review: I bought this game while it was on sale here on th Steam storefront. I had purchased the original PS3 version way back when this game was brand new. Not exactly day one but it might've been a day or two after it had been oout on the market. I gave my PS3 and the digital copy of the game to a friend a friend who split the bill for buying this game in the first place . I managed to try out the newer generation ports over at another person's house on the Xbox One. I was fairly impressed but $60 for a re release seems a tad bit much. Even for an assumingly huge studio like Rockstar. I told myself if ever I were to get into PC gaming proper I would try this game out with the incentive to replay the campaign story mode at my own pace rather than speeding throught it like I had to around launch. Then once I was finished with the story mode I would install and play mods. Because it's a Grand Theft Auto port for Windows a series reknown for it's modding community on the PC gaming side of the industry. While it's not the sole reason I bought the game for a second time mind you it is a major reason as to why I did in the first place. So I finally own a real gaming PC get the game a few weeks after that and when I beat the game I decided to take a break from it. Having spent a few days on it. Then I found out that the main way of modding the game had been deemed illegal. Which is beyond inept. I don't care for online I don't want to shill out more money to Take Two or even to Rockstar. And I was a huge fan of your games still am. But this is degrading to everybody and I'm honestly upset that I bought this game again. It would've been better off if I had only stuck with the memories of having played it a few years back then try to climb back into a newer package with the possibility to have my experience be even more fun. Giving the game more of a lifespan. I'm actually ashamed to have bought this off of Steam. I now know I should've gotten something else on sale instead. Wasted my cash on something that doesn't want me to play it how I want to. I bought the damned game I should be allowed to play and do whatever with it I want as long as I'm not ruining other people's experiences with it or pirating the game. Which I would not do. I just wanted to play with mods and the companies in charge took away the players' right to do so. I'm glad the community is taking a stand. Hopefully OpenIV will be reinstated and left alone. It doesn't mess with online and from what I'm told your servers are flooded with terrible cheaters anyhow not even related to modding. It's too late for me to get a refund but if I could I would. I'm done writing the points been made so many times by now. I hope this sends a clear message to whoever made the decision up the latter of corporate meatheads. A decent port with a little something extra now stripped of what made it stand out. Unless this is fixed I won't be supporting Rockstar or Take Two any further.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Rockstar you disapoointed me so much. I looked up to your guys company when i first played gta sa as a kid it was a blast! But when I bought Gta 5 on the xbox 360 IT WAS EXCITING! so i bought it on ps4 and it was accuallty worse online because of constant disconnecting but the graphics were better and some more grass yeah!!. then i was gonna buy it on pc cause i thought to myself "OH YA GTA SINGLEPLAYER CAN BE MODDED! I'VE SEEN SO MANY MODS THAT MADE THE GAME EVEN BETTER!'' but when i heard of the news about mods being shutdown i laughed to myself thinking " Rockstar wont do that! the've shoved Shark Cards down our throats but they wont shutdownthe only fun thing left in gta. i didnt think it was a big deal at first. i thought you could mod it still but just differently. review: Single player is good but like most games you will spend most of your time in multiplayer or modding in single player. Take Two pretty much killed the modding part so that leaves multiplayer.Multiplayer is not fun. In general coming across other players just makes you worried about getting griefed. This is heavily amplified when you become a Vip/Ceo/MC President which are the main ways to make money. Doing these typically involves putting your own cash on the line in order to make a potential profit. That's not a problem in itself risk/reward and all but the extent is ludicrous. You can put in many hours of work to make a profit and then lose it all at the end because players are told "Here's 5k if you destroy that guy's cargo truck that he spent 5 hours and a quarter million ingame cash to sell."And that's only how Rockstar intends for it to work. Most of the time lobbies are locked down by one or two players using a Hydra Oppressor or whatever other toy of the day to grief the entire lobby on their own. The only way to counter it is to have your own Hydra/Oppressor/whatever and solely dedicate yourself to trying to keep them down as even if you do manage to destroy them these vehicles have very short cooldowns and they will be able to use them again almost immediately in most cases.Quite simply Online is a griefer's arms race. All the best things are expensive and require hours of grinding or paying into the microtransactions. And if you just want to have fun with friends somebody with more powerful weaponry will make sure you don't. You'll get frustated until you buy a hydra or acquire the new explosive sniper rifle so you can be the top griefer yourself. I've bought a Hydra myself before the gunrunning update and just felt hollow inside realizing that it's just a part of a cycle that makes people want to pay actual money to acquire the tools to ruin other people's times.Only consider this game for the single player. Only consider multiplayer if you can reliably play with enough friends to do heists and have a numbers advantage to dredge through the multiplayer hell.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Dear Steam Users When I first downloaded GTA V I was not able to launch the game. When I tried to launch it my steam said I was playing but only for a few seconds. Then nothing happened. Confused was I so I decided to do some research. There seemed to be a glitch among portable graphics cards that would not allow the game to launch (I use my trusty ASUS G750 notebook with an 860m gpu). I tried multiple times but nothing woud work. After countless attempts I left for class furiously. I ressolved to give the game a nasty review but then it happened. Just as I sat down to write my strongly worded review I tried to start my game up one more time. BEHOLD IT LAUNCHED! From that point forward I have been robbing banks winning races and claiming glorious victory! The gameplay was smooth and very nice. After that first hicup I experienced no other problems with GTA 5. For this reason I recomend this game and I hope you enjoy it just as I have. P.S. I do not have the slightest idea what I did to fix it.... Sorrrrrrrr'. Sincerely King Vulture

review: This game use to be good. The singleplayer is great but if you are buying it for single player I'd suggest getting it from a discount website because it isn't worth 60 for just that IMO. And online? Forget it it's basically pay to play now. Sure you can play for free and all updates are free but don't expect to get anything good unless you grind your off or buy the shark cards. And the icing on the cake? A majority of player will still defend rockstar when you try to call them out on their bull saying if you actually play the game you can get all the stuff. Well it doesn't take a mathematician to figure out that at about 10 minutes and 30 thousand max per mission a 2 million dollar car will take about 5 straight hours to get and that is completely straight no breaks and don't even get me started on the 8 million dollar yacht. So unless you have absolutely no life and want to devote all your gaming to grinding one game don't even bother with online. And don't expect rockstar to change anything when the fanboys are sucking their d i c k s and buying shark cards. I love GTA it's probably my one of my favorite games but rockstar they have turned into a bunch of greedy heads
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Alot of things have changed since i posted this review. At first i did not recommend this game because of the rampant modding and griefing situation when playing GTA Online. But at the moment with the latest patch there are virtually no modders online. Usually by now you would be seeing modders in every session teleporting around and blowing up everyone on the map or spawning UFO's but you simply dont see any of this anymore. The only thing you have to deal with is the people asking for money drops. But besides this the game is fantastic and a great way to have fun with your friends. Theres so much to do and the latest updates have introduced new ways to make money. The cops are still annoying but they can be fun to watch sometimes. The story mode is great and there are many great mods that you can use in single player to enhance the look and feel of the game. GTA Online is a absolute blast when gaming with your friends. Recommended at the moment as of patch 1.34.

The only negative thing I have to say is the controls are a bit wonky and I had to change some of the key bindings to make the gameplay a bit more comfortable.Campaign 10/10Multiplayer 10/10Overall Game 10/10

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Welcome back home GTA you were worth the wait. This is without a shadow of a doubt my absolute favourite GTA surpassing my love of San Andreas.I completed the single player to 100% on the 360 and it simply blew my mind that Rockstar somehow got that version packed on the now 10 year old console. I never got around to trying the online mode.But enough of the old V my jaw has dropped several times on my now second playthrough. This version is visually stunning and I currently aren't running the game on its maximum settings. I have also been playing for the most part in first person view thanks for that addition Rockstar shooting feels so much more comfortable in that perspective and in my opinion makes a much more immersive experience.1080 mostly high settings with a few very highs and I get a fairly solid 45 60 FPS (it could be higher but I currently have a 60hz screen so)Hardware AMD 9370 4.41 Ghz 8GB Ram R9 270X 2GB Win 7 64 bit. HDD is a standard SATA IIUsage is 100% for the most part on both CPU and GPU and when I did a test FRAPs record the FPS dropped about 10 or so.I hope this information provides some assistance to those having difficulty running the game.I have also seen comments about controllers I have my 360 controller plugged in prior to launching and have even plugged it in and out a few times mid game for a reason I am about to explain further. For some reason the aim tries this weird recenter after "inactivity" which isnt a problem for close targets but when sniping and zoomed in it can be a pain.Still haven't touched multiplayer so cannot comment on it yet will update when I have.Good job Rockstar Red Dead Redemption port next please!

review: To be honest I play GTA v a lot and a lot of multiplayer. A lot of reviews are "claiming" that hackers are in every lobby. I have joined a lot of multiplayer lobbies and have only found a hacker once (today ironically). I'm not saying these statements are wrong but are over exaggerated. Any way the single player is GREAT I've played through it on Xbox ps4 PC each time it was different. Also the modding community is great I mostly just around with mods. The graphics are stunning.Overall GTA v is great the single player is hands down 10/10. The modding community makes a already fun game 100x funner. But the online is very repetitive (grind kill steal take this thing to this guy) although the online is updated frequently the updates often (always) add expensive vehicles houses etc. For example the yacht which would cost around (6 10 million) so the online is fun but repetative Single player 10/10Online 8/10Modding 10/10Graphics 9/10BTW I play in Australian servers System specs are on my profile

review: A fantastic game throughout! GTA Online can be hit &amp miss with trolls and modders (I usually go into a friends only server to avoid them) but you get them in every game I guess......The single player game is brilliant the ability to use 3 main characters allows for a lot of variation and thats a big plus for me. The main missions are exciting and really do allow to you to see most if not all of the Island of Los Santos. Often forgotten are the smaller missions these too are great fun nothing like driving round shooting "for sale" signs or attempting to locate some inner peace (the latter usually good to find after gunning down Merryweather morons!)8/10 for me great game!

review: If you only own a keyboard/mouse combo (or plan to only use one) GTA is ready to frustate you.GTA loves to throw you into the deep end without prep time wether it's driving shooting diving or flying.Flying however is the worst with default PC controls being an unworkable nightmare that also happens to be delivered while being shot at.From my current perspective flying in GTA V is about 10 of fun and there is no excuse for it. It isn't just dedicated flying titles that do it better like World of Warplanes but also so called rivals where one presume Rockstar paid at least cursory attention to like the Saints Row entries 3 and 4. They all can boast better control schemes right out of the box and that makes the poor performance of GTA on this front all the sadder.I'm now off to see if that gamepad I bought for emergencies is any better at not hitting the virtual ground but even it is why the hell do I need to install an entirely new input mechanism when there a several AAA title that don't need it ? Steering planes on a PC isn't some new and arcane art.

review: Hey all!First off I want to start by saying that I DO NOT IN ANY SHAPE OR FORM ADVISE YOU GETTING THIS GAMEFirst of all. Crashes. This games has incredibly bad crashing and freezing issues. Like every 10 20 minutes I get the following error message 'GTA V Has stopped working'And yes. I have tried EVERYTHING. I have spent the last 3 days solid trying to make this game work.This is the only issue that I am experiencing however there are countless players experinces issues along the following linesFPS Drops even on good systemsRandom crashing and freezingSocial Club wont start or crashesGame won't even download hwne you click the download buttonThese are some of the most popular bugs that people are postng online and it seems that the PC players that can play without fault are few and far between. Don't get me wrong. With what I have played of this game. It's bloody amazing. I run the game at Very High settings at 60fps and its absoutley stunning. The game is great and the online is full of fun. However due to the nature of the bugs annd how many of them there are I really wouldn't get this game right now. Rockstar has only formally addressed 2 of atleast 10 GAME BREAKING bugs. All current players can do is sit wait and hope it gets fixed. Litteraly.I love GTA. Played every game. But right now If I could get my money back... I wouldDo not buy this game right now. Wait a few months untill all the serious bugs have been fixed
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V is an amazing and beautiful game with my MSI GTX 970. Sometimes it reaches 30fps. in certain areas. There is no reason on why it does do this and is there an explaination on how can change anything to make it play smooth? Even if I don't get constant 120 fps at least 90 115fps would do just fine... Anyone want too help?

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Great game and it's optimized really well. I do miss some features especially the lack of working car mirrors can be annoying as I'm currently doing a first person only run. Another thing that annoys me is that there's no option to disable the camera from automatically centering. This is clearly a leftover from the consoles it's really annoying for those who use a mouse. There's a slider in the menu but it doesn't change anything and the centering can't be disabled. Another annoying aspect is the lag in GTA online (and no it's not my internet) and the insane amount of loading required and the insane loading times. There's no reason at all for rockstar to require us to load lobbies games maps and stuff 10 times before you can do a heist. And then there's the stuttering caused by the custom radio etc. Getting an SSD and tweaking some stuff fixed the stuttering though. What I don't like about this is the fact that we had to wait years to get the game on PC but on the plus side they don't seem to be using the DLC policy almost every other game company uses nowadays so I'm willing to forgive them for that. Don't let these minor complaints give you the wrong impression though. The game plays great it looks great the story is fun the humor is great the freedom is unlimited and I'm really impressed by it all. I currently spent around 40 hours in singleplayer and I'm not even close to discovering all there is to discover in the game. It's one of the best games I've played in the past few years.

review: It's a good game at it's core gameplay is fun and GTA Online has alot of content and is consistently updated. I only have a couple gripes. The first is that while GTA Online progress is saved server side single player is not. It doesn't even have cloud or Steam save options and Online progress saved led me to believe it all transferred. I'd actually move on from this issue as my fault for losing my save but I beat it anyway however you HAVE TO progress passed the prologue to play Online! Super annoying.But the BIGGEST issue and the therefore DEALBREAKER is how GOD AWFUL Rockstar Social Club launcher is! I have played the game once in the last 5 months because the launcher breaks over and over it worked once the other day out of sheer luck and has since failed again. No Rockstar official suggestions and online forum methods have proven futile. You could argue that the game would still be recommendable if the base game was unaffected but NOPE it needs to log in and verify through Social Club even for single player! Absolutely garbage and inexcusable STAY AWAY.

review: The publisher Take Two is issuing cease and desist notices for single player mods. This pisses people off because most modding online is still going on.Another thing is the new update. The player base is honestly really annoying so they mess with what you are trying to do a lot. Originally there was a way to play online solo which was removed.Along with the update is the content. In game to get everything in the free DLC costs 40 million in game. To purchase that money is $100 irl for 8 million in game. This means they think that the content is worth $500 to be accessible to players. You can access it all for free but you would need to grind for over 700 hours.Finally comes the minor things that people have become fed up with. There are glitches and bugs that haven't been fixed for years. Rockstars anti cheat has been wrongly taking in game money from people for no reason they overprice everything to make sure you have to spend to get things and other small things.TLDR Cease and desist to harmless single player modders and genuinely acting like they don't care about the playerbase.

review: Basically buy this game if you wanna spend 60 70 dollars depending on your region and then get nickled and dimed online. This game WAS really good when it came out and then it got worse and worse. R* does nothing to really moderate online and can't seem to patch hacking worth a damn but then proceeds to demolish the modding community associated with this game. Also for a game that's been released 5 times or so between all the consoles and the PC they've really failed to innovate. They add some new stuff to MP every now and again but mostly its not much the last several expansions have all felt like cut and paste copies of eachother with different skins. Also the replayability for the single player sucks. Once you've beat the game once there's no real reason to go back and play it you just accrue a bunch of money that you can't spend on anything new because all the new weapons cars clothes and houses are multiplayer exclusives. Half of my time spent in this game I spent on single player mods like LSPDFR and now I won't be able to use those because Take Two and R* are so greedy that the HUNDREDS OF MILLIONS OF DOLLARS that this game has generated for them ISN'T ENOUGH. So yeah spend your hard earned money elsewhere. This game has been out for years and still commands full price and then there's shark cards to top it off. Half the time the server load times are outrageous the game crashes and freezes for no reason whatsoever and 6/10 sessions get hacked. There have been times when playing this game where I spent the entire time bouncing server to server with friends because either the server didn't work right there were greifers or hackers. NOT WORTH 69.99 CAD.

review: Updated 23 06 17Great addition to the series even though it disappoints on a few fronts.Singleplayer is fun not all characters are equally interesting. Graphically still a sight to behold. Gameplaywise it has the usual GTA quirks with hard to control characters and some wonky animations. Cars handle pretty well and handling most vehicles is easy.Multiplayer gets updated regularly earning loads of money is hard however so be prepared to grind or fork over cash for shark cards.After finally adding heists Rockstar has sadly been silent on more of these involving missions and instead focussed on different aspects of online.Overall the game leaves a good impression which is slightly overshadowed by the cash grabby nature of the multiplayer. Not the best GTA by a mile however.14 06 17Ridiculous new modding guidelines show that Take Two and Rockstar do not care at all for their customers.Both from a legal as well as a technical standpoint this modding ban is just plan idiotic.I'll gladly recommend this game if they fix this ridiculous modding ban. For now however this game seems more and more like a smart cashgrabbing scheme by Take Two while Rockstar are being annoyingly silent on this matter.*Seems Rockstar have now responded they will look into the matter. I'll gladly alter my review if they re enable single player modding while still banning MP mods.*23/06/17https //support.rockstargames.com/hc/en us/articles/115009494848Rockstar have finally come out with a statement on the matter. OpenIV seems to be working again according to reports. I'll update my review as stated.

review: The game has an okay story with decent controlls and options. There is lots of customizability to cars and there are many cars in the game itself. The loading screens take a very long time and most of the game is just driving around in a car and if you so choose kill innocent pedestrians. The online mode has a lot of content but to purchase anything of said content you need to do dozens of heists and petty thefts as most things are locked by RP and cost hundreds of thousands (and in some cases millions) of dollars. The sodas and candy of course cost $1 at the gas station so you can stock up before you rob them for all of your money back. It is very hard to acquire any money and if you want something fast you may as well buy a shark card as the entire money system in the game is designed to make you buy cards however does not make it impossible to play without. As everyone who looks at the reviews of this game is vehemently aware they also started to "crack down" on modders. Some may say "Oh wow they are finally doing something about the hackers!" but they are not. They are cracking down on single player mods of which you can now get banned for.TLDR It is an okay game held down by scummy buisness practice.

review: So far great game! 10/10!At first I wasn't really into the whole 3 character story mode thing but it eventually grew on me and now I really like how the story is unveiled through different perspectives. It can also be a little confusing at first as to how to advance the story since there's sooo much to do in the game. Driving is fun in this game too! Each car handles a little differently and the first person mode makes it feel like another game in and of itself.Online mode is also really fun. It goes without saying but of course heists go much better when you have friends to coordinate with instead of random people doing their own thing. Not anyone's nor the game's fault just something that is what it is ya know de facto and all that jazz. So yeah make your friends buy it too!!

review: POSİTİVE + Fun enjoyable and well written story. A lot of missions to play either with friends or alone. Beautiful graphics. Gorgeous open world. Heists. Good customization for cars. Characters are awesome. Impressive degree of freedom. First person camera.NEGATİVE Not that great MM. Large number of hackers. Character customization could be better. Not enough choices that affect the gameplay further on the story mode.In few words Gta 5 it's an amazing and fun game without doubt it's like a next gen remaster of what we have experienced and played so far. You can spend a large amount of hours playing with friends and you still will find new things to do every day . It begs to be played all over again especially when you have company. It's a must for everyone to try out. Those who didn't play that masterpiece yet they definitely should ! I recommend this game to anyone without remorse .

Now even though I recommand this game there are problems with it one in particular which needs to be fixed asap. Laptops with two graphics cards (Usually an Intel one and a deticated one from AMD or NVIDIA) cannot currently run this game without a whackey workaround which doesn't always work. This needs to be something they fix in a week to two weeks time or else you'll have a massive flood (Which you already have so why would you want more?) of people who complain on steam on their forums and to their costumer support that the game is broken and they want a refund.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: While almost every GTA title since Vice tends to launch with mixed reactions and criticisms I like to think of GTAV as the defiance. I've heard this title derided as a Trucker Simulator as an apologist repetition of GTAIV as a false idol where other franchises have overtaken First Place for themselves... To be honest those are the criticisms of the bitter and inexperienced alike.This is the review of someone who stumbled onto the series in 2002's Vice City and loved San Andreas just as much but felt GTAIV was an ailing entry in the franchise and that Saints Row nailed fun but little else GTAV is wonderful.Like its predecessors V tells an emphatic satire set in San Andreas an iteration of Los Angeles. The three playable characters are wonderfully complimentary to each other. They are the qualities of hubris cynicism and rage each made flesh. Rockstar once again mistakes themselves as being in the movie business and delivers these characters with compelling texture and memorable personalities. If we were to sum up the concept of the game's "Stage Presence" as being comprised of its cast its setting and its plot Rockstar has delivered miles ahead of their competitors.Side games are plentiful (if not a bit sporadic at times we're running the gamut between games of soon to be divorced couple's Tennis to street racing to bank and jewelry heists) though I can't say they're as fulfilling (or plentiful) as they'd been in similar titles like Saints Row the Third. Regrettable people like me who love Barbie Dress Up are going to be a tad disappointed in the wardrobes they're not all perfectly interchangeable and where one character might buy a suit that same outfit would be wrinkled and dirty on another character. Cars are customizable to wicked fun but not as consistently as in Saints Row and at times the game has an inconsistent hold on *keeping* those cars. (They use an archaic impound system which may or may not save your car should you lose it.) New features are pretty sparse which is okay by me. One of them is character swapping which is actually a lot less clumsy than I'd predicted and much more compelling to boot. It's nice having three guys but I do wish they'd have implemented some reasonable things like sharing money between them.An unfortunate visitor from GTAIV the driving scheme. It doesn't seem as bad as it was in IV (a game which made me wonder whether Rockstar employees had only driven on the moon drenched in syrup) but it's not the sterling driving scheme from this franchise's glory years either. On the PC in particular I found that mouse driving can be stupendously bad and I even keep my console controller for PC handy if I need to fly. Flying is awful with the keys/mouse. The trade off is that mouse aiming is wonderful.And while I don't usually like playing games online and especially with strangers I have mixed feelings about GTA Online. For one it's still pretty bugged. Joining differently ranked members can result in some goofy flaws but mostly they come in the "Blank loading screen for 20 minutes" variety. They have improved it since this game's original launch (in 2013 if I recall you could only design a character by chosing its parents all of whom were tragic uggos) but I think we've got a way to go before we're out of the woods. I really need them to release the iFruit app on the PC since none of my devices are compatable with it (?!) and frankly I want games to stop doing companion apps altogether. So here's to hoping for improved online experiences. Ironically connectivity during play is flawless for me so it's probably something in the design that makes it cringe worthy.Oh and you can set an option to deny spam phone calls from your kaazin as well as set limitations. I'd forgotten how awful that was in GTAIV. You could do a lot worse with $60 and if you're like me you've forgotten just how awesome this game had proven itself back in 2013. Oh and by the way it actually is optimized as hell. I thought that was just an empty little ad campaign but thankfully they meant it. Game looks incredible and runs even better.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Back in December I wrote a review praising this game for its timelessness and enjoyability. OpenIV made this game incredibly fun. I can't remember how many hours I spent screwing around in single player with all sorts of mods.But those days are over because Take Two Interactive sent the OpenIV team a Cease and Desist. I will not be playing GTA V anymore and I recommend that no one else does. I don't know why Take Two Interactive insisted on stopping single player modding (I can only assume it's money related) but whatever the reason is I won't be returning to GTA V ever.Take our mods we take your revenue.

review: Well they've ed it. Straight up. They've been ing it for a while with all their shitey microtransactions and "not monetizing the end user enough" (ACTUAL ING THING THEY SAID).They've not asked but taken legal action against almost all mods. No warning just t reasons to make their throbbing money grabbing expand even larger. With reasons given like (paraphrased slightly) "it ruins the online experience". Yes I have to say personally that my online experience (which I have never actually got to work because the whole thing is a piece of has been greatly interrupted by the single player only modding scene. Specifically the modding backbone 'OpenIV'. This SINGLE ING PLAYER ONLY mod has really ruined the enjoyment I've had from the multiplayer I don't care about and the single player? Man I can't tell you how many hours have been infected with that horrid mod... I'd probably estimate 100 hours out of my 100.2 hours on record have been purely spoiled by this mod. I mean I've completed the first story mission and left the game to let the modding scene evolve for a few weeks before actually putting any sort of time and energy into playing this game. It's not as if I played 100 hours of modded GTA for no reason no I was obviously just intent with ruining the game for myself. That must be it.Don't get me wrong the game is fantastic but I never bought this on Xbox (I had one at the time of release) or PlayStation. I actually waited TWO ING YEARS for this to come out on PC. Not because I didn't want to play with friends but because I wanted the game to be how it was meant to be. You program a game's code on a ing computer then port it to console because I got the game how it was meant to be played. Beautiful graphics 60fps 4k run on a 1080p screen. Hell I even tried it across 3 monitors (but because it's an unoptimised piece of I couldn't get above 15fps). But I had the game and the game was perfect. It didn't force you to buy shitey digital only products. It didn't have any restrictions on what you could and couldn't do by yourself. It was good.So in summary I hope the developers of OpenIV go on their own way go somewhere really remote and keep updating this or better yet target the core code of the game. If malicious intent was what they wanted to do they would have done it. If they wanted to destroy multiplayer they wouldn't have to because it's already ED. Get a grip Rockstar. You made this game stop hiding behind Take Two and actually grow a pair. Properly ashamed to even consider you guys a Scottish company. Get yer ing skirt in the bin and put on yer kilt. Yer no gonna do anything with yer baws held in a vice. Take Two can have their shitey reign over the lesser consoles. But PC's will last longer than any of that and if you think about it logically they're your most dedicated players. They'll be with you long after you're dead and rotting in a pit somewhere. Give respect to those who respect you. Console players don't have any respect for anything or anyone. PC gamers understand how difficult it is to do something on this platform but we also understand how easy some thing should be such as growing a pair.

review: I originally posted this review negatively to participate in the protest against Take Two's actions against the single player modding community for GTAV. I'm happy to say it seems rockstar has stepped in and gotten Take Two to rescind their Cease and Desist against OpenIV and that they're currently in talks with OpenIV to help prevent it from being used to cheat in GTA Online. This is a great development and it proves that customers can affect change in the immovable AAA industry if they can raise large enough of a stink. I'm changbing my review to positive to reflect the positive change in Take Two's attitude.

review: You've heard so much good things about GTA!You decide to finally get it!It's 18+ though!Oh well who cares about breaking the law!Because you break it ingame anyway!You buy it!You begin to install it! It's 60 gigabytes!You're crying!You play offline games for the next few days!It's finally installed!Start it up!You're robbing a bank!You don't remember how you got here!You're enjoying the game so far!You loot the bank!Now you're running from the cops!Your crew is ambushed!They're all shot!The cops arrive!You run!A few years later!You're just off a plane and talking to Bob Ross!Now you're a black dude!Now you're stealing a nice car!Now you're racing through the city!Now you're talking to a short Russian!That Russian is a car sales dealer!Now you're.... Oh wait you can play Online now!PLAY ONLINE!You start up in the character creator!You either try to make yourself!Or make some sexy dame!Start the game!It's freakin awesome!You do a bit of stealing and killing!You're finally level 20 and you have 500k!You buy a nice car!You drive it around town!You feel like a boss!Someone approaches you!He throws something at you!You've realised it's bombs!You have a miniature heart attack!Your car explodes!You're scared angry and vengeful!You respawn!You get a phone call about insurance!You're happy!But still slightly angry!You call insurance for a new car!You enter your car and seek out the person that killed you!You give up after 5 minutes!You rage type in the chat!You get replies in Russian!You swear you were put into a local server! You start your first job!It's great fun!You hear about heists!You gather a bunch of friends and allies!You start the heist set up!You fail it multiple times because of your one friend the troll!You kick him!You fail the heist set up due to lack of players!You curse!You invite randoms to the lobby!You try again!You succeed!You finish the other heist set ups!You're on the heist finale!You're ready!So ready!You charge in there!Your getaway driver dies!You fail!You Alt F4! You come back after a while playing other games!You play more Online!You reach level 50!You start hunting Bounties and Insane people!Your car gets blown up hunting!You steal a civie car!You get a text from someone!It's saying you stole their car!You've got a 9000k bounty!But you only stole a 5k car!You drive away!Suddenly someone appears in your side seat!You pause for a moment!YOUR CAR EXPLODES! YOUR HANDS EXPLODE!YOUR FACE EXPLODES!YOUR COMPUTER SCREEN EXPLODES!YOUR WHOLE DESK EXPLODES!YOUR BRAIN EXPLODES!Just kidding.The person is gone now!So you continue driving!BUT YOUR CAR SUDDENLY EXPLODES ANYWAY!You realise it's a hacker!You go spastic!You rage type!You say they should leave their dad's credit card alone and that they should go back to CoD!Which is true because there's a lot of minors on GTA V anyway!You massage your eyes!You decide to join low population servers from now on!You do a bunch of events and more jobs!You're level 75!You get your first heli and plane!You find someone with a level over 2000!You think that's impossible!It is!You accuse him of hacks!He makes you explode!You start calling him a 12ie!He starts making you explode every time you spawn!You type "Umadbro?"There's a large pause!Everyone left!You are gob smacked!You swear your modem was top of the line!You search for a new session! You see a yacht!You realise you can buy one!You try to save up for one!A friend owns one already and invites you into his!You don't want a yacht anymore!It's not as good as it sounded at first!You continue grinding heists and jobs!You're level 100 finally!You stroke your beard that you grew during your play time!Your life is complete!You don't know what to do!You shave your beard!You create a new character!You try to make the Joker!You got it pretty close!You go around being a maniac!You see someone who looks kind of like batman!You shout "What's the matter Bats? Don't like me?"Batman responds!"It's punks like you that deserve to be locked up."You laugh!Suddenly The Batman comes running at you!You loaf in your pants!You run like hell!Batman kicks you in the back!You fall over!Now he's kicking you on the ground!You die!Now your game crashes!It won't launch up anymore!You're stressing out!You try fixing it!You give up!You can't be bothered reinstalling it!The end!

review: Rockstar doesn't care about your consumer rights or the longevity of their game as made evident by their supression of single player mods. They also clearly don't care about anything but profit regarding their online service and the rampant use of multiplayer mods and hacks. Instead of targeting the actual problem and making their online service palatable they decided to try and reduce mod use to encourage buying their DLC and paid currency for GTA Online.
