review: First they let hackers ruin aspects of online play and now punish those who genuinely work hard to earn loads of cash by resetting everyone's wallet totals every now and then even though it could've been easily prevented. That in my eyes wasn't such a big deal as you can put money into cars boats weapons etc and resell them later for about 30% less but I think it's worth mentioning. I still despise the decision though as it is a major annoyance and the system doesn't even work as it revolves around just screwing over everyone who works hard aside from the hackers.Now the OpenIV group (basically responsible for nearly all SINGLEPLAYER mods associated with GTA V has been legally neutered and destroyed by Take 2.I gave this company $20 of my hard earned money (bought it on a sale).They responded by royally f***ing every online player solo player AND modder involved in this game.F*** this.Don't support a company who judging by their actions sees their player base as a pile of cash waiting to be drained.EDIT AS OF 7/6/2017 Rockstar has taken to conversing with the OpenIV team and has released a public statement indicating their support for singleplayer mods as well as reiterating their stance towards multiplayer modding (which is generally considered a bannable offense). I support Rockstar in making this respectable move but I still uphold my negative review due to the fact that the only reason Take Two responded the way they did was because they shot themselves in the foot in a way. Their CEO has not changed his position and the company has not changed their direction so this negative review still stands. Fantastic game great developers sh*tty head company.

review: Amazing Game yes. BUT... If you have it already there is no point in the PC Version. You can no longer mod to the extent that was once possible because take two have banned the famous and widely used modding tool called "Open IV". Open IV was a modding tool originally made for modifying GTA IV's game files to replace or add modifications. Since it's move to GTA V it has been the base for almost all mods Take Two and sent a "Cease and Desist" letter to the Open IV team and there's no other widely known alternative. Unless Open IV makes a return I would not recommend buying this game anymore.

review: While this game is controversial for many reasons it remains to this day as one of my favorite games. This is mostly due to the developers having so much detail in this game. If you look behind you in a car your characterlooks at the mirror. Flip flops flip and and flop. Speaking using the mic online makes your character move his mouth. Its the little things that make this game stand out. They also have a very intresting story. You understand where everyone is coming from. Franklin wants to grow up and make more money. Micheal just wants to have a nice retirement. Trevor is just crazy. You like everyone (except micheal because he lied to trevor and is an to his family) Its really great stuff The music and graphics are on point. The graphics are just fantastic. This game looks incredible even better then the consoles because you can run this game at a higher frame rate. It is very demanding but you can still play it on a low end card. This game also has so much veriaty in music its stupid. You got your rock your pop rap electronic latino you got everything except jazz classical ect. Gta 6 must include jazz or classical or else im downvoting it. Also the Driving in this game is very good almost to the point where you can call it a racer. Its a really good alternative to those racing games where it costs 60$ and all you do is race and nothing else. Terrible value. Online is so dence with activities that it almost feels like another game. Playing it for long enoght and recieving money in the millions you start feeling like a badass that wont take crap from others. You got your tank attack heli personal company minigun and just everything to make you feel like you own everything. Of course theres hackers but those are rare and that is why the exit botton was invented right? Tl DR Gta 5 is everything you can ask for. Its a racing game exploration game shooting game story driven game a yoga game. It has so much to say about our world today its almost a parody. and it is one of my favorite games.10/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Here at Rockstar you're only allowed to do something if you pay us for it.With the attack on OpenIV TakeTwo essential killed single player modding for this game claiming that it opened the door for people to cheat online. Practices like this should not be tolerated and the backlash that TakeTwo is getting from this is very well deserved.As for my honest thoughts of the game I was able to get 200+ hours out of this game. The single player campaign is worth a playthrough but I've never been able to bring myself to do it again like with GTA San Andreas or GTA IV. GTA Online is an absolute trainwreck and TakeTwo's cash cow. You'll grind for hours sometimes days or weeks on end to get a new car or a bigger house. Shark Cards are a way that you can pay real world more for in my honest opinion disgustingly low amounts of in game currency for what you pay and how expensive everything is in the online mode. Hackers are everywhere and innocent people are consistently banned with no option for appeal while the real hackers run free.Story mode is 7/10 Decently fun and has a pretty good story.Online is a 2/10 You may find it fun for a bit but it quickly fades and it becomes a chore to do anything.EDIT Looks like TakeTwo has listened to the people are reversed their cease and desist of OpenIV. While this is definitely a step in the right direction the actions of TakeTwo should not be forgotten and they should be kept under a watchful eye.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: openiv is finally useable thanks to rockstar.Edit Now its time for all of us that have been falsely banned to get actual customer support. Mods are just a part of what we needed to fix. Remember FiveM the multiplayer mod. Well everyone who used FiveM has their Social Club account banned and you can't even play the story mode of the game because Social Club is the DRM. And many was falsely banned from the multiplayer and everyone can't do nothing about it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The following review has been edited to appropriately accomodate for the now resolved issue of mods being banned in GTAV and has been cautiously marked as positive. I hope this will shed light on recent events. // In June 14th of 2017 Take Two Interactive had issued a Cease &amp Desist order towards OpenIV a singleplayer only modding tool that allowed mods on games that used the RAGE Engine (e.g. GTAIV Max Payne 3 GTAV et al.) under the guise that it and I quote "enables recent malicious mods that allow harassment of players and interfere with the GTA Online experience for everybody." Roughly a week or so later Rockstar Games claimed to have been "working to figure out how (they) can continue to support the creative community without negatively impacting (their) players" and it was rumored that they were indeed in pseudo negotiations with OpenIV's creator Good NTS in order to achieve a perfect balance that benefitted both parties to a degree.On July 5th of 2017 Good NTS issued an official statement of his own to claim the return of OpenIV albeit with some caveats Map conversions from other games may not be allowed as modifications to Grand Theft Auto V meaning Liberty City V had to have been dropped. Just as well OpenIV will along with its original 'conditions' also abide by the recently created Rockstar Modding Policy (seen here https //support.rockstargames.com/hc/en us/articles/115009494848 ).Although ultimately GTAV will see a resurgence in SP Modding once more and its shelf life will be expanded again due to this there are things I would like to mention that are not directly related to this issue. Mods have been on companies' eyesights once more with this event Bethesda's 'Creation Club' and their... mess back in 2015 it seems as though companies will attempt to find a way to monetize something that had been existing since the dawn of PC gaming. And that is what concerns me the most...As for the game itself? If you've been a part of this debacle it's likely you purchased the PC version for modding as I have. Which means that you may have previously played it on a console and enjoyed it thoroughly! For those who haven't? It is a fine game with a good engaging story multiple playable protagonists on the same game/story (a series first). The horror stories of GTA Online (which still happened even in the OpenIV drought) had always cemented my PC purchase to be offline only. Should you venture yourself be prepared to find hackers with money drops and a skewed Real Money/GTAO Money economy with scales tipped heavily against the end user who needs to invest in Shark Cards massively before being allowed to enjoy one or two items from the Freemium DLC let alone all of them. If you really want to I'm sure there are alternatives for online. FiveM is one of these alternatives using a more 'traditional' online system. // The original review is placed here for posteriority and archival purposes // Take Two issued a Cease &amp Desist towards OpenIV the modding tool for singleplayer and singleplayer alone under the guise that it and I quote "enables recent malicious mods that allow harassment of players and interfere with the GTA Online experience for everybody." Furthermore they're claiming that they are "working to figure out how (they) can continue to support the creative community without negatively impacting (their) players."tl dr a BS excuse with no good reason just so Take Two can attempt to push forward paid mods for GTAV or any new release titles. First Bethesda's Creation Club and now this? Bit too big of a coincidence.From this day forward my money will not go towards any Take Two or Rockstar release until this is PROPERLY fixed.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Where to begin...This review will mainly focus on the online portion of this game. If your intent is to play offline disregard everything I'm about to say. In my opinion there is not a single enjoyable aspect of this game that cannot be experienced in the single player game mode.I hesitate to call GTA V Online a pay to win game. Although you may certainly pay your way into more online cash to spend there is no winning to be had. It is not possible to win at a rigged game. Rigged how? Why by all of the hackers of course! One game you may be killed dozens of times by an explosion under your feet which acts as a ranged spawn camping device. Another you may open your inventory to find millions of dollars not earned but given to you by your modding benefactor. The online portion of this game is simply a cesspool of hackers modders and cheats. The very first online job I queued up for was one of the Dawn Raid missions. These are basically team oriented shootouts with an objective to find a transmitter and get to the extraction point while holding it. The first round was quite enjoyable there were multiple back and forths between the two teams but we were narrowly defeated in a multiway shootout inside the extraction zone. At the start of the next round all of our parachutes were locked up in mid flight and we plummeted to our deaths. Upon respawning inside of the plane we were all greeted with our old firend Spawn Camping Explosion. While the hacker ran the transmitter both teams ended up dying on repeat for the next 4 minutes or so. I ended up being 0 13 by the end of the round while everyone else from my team had left around death 5 or 6(which is penalized btw).From my experience with the game I would say you have about a 50% chance of encountering a hacker each time you enter an online server. I experienced less of this in missions but would still give it a 10 20% chance. If you don't mind waiting at the ridiculously long loading screens to switch servers and don't mind leaving missions when a hacker is present maybe this won't bother you as much.

review: So all in all GTA is a great game not amazing in any way but an improvement to the last gta game. I personally prefer saints row when it comes to the story as it tends to be a lot more humorous and entertaining. That being said GTA's story is decent not amazing in any way and you can pretty much tell where it's going at any given time it does however manage to keep your attention for moderately long periods of time and has some moments squeezed in with a bit of sarcasm and humor. Gameplay wise it's pretty good none of the features are as fleshed out as they could be and especially not vehicle handling and physics. (then again saints row is absolutely terrible when it comes to vehicle physics) The game in itself is fun but graphics are already getting a little dated with very obvious repetitive textures and foliage that was designed for consoles. So for the singleplayer bit it really isn't worth the price tag.The multiplayer bit it's pretty much like APB with a different system for unlocking weapons and vehicle mods. It quickly gets repetitive when playing by yourself however having a few friends along makes all the difference in the world and opens up a whole new layer of shenanigans. (This could similarly be said for APB but GTA is a lot more optimized and offers a wider range of activities to take part in) The customization is a little lacking humorous in character creation though. That being said there is a distinct lack of clothing options/hairstyles to make your character look truly unique. This is very apparent when looking at the female player models (Although there is a very large amount of makeup so kudos on that one) where most players with a female character tend to look very similar when it comes to hairstyles and clothing. There are also quite a bit of apparent bugs as you play through it some even game breaking (Looking at you Tennis minigame) Although I have mostly played the multiplayer by myself due to the fact that a lot of the random encounters of players seem to be 14 year old asshats. There are some who aren't but what do you really expect when playing a GTA game? Singleplayer 7/10Multiplayer 6/10Yes I rate games VERY harshly. The score for the multiplayer might go up with a bit more social interaction and shenanigans.

review: It's friggen GTA 5!I've enjoyed all the 3D GTAs each one taking broader steps towards a fully realized city. It's been pretty cool to see the games progress they almost seem to benchmark large strides in technology. This latest installment has been no let down with the new story mechanics and expanded activities throughout the city the single player game is an instant classic.I can't say that I like every aspect of the multiplayer some parts were definitely fun plus it's multiplayer GTA! What's not to love?Well it seemed a bit overdone at times.. Social Club was never my favorite thing who likes more passwords? Online seems like less of an option and more of an intrusion. Especially when a loading screen takes so long to get through if you mistakenly switched to online mode get ready to wait... It's still enjoyable and programming is never easy so all in all I should just be happy that it works. It does seem a bit overdone though.Did I mention it looks gorgeous... That's running on nearly the lowest graphics settings on my laptop make sure your drivers are up to date by the way...If you've got a good rig for it it's absolutely stunning. Strongly recommended even if the multplayer feels like a bit of a dressed up after thought.

review: Let me apologize up front. This will be a tldr for most of you but I need to say it.GTA V is a good game made by a very talented developer. Moreover it's an exceptional PC port. It scales well with a wide variety of hardware and both of the major graphics vendors are equally catered to. I've stated in other forums that GTA V is the bar by which all PC ports should be measured.....but! While I understand and appreciate the distinction between developer and publisher they are representative of one another and there is such a thing as guilt by association. That's why parents always warn their kids to be careful of the company that they keep. So I'm sorry Rockstar but you're getting thrown into this too because frankly your silence on the matter is just a damning as Take Two's actions.Through the years my general impression of Rockstar and Take Two's attitude towards gamers and the PC gaming community in particular is apathetic at best and in some cases downright hostile. Be it their abysmal customer service banning of players through no fault of their own or their general inability or more accurately unwillingness to release timely PC ports (I know I know your meager 1.78 billion in net revenue in the previous fiscal year just isn't enough to afford the extra talent it would take to get it done) Suffice to say their reputation as a customer oriented company isn't the best in the business. The recent actions against OpenIV is merely the proverbial straw on the camel's back for this particular consumer.As a long time fan of your games I've personally purchased numerous copies of many of your games across a variety of platforms. GTA IV Xbox 360 PS3 and PC. GTA V PS3 Xbox One PS4 and PC. I've also spent over $200 on in game currency for the PS4 version. So you can call me a lot of things but you can't call me cheap.I've actively advocated against used games sales for many years now. I personally believe that if a developer makes a quality product then they should be rewarded for doing so. In my opinion used games sales work against that notion so I have to the best of my ability avoided them. (I currently own 3 to be exact and I only own those because at the time of purchase new retail copies were no longer commercially available.) So though it pains me to say it I will to the greatest of my ability work tirelessly to see to it that you never...NEVER receive any monetary compensation via new game purchases or in game content from me going forward. When RDR 2 launches I will buy it and I will play it but you can rest assured that even if I have to pay $70 six months after launch just to get a used copy I will do so gladly before I support a company who treats the communities that support them with such blatant disregard.Sincerely Disenchanted Customer

review: It's an awesome game but there are four main points that make it absolutely in my opinion.Firstly the way so called "hackers" are dealt with. They can force other people in the lobby to accept money. But receiving it (even without consent!) can get your account banned. This is just a policy.The second item is modding. I completely understand that you don't want people modding and cheating in multi player. But how in the name of everything that's holy does that relate to stuff you do on single player?Furthermore those load times. How do you even manage to get something to load multi player this slow? The last item in this rant is about the Shark Cards. Just a dirty cash grab that doesn't need a lot explaining.

review: This game seems pretty lackluster and I can't recommend it for full price. Maybe at $20 but that's still pushing it.Pros + fairly well built world+ good number of little details for world building+ large open world+ decent story and charactersNeutral little detail in the world most weapons feel extremely similar most vehicles feel very similar physics aren't very goodNegative progression is slow very little depth to characters or world (similar reactions from everyone AI is pretty bad) the grind is fairly bad loading times are absolutely horrible even loading from an SSD ONLINEThe online portion of the game (which is being pushed heavily right now) is horrible. There are long loading screens everywhere trolls who want to do nothing but kill you repeatedly are the main players in lobbies and hackers are rampant. All of the interesting things they've added in the online mode aren't made available in singleplayer either. The final nail in the coffin for online is that the grind is insane. For example to gain access to CEO jobs you need about 3 million dollars. To get that much you can do heists or jobs which net you very little money and often rely on the good nature of other players for you to succeed. It's a simple case where those who've played more and have better equipment can just stop you from progressing at any sort of meaningful pace. Of course you can just pay huge amounts in the form of microtransactions in order to skip some of the grind.Something that I bought this game for which I had hoped would massively improve the quality of the game was modding. However with Take Two's current stance on any sort of modding this isn't likely at all. If you want a fun open world game I'd recommend any of the Saints Row series or even Watch_Dogs instead. This falls far short of what I'd consider a well made game.

review: Being a loyal fan of the series and R* I feel disappointed in what has been happening to this game recently. After getting millions and millions of whatever currency you feel like using in ROI you might think that R* after all these years of selling the game and other relevant items (sharkcards) might actually stop the blatant money grab politics and think about what the players want. That's where you're wrong.They haven't for a minute stopped thinking about that and now completely gave in to this ridiculous system of dripfeeding content and manipulating game files (changing the downforce figures in certain cars) in order for the players to catch the bait and spend some real life currency on this game. DLC after DLC the prices for new stuff seem to rocket up to the Moon and beyond while the payout people get are not proportionally matched at all.In the recent example (Smuggler's Run DLC) you essentially will have content worth of $60 000 000 (!!!!!!!) whilst the payout you get for completing tedious deliveries stays at the level of what was relevant 3 years ago ($10 000 per mission)!!! If you politicize the situation you will have a clear example of "oppressive" dripfeeding. And I will not even say anything about the lack any sort of content for the single mode.The content that gets released gets more ridiculous time after time soon enough and we will be riding pink unicorns that drop a barrage of homing explosive sh*tbombs on people!!! It's like I'm playing Saints Row V and that isn't even a game yet!!!!Anyway hopefully Rockstar starts listening to its fanbase because as of now it seems they really don't give a damn about what we think. Not a single sh*t.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game itself is a beautifull work of art. Optimized to the assembly level to give even old/potato PCs a chance to run this baby at FPS and graphical levels above console peasants (sorry had to take a jab there XD). The story is incredible the world is absolutely stunning the characters are (mostly) deep and make sense and there are countless refrences to pop culture and 4th wall braking gallore (if you pay attention).The online part isn't that great there really isn't much to do besides f**k around with your buddies and do repetitive missions and races untill you get so bored that you start finding races with loop de loops and that other BS fun. The only redeeming aspect of Online are the heists those are quite fun but again there are only a handfull (5 or 6 I believe?).But it cannot go without mentioning that Take2 (and Rockstar to a smaller extent) is milking the Online cow waaaaaaaaaay too far. The Shark cards and the micro transactions are plain cash grabs and just add inflation to the game which in part makes making money a grind if you don't want to spead REAL money. Ugh _ 'Of course I get that this was the most expensive game ever to develop and they are a business so they have to make ends meet but after almost 4 years on the market still being sold for only 17% less than original price (without sales of course) you'd think that they might not need to resort to greedy (and unnecesary) cash grabs to fill their $$$ quotas. There is just no excuse for such greediness.Oh and let's not forget about the massive neon pink elephant in the room the Cease and Desist given by Take2 o OpenIV. It's another case of a big company waving their mone d**k around intimidating the little guys and ultimately affecting the end user. Even though they apologized it's just more evidence that they don't care about the user and only see them as a $ with legs. Scummy.

There has not been a single SP dlc release (Which I would have even paid for so it's not like I expected a free expansion).I can't recommend for the sole fact that I feel if I did Rockstar would take that as confirmation that GTA V Online is a success. It's not at least for me. And honestly with every site that I've seen GTA online has received a lot of flak for nonstop hackers. the fact that if you want to have anything decent you are essentially forced to buy a shark card or spend ridiculous amounts of hours to buy a single car which isn't for me.

review: This is kind of a mixed bag for me. So lets cover the reason why I gave this a thumbs down. The Good Amazing Single Player Looks AmazingAlright Multiplayer The Bad Multiplayer Unlike past GTA games. This one has a big focus for multiplayer. It has good core gameplay and is enjoyable with friends but there are a number of issues with it. Everything costs a fortune! You will spend hours upon hours of grinding your off just to get enough money to buy a plane. If you up and buy the wrong thing there is no way to refund that cash. In a DLC they gave us Yachts as an option for a mobile off land home. Only problem with yachts is they cost minimum 6 Million Dollars for just a basic one and up to around 11 Million for the best option. To get the basic yacht without using shark cards it took longer than 3 days of me playing just to get one. If you want to use shark cards to get a yacht the 8 Million Dollar (Highest Amount you can Buy) is 100 ing Dollars. To top it all off. The game is poorly balanced all around if you just want to play by yourself the lobbies take far too long to load if you want to organize a heist or a mission it takes forever and if someone leaves while your in a heist the game will fail. If you don't have any friends to play with this complete part of the game is Modding Most players who bought the PC version of GTA V already owned the game on console. Why? Because modding. Modding is a huge thing it allows players to make the game whatever they want to make of it and improve the experience. Rock Star and Take Two have deemed modding illegal for this game as of recently and now a lot of people feel screwed over. Yes people were using the modding in Online mode. But perhaps instead of doing this. include a method where if the game detects any sort of invalid file in the game when going online. Just make it crash. Some mods even had this feature. Optimization I did say this was fine. But my friend who bought this game had more than the required specs but the game continued to crash for him. I've also had a lot of weird lag and my pc will gain more than +20 Deg C. When playing. It is optimized pretty alright but it could be better. Weird Bugs that come and go from time to time Rockstar somtimes s up the patches causing a lot of problems. For instance for at least 3 months Rockstar made it impossible to fly using the mouse forcing players to use a controller or god forbid the numpad. Demo Lots of games have been dropping demos. While this a mostly minor nitpick. For a game like GTA V that has a lot requirements. It would be great to see if my game could actually run the game before getting it. Single Player DLC While other games in the GTA series had a long and amazing story. This one was kind of short. Rockstar employees even said that there would be a Single Player DLC years ago. But it has gone forgotten. I myself am mostly a singleplayer gamer so this is sad to see. END Overall Rockstar needs to fix a lot about this game before I can rate it positive. Some of these things include Lowering the in game prices or the cost to buy Shark Cards Improve Lobbies Improve Heist Games possibly have it so that if someone leaves a bot is placed there instead. Wouldn't it be great to have Micheal Trevor or Franklin join you on your heists if you can't find any players or if someone leaves? Instead of holding your game hostage while you wait? Give back Modding. If your scared of modding add in more methods to prevent modding online. Optimize the game better or give us different specs. Give us a Demo to see if we can actually run the game. Give us more options for single players. Possibly add in the online contact for singleplayer.Overall It's a really good single player game. But the Online mode (Which is the main focus) Needs a lot of work to even be playable.

review: The long wait has been worth it. If you re a PC gamer who s spent the last eighteen months envying the console crowd while they all got stuck into the latest greatest GTA then rest assured that you can now play the definitive version. Sure the Xbox One and PS4 versions were amazing delivering GTA 5 at higher resolutions with more detailed textures smoother surfaces better lighting and cool depth of field effects but the PC version offers even more enhancements plus a couple of additional features that play to the PC s strengths. In doing so it adds a few more metres to one of gaming s towering achievements. It it worth it to play no doubt. Why not try it?Update you "Take Two Interactive" for shutting down OpenIV.

We don't believe you. So as much as I loved the GTA series I'm not going to bother in the future. I'll just wait and buy it second hand.

review: Take Two the publisher of the game has engaged in legal action against OpenVI. They are actively attacking mods and no one knows exactly why. These are not hackers or cheaters just people modding their single player game for enjoyment. The modding community is one of the oldest and most important communities in gaming. I personally do not take kindly to a publisher attacking it. OLD It appears Rockstar talked with take two and single player modding is back. Good on Rockster changing my previous negative review to positive. The game itself is incredibly fun in single player. However the multiplayer is all Rockstar cares about now and Shark Cards (real life $ for in game $) are ll that matters. However free updates make me a little happier about it. The racing is incredibly fun and the business ventures are good time wasters. Since my review was originally only created to criticize the anti modding move by take two I won't be going too much further into the review.

review: First of all Personally I think this game does not live up to its predesessors...The RDR and GTA IV engines where one of the best engines introduced to any game of that generation...Now on gta v we get stunning graphic materials but game AI (Drivers get out of their way to stop you and they always pretend they dont see you and YES IT IS ANNOYING AF...Cmon its just a game rockstar...) game engine especially on vehicles...now obviously we got introduced to planes and stuff but other than that the vehicles are the same exact like the other gta games and then some but that doesnt take away the fact that we got a game in 2013 with a game engine of a game along the lines of GTA SA and GTA Vice City with just upgraded graphics and AI...Thats what it feels like to me Im sorry but crashing a car feels a ing lame cheap joke...Also GTA Online is the reason this game is mainly IDC whatever the ing other ppl think about it..its it is a grind and a half and it does not reward you as it should...This is also the main reason the game engine is so crappy because they cant design physics for every car that comes out ever 1 or 2 months (they usually come in groups) No the dedication and realism of rockstar is slowly fading..This game is a bloody joke having more than 50 online updates and zero to absolute non for the offline more like sit down relax players...This Is a dissapointment and it sucks to say as a rockstar fan from 5 years old (I am now 16) this is the first time im mocking any of their games...They implemented online features into their game and have taken away singeplayer aspects like Whole ing storyline long DLCs (Ballad of Gay Tony Lost and damned Liberty cities Stories Vice city Stories just to name few) This has and will negatively impact their future releases seeing as they will have GTA Online aspects and most importantly now with modding being absolutely removed from Take Two Interactive their games will not sell as well on some consoles In my opinion...There are so many games that allow singeplayer modding that do not effect their counterpart multiplayer experience and in 2017 the Game Developer of the most selling game franchise of all time can not take care of their own (Way of making money and only money) GTA Online

review: Recently Rockstar decided to remove vast amounts of money from people's accounts because they felt that these people had 'too much money to not be hacked in'. Of course a huge amount of these people had gotten their money legit or even from Shark Cards (Rockstar's microtransactions for in game money). I had around $300 million removed from my account and I am far from innocent. I hacked in almost all of my money because if I'm being totally honest the game is more fun that way. It is designed to be a grind so you buy shark cards and that system is inherently limiting in a game that has historically been about having no limits. I still have well over $100 million and that is enough to buy anything I want in game whenever I want for months to years depending on how often I play. So I'm exactly the kind of person that Rockstar was trying to punish with this 'money wipe' yet I've not been punished because of the complete lack of effort required to get that money in the first place. But they have successfully punished potentially thousands of players that are completely innocent. If that injustice isn't worthy of a negative review then I don't know what is.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

I would love to pay 20 for new heists to come into this game and extend on the pve aspect.as for the story mode there is not much more to say it's amazing in every way played the story for about 5 times now and i will probably play it some more.pros about this game free content to online mode great pve in online (need more thou) big clothing variety in both the story and the online mode lots of cars to chose from with a big variety of customization lots of guns and customization custom weapon loadout in online mode (if you have a gun safe in ceo office or biker club) lots of activities to do around the city (no bowling thou) amazing story good graphics PERFORMANCE is top notch great driving and gunplay intresting npcscons about this game no animals in the online mode? very expensive content that are being added not much for the poor. hydra tanks and littlebirds that you can buy in online... should not even be there they should be in the military base ADVERSARY MODE CHEATERS and lots of them

review: At the moment I'm conflicted on the game.Grand Theft Auto V is in my opinion a huge step up from IV at least up until about the time Import/Export came out. The story was fun to say the least and kept me active for a while when it comes to single players it was fairly long compared to a lot of others and also depending on how you played it. One thing I didn't like about it was that the actual story only was about 70% of the whole single player I really wish they would have added more story missions and less "Strangers and Freaks" missions because those feel like more of a chore than fun.To put it simply GTA Online WAS half decent at one time but the Shark Cards are what's killing it. The best you can hope for out of the best paying heist on the hardest difficulty is maybe $200k which sounds like a lot but the cheapest apartment you can host a heist from is just over $200k lowriders can easily stack up to over a million (the "upgrade" to being able to modify it to be a lowrider is about $325k alone much less the other upgrades) medium high end super cars cost from about $2m and all the vehicles buildings et cetera from Import/Export alone at their higher end rack up to about $33m.That means if you do a good heist and get $200k you have to do that heist 165 times which would take about 247 330 hours if you're lucky. That's ing ridiculous.Alternatively you could take the easy route and chimp out for shark cards but you get no experience doing so and basically you're just going to do it again when the next DLC that comes out needs $33m to own all the good Now you don't need to own anything in fact the only person I know who is a multi millionaire in the game and has done it all without shark cards and without exploits has done so by never owning a vehicle and just stealing them never owning apartments and just joining heists and jobs as crew never owning a business and just working for some (which will be covered below) and basically pooling all his money just to have it and he's been doing this since it first came out on PS3. He has $30m. That is ing ridiculous for a game where you're supposed to be doing this high level crime like robbing banks and breaking people out of prison it takes nearly four years of owning NOTHING and playing the game to earn $30m that is ridiculous. (Now he doesn't play like dedicated he plays other games and I certainly wouldn't say he plays GTA the most but with that money you could only buy and fully upgrade a handful of vehicles much less the higher end things like yachts).You could also be an employee for a "company" where you will get pay for the in game economy. It's not worth doing and doesn't always end up with getting money at all. I was helping clear a garage of cars for a friend we lost everything because some in an Mi 24 blew us up for absolutely no reason whatsoever.Players have no true incentive to leaving other players alone. I can't simply drive down the street without getting shot at and you might say "enable passive mode" but ing listen to yourself. This is GTA there shouldn't even be a ing pasive mode not to mention passive mode cucks you big time. The money incentive to being decent to other players and not killing on sight isn't worth it you could make more killing players in the same amount of time. The whole "you have to pay for destroying someone's personal vehicle" thing is also not much of a drawback as if you run out of money you just don't have to ing pay it. If I have $50 dollars in the game I can go around and destroy other people's vehicles for no reason without any consequence whatsoever because you don't have to pay when you're at $0.You'd think with that being said Rockstar would add in something that kind of makes players think twice about messing with other players wouldn't you? Well they did the exact ing opposite. Being a CEO or a biker gang leader or doing any of the missions that you HAVE TO PLAY IN AN OPEN LOBBY puts a massive ing target on you because you're basically told "hey uh this guy is trying to grind out cash go ruin that for him".The online lobbies are cancerous the community is garbage people will join heists as randoms and leave for no reason or rage out or do like run you over in a heist and cause you to lose on purpose. The chat is literal AIDs I don't know about the voice chat because I turned it off as soon as I started playing know that it would most likely be a hemorrage in the form of sound. People will see you in an ammunation or in an LS customs and place mines outside so you instantly die when you come out and it seems like every other person drives a ing kuruma or an insurgent two basically bullet proof (the later being explosion proof) cars which still baffles me why they were sold to people just to use and not just be in heists. But that's not the worst part of all the online "experience" (I say experience in the same way Syphillus is an experience) no the worst part are the newest DLC.The ing rocket bike which is stupidly OP as a vehicle the APC with the stupidly fast missiles the unique upgrades for weapons you only get with a multi million dollar bunker which include things like explosive ammunition and thermal optics for snipers the ability to just call a wanted level away for basically no cost the fact you can hire a private army to hunt down one person or have an escort helicopter and not to mention the iest AI in the world.I'd like to end this on a story. I was driving my car actually normally because I didn't want to ram into anything I was just driving around because it was the middle of summer and I had nothing to do but listen to Self Radio in the car and drive around.I was in a solo session in GTA online and I was driving on the outer most lane on the correct side of the street when a car FROM THE OTHER ING LANE SWERVES RIGHT INTO ME NO TURN THERE IT WAS A STRAIGHT ING ROAD DOUBLE YELLOW LINES AND EVERYTHING SWERVED RIGHT ING INTO ME.The AI is ing horrendous.I wanted the last thing to be "why rockstar why?" but I know why we all know why the whole online experience of this game is to grab as much money as ing possible and it's going to be like that forever now Rockstar is basically going to be known for shelling out t on a fake silver platter so they can grab money.oh yeah and take two

review: Really fun game to play. I rather enjoyed the story line aswell as having the option to play as 3 character i feel that gives alot to a game rather than being locked to one character. I do have to say though it would be nice if they added this feature into Gta 6 but aswell as having a female protagonist. The online side of things is really fun love the fact they release new content such as new cars clothing and apartments. The main drawback is the fact you get alot of hackers in the game which brings this game to a complete negative. Im at the point of where im quitting playing it for that reason seems that hackers have a way of getting you involved aswell when you havent done anything wrong. Its not a fair policy and its not worth the risk playing online due to this unless your going to solo or play with friends you trust.

review: Very fun game. Great campaign. Very fun multiplayer. I spent hours randomly exploring the incredibly detailed world. I would recommend this game to anybody. I did run into a few problems playing this game but i dont know if this is valve or Rockstars problem. If i want to load up GTA V then i have to turn my graphics card off then boot up GTA V then turn my graphics card on again. This isnt a huge problem and i can deal with it and i wont cry and give the game a 0/10 just because of that but this was very frustating initially when i couldnt start up the game. For anyone that runs into problems look on the internet.

review: Welp it looks like OpenIV is back from the dead and as a result I take back my earlier statement about never touching this game again. Hopefully Take Two learned from this farce and will stop trying to criminalize the modding community. Even if they do change for the better however I shall still leave my original review below as a reminder of what has happened. Although this situation has been resolved it must not be forgotten. ORIGINAL REVIEW I enjoyed this game not for its story or the online gameplay but because of the hilarious antics and challenges only possible through the use of mods and since Take Two Interactive has essentially banned these mods I no longer have a reason to play this game. I wish I could get a refund but alas I simply played too long. I can say with full confidence that I am never touching this game again.

review: Well I suppose since everyone else is reviewing it poorly I should jump on and say some things too. Now before I begin I must say that I actually enjoyed GTA V back in the day. Back when it was first out on consoles my friends and I would hop online and play some online multiplayer. Then when nobody else was online I'd play the story and oh boy did I enjoy the story. The story in my eyes is such an interesting tale that it deserves your upmost attention. For those who don't know it features three main characters who pull off heists and other criminal jobs. In most of the missions you get to control two or even all three characters. This allows a very fun gameplay experience as you can switch between these characters fast and with ease. Now the story alone sounds like a blast but this game has one more component that ultimately ruins this game and that's online. Online sounded so promising! You and your friends could take to the streets of Los Santos and do various missions races and fun gamemodes. They even promised heists just like in the story. For starters heists weren't placed into the game for a very long time but at least we got races and various missions. But those were limited. There was only a handful of missions before you had to grind them just to get guns and planes and cars even an apartment. Online started to get more and more bad with each passing day. Soon enough joining an online game meant either getting killed constantly by randoms or getting killed by hackers all while racial and sexist slurs are thrown at you. Online devolved into this toxic community where you couldn't get anything done or just have some fun. Pretty soon Rockstar started pushing out FREE updates. This is a godsend! Free updates hear we come! Except...they were Sure we got new cars new houses/apartments new boats and new planes but there was one glaring problem. They all costed way too much in game money. The only way to afford these new big boy toys was to either grind missions until sunrise or buy sharkcards. Sharkcards allow you to use real world money to buy in game money which seems fine at first but it gets worse. The updates started to roll out more and more fun vehicles that were locked behind ridiculous amounts of money. Every update the prices for the newly introduced vehicles rose. So it was either grind for about a week and get one new vehicle or buy a sharkcard. This became a problem as you had to keep buying sharkcards over and over just to keep up and get the new content. They also released these online only supply running missions where you and your crew drive some supplies to a warehouse and eventually sell it while people try to attack your shipment. The problem with that is how almost everyone in online is a total and will just destroy your shipment for no reason. You get the supplies you die. You get them again and you die again. They released more and more updates around this concept but it just doesn't work at all considering online is filled with ruiners of fun. They just released another update very similar to this concept which doesn't help Rockstar at all. But TakeTwo Rockstar's parent company decided to really dig their grave. They sent a cease and desist to OpenIV a tool which lets you mod GTA V and thus they had to take it down. This for me is what ticked me off. They just openly shut down modding with almost no warning whatsoever. They completely ruined the game with their "free updates" and now they really ruined it. With all that said I do not recommend this game for $60 or really any price at all. Rockstar only cares about the money they earn from online that they don't cater to others. They still have yet to released a singleplayer DLC which was promised a couple of years back. Innocent people are getting banned left and right for no reason while cheaters still lurk in the online mode. This game does not deserve your time especially not the online mode. The story is really good but only enjoyable till you 100% it. Then you can't really do anything else considering you can't mod it anymore. This game is not worth $60 or even $20. Oh how the mighty have fallen.

review: Intel i54690k 3.8Ghz (Quad Core)AMD Radeon R9 390X with 8GB V RAM16GB RAMand then all the other stuff that's not important.If you don't know already the game itself is amazing Rockstar constantly adds new features to GTA Online and some of these features will also be available on the Singleplayer mode although you can fix that with mods (which are really easy to use). The Singleplayer story is amazing and I easily have 200 hours across all platforms for it it will last you a while and is generally exciting and interesting. The Online support is also very well done it will provide lots of stuff to do and in all sorts of different ways. The hacking problem is beginning to disappear the most common thing now is the use of trainers that allow people to give themselves weapons vehicles and other features however this is much less of a problem than it has been in the past.My only problem with GTA Online is the money wh*ring techniques of Rockstar this is mainly done by making things almost too expensive to own without the use of their micro transactions in the form of 'Shark Cards' although it is possible to bypass this by grinding heists one after the other.Overall I would highly recommend this game not only to you but also your friends as I have never really got bored of it and when I have had enough just wait a few weeks and there will be a new update with new missions races vehicles etc. Yes it is a bit expensive but nonetheless it's a great game and has given me hours of fun.

review: I'm willing to bet that roughly 90% of the negative reviews are negative because "eye h8 maenstreem".Being able to say that this is the first ever GTA I've ever completed the story in doesn't sum up my satisfaction. I really loved this game. The story I thought was pretty deep connecting all of the characters in some fashion or another and creating bonds and divides all across the board. Compared to the other titles' stories...Some Russian's cousin who is inherently supposed to just kill people... V is a winner. Characters are unique so very interesting. Franklin is a young man from the hood trying to work his way up in the crime world Michael is a "retiree" from running big time heists with family issues from hell Trevor is the meth head that people put in commercials to scare people. Somehow they're all supposed to work together. Somehow it works out perfectly. Heists oh my God heists. Some of the side missions can get a little grindy but when the "H" word got thrown out there I kept noticing quittin' time to be later and later. While the heists take a good bit longer to put together once it starts happening every second of it is intense and in no way repetitive. Visuals... I could take up a whole paragraph for this one but just about every other review covers it. Me gusta. Downsides? All I can think of is maybe some of the side missions being a little bit grindy and not enough heists but that's me being critical.All in all just as with all GTA games there is a lot of satirical humor in every detail from the radio to the advertisements on the benches. I didn't feel like any shortcuts were taken in any aspect of creating this game. GTA V is worth every last penny I paid for it and I haven't even gotten on the multiplayer game yet. Still sitting on the fence? Stop. There aren't any unbearable Russian accents to listen to or any odd obligations period. Kudos Rockstar if I were a woman my panties would be wet.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

After this the community exploded and began review bombing the game so R* and T2 would reverse the situation and it did. R* tried to convince T2 to bring back OpenIV and don't intervene with Single Player modding and thus bringing back OpenIV and all of its mods.So yeah thanks for all who participated and a big f*** you for those who defended T2's actions (hope they wake up from those dreams about shark cards).

review: Originally I had positively rated this game but I didn't take into consideration the cancer that is GTA Online. The servers are rarely fully functional and when they are they're full of russians. Also the community for this game is terrible and Rockstar has done nothing to discourage players from mindlessly killing and destroying other players' property. So pretty much when you get in a GTAO lobby you kill everyone on sight because your head is on the chopping block from the time you exit your home. There are also a lot of modders but I think GTA has bigger fish to fry. The community really ruins the online experience of this game. No cooperation no teamwork no friendly players and no consideration of ever not killing everyone on sight. You constantly have to recover your vehicles from the insurance people who don't even pick up their phone half of the time. And then you have to retrieve it only to have it blown up immediately after. Its a continous cycle of everyone killing everything and its not fun for either party. If you're buying it for the single player experience then that's good for you but don't buy it for the online. You'll be very dissapointed.

review: This is a singleplayer review only as i don't generally tend to play online.Pro's Good GraphicsBeautiful locationsGood AI for the most partNew sidegame additions to the series like Triatholon Golf TennisLot's of vehicle/plane typesLarge mapCar modding optionsStock MarketCons Well the biggest negatives are the stuff missing out of the original San Andreas like No home InvasionsNo gymNo drivable TrainNo gang warfareNo jetpackAlso other issues for me are Arcade like driving If you flip your car don't worry just press a button and it magically rights itselfStoryline Too shortCops/wanted system Drive past the police at 100mph they will ignore you slap a pedestrian abusing you and they will shoot on site every timeSuperpowers They have no place in GTA and they make the game too easyIndoor locations There is a serious lack of themRobberies/Heists You should be able to rob shops and set up your own heistsAnimals There is barely any point to them other then to act as scenaryDestructable enviroments There is none other then blowing up vehiclesCasino There is one on the map but it isn't openRace Track Same issue as casinoAll in all it is a good game but certainly nothing special and it is definitely a step back from the original San Andreas excepting the graphics and a few other bits.6/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: "We are convinced that we are probably from an industry view undermonetizing on a per user basis. There is wood to chop because I think we can do more and we can do more without interfering with our strategy of being the most creative and our ethical approach which is delighting consumers. You can't give stuff away for free in perpetuity there's no business model in that. But we're not trying to optimize the monetization of everything to the nth degree. My concern is if you do that the consumer knows. They might not even know that they know but they feel it. We're not going to grab that last nickel." Strauss Zelnick Take Two CEO

review: This game truley never get's old for me. It was so well done and I can't wait for them to release a sixth one. I mean C'MON! IT'S GTA! HOW CAN IT NOT BE GOOD? I'm only saying that because almost every GTA I have played has been great. As far as Grand Theft Auto 5 goes everything is possible. Open world? Great! Concept? Amazing and always has been! Characters? Nothing short of cool! I played this on my Xbox One for a long time until I lost the game so I decided to buy it once again for the Steam Summer Sale. It was 40% off and I knew I wasn't going to find a better offer than that untill another sale arrives. It was 100% worth the buy. GTA 5 is one of those games where I can say "That makes so much sense as to why they are making so much money". Despite this being a very popular opinon Grand Theft Auto 5 it one of the best games to come out in the past 5 years for sure. Overall very fun to play.9/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is great. I'm actually a big fan of GTA series I was playing almost all previous games and fell in love with them like I did with this one. Of course there is one more thing. GTA 5 is good but I like many other bought this game for its online version that stole my heart and maybe it doesn't have a lot of updates it has some major bugs and annoys with some random small things but still. It is great. When i talk about small things I point not that many abilities to sell or remove things. Ok cars system is very good but what we can say about our apartments we can't sell them even when we are CEO and don't need all those 6 houses which make it a little annoying to choose cars another thing is about weapons 16 melee weapons you need to scroll to get to your choice of course they made lockers for it but it only works in freemode. And the biggest one is the "phone calls" options imagine when you're in the middle of the fight and some NPC calls you to tell you you need to visit him but you never did and will... Those phone calls can appear very often.Other than that this game rules and I wont stop playing it any time soon )

review: Wow. That pretty much sums it up thus far. I was considering buying a console just for this game (and a few others) when it was released but I am glad that I just waited for the PC edition especially considering all of the hiccups that GTA Online had on console. I am a little over an hour into the story mode and so far this is one of the most impressive and downright awe inspiring games I have played in quite some time. The graphics are absolutely stunning and there is a level of detail that few other games have accomplished and this is the first GTA game that you actually feel like you are in a thriving bustling city. The gameplay and combat feels natural and fluid and while there are a multitude of different ways to approach combat they keep it simple as far as controls go. The driving physics are great especially compared to the 'boat cars' in GTA IV. All in all this is a must have game (especially if you are a fan of the GTA franchise) and anyone that enjoys action games will love this. I have a feeling that all the other games in my Steam library are going to be neglected over the next few weeks as this game is taking the front seat for now. Couldn't be happier!

review: It pains me to give this game a negative review but Rockstar has some horrible blatantly anti consumer/gamer greedy cash grabbing practices. They have officially sold out. Everything that they were innvoative as it was serves only their shareholders interests now. No more single player content and you can be certain the same will apply to red dead redemption. The philosophical question of what defines video games as art vs "purely gamey"? That line has been crossed Rockstar you sell cheap tricks now and you've diminished the artistic and storytelling craft that went into the game you created. Devs shame on you.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Taking away modding is one thing and it's just not right but I'm personally not into mods and have different issue To start off this was the only game and the whole franshise that was a 'love on first sight' for me. No other game comes close comparing to GTA 5. When I first played GTA I would never ever imagine my self writng a negative review. For the 500 hours I spent on this game I grinded my off to save up $15 million. Then a online modder started a lobby wide money drop I had no control of the situation so I stopped whatever I was doing and recorded and screen shoted in case I will be wrongfully accused. Few days later (when gun running launched) my money got reset including all of my grind money. So I sent a ticket to the support took a while to write a very polite and thorough detail of everthing it was 4 paragraphs long. Also included the recording and 4 screen shot pictures. I clearlly stated that I acknowledge that I have taken modded money and why it is wrong but I also added that I never wanted the modded money in the first place and the attached files proves it so I would like my grind money back.Turns out they replied a pre written response that talks about modded money and why it is wrong which I litterally said in the ticket. They don't need to tell me why it is wrong I already know why! I swear R* probably never read beyond my first sentance. Horrible customer service never knew they would treat a very loyal dedicated player like me this horribly.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I bought this game 3 times on console loved it so much I bought it a 4th time on PC with the hopes of playing multiplayer and once and a while modding the game in my singleplayer world. Well Rock* ruined the multiplayer by making everything astronomicly expensive and turning this game into a pay to win. I have never bought a shark card and I never will becuase I have given this company 240 of my dollars. And Now take 2 screwed me out of the only other part of the game i enjoyed after beating the campain 4 times. The take 2 anti modding policy is terrible I paid for the game I should be able to do as I please with it. Ill never pay for another take2/rock* game again unless take 2 fixes the mistake they have made... If they can at this point.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I honestly loved this game. One of the best games I have ever owned. However with Take Two's recent actions I will no longer be supporting the franchise nor any franchise under their banner. You are starved for control lunatic cashed up board members who know about as much about coding as a preschooler playing numbers up on mum's work laptop. What a disapointing display from Take Two. These people work long and hard on these creations often studying the craft of coding to become proficient in their mods and you crush their efforts with a need for control? Sure paid mods are sucky and Bethesda has copped flak for that but atleast they are embracing their fans culture and what they want to see. Take Two you are purposely destroying this content for no other reason that wanting to be the big kid on the playground. Take solace in the fact that while my friends can't play their iron man vs war machine mod in GTA V you're allowing Джон Смит to run around turn people into whales and shoot money from his star spangled bellend. Enjoy the rotting corpse of what you once called a company.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The GTA series is my all time favourite gaming series expotentially getting stronger after GTA III. This game has the regularlities needed to be a great GTA game however it's not as perfect as I expected espeically with the lack of online enjoyment that required $$$ if you wanted to do anything of new value. Although this game was great I did feel however that getting on the hype train before release did have it's downsides such as cutting short the enjoyment factor of the game after release. It felt somewhat short of my expectations I had during the hype train before release. I know I'm only talking about the negatives but for a GTA it's still of excellent play/replay value. The majority of the game the storyline the mechanics and the soundtrack I found all in a positive light however certain issues I believe needed to be fixed to suit the games overall emphasise on replayablity. The police we're somewhat annoying espeically with there driving mechanics (constantly tailing you while you drive following your every turn 1 shot K/Os shooting a silenced weapon in the middle of the desert somehow got you notoriety). The online missions we're quite difficult to complete for beginners on solo/2 player levels and we're quite repetitive (go to location kill guys take drugs/money/truck go to next location done). Other than that and costly online mode (if you want to get the" bigs cool toys" you'll need to spend atleast a couple of $100AUD on Shark Cards) the game was still on par with other GTAs.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: 116 hours played at least 100 of those are load screens. I'm not sure if I recommend this game or not... it's good but at the same time it got pretty old fast compared to other gta's.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I won't lie GTA V is a superb game! The singleplayer has definitely been one of the best experiences I have ever had in gaming. Its literally jaw dropping to see how much detail there is in Los Santos. It feels like a living and breathing city! I really liked the story and cared about all three characters when times got tough for them. The online component is also very good with loads of heists races and other missions to play with your friends. Be warned though since the game uses matchmaking you will have quite a few connectivity issues. Also you cannot deny that there is a giant amount of hackers in the game. It won't be a problem if you just prefer friend only sessions so you can play with your friends but you will definitely suffer if you want to play with random people. Overall I must say I had tons of fun with this game so I can't not recommend it. You might want to wait until Rockstar actually takes the hacker problem a little more seriously however.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player Amazing 10/10 The atmosphere and story are both top notch. You can tell R* put a lot of work into crafting the city. The characters are great (fleshed out stereotypes) and the graphics look amazing as well.Online So so 4/10 The world is identical to the story mode so it's great and I created a character that looks almost like me so I rollplay as myself being a criminal. With friends you can have a blast playing vs modes or cooping on heists or just messing around in the world. From my experience you will get dropped into a hacked lobby about 1/3 of the time which can be exteremely frustraiting. Quests and missions are not clearly outlined and doesn't really give you the same leveling satisfaction you would get from an MMO or a single player type game. I just felt like I was aimlessly wandering about doing whatever. But I get kind of OCD about that so it's mostly my issue. If you don't have a problem with a lack of clear waypoints or instruction on leveling up then this won't be an issue for you.With so much quality content It's hard not to recommend this game despite it's flaws. If your just picking it up for the single player game it's completely worth it or if you have a few friends to play online with it's also a great time. If you want a game to mess around with random people in an online playground this might not be the game you were looking for.My percieved value of the game. (AKA what I would pay for it) Single Player $60 Multiplayer $25
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The ban on modding because of a thirst of finacial gain is frankly sad. As an individual who has supported and bought many of Rockstar's and 2k's game I am disappointed to see that there publisher (Take Two interactive) has made an unfair ban on the (previously) active modding scene. Take Twos and Rockstars excuse that "OpenIV enables recent malicious mods that allow harassment of players and interfere with the GTA Online experience for everybody" though in part true is not the obvious full story. The publisher has made an very noticable move on making the single player experience something that no one would play after finishing the man story. This is done by never releasing single player content and not even bothering on porting the already made online content to the single player experience and now going as far as too severly limit one of the most popular ways of enjoying the offline game. Why would they do this? This is simple as a company Take Two wants to make as much money as possible and if a player is playing single player they are not spending money on shark cards. To sum this whole thing up (and to be as kind as possible) you Take Two for implementing this and Rockstar for not speaking up against it.Sources http //www.pcgamer.com/heres rockstars statement about take two shutting down gtas openiv modding tool/

review: I don't even know where to start this game is a huge improvement from GTA IV. There is so much to do in this game that you can't get bored. I was playing on PS3 and PS4 before this and I can say this is worth the wait.The hype was real before the game was released and still is even after the release. I was waiting for PC version since 2011.If you are a console gamer there is nothing to argue you can't beat the PC version 60FPS Max Graphics no problem on any modern PC.3 playable characters Michael Franklin and Trevor. The idea of 3 playable characters was really smart I can't imagine GTA V without that. I do not want to say anything about the story PLAY IT !Everyone who is reading this BUY THE GAME AND SUPPORT R* !!!If you ever get bored you should try Rockstar Editor as well as Director Mode it's hard but worth the while.You can't just explain this game in words.Good job Rockstar Games !*EDIT* since Take Two decided to shut down OpenIV I don't recommend GTA V anymore modding was an important part ever since GTA III.10/10

I am getting a second 1080 ti and I can't wait to see this in multiple screens as was always my dream when playing this game in first person.I currently own Proud owner of 40 infernus sports cars (Take that Tony Mctony)Have bought and tested every car purchasable through the various websitesMaze Bank Tower with Ice themed office all perks3 executive Garages with Marble finish and Crystal lights.All classic sports carsHighest tier yacht all boats purchasedAll warcache vehicles purchasedAll elitas travels planes/helicoptersAnd still have $71 mil in the bank.My favorite vehicles are the X80 Ruston Osiris Roosevelt Valor and the Z Type.I am not trying to brag Tony McTony but I think I won.

review: The offline game itself is great 10/10. But the Online play is atrocious.Don't get me wrong online is fun. The game modes are entertaining and so on. But it's economy driven with no real answer for the constantly increasing prices. I can't conceive getting enough money without buying the under value shark cards to actually experience the majority of items available in online play.This isn't even a hard thing to fix... open up investments make weekend events more meaningful have an occassional event that actually pays well. Add competitve modes that you need to pay to enter and have a pot or something. There's a pletora of solutions but Rockstar hasn't supported it.To top it off the game is still riddled with hackers.If it goes on sale offline is worth $40. I wouldn't pay more than that.

My suggestion dont buy this game. do not give take2 or rockstar money anymore.Edit 2 (6 24 17) Well now seems rockstar have really came through for us fans. while the parent company of take two is still shady imo rockstar put a leash on the angry puppy. at the time of this edit the primary modding tool has been put back up for use and singleplayer mods are alive agin. review: Update OK looks like everythings back in order. Changing the review back to positive.So there is not enough money comming in from GTA Online which is why you needed to find a way to make gamers who only played single player come back to the multiplayer section of the game.How? Just shut down the tool that makes Single player fun state that this is used for hacking in multiplayer (which is not) and just to be sure shut down some real hacking websites (2 sites down from 100...) so people think you are doing a good thing... oh oh and make them donate their winning to charrity this way they will surely not realize the real porpuse of this whole thing.You could have started this a long long time ago but you did not. Why? Because you don't give 2 rats about the players its again all about making more and more and more and more MONEY.I'm not blaiming Rockstars I blame again those greeeeed #&amp !% coorporate money hungry publishers. This is why we can't have nice things (I have uninstalled the game because I don't like to play a game from a publisher that thinks I'm stupid and who doesn't give a &amp %! about their playerbase or their game (again publisher not developer).

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Not much to say about GTA V. Port is great scales very well. Best looking PC game? No Is it pretty? Yes Is the story good? Yeah I love to be able to play for 3 different characters How's the gameplay? Well that's the only thing I hate about GTA V. Driving is fine flying is fine but shooting mechanics are just very poor first person seems a bit unfinished and COPS .. geez... they are ridiculous they just spawn anywhere at anytime can see and shoot through anything Ahh I almost forgot NO BLOODY MONEY money in GTA V is so scarce that it is not even funny the only way to really get money is to finish the game but leave assassination missions after (I did not know that)EDITGTA OnlineAbysmal experience insane loading times lags server issues fps drops. matching system no back to lobby option instead the entire group gets dismantled. Cheaters and hackers everywhere.

review: I have been mostly hyped for gta 5 on pc this year.GTA 5 is a really fun game Its fun to customize my online character that is from ps3. This is an amazing feature. I have some problems with small lag spikes (the reason is that my graphics card and my RAM is not high enough to run GTA higher than "High".I have no problems launching the game (it takes me some seconds to get in game) I also see that many people have problems with launching the game or the game crashes on start up. You either need to update drivers update directx and get Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 SP1. Anyways.GTA 5 on pc is amazing and really fun to play through last time i played it was on my ps3.

review: I waited several months post release to buy this game because I wanted to be sure the PC port is solid. And it was. And I paid $60. And I got my solid 60fps. And all was great.And then several weeks later RockStar released patch 1.28. And now performance is and the entire point of buying the PC port has gone moot for me. How they managed to screw that up is beyond me.I miss the time when I could choose which patch I wanted to install. Oh wait I still can by buying on GOG.comEdit Ok after 2 weeks another patch was released and now performance is back to normal and I'm happy again. Great game. But don't trust RockStar...

review: UPDATE Take Two are reverting their decision. Open IV's development continues and it will hopefully be officially available again soon.GTA V's story is awesome. The multiplayer not so much. The grind in this game is horrific but that doesn't keep one from having fun in GTA V Online.Where they really ed up is with modding. Until now you could mod the game with a programm called 'Open IV'.Well....despite being perfectly legal Take Two (the publisher not R*!) decided to send the developers of Open IV a Cease and Desist Order. They have to stop distributing and developing Open IV.In other words they killed GTAV SP modding.Now you might think that they did this to stop hackers from modding the game.There's just one problem with this you don't need Open IV for trainers the tools used by 'hackers' in GTA Online.So in conclusion GTA V is an awesome game and the multiplayer is fun if you have friends to mess with.But Take Two just messed up bad. There's a petition going on here www.change.org . Please sign it to try to change Take Two's decision.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: EDIT Take Two / Rockstar have reversed their decision and Open IV is back up. As such I felt it only fair I revert my review back to positive.GTA Online is plagued with Take Two simply trying to get money. What should be a $60 game with plenty of content is actually a $60 game with $500 worth of extra unlockable content by buying shark cards. What makes matters worse is that there is also a plethora of hackers on GTA Online doing anything from spawning explosions all around you griefing spawning a cage around you making themselves invincible and even draining your own hard work (or bought) money! These hackers also have a habit of spawning themselves money and occassionally you! But then Take Two gets and takes your money away. So you have hackers taking your money and Take Two taking your money both IG and IRL.So you play single player but you can only do so much. So maybe you mod it a bit. Well now that's not allowed. Take Two has already ed over your online experience and now they're ing over single player.Moral of the story don't buy this game. It's not good anymore.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player was OK till Rock Star torpedo'd it. Online is worse Rock Star has created a anti consumer milk machine that froces you to pay real life money to get anythign done. Waht's worse is that Rock Star has compeltly ignored the single player experience that makes GTA fun in the name of this milk machine. Guess it's easier to make up a few BS inserts into online that cost nothing and force people to fork over ANOTHER $60 to fully utilize it than to actual make memorable single player content that adds to the actual game itself. I'm now extremelt apprehensive about any future Rock star titles including the upcoming Red Dead Redemtion. I refuse to buy it until I see Rock Star commit to it with true expansions or at the very least not create an online version to milk it's player base.

review: An outstand PC Port of Grand Theft Auto V. Rockstar games has really redeemed itself after the horrible failure/mess that the PC Port of Grand Theft Auto IV was.Good Points Way better optimized than GTA IV was. Rockstar Editor a video maker only availible on PC. Rockstar shows that they really care what PC gamers want Next Gen Features (especially for those who havent played the PS4/X1 version of GTA V. Gotta love first person mode. Modding Community. In my opinion nowhere near as big as the GTA IV PC Modding community but it has picked up.Low Points I really don't have any because rockstar did an amazing job this time porting a Grand Theft Auto game this time around. Yes the game got delayed a few times but can you really complain now considering how good a job they did with the port? Otherwise the fact that the game is sill almost impossible to max out because of the advanced features id say anyone with a decent gaming right with a GTX 750 or above should have no problem making the game look nice and having a consistent frame rate.In all i would recommend this game to anyone who has a decent PC and wants to play something "The Way It Was Meant to be Played."
