review: Below was my review before they decided to mess it all up for singleplayer mods by ordering OpenIV to stop. Somehow I'm guessing they will bring back mods which you can install by buying sharkcards. As if they didnt made enough money by milking it completely dry with the online game. The love is gone The game itself is great! Good storylines funny sidequests and offcourse some good humor and a very well designed huge map. There is this great balance between the main characters they are all different and have their ... well issues but the chemistry is great. Lots of things to explore good fun hidden random events. You can finish the whole game quite fast if you are just doing back to back story missions. But you can also lose yourself in wandering about looking for items things to do. All and all good fun. Also there is a huge modding community which allows you to mod the game pretty much as you prefer. More cars houses settings scripts even more cars etc etc. My first review wasnt too positive mainly because of GFX troubles which are obviously known for a while by Rockstar but there isnt a specific fix for it. Online everyone has different solutions but none of them work for me. (err_gfx_d3d_init). Sorta fixed it by fiddling with the graphics settings but not ideal. So aside from the good game the random crashes kinda get to me. From the playing on record time ive spend a lot of time trying to fix stuff booting crashing and trying to find another fix.

review: TL DRThe online game is no damned fun in passive mode. It is no fun playing with Xbox player griefers. I was labeled as a bad sport after killing two guys that started attacking me. It went away after a couple of hours of playing with passive mode turned on. Yay! 5/10 Half the game is fun all by your self the other half is online pretty much all by yourself then you crash and if you are lucky you crash back to single player. For a full $60 this game should crash way less often. I have crashed out of the game in online mode every time I've played it. I have crashed twice in single player mode and I think I've played that 3 times. Only about 10 of my 28 hours played so far are for single player story mode. So about the crashes most happen for no reason I can tell during the most mundane moments like driving or entering a garage. The rest happen at the exact moment that I'm finally about to have some fun with my friends. After long loading screens figuring out who is on what server the debate over whether or not to turn passive mode on (read no fun mode) so we can actually make it to each other in order to play together and ride in the same car we finally get to a cool spot for a race or a job and then the game crashes. When I relog I find I'm in a different server and I have to do the same damn song and dance and waiting to meet up with my friends who have been missing out on their fun waiting for me. I expected bugs but not constant CTDs. Friend just stole a helicopter and landed next to you to pick you up for some helicopter cop sniping? Yay! Two seconds after take off CTD. Fifteen minutes in on your first online heist with a friend and all you have left to do is go home and set up for it?...Aaaand the game crashes on you both as you try to park in your garage. There are times when other people can hear us talking even though we are all set to friends + crew on voice chat. If another player brings a whole four star army of cops past you they will usually begin to chase you and your friends as well. I'm still not sure why. And since you are in passive mode you can only run from the cops but they can still shoot you. Let's take a moment to also point out that with the number of people that have over rank 100 characters they imported from their Xbox accounts it is impossible to hold your own against someone who is determined to kill you as you run around on the map trying meet your friends in game. You can gear up pretty quick online thanks to some free DLC weapons but when the other player shoots your car full of friends with a minigun all the rifles in the world can't help you. Only lucky head shots. And no ones PC character has any skills yet. Those must be grinded like everything else for some reason. Which is fine except for when I'm fighting against someone who rarely misses provided they have the mouse cursor on target. I can click on your head and often miss anyways thanks to poor shooting skill so far. Look I'm sure single player is solid. I plan on having fun with that for many hours just to do the story at least. But I bought the game to play with my friends online. Because Rockstar advertised that I could. Well I can't really.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Bought the game after debating whether it was worth 60$. Lets see single player is great no problems their nice and long with alot of to keep someone busy.. But lets look at GTA Online... Its matchmaking is difficult to learn for someone new trying to set up their own private match. Connection between people with internet vs good internet is completely unbalanced and unfair. What I mean is people with internet will literally jump fly and do all sorts of fancy tricks across your screen in turn affecting the npcs around you. Not fun... Now let me get onto the Heists im still new so i only got the first heist but doing this with my friend on the first part will 9/10 break when we are bringing the van back to my house. Makign me with three choices exit and restart get into another game and sit through a loading screen or pray that it decided to ing work... Might I also add trying to buy things in this game is annoying because I will accidently buy .. Oh and why cant I sell anything from a mistake at buying the wrong thing. Now seeing as I bought this game to play with friends and have fun the online aspect of this game is a BIG let down as half the time im lagging in my friends car or the mission keeps bugging out... NOT FUN.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I'm on a mission to silence 4 corrupt jurors who are about to return a verdict that would seriously damage the share price of Redwood Cigarettes Inc. If I'm successful it's expected that Redwood Cigarettes' stock price will skyrocket in value the following day. To prepare for my mission I customize my sniper rifle with an advanced scope and a supressor I grab a nice versitile vehicle (lifted Ford F 150) and I spend the remainder of my cash on Redwood Cigarrette stock on the hopes that my mission will be successful. However after I execute the first corrupt juror the situation on the ground forces me to make some adjustments to my plan. The cops are on me but its only one star so its not too much of a concern. On to the second juror. I take him out quickly but the cops see me do it again and they are starting to get Two stars. Still not that bad. The third juror is standing on a sidewalk so I easily find him and run him down (again right in front of the cops). Three stars. Now I've got to do something to deal with these cops before I make my way to the final juror who is hanging out on his yacht in the harbor.But then I notice I'm running out of time. Just one minute before juror number four goes into hiding and my mission is a complete failure. Frantically I speed toward the harbor. Thank God I decided to use a sniper rifle for this mission. All I need is a good vantage point. Then I see it. Perfectly positioned near the harbor are some high bluffs that I can easily drive up with my lifted Ford F 150 to get a birds eye view of my target. 'It's gonna be close ' I think to myself 'but I got this mission.'At this point I'm feeling really smart. Correct weapon choice correct vehicle choice and a chance for an enormous payout (due to my purchase of Redwood Cigarrette stock before the killing spree began). I park my truck at the top of the remote bluff. Hop out and start to train my sights on the final juror. 20 seconds left. The boat is moving up and down with the waves making this a pretty difficult shot. I put the jurors head right in the crosshairs. 10 seconds left. And just as I'm squeezing down on the trigger...I am mauled by a mountain lion. Michael is dead. Mission failure. 11/10. Moar plz. Best GTA ever.

review: According to STEAM I have been "playing" this for over an hour. My recommendation is DON'T EVEN LOOK AT IT unless you have a superlative tolerance for malware adwae getting mugged for your personal information shady practices and a long torturous login procedure while the game (and steam) lock you into a devils contract and load up your computer with warez.The highlight was found after reading through the privacy policy (the company predictably promises nothing. gives itself permission to grab anything it can and then give it (or rather sell it) to anyone they fancy.) When I returned to the sign in message box it's code token had expired. I hadn't read through the document thoroughly that would take a good half hour and hadn't started on the Terms and Conditions yet and the code token had expired ten miutes ago. I had to start the login again from scratch. There can be no presumption that a user could have knowingly read and understood these longwinded "contracts" in the time allowed (strong evidence it it is needed that the consent is not intended to be informed. This would make the contract void in the EU at least.)As for the gameplay? Who knows? I am too fed up of the whole thing to want to even try it and given that they let slip in the T&amp C that there are in game purchases necessary I can't agree to it void or otherwise.CAVEAT EMPTOR because the purveyors of the bloated STEAM malware surely won't.

review: So you know when you buy a game and you think 'you know what im going to play this game for a good while this evening to unwind from work and lose myself' then you download all 70GB of it after parting with your money and wait for it to instal onto your SSD you so carefully made space on after uninstalling the last game you were really into!! Then you boot the game doritos ready and a bottle of lemonade by your side but it doesn't work.... I mean you paid for it you installed it you clicked play and it doesnt work.... NO SOUND?? Like really? So you spend 3 hours of your evening after work reinstalling drivers DX11 DX12 GPU sound card you trawl google redit amd rockstar microsoft etc and after 3 hours you still cant play the game.... so you want to play your old game you have to uninstall this reinstall the old game and now im 3 4 hours wasted annoyed and out of pocket doing the very thing I would have been doing 3 4 hours prior had I not bothered to purchase this at all.... If it doesn't work DON'T SELL IT!

review: Update 05/01/15 After the latest patch I'm able to play for a considerable amount of time before encountering a crash (4+ hours). So I'm changing my review to "Recommend". I hope they continue to improve the game and fix issues but it's at a stable enough level now to be enjoyable.GTA 5 Single Player Very solid enjoyed it a lot. Glad that alot of the annoying missions previous GTAs had are gone or relegated to non critical to the single player story. The story itself was solid enough there are parts where it drags on a bit or stumbles a little but by and large it works. If there's one thing I'd love to see improved Quit changing my characters outfits. I designed looks for the three main characters right off the bat many missions will see them change outfits and after the mission is over they don't change back to what they had on before. In particular this annoyed me with earrings and glasses. I wouldn't mind the wardrobe switch nearly as much if the new wardrobe wouldn't remove glasses and earrings.GTA Online So much potential stuck between a mirade of long loading screens. These really need to be cut down one of the worst offenders is when asked if you want to enter a queue for a mission or not and answer no it has to reload the entire world again... why?!? just drop me back in the world I was already in.There's also *soo* many things to do that it's a bit overwhelming. Better presentations of missions would be very welcome. There's some oddities in this regard as well after completing a mission solo I'm presented a list of 5 additional missions or a random one to immediately do. The 5 additional missions are *always* missions I've already done even though there are plenty of missions I haven't done yet. When I hit refresh I'm then given a lot of game/mission types of a totally different variety instead of the same type.Heists need to be more 'fault tolerant' of people leaving/crashing.Lastly it would be SOO nice if planning a mission or heist could be done w/o leaving the freeroam world. Having to wait in a lobby screen in the hopes that people join and you can launch the job is mind numbing.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: best game ever
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Good game though cheaters are rampant in online and Rockstar doesn't care. Tanks also are useless in the game as they flip out uncontrollably if you so much as hit a pebble and are damaged by small arms fire which reduces your character's health bar not really any differently than if you were not inside the tank. It also suffers the same control issues/lag/delays as most other console ports. The menus are terrible and important options only appear in certain circumstances which doesn't make sense for example requiring you to be in solo mode to launch a crew only online game. Otherwise it's a good game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: "Now Go! I Need To Meditate. Or Masturbate. Or Both."GTA 5 is everything we expected it to be. Graphics gameplay you name it it's all there! Rockstar (probably the last remaining quality oriented company) didn't let us down this time. I'm not a hardcore player nor am I a huge GTA series fan but when I see another Grand Theft Auto game announced my heart starts pounding a little bit faster. This game literally has everything it was expected to have good singleplayer rewarding multiplayer races shootings base jumping golf... hookers for god's sake! Let's start with singleplayer. It is absolutely fascinating you have your own new realistic open world to discover main missions which are gripping (but prepare to drive a lot) lovable and hilarious characters. There should be a separate review to describe just singleplayer alone so let me tell you that it is worth buying just for playing alone.Multiplayer is a whole new ball game. There are lots of new features which are absent in the singleplayer. For example visiting other player luxurious apartment or garage full of neat muscle cars. Together you can go complete a variety of all kinds of missions from racing to classic "kill 'em'all" arenas. Talking about multiplayer one can not skip "The Heists" which are (pretty self explanatory) series of high rewarding missions aimed at perfect teamplay among 4 players it somewhat resembles Payday. And astoundingly there is much much more...The only significant drawback (and the source of its state of the art graphics) of GTA 5 are system specs. This is the game that truly tells you or perhaps shouts at you to update your graphics card buy new i5 processor and as a possible consequence change your motherboard entirely but if you are a devoted player every greenback spent is tons of pleasure gained.Thanks for reading!Have fun and enjoy the vibe!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: In my opinion the story is okay not as good or immersive as GTA IV but still fun. The online is great if you have friends to play with otherwise it can be dreadful waiting to fill a pug group just to complete a heist. I don't think it's worth the $60 if you've played the game on the consoles already if not then it's a definite must buy. Try to aim for at least 3 other friends to have the game to really enjoy the online aspect to its fullest.If you're wondering if your computer can run it compare it with the recommended requirements not the minimum. I have Windows 8.1 64 bitIntel i5 3570k 3.4 GHz quad coreMotherboard with PCI Express 3.0 x16GTX 660 2GB8 GB RAM1 TB HDD at 7200 rpmWith these parts I can run the game on medium settings and maintain the 60 frames per sec with VSYNC on. To go higher I would recommend buying a GTX 970 4GB card to push the graphics to higher settings. This game also has long load times I don't have much of a problem with it but you can get a SDD (Solid State Drive) to reduce load times but these come at quite a higher cost than a regular HDD. You could get a small one say 250 GB SDD to run alongside your HDD for some games. As far as game stability and any crashes or bugs. I put almost 100 hours on this game the first two weeks it came out and I haven't crashed or experienced any bugs with the game. I formatted and upgraded my OS from windows 7 to 8.1 with a clean install and updated it as well prior to installing GTA V to minimize the possibilities of bugs.I hope this review gave some insight and information to go on. Thank you for reading and I hope you all enjoy the game.

review: Previous review Just fork over the money to Steam or Rockstar already. It's a benchmark of PC gaming and a technological achievement. GTAV is meant to be on PC. Buy the game NOW.Recent Review Still pretty much the same view regardless if mods have been stripped from it. While a complete attrocious move from Take 2 Grand Theft Auto V still has a pretty substantial single player and multiplayer portion based on one of the most technically detail city open worlds ever created. Even if you don't mod you can get plenty of hours with the game regardless of what price you pay for it. I'm not saying that the take down of mod support is not terrible. While it can hinder one of the main fundamentals of PC gaming I still think people who have enjoyed GTA/Rockstar games in the past should buy it (if they can afford it) anyway. Me and three others played GTA Online and the story just fine without any mods. If you primarily game on PC GTAV is still one of the best ports of it containing graphical options and optimization out there. Regardless if mods are gone GTA V is still worth whatever price you pay for it.

review: I thoroughly enjoy this game with the exception of some diffuclt controls cant make tight turns when on foot rolling dodge only when aiming things of that nature. The game itself is fun in story mode but I do prefer the online multiplayer but prefer to only have sessions with friends and not a lot of strangers from around the world. Frequent patches and "expansions" keep this game fresh for me too. Loading times are a bit annoyingly long and to get into online mode and invite friends to your session tend to be kind of "jump through hoops" in a way. Just giving you guys my honest opinion lol. I do still really suggest this game and try to get more of my friends to purchase it. I do think it is time to drop the price though but that may be on Rockstar's end and not Steam. some wishful thinking they should add hangers and boat docks for people that buy boats or planes or helicopters so that we can walk up to them and board them just like cars bikes or motorcycles. Also they need to add more heists. The heists are fun but getting 4 people to do them all (for me anyways) is difficult to coordinate schedules. So more less than 4 player heists. Ok I feel like Im rambling now so Im going to end this but I just want to say "buy the game you won't regret it."

review: Gta online has slowly gotten more and more expensive as rockstar tried to shove shark cards deep down our own throats. So to anyone who wanted access to all the new content would find someone with a mod menu and have them drop cash. This is a thing rockstar has tried to combat since release and every time you think that this ban wave got everyone and we won't meet any cheaters for a while I always encounter a bunch being jerks to everyone because they can. Now that open iv a single player modding tool has been banned and I still meet other people with mod menus who won't stop annoying people. So why are they still here? After all the time spent on "cracking down on them there is still a thriving community of gta cheaters. The game from the get go encourage mods and since every but of new content had some price that would make your wallet cry. Want a new fun flying bike???? Well a $50 shark card later and its yours. This is why tons of people have just been modding online content into single player. They don't want to deal with these insane prices and take two realized that a lot of people were doing this. This one of the reasons a beloved program such as open iv was banned. Now what do we have today? A bunch of off fans that wont stand for the actions taken. Look at the reviews of any open iv game. Rockstar and take two have their fan base off and should tread lighly. You shouldn't bite the hand that feeds you.

Non GAAP net income was $218.3 million or $1.96 per dilutedshare as compared to $219.2 million or $1.98 per diluted share for the prior fiscal year. Non GAAP net income for fiscalyear 2016 reflects $37.6 million in tax benefits related to video game development costs.The largest contributors to Non GAAP net revenue in fiscal year 2016 were Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft AutoOnline NBA 2K16 WWE 2K16 NBA 2K15 and XCOM 2. Non GAAP net revenue from digitally delivered content grew36% year over year to a record $835.2 million led by Grand Theft Auto NBA 2K Borderlands XCOM 2 and WWE 2K.Revenue from recurrent consumer spending grew 33% year over year and accounted for 48% of Non GAAP net revenuefrom digitally delivered content or 26% of total Non GAAP net revenue $1 561 000 000 * .26 $405 860 000Make of this what you will but I will never buy into a system that nets me essentially nothing with minimal effort on behalf of the devs for implemented features.If you somehow do not yet own GTA V I would suggest steering clear of the minefield for now.

review: They added a shark card and then with that made the price 25% so it's the same as the normal game also the shark card makes you unable to get a refund. Scumbag Rockstar.All the upgrades from console are worth the wait. The price is a bit high though I think $60 for ANY game is too high. The optimization is amazing my PC with a SC 760 4790 4.0Ghz and 16 GB ram is getting 70 110 fps on high settings. Other PC with 970 is getting 100 130 on ultra. Game installed fine online works great with no lag. Unfortunately some people playing it are still using a controller.. no wait actually that means those that use a mouse + KB will win more often )Overall from my first 2 3 hours of gameplay 9/10Main problem is the low fov makes first person just not playable. Especially in driving.

review: (Edit regarding steam summer sale and Rockstar raising prices for their game) 11/6/2015It's sad to see a company like Rockstar do what it did this doesn't reflect my point of view for the game itself mainly because the game as a product is worth every penny as i explain it in my original review below im changing my review to a negative one to try to make a minimal effort trying to counter the terrible business practices that are invading gaming as a plague the sad thing is Rockstar a few years ago used to be one of the few developers out there witch could be holded as the kind that didn't pull this kind of nonsense but i guess the times are changing and once more just as Netherealms did with Mortal Kombat X Rockstar has finally joined the dark side... Just hoping they would still make good games after this.(Original review)Great game you know it begins with the petty career criminal that eventually traverses to become one of the best ones eventually meeting the other protagonists along the way for obvious reasons the game is regarded as the best of 2013 the game technically it's a masterpiece altho there are certain missions wich do tend to drag themselves along the way some of them wich involver you laching parking veichles i mean...But overall the game it's great runs great too with a few minor exceptions there are some graphics options wich are devastating for this game (The advanced ones at that) I would recommend you to disable them since they do not tend to make such a huge difference visually but in performance they just tear appart the game it's great tho worth every penny.

review: .....Aaaand now i cant mod the game anymore... thanks T2ok im going to change my review with all the recent updates the game is KIND OF better however there are many problems i still have with the game(as of 8/24/2016... i have to hope that these issues will be cleaned up in the future but im not holding my breath)1. Hackers are freaking everywhere(duh) but the problem is alot of the tactics they use havent been patched out for a LONG time if Rockstar actually cares about their comunity they need to do something about this2. It takes WAY too long to grind for money to buy anything ive played the game sence its launch on the ps3 and sence then ive seen the monitary rewards only dwendle while the cost of some of this stuff only goes up(the best yacht is almost $10 mill)3. The cop AI is utter B.S. 90% of the time there are instances in the game in which im running from the cops and i can LITTERALLY see a cop car/heli/boat spawn infront of me too close to react to it before they see me. And theres a mission where getting spotted by active cops ends your progress and the B.S. cop physics dont let off at all4. They need to improve the online service 8/10 times that i select join friends online i will be put into an invite session ALONE and the game will tell me that i should join my 4 friends who are playing in a session somewhere... I wish i was lying about that too.Final verdictthe game still inherits its ability to just be fun when your goofing around in the world whether online with friends or by yourself. Despite the issues it has nothing beats popping into a private session with some of your friends and just dicking around to kill a few hours. The single player is good theres plenty of easter eggs to discover. The online is still fun once you load in properly and get a good lobby without hackers or general s. If only social club wasnt as granted it has gotten better sence my original review but it still has issues.This is my original review if your interested there is always a problem when trying to sign into the social club then your account gets locked and you cant play the game for hours... even after changing your password 5 times. once you get into the game its fine save for how anal Rockstar is about the mods which is a damn shame cause thats the only reason i bought the game for PC anyway...

review: PC SPECS Radeon r7 260x8GB ddr3 ramAMD A10 7850k As a longtime player of the GTA series When GTA 5 came out for the consoles I automatically made a leap and purchased it. It became my life for about 5 to 6 days then I realized I had wasted a week on a video game. When it was finally officially announced that GTA was coming to PC I was hyped. After being delayed 3 times I wondered if the game was going to be a mistake or not. I first loaded up the game and even with the expected server issues I was able to go into online and transfer all of my stuff from consoles to my PC. The next 3 weeks were the funnest times Ive had in a while. With mods and all other things with the steam version of the game you will never be bored. I totally believe if you have a PC that can run this game Jump on it. It is the 2015 PC game of the year so far. As always It has a 8/8 on my 8 scale.

review: yayy mods are backthis should go without saying but don't cheat! You almost got our mods deleted. You know what its like to have gamer ADD right? Where you kind of just hover over games and always come back to a few?Well I have a small hard drive so there was a time when GTA just didn't cut it in my playtime any more to justify it's giant size (at the time.) So I uninstalled it sometimes I would reinstall for a week or two but always uninstall for other games.Then one day I started modding. Suddenly the game started transforming into something that became GTA the way I wanted it to be. The work of the modders is just so incredible.Basically my mods transformed my playstyle into a game that offered infinite replayability and it has been installed for half a year now.I set up an improved cops and stealth mod where if nobody sees you or calls the police you can get away with virtual murder. I set up a fuel and food mod and interiors mod where cars have random amonts of gas and any fast food area has a red blip that heals you.I made pedestrians drop more money gang members some other poor targets that I won't mention would drop STACKS. I set up a mod that did multiplayer random missions in Single Player so I always had a crate van assissination car steal or car blow up mission. I set up gta iv euphoria rag dolls so i could shoot people in the arms and legs and they would try to keep standing and roll around crazily realistically. I set up the game so I could get immerssed into my nasty despicable anti heroes and actually live their lives eating sleeping stock trading getting investments from businesses. I had mods that unlocked all the new cars like the parachuting one with misslesMan my end game is glorious looking forwards to Red Dead 2

review: Gta V is an amazing game. This is a proven fact that we as gamers all know well.The recent ordeal regarding the ban of mods from Gta V completely is also no stranger to us all.However finally after almost a week and a half of hard fighting R* finally did what was best for not only them but for the whole Gta V community as a whole. They made Take 2 TAKE back the cease and desist they placed on openIV.This is exactly what i expect from developers nowadays and i have nothing but respect for R* and T2s decision to undo what they have done. lets hope what happened here is a good statement for future developers of the gaming industry as a whole.GG R* and T2. you dun good.If you haven't played this game ( the singleplayer at least ) by now what are you waiting for? you're missing oooouuuuut.

review: The gameplay can be fun and the online multiplayer which is a long overdue feature is nice however the game itself is choppy load screens are horendous and doesn't bother displaying pertinent information like ping. In addition there are typos everywhere in important tutorial info and the tutorials themselves are aweful. I frequently see new players struggle to understand the system and frequently have to ask for info only to get shunned by the community that is designed and meant to be volatile.To add to this list of cons there is no profanity filter no block list no features that every single multiplayer has online yet this does not. In truth if I didn't have a single friend who played this game I would likely have returned the game since playing with party members is also a nightmare scenario. With load screens taking so long (solely due to host migration and network syncing problems) you spend more time loading the game than you do playing if you pug into a random group. This is not a game you play alone. You bring many friends and hope no level 100+ is around with any flying vehicle else you'll spend your time in loading screens on the curv dead every few minutes.

review: Single player was awesome! I played single player over multi due to the long wait times and menu time you spend in multiplayer. If they can resolve the sitting in menu waiting on games or heists for as long as you do now i would have probably played more. Overall it's an awesome game and I would recommend to others!When the game first launched I had a lot of disconnect issues online but that for the most part was resolved with some of the patching. It can be a pain when trying to join a friend or crew member at times and there is the occasional disconnect here and there but not as bad as it use to be.Overall Positives+ Gameplay+ Graphics (I ran on ultra settings)+ Story+ Attention to detail+ Vehicle controls Overall Negatives Menu feels clunky Random disconnects when playing online Heli and Jet controls needs work Online wait times for Heists/DM/Races can be brutal First person needs some work

review: I have reverted back to my old review as a thank you to Rockstar for taking steps to get OpenIV back up and legal. Good show glad they came to their senses. GTAV is still a great game. Just don't mess with the community please. Begin Old Review The ultimate version of GTAV!I've already played the heck out of this game on PS3...beaten the story and played MP...everyone pretty much knows that this is a great game chock full of goodness in an open world scenario.The PC does the consoles one better with glorious HD graphics with low system requirements. My experience thus far on PC has been smooth as buttah with zero hiccups or flaws.My rig is not even high end and the only current thing I have in it my graphics card. Regardless I'm able to crank out a smooth 50 to 60FPS in all but the most intensive scenes where it drops to 40FPS occasionally using max settings.i7 92024GB Crucial RamEVGA X58 SLiEVGA GTX 780 Ti Black2TB WD Black HD1920x1080RezMax All Settings (3GB VRAM used)The added improvements are what make this the ultimate version. I spent an hour of the 4 hours playing so far just screwing around in Director Mode. It is so much with basically built in cheats to let you be the fanatic you've always dreamed about. Doing massive jumps and crazy crashes just to record the best scenes you can make. There's no doubt there are going to be some impressive videos coming out soon.To keep this short Rockstar did a commendable job on this game and the port is lovingly done. A huge difference from GTAIV's release it's obvious they paid attention. Yes there are teething problems but overall this game is worth the money and your investment. It will provide absolutely hours of entertainment. Just wait for the mods!0 Comments Subscribe to thread (?)

Doing Heists.2. Buying in game currency with real money.3. Modding the game/Begging to moders for money.Now you might think it's cool since heist are awesomely planed exiting and fun and you would be right except for the fact that Heists cannot be done solo and this game's matchmaking is more broken than 70's superman's neck. You would waste hours (literally) trying to get people to join and when you finally gather enough people and launch the game someone is going to be randomly disconnected causing the job to be failed sending you to an absurdly long loading screen and ending in a session alone You will try to join a different session but the eternal loading screen will end with an alert message saying that the game is ed up and you need to go back to the offline game.Repeat the process several times untill you waste 70 + hours trying to give the game a chance so you can no longer return it.If you're thinking into buying this game spend that money on a sand paper cover it with glass fragments and then stick it up your it would hurt less.

review: Was really looking forward to this on the PC for a constant 60fps. Own it on the Xbox 360 and the Xbox one and it is hands down the best game I've played. Unfortunately even my high end system with a 980 ti still wasn't enough to make it look or run better than the Xbox one version. It can barely maintain a constant 60fps even with most settings turned down at 1080p. Even with grass quality turned down I only get 25 30fps in grassy areas. It also takes these crazy frame dips from 60 to about 15 for no reason while in the same area of the map which makes no sense. Then theres the problem of objects and shadows popping in and out and weird jumps during smooth gameplay that resembles online lag. I guess 1000 dollar video card isn't enough to make a game run smoothly these days. EDIT Apparently after some research a lot of people are experiencing this erratic framerate problem since one of the updates. I seem to have fixed mine. Advanced settings was the culprit. Still have a stutter from time to time but nothing like before. Still have really bad popup for shadows and trees though.

review: Fun but buggy as hell
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I highly recommend playing this game it's a masterpiece....With that said I'd like to also add that this game has a level of deceit. I'm not 100% recommending this title that's because of the Online. I've spent the majority of the hours I have in Single Player and then I eventually made my transition to Online mode and that was a MISTAKE! The WORST online experience I've EVER been apart of. EVERYTIME I'm on there's a low life hacker causing havoc becuase they've spent 1000 hours and are bored or for whatever reason. If you can find a session with players and no hackers (good luck) then you're going to run into people level 300 and they'll just kill you. Repeatedly... Yes you can go into passive mode but then you can't access your guns in freeroaming mode. So you're essentially left to driving from event to event. If you don't turn on passive mode they'll just keep killing you over and over and over on spawn. This is midly annoying but what's more annoying is the cost of it you die and you lose money. I've lost over $100 000 of in game hard earned cash to this exact issue. Too many people on here have had their fun and now go around trying to ruin it for others. If you can get into a session without hackers with people who wanna play right and they don't spawn kill you then good luck getting matchmaking to work. If someone who's higher level gets in queue with you see you're level 20 they'll just drop. I spent 30 minutes waiting for a 4 man team. Absolutely pathetic. So again I recommend this game but only for the single player and I'm glad I bought this on sale for that very reason. Screw this online piece of ****

review: I have given up on the Multiplayer and the publisher basically is trying to eliminate singleplayer mods to force us onto MP I don't want to do that. I want them to drop support for this stupid part of the game and let us mod the crap out of the PC version you know the reason we bought the PC version.To the PC community Rockstar is not a PC publisher. Bully had vary few options GTA IV had a lot of problems San Andreas somehow ran better on my four year old Macbook pro then on my high end Windows Desktop. Unlike say Ubisoft they admit it With that said GTA V is their best game and the pc release actaully went pretty well. The story world and Charactors are entertaining. The detail is insane and little behind the scene features make the game trully come alive. The multyplayer is fun to play with friends but an important thing to remember in freemode is that every player is trevor and as long as they arren't cheating it is fun to play cat and mouse with them especially if you can explode your way to cat. leveling is a bit grindy so defenitly play with friends and some of the online missions can be completed with some creativity. Mostly I would stick to single player sence the world is more filled and you can actually mess around either with the vanila game or some mods.

This is not cool Take Two you must understand that aside from the (very excellent) single player campaign and the ability to fly around LS in a jet car or a UFO or general hysterical shenanigans I no longer hold interest in this game. Unfortunately Take Two has decided to rob it's PC comunity of modifying the game. Stifiling creativity and invention I am not a mod maker but I have enjoyed them emmensley becasue of mods I have come back to GTA time and time again. review: Frankly I bought GTA 5 purley because I thought it would be a step up from console. I thought it would have better graphics (which it did) and MODS. But after the recent news from Take Two they have ended modding for ALL of their games. Now you may be thinking to yourself "why have they done this this is an outrage there must be some copyright issue right?" NO ALL THEY WANT IS MORE MONEY. With mods you could obtain vehicles and other multiplayer based things in the single player which has no effect on anything other than you personal copy of the game. But Take Two thought to themselves "hey people are having fun with stuff that you normally have to pay for in the multiplayer we aren't losing money it's just we want more SHUT IT DOWN!!!" All they care about is money not the player base they don't make anything that is fun to use in the multiplayer easy to obtain. YOU HAVE TO GRIND FOR EVERYING and to be honest I would perfer to not spend 200 hours farming to get level 100 so I can have a VIRTUAL house and VIRTUAL cars. I would have recommended it before but now I do not recommend Grand Theft Auto 5 The multiplayer is grindy and the single player is now a boring cespule of broken dreams.

review: It's really sad to see a devolopment/publishing team opt for profits over keeping the player base happy. I've purchased GTA V on every gaming system I own (360 and PC twice because I lost my game data accidentally and rockstar doesn't allow you to redownload after 30 days of purchase which I think is also pretty ed up) and a hallmark of playing on PC is that you have wonderfully creative minds in the communtiy who try to make the game BETTER by modifying the game experience. However due to the fact that Take Two has decided to opt for a multiplayer centric model and cancelled their single player dlc plans they see that creativity and community creation as a threat and use the empty excuse of "It allows bad people to maybe sometimes manipulate the game in unfair ways" which is t. We as consumers should not stand to be pushed around by developers just trying to make a buck off our backs. I hope rockstar and take two take all of these negative reactions to heart and actually do something as opposed to just releasing half statements.

review: Edit #1 With an agreement between Rockstar and the OpenIV dev OpenIV is allowed to be used again. I am reversing my No to a Yes. I will keep my original statement as it is still true. Thank you Rockstar for doing the right thing.Original Post Take Two Interactive basically KILLING the modding community under the guise of "stopping cheaters" is unacceptable. If OpenIV is the utility used so that cheaters can use their cheats (as they claim) they can at the very least patch the part that allows cheaters to use cheats so that they no longer work all the while leaving the good things OpenIV does alone. Until OpenIV is allowed to continue development and be released to the public again I cannot in good conscience recommend this game anymore. They need to understand that they have profitted off of modders UNPAID hard work which has created a longevity for their game (ala Skyrim). They need to feel how much the modding community means to their userbase.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: SO i bought the game when it first dropped on PC I preordered it so I could get the extra 1.5ish Mill bonus to start. The game started out great. Then the game slowly devolved into mobile gaming grinds. They build all their new DLC content to make it as grindy as possible but for a few shark cards worth of effort you can have it all at your finger tips now..... While this irked me I just figured it I have fun doing the heist maybe they will release more..... Nope... they just keep releasing DLC Grinds and "New Cars" or gimicks to get you to buy shark cards becuase who has time to grind it all when there is Work or School ppl have to worry about. Their customer support btw sucks!... Just a personal gripe for a moment but I spent like 3 days grinding the money to buy their 60 car garage for 1.6M to find out its a 20 car garage and if i paid another 2x i could amass 60s worht of storage in one locatoin... I opend a ticket and explained the misunderstanding based on what I read on their ingame adds. Rockstart Devs told me to suck a fat egg and kick rocks.... So I stopped playing their online BS grind simulator...... Now after all the most of the community and I have swallowed they come out with these "You cant mod your single player game" policy?.... Ok im done with Rockstar and take two... They are going to have to make a huge come back in order to win me back.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've barely scratched the surface of this game so far and I can't stop playing it. The Story mode is fantastic but I haven't played much of it yet. Boy once you get into GTA Online though all hell breaks loose. Some servers do have the occasional modder/hacker but for the most part it's awesome. The other day I was just driving through the streets minding my own business when the guy comes screaming through an intersection...in a tank...being chased by what seems like the entire Los Santos Police Department. Literally anything can happen. I haven't even mentioned the Heists yet they are fantastic. As long as you get good crew members to work with. There's a wide variety of them with bigger payouts as they increase in difficulty. I would highly recommend getting it if it's ever on sale. You won't be dissapointed.

review: GTA V Online is not for the weak hearted.Bought some P's &amp Q's from Chang the local market store owner. We were having a pleasant exchange about the weather when some jive turkey comes in and pulls out a minigun. I thought he was there for the money but no... He was there for the blood. Before Chang could even reach for the cash register the madman fires up his minigun and shoots. Chang didn't even stand a chance. The shooter left me unscathed so I could live to tell of the horrors he had committed.Went to my favorite clothing store. As I exited the store I witnessed old ladies getting beat up. Went to stop the man. Got blood on my favorite jeans. Never helped anyone ever again.Was taking a nap in my apartment. Woke up to the sound of fighter jets and tanks... "Is this World War III?" I thought to myself. No. No it wasn't. Just another day in Los Santos.Was taking a nice stroll in the park. Guy was getting chased by the police. I was just watching when a policeman bumped into me. Instead of a polite sorry he hit me with the butt of his shotgun. Still paying for the med bills to this day.And the worst part of it all is I can't even fulfill my BMX fantasies without getting run over by some scrub's multi million dollar car.Not for the weak hearted...10/10

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V is one of the best games I have ever played and I say that with Fallout and Elder Scrolls games in my library. The story is outstanding and if the player chooses the third option at the end the ending is beyond satisfying. It also helps that the game is hands down one of the most beautiful I've ever seen in fact the only complaint I have about the graphics is that the nights bother me because they are unrealistically bright. (Many people prefer bright nights because they find dark ones annoying so I can understand Rockstar's motivation behind doing this.) Underlying the amazing intense story and beautiful meticulously designed city and graphics is the satire and social criticism that still holds GTA close to my heart. A major part of this game even more so than in GTA IV is the focus on the subtlety of these criticisms. GTA V presents the player with these things and doesn't say a word about them primarily because it doesn't have to. It's up to the player to recognize these elements for what they are and putting forth the mental effort to discern them makes the game that much more interesting and enjoyable it just goes to show how much the writers and developers of Rockstar think about social issues and weave the satire masterfully into the game. Sadly not many developers treat their games with the love and care that obviously went into this one. If you haven't bought this game and you're thinking about getting it BUY IT. I would buy it again if I had to.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Characters are well acted. plays great with a controller and decently with mouse and keyboard. first person mode is a wash though. tiny fov and movement is clunky and awkward. luckily it's optional.

review: With a heavy heart I have to say that this game is pretty bad. I was really hoping that this game would give me something new to play after the fantastic Saints Row The Third and Saints Row 4. Unfortunately this game is riddled with bugs and crashes. I have a pretty decent machine (8 gb RAM 4 gb graphics card 3.1 AMD FX 8 core processor). The story starts off pretty interesting but you don't get a chance to explore the personalities of the protagonists or the secondary characters. The side quests are insanely boring and most of the game is just driving for 20 minutes to get to the next mission which usually involves diving around trying to catch someone or escape from someone. The game is just incredibly monotonous. After putting in 30 hours (most of which i'm sure was spent driving) I ended up getting tired of dying due to driving recklessly (I was trying to get to the objective faster because... you know... driving is boring as hell) and I uninstalled the game. If you want a fun laugh out loud open world game like this I highly recommend SR3 and 4.

review: I love R*. I think Red Dead Redemption is probably the best game ever made. With that being said there is some amazing things that have been implemented into GTAV. Althought it gets buried in the multiplayer under a brutal grind. There are thousands of things to do but to get serious money you have to spend days playing the same missions over and over. The grind should feel effortless not exhaust the players into playing other games. I find that when I do play GTAO I can only handle it in bursts. Otherwise I wont play it for weeks on end. All of that aside the singleplayer experience is beautifully performed. The characters are intersting and interact in interestingly with eachother(that was painful to write). The minutia throughout the world is impressive. there are memes on how in depth R* went with including all the little stuff. TL DR Great but be weary of GTAO

review: Great story mode and Online only if you play in a closed session with your friends. Public sessions is all hackers.Let me give you a few thoughts about this game. Bought it for my 360 and again for computer so I've been at this a while now. GTA V or GTA Five (for those who are confused by roman numerals) has a fantastic story. I enjoy the ability to swap between the three characters at random. The graphics look absolutely amazing and will make you want to take screen shots of the landscape...a small hint everything looks way cooler with explosions! Weapons handle quite nicely as do the cars. But lets talk about GTA Online. Hey you finally can make your own anti hero to cause havoc with. Got friends who will play with you? Awesome! You guys will have one hilarious time!Now the bad part As is stands now I honestly doubt there is even an anti cheat service active on the Online part of the game. If you play in public game sessions let me give you a taste of what to expect everytime. and I seriously wish I was over exaggerating when I say "everytime" Players that take no damage aka God mode Players that can jump into the air and fly off like Superman Prepare to just freeze and not be able to move then catch fire and burn to death Suddenly everyone in game will explode (hope you weren't driving your most expensive car) So basically its plagued with hackersSo if you are here for the story or to play with friends in your own session then I say heck yes you should buy this game. However if you are here only for Online and don't have friends to play with then no...just no.

review: Normally I would give this game a positive review however due to a recent Cease and Desist taking down one of the oldest and largest mods which enabled other mods to function I cannot reccomend this game if you plan to play this in singleplayer.The singleplayer has been under attack from Take two for a while now. The Hydra which arrived in a DLC allowing the Hydra to be purchased from the ingame store is only available to purchase on the multiplayer So if you had wanted to fly around with the Hydra whenever you'd liked you would be forced to go onto multiplayer which in itself is a Microtransaction cespit of terrible prices. The large group of people who play singleplayer for the modding scene even after already owning the game on another console before are being attacked from this Cease and Desist. So if you plan to buy this game for the modding scene don't. If you plan to play this for the singleplayer DLC add ons don't. If you plan for whatever reason to buy this game for it's god awful multiplayer scene you can do better. Take Two has also recently come out saying that they felt they had "under charged" it's users meaning they might be planning to introduce more microtransactions in the near future.TL DR One of the biggest mods which a lot of other mods need so they can fuction has been forced to shut down. DLC doesn't always affect the singleplayer forcing you onto the multiplayer.Multiplayer has terrible Microtransactions.Take Two feel players are "under charged".I honestly found this game fun to mess around in either using mods or with my friends but now that Take Two are just attacking the singleplayer users to try and make more money.

review: Great game now I'd pay $60 for both the single player and online separely! Don't buy until OpenIV returns! Modding any portion of the game is now prohibited. Not currently the superior version.If you want to get the most out of this game the best fun you can have is only available when you obtain the game by... other means. I love this game but "those" users have the superior version of the game. In the Steam version you can get banned for using mods single player or not. Most importantly the game doesn't support a high enough FOV for first person to work. This game is in serious need of some patches as it is currently broken in this regard. It's close to being a great game but certain policies make the game broken. Mods will provide you with the most fun including the unofficial online mods/servers. In order to use this superior version simply don't pay for the Steam (or R*WH) edition of the game. For right now the Steam version is inferior. If Rockstar fixes a few simple policies this will by far be superior in every way to every other version. But for now it is not.Alright they don't ban for Single Player mods. Just make sure your completely revert/remove any files so it looks like this i.imgur.com and then verify game cache to make sure they're clean. Then you can play online. No need to force scOfflineMode in commandline.txt but it's a good idea to make that file so you don't accidentally go online with mods.

review: This game as already made tons of money and they keep making us pay more how do they do that let me explain to you so first of all yeah its cool they put out new stuff all the time gunrunning is a good example so whats wrong with that you might ask its wrong cause everything in the game costs money and going through the online game without buying shark cards is a pain in the cause youll never make enough money to afford the new stuff unless you have a company in the game but wait that too costs money so either you buy tons of shark cards or you get ed by people with the new stuff however there is a last option called modding wich i was doing i was modding to get money in the game thats it thats all i never used it to other peoples games or make me invicible all i wanted was to enjoy the game to its fullest by adding money and by giving some to other players who was in the same situation as me guess what ? i got banned for life so now either i buy the game again or i never play again. And all i did was modding money for me and people without bothering anyone because buying shark cards is too expensive for some of ous and playing the game without the new stuff is kind off bluh especially when you play in a server with a rich kid who as everything he wants and keeps killing you with his stupid broke vehicles so yeah i used to love the game but now its just a money company who wants more and more even tho they did well enough money and they keep making alot from people buying the game.My regards Ace

review: 60% of GTA online is spent in loading screens. That is if you want to actually get done to get fun weapons and vehicles.It's not due to bad computer specs servers are just really bad and sometimes you'll get dropped from servers out of nowhere. Tried and tested among all my friends most of them have better specs yet they have just as much problems as I do.Also the grouping system is quite ed or should I say the lack thereof? You can play one mission with your pals then one of four things will happen 1. One of you guys will drop out of online for no apparent reason.2. You'll be put in a group with other players no one in your crew having host privileges so you can't even kick the unwanted out.3. Someone's game will crash.4.1. You all try to go back to free play mode but you all end up in different sessions so some of you will have to sit in a 5 10 minute long loading screen just to get back together. 4.2. You will end up in the same session again thankfully but someone's game crashed and they have to wait an extra 15 minutes to both start up the game and then have to exit a lobby because the game doesn't realize you want to play with your friends so you got put in a different session and have press Home and specifically tell your game that you want to get put in a game with your friends.Also there's the issue which I'm having right now I've tried to start up the game 3 times in a row all three times I ended up in 10 minute loading screens I.E. server doesn't connect me. Then even if I get connected I can only do one mission and I'll get booted again. And in the off chance that you actually get connected to a server you'll have been auto kicked for AFK because you alt tabbed the game because SERIOUSLY the loading screens are so long and you get bored.Seriously Rockstar fix REAL designated servers MMO servers perhaps? You've got the resources to keep pumping out fantastic updates in an amazing game but what's the point if the players can't play your game?
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The base game is solid but community support through mods is what really lifts this game above the competition. Unfortunately the publisher would rather bait you with microtransactions for a poorly structured online mode then allow you to improve the singleplayer experience.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I enjoyed the one player story of the game but very much dislike the company's buisness model and "Screw you" attitude to its customers. This isn't the first time they have said "screw the customers". First they lied about the online gameplay when the game was first released. Then they released it for PC at full price years later still lacking the online experience as was originally promised. Then they charged full price for the game during what was supposed to be a Summer sale stating that the game was marked off 25% but that it comes with about $15 worth of DLC (shark cards.. aka useless in game currency) raising the overall price back to $60. This also means those who bought it could NOT get a full refund if they decided to return the game within the sepcified time because technically DLC (which was what they stated the users were paying for) is non refundable. And now while they have always been against the modding community they are banning OpenIV (GTA V Modding tool) which the community completely loves. Hope it get's through to them that people notice these actions and it really sucks.

review: I have played this game for about 200 something hours online. This was on the initial ps3/360 release. I recently purchased the game for PC. Overall this is a great game. It still has stability issues and some weirdness. It's partially because the game is so huge literally. But I also feel the need to wag my finger at rockstar for some issues that have existed since launch.Bottom line this game is great. Get it play it. It's not a waste.However there are some issues that need to be pointed out. The game has some stability issues even to this day crashes freezing an acceptable level of frame loss. These issues can be common compared to other similarly proforming games. The single player is great. I have no big issues with it.OnlineAh GTA online. What a novel idea. To best summarize it It's like an abusive romantic partener that you stay with even though you expect better. And eventually you learn to love it. Despite it's faults.My bigest complaints are as follows THE LONGEST LOAD TIMES OF ANY GAME EVER.ALL OF THE HACKERS ON A CONSISTENT BASIS.Rockstar's commitment to selling you in game money instead of fixing anything broken or poorly designed.Trolls joining missions and quitting before or during the job.People who suck. The level one dude who joins a higher level mission because they got the invite. The strange design choice to make GTA online a quasi MMORPG.The odd design to PUNSISH the player for acting like this is a GTA game and killing NPCs and other players.The world of underware &amp dunce caps. Known as bad sport world. Where you go when you blow people's cars up. It's a great game. But it's poorly designed and not supported. Also did I mention the hackers? Because they can make you CTD for telling them they ruin the game. Because they honestly do. I don't pay a subscription fee which is nice. But the rampant instability and extreme level of hacking that happens in this game is enraging. I like this game but I don't like the hackers. I don't like how rockstar treats me like a pinata full of money who dosen't care that the product is crap with perfume.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I contacted Rockstar support about the multiple occasions where hackers have ruined different kinds of cargo missions for me and my friends we have probably lost $2mil $5mil in game money because of hackers. Here is their response "Regarding product destroyed by the hackers while selling the product We would like to inform you that the Rival Organizations (including other players) and authorities can interrupt your Buy and Sell Missions by either destroying the crates or the cargo planes transporting them. Remember that the job isn t over until all of your Cargo is safely transported. The profit loss from destroyed Cargo crates is part of the risk/reward of the Buy and Sell Missions. Players cannot be reimbursed for Cargo that is lost during Buy and Sell Mission gameplay in GTA Online.The best thing that you can do is to continue to report the hackers and modders in the game. Rest assured we do try our best to take action against cheaters accounts."Reporting hackers in the game is no use as they never get kicked out real time. Banning people for using hacks is way too slow if you try to report a hacker while in mission to save your product from such players it is no use. Vote kick is also either broken or extremely unfair. You need a lot of people voting to kick a player for the player to be kicked. And when you're in a session with 30 players in it people just don't care enough to vote.The response Rockstar gave me made me feel that they are not addressing the issue and they're not going to. The game will remain filled with hackers.Other point is the clear turn the content has taken they are catering to the below 18 players who love competition. There are overpriced vehicles boring and repetitive missions that don't really reward you clearly a carefully crafted system to sell shark cards to stupid people while making the older playerbase feel ed. Seriously this does not feel like GTA anymore. I've had hundreds of hours of fun in the previous ones and even through the storyline of GTA V but the Online content and current state has become very unenjoyable.If you're going to only play through singleplayer then get it on sale. If you're thinking about getting the game for online play just don't.

review: Hyped as hell and it delivered. You've all seen the story and the content so how does it hold up on PC?Well first I have to say that GTA V PC is extremely well done Rockstar put their heart and soul into optimizing and enhancing it. The graphics are a massive improvement from the console versions they're not Crisis beautiful but they get the job done. Most importantly get this the game actually runs fantastic. I'm able to maintain a solid 70 80 fps on average easy with my GTX 970. Actually the GPU doesn't do a whole lot it's the CPU that gets pushed. When they recommend an i5 3470 and FX 8350 they mean it. There's only so much you can optimize in a game where there are hundreds of entities on your screen at once. I have an FX 6300 with a slight overclock and the lowest I've dropped to is 40. Especially when using a submarine underwater. TL DRGTA V is awesome. Great performance (CPU intensive) Great graphics And your everyday GTA gameplay. 10/10 would heist again.

review: This is the third time I have purchased GTA 5. I love the game however I purchased for pc with modding in mind. Now I can't mod my single player game without risk of being banned.Update I fell for the hype... "We have always appreciated the creative efforts of the PC modding community and we still fondly remember the awesome zombie invasion mod and original GTA map mod for GTAIV PC among many other classics. To be clear the modding policy in our license has not changed and is the same as for GTAIV. Recent updates to GTAV PC had an unintended effect of making unplayable certain single player modifications. This was not intentional no one has been banned for using single player modifications and you should not worry about being banned or being relegated to the cheater pool just for using single player PC mods. Our primary focus is on protecting GTA Online against modifications that could give players an unfair advantage disrupt gameplay or cause griefing. It also bears mentioning that because game mods are by definition unauthorized they may be broken by technical updates cause instability or affect your game in other unforeseen ways. Source Rockstar Newswire www.rockstargames.com "

review: Was playing GTA Online.Saw a player abiding by traffic laws.Follows them.They crash into a ton of things (bad driver) over the course of about 5 minutes.Eventually they are displeased with the physical state of their vehicle decide to steal another.Follow them to an on ramp.They acquire another car but they don't move at all.Cops come. Shooting at them.They panic and get out of the car at which point they make it about 50 ft on foot before dying.I stand watching do nothing.Cops leave their car.Stand over my fallen comrade in the middle of the road in a disappointed mom (hands on hips) stance.One officer gets bored and gets back in the passenger seat of the police car.Other officer still standing over my deceased friend.NPCs in their cars starting to get annoyed.One makes a bold move and decides to just run the remaining officer over.This did not fare very well for the two police officers.Both officers open fire on the NPCs car.He's not dying.NPC gets out of the car and runs in fear.After a few seconds of shooting at the man (whom most likely has no idea what he's done wrong)the police just give up and drive away.10/10 would watch my friends die again

review: This game is fantastic endless amounts of fun. The story doesnt give you many choices on how you want to go but the perspective of each charaters life as they move on in the world of Los Santos brings enough itself. Now I want to talk about multiplayer It is really only sutiable to play by your self or with friends. Public lobbies ALWAYS have hackers and they have WAY TOO much power. These aren't your Call of Duty type hackers they can pretty much do what ever they want to whom they want. If you want to buy this game and enjoy it make sure you have friends to play it with.Now what Hardware do you need Can you run it?This is pretty much what youd expect Its a great game high graphics around 50 60 Gigs of open world fun. Yes you will need good hardware to play it. Your not going to play this game on a low end PC. Id reccomend you get a CPU with at least 4 cores of 3.8 Ghz and a High end Graphics card before you try and play it. you dont have to have a GTX 980 but you want around a GTX 660 and above. make sure you have atleast 2 Gigs of Video RAM so you can amp those graphics a bit. Now how much RAM should you have? 8 Gigs is enough and has been enough for a LONG TIME! You dont need to go over kill here but if you want to stay to the low numbers and stick with 16 Gigs. This game is ported very well and if you get a exspensive card like a Radeon R9 serires or a Nvidia GTX 900 series and the game is all choppy dont s*** your pants and get a refund. UPDATE YOUR DRIVERS! Always keep your GPU/Graphics Card drivers to date if not new games will be very choppy and unplayable. Keep this is mind too. Drivers for your GPU are FREE!!! If you ever pay for them seek a refund. Just search your GPUs Drivers on google and you will find a link. So Can you run the game? If you feel the need to ask... and you feel that your PC is kinda bad... well probably NOT!Save that money to Upgrade before you buy this game and have to play it on 800 x 600 with 25 30 FPS.*Update* Recently Rockstar released an update that seems to have fixed the GTA Online hacker problem. Either way I feel my statement still stands GTA Online is more fun with friends if you dont have any make some. ) I highly recommend this game.*Update* So in the amount of time I've played this game I've had to re install the entire game (yes even after a "Verfied Game Cache") 4 times. One of which was becuase I reformated my Harddrive that the game was installed on. So a total of 3 times caused by the game itself. So yeah be ready for that.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Honestly Grand Theft Auto 5 has always deserved a not recommended for me. Since launch it has been plagued with low FPS and stuttering despite my pc far exceeding the recommended specs. Any attempts at contacting Rockstar in order to get a fix or help were met with no response and the thousands of forum posts documenting the same problem as me are still without a solution that works for all. However with the news that Take Two interactive are essentially putting and end to openIV and with it PC modding for GTA V I find its a good a time as any to point out the only reason I got 200 hours in this game was because mods as I could look past the awful stuttering when launching cars into space. I honestly could not recommend this product at all as Take Two seem more interested in money than player enjoyment and fun in a game should always take precedent. Absolutley disgusting.

review: Don't get this game. You will meet so much try hards and hackers. You will meet try hards of every race dissing you in another language while they use expolsive ammo for snipers and miniguns and expolsives close range. They will run after you kill them a couple of times. They just go ghost orginization(Off Radar for entire crew) to run get bull shark(boost that allows you to take and give more damage) and snipe or try and rush you. Or they just might go ghost orginization and get a armored truck or a car with guns to catch you by surprise. And if you say that you will just "leave them alone" just know you can't. They will try and kill you if you are minding you own business. Take it for me don't get this game i owned it on ps4 previously and wanted to see if was different on pc but it is not. The main thing i did with the time i have on this broken game is main get into gun fights with lvl 200+ people who try hard even when i am not even lvl 90. They will just the minigun on you like with was a normal assault rifle. The have no care they will kill you if you even if you are lvl 2 because they want to boost their kill/death ratio.Just don't buy the game.EDIT Also every thing is over priced so if you want to pay 10 000 for a shirt in gta online(which all of the first part will take place in) then go for it. All the cars are also over priced so if you want a car(The cars that are not slow and the ones that have cool customization cost basicly $1 000 000+) and you do not want to work for it then that will be $20 of your real life money.

review: Singelplayer is the only aspect worth buying in my honest opinion. The storyline is fantastic the world is alive and gorgeous and everythings just as fun and enjoyable as you would expect from a GTA title.But the focus here was clear from the getgo Online multiplayer. ( TLDR microtransactions the game)Originally it was extremely fun. it delivered the experience of the same open alive wolrd that singleplayer has. Ive got hundreds of ours in the original on xbox 360 and opted for the PC version when it became avalible on the relaunch. After that the money grabbing started. Every DLC added more content with ever soaring prices. When that didnt get as many sharkcard sales as rockstar wanted they started locking DLC content behind extremely expensive must buy objects. You need to spend 8 million on X building to even acess X content because thats the only place you can store it. The prices kept going up and the mission payouts stayed the same. You will spend hundreds of hours to amass a small ammount of cash. Rockstar has pulled out every stop to force your hand to buy sharkcards. The only other way is hacking and boy are there a lot of hackers. Rockstar didnt care about the player experience being ruined by the antics of said hackers untill some robin hood types started spawning money. This cuased a knee jerk reaction to ban the use of any mod software including single player mods. Modding the game in any sense would result in a ban Except it didnt stop the online hacking It was just a huge middle finger to the loyal singleplayer fanbase.I have been a loyal GTA fan since the original top down style games. III and Vice city basically turned me into a gamer. I remember every kid in my neighboor hood going over to one friends house to take turns with Vice city and San Andreas. I will not give a cent or a minute of my time to rockstar or take two again. They have shown that fans mean nothing in the wake of easy cash and that we are just wallets to open.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The very long wait is over and... GTA 5 is a great game to play. Great graphics superb cars missions weapons and camera angles make this a winner. The characters are not to my liking and the long wait is not good or fair to PC players. However the great sound track and fun gameplay makes GTA 5 a must buy.Pros...1. Graphics and sound track is superb.2. Amazing camera angles including First person.3. Massive city to explore. Cons..1. The long wait was wrong and unfair.2. The characters are dumb. They lack charm or humour. 8/10 ... A superb game. Better characters and less of a wait would make it a 10.

review: I really enjoyed this game. The biggest changes are of course the 3 protagonists that you can switch between at any time the introduction of a first person mode and the story structure itself which revolves around pulling off heists. The single player story is rewarding and fun the heists are interesting to plan and execute! The multiplayer mode is a mixed bag due to hackers etc. but overall I had fun with it. Your mileage may vary! I spent most of my multiplayer time in a group with IRL friends doing the heist missions etc. Overall a great experience and totally worth your time.I think I spent 5 or more hours of my playtime just cruising over the hills on a dirt bike listening to the radio )

review: I bought this game about a year ago for PC before that I preordered it for my 360. The GTA Series is one of my favourite game series. When I bought the game on PC first thing I did was transfer my online character from 360 to PC. I recently moved for university and both of my roommates play GTA Online on PC so we have a lot of fun playing together. I will admit the online by yourself is not that fun I found it very boring. The only thing I do dislike about GTA V's online is there is no way to play freeroam like in GTA IV. You have to worry about money and other such stuff in GTA V unlike GTA IV. GTA V brings looooads of content compared to GTA IV but there really is no online sandbox mode which is really upsetting. Other than that the game is really great and I would suggest it to any GTA fan.

review: Updated ReviewToday I beat the main story to this game it only took me 2 4 months to beat though.When I got this game I played it consistently up until the end where you must confront Merryweather this is because there is a gamebreaking bug in the game and switching between characters seems to crash the game... That's not very impressive for a triple A title.Moving along... Today I got up the motivation to finally take another shot at the ending of the game all I had to do was not switch between characters during gameplay and that seemed to phase out the crashes still very unacceptable for a triple A title.Other than that bug this game is wonderful and I recommened it (and don't switch between characters after you rob the bank for $200M... the only time I switched characters was when it was necessary to further the plot of the game).To note something... I realize that every game reacts to every computer differently because there is different hardware in everyone's machines... But I don't think that that fact alone justifies selling a really expensive game that's broken.

review: Good game at least the narrative is. It's a bit pricey $75AU but I'm sure you can find it on sale some time in the year. How does it run? I'm using a 4760k gtx 770 and 8gb ram and it works for the most part at 60 90fps.The game has some mindnumbing frame drops especially if you pull up steam overlay and leave a window open.As for the gameplay it's for the most part a solid effort but be warned the controls for a keyboard and mouse are sometimes really stupid. For example driving a car feels a bit clustered around the wasd keys. After taking a long break from the game I don't think I can recommend the game. The controls are garbage and it feels like nothing ever responds the way you are inputting it maybe it's input lag but I highly doubt that. They really don't make games like they used to.

review: GTA V has to be one of the best games ever made. For fans of GTA you pretty much know what to expect the smart and at times dark humour characters you can't help but love even though you would hate them in real life should they cross your path. The game centres around three different characters each are different in their own way A rich Ray Liotta character the young black guy who is the next big thing on the crime scene and a lunatic hill billy who was by far my favourite character. Each have individual missions some hilarious and random and main story is highly entertaining and I loved watching the characters succeed the usual buying properties and garages new gear customising cars etc and then having all three characters work together towards a huge final mission in the end. The game looks amazing on PC and all the more enjoyable exploring the open world of San Andreas especially when you go rogue and fly yourself off buildings and out of planes. Overall I would highly recommend this game. TO NOTE I haven't played the online content of GTA. As the game is so huge I moved on to play a few other games once I completed all missions. So my review is not based on GTA Online.
