review: TL DR This game is really good.GTA V has exceeded my expectations in every way the characters in single player are believable the world feels big enough to explore and enjoy without being overly massive the Online component is awesome fun with friends I could go on but that would take too long.My one major complaint is the propensity of hackers. I don't care if someone wants to hack themselves in an infinite ammount of money and every vehicle in the game that wrecks their fun not mine but the most common occurence is hackers screwing with your camera auto ejecting you from any vehicle you enter and adding massive invisible blocks all over the map just to screw with you. That being said roughly 50% of the lobbies I enter have some sort of hacker and roughly 10% have the jerkwad variety.if you switch lobbies whenever you get a jerkwad you spend 5 minutes in a loading screen for a much better experience.If I could change one thing it would be the lack of anticheat but since I cannot I'll just give this game the rating I would if it had no cheaters 9/10 Never stop playing.

review: It was a hard decision for me to give this game a thumbs down or a negative review in general. I have always loved the Grand Theft Auto games and the amazing job that Rockstar and TakeTwo Interactive has done in creating these living and breathing worlds.The addition of online multiplayer was interesting at first but I came soon to realize that I much prefered to play offline (mostly due to the fact that there is always cheating/griefing/trolling online). I'm not saying that I didn't enjoy some of my experiences online but it was always frustrating. Therfore I avoided it for the most part and focused on offline play.So I am extremely disapointed in Rockstar's decision to essentially end modding for Grand Theft Auto V. I was just beginning to learn how to use OpenIV and a couple of these other mods to enhance my single player experiences in the game. It's a shame to think that they would do this to the PC gaming community and I am therefore giving the game a negative review.Besides that the game is one of the most enjoyable GTA experiences that I have played. Great story and characters lots of action and comedy. Typical GTA entertainment with amazing visuals and easy controls.

(Disabled)CPU i7 4790k 4 GHzHard Drive 4 TB (Not going into details with this one because I don't want to look it up)Graphics Card EVGA Superclocked Nvidia Geforce GTX 970Graphics Driver 2.4.1.21Motherboard Asrock B85 AnniversaryOperating System Windows 7 Home Premium 64 bitSteam is up to date.System Memory (RAM) 16 Gigabytes of GDDR3 1333 MHzWindows Firewall (Disabled)I strongly don't recommend this game until the game is fixed or at least launches...Details of Crash The Launcher works perfectly but as soon as I hear the window crack my game crashes. There have been times where I got to see these white street lights go off but that's as far as I've gotten. I have tried reinstalling the client and that fails to work and after checking the integrity of game cache all files were 100% validated successfully no errors. I tried this before the reinstall as well as after it. In fact I may just upload a video showing exactly what I do when I launch the game. My youtube username is Andyman99999 (haha).I recommend it now. The game runs really well on my setup... I'm still in disbelief that my Xbox 360 controller kept crashing the game in device manager when you're suppose to be able to use it to play (I don't use it to play btw)... Unplugging the controller from the pc and then restarting isn't enough to solve the issue. You have to disable the controller in device manager. I do believe this issue may be fixed now but thanks to myself upgrading to windows 10 and not having the drivers for the 360 controller (thanks Microsoft for not letting me use 3rd party 360 controllers since they have unsigned drivers). I've even enabled unsigned drivers to run and my 360 controllers still don't work when I plug them into my pc...

review: I'll keep this short and simple. (Campaign only)Pros Insanely indepth and involved main storyline that puts the vast majority of other games to shame. Amazing graphics and attention to enviroment detail. Holy the rain looks amazing. Voice acting 10/10 Lots of customization for guns cars and your body. Sadly none for your cribs. Missions are fresh and fun. Extras ConsThere are no game breaking problems or any major issues it's just some little things that really bothered me for a game that went overboard in so many areas while others were neglected so. Your cars Your purchased and customized cars vanish or get impounded if you dont park it in a garage and if you boost 2 cars before retrieveing it from impound it's gone forever. No Refund. Start a mission odds are your car can't be used so it's impounded. Also you are stuck with ass cars for "Your" car to use in main missions. Money Other than buying expensive vehicles and property(Useless except garages) I felt like there really was no point to it I could always buy guns ammo and anything else I wanted without giving it a second thought. I've done two playthroughs and realized I didn't hold up a single person or liquor store for $20. Cops being alerted You can literally shoot a random hiker in the back on top a remote mountain with a supressed pistol and still get wanted Stars. Vehicle speed cap due to console F gs and rendering issues the max speed of ALL CARS is topped off at like 110 even though many go above that on their descriptionsFinal verdict 8.5/10

review: Singleplayer story was great. Favorite protagonist is Michael.I think multiplayer is good as long as you have at least other 3 friends to play with as planning is way easier and no solo rambos dying by every chance given. If you do go play heists or missions with randoms be sure that you have the time to play for the next 5 hours even to NOT complete Edit Im just going to make this negative just because the game is made boring due to all the grinding you need to do to get anything the pay on some missions are uneven and it aint even that high to get some cool vehicles. The story is still okay but to achieve 100% R has put way too much collectibles for the player to find that makes it boring. GTA IV physics and pedestrian/cop AI were way more fun to mess with and it saddens to not see them in this game. Also you could go into the buildings in GTA IV with guns and without any loading screens as they were easily accessible. And the world size... Where is Las Venturas?? Where s San Fierro?? And also where s the other small countryside villages? But the one thing I mostly hate about this game is when you try to lose the cops. They know where you are even thou they dont. Try to hide into an alley and watch as they all go there to inspect for any criminal activities that didnt happen even at a distance of a few blocks.

review: GTA Online loading screen simulator and hacker fest due to p2p based networking. Takes forever for job lobbies to fill up because of horrible matchmaking. I'm sure I spent 30% of my logged hours in loading screens and waiting for matchmaking. Over inflated price because of corporate greed to push shark card sales. Godawful customer support response time measured in months.Singleplayer it's good but no SP DLC in sight. Potential for new content (in terms of mods or otherwise) basically nonexistent now after Take Two expressed their hostility toward the entire modding community. But really don't get it unless you really like the singleplayer or can put up with the toxic online communities grind for virtual cash and ridiculous loading and waiting times. Also your hardwork in GTAO could be undone in an instant from temp bans which removes everything you own without a chance for appeal. Shouldn't be an issue if you don't cheat but if you're the unlucky sod who get falsely banned for reasons you don't even know well sucks to be you then since "all bans are final". Have fun with that.

review: I will be honest with my review. Hopefully it will useful somebody who would like to buy this game.Pros Open World. Long interactive story line in Single Player. A lot of vehicles. (Ground/Air/Sea) In depth character customization. (Online) Passive mode online so players can't kill you. Nice and smooth weather system with day/night cycle. Multiplayer. Heists in the Online. Buyable properties in both SP and MP. A lot of mini games races. Community made missions and maps. Mods in Single Player Crew and grouping system. PvPCons Expensive. Hackers/Scripters. Ability to use real money to buy in game money. You can get banned if you get in touch with a cheater. You can randomly get disconnected from the server Very few heist and story in the Online part of the game. A bit bad community. (I mean players just walk around you and kill you.)Conclusion Grand Theft Auto V is a beautiful game. With such a big game there is bound to be issued but nothing that breaks your fun. Create your own Crew/Gang/Group/... on the Rockstar Social Club website get in the game and have fun with your crew members.10/10(If you found this review helpful consider giving it a thumbs up!)

review: Easily a contender for Game of the Year 2013 GTA V does an excellent job balancing realism and fantasy to create a wonderful envrionment compelling story and generally enjoyable multiplayer to play.PROS+Well written and compelling story+Plenty of things to do aside from driving and shooting people like parasailing tennis and stunt jumping.+Hidden secrets scattered throughout Los Santos such as ghosts dead bodies and Jaws.+Interesting if slightly insane main characters.+Yet another well executed series of criticisms and satire referring to modern America.+A gunplay system which far exceeds GTA IV's.+Graphically beautiful even on lower settings.+One of the largest worlds we've had in an open world game yet.+Radio DJs with excellent taste in music.+The option to use your own music on the radio complete with a DJ and advertisements already included in the game.+Exceptional levels of customization from cars to guns to clothes to tattoos to hairstyles.+Free DLC!+Vehicular combat!+Races which make you feel like you're in one of the earlier Fast and Furious movies!+Flying military jets while listening to Danger Zone!+ONLINE The best open world multiplayer I've ever seen.+ONLINE Cooperative heists clearly inspired by Payday.+ONLINE It's incredibly easy to get in a game with your friends and do whatever you want together.+ONLINE Steady progression system to level up your character.+ONLINE Servers seperate between players with keyboard/mouse from controllers keeping anyone from having too great an advantage.+ONLINE As of this review frequent double xp and double cash missions and events.+ONLINE The opportunity to interact with characters also in the single player campaign.+ONLINE The ability to enter clan only or friends only sessions.+ONLINE VIP work allows more wealthy players to help others make really good money.CONS Flying can be difficult without a controller. The controls are simple in theory but difficult in practice. ONLINE Rockstar does disturbingly little to combat hackers. ONLINE Money is incredibly difficult to earn with the only viable ways to make any serious cash being heists or buying "cash cards" for real money. This only encourages players to get hacks to give themselves the money they want. ONLINE It can be difficult to use special vehicles you've purchased (such as helicopters or tanks) due to the Pegasus system. A hanger (such as the one in Saint's Row III) would've been a far better way to handle this.A must have title for any gamer regardless of platforrm.

review: Omg how the hell are the reveiws mixed!!! Don't believe what people say I mean yes there are rude bits but if you avoid the strip club and skip one or two of the cut scenes and you don't care about swearing then you're in for a treat. the single player mode or "story mode" as they call it is pretty fun and if you get bored then use there app to learn the cheat code done by controller (if you have one which you probally should but it won't affect it really its just better with controller) or by typing it in console commands. Then you have GTA V Online AWESOME. yes there is the constant players killing you BUT you can always go on a invite only session so you are on your own (Solo session diables some features) the only two things I have noticed is it can be quite hard to get a lot of money if you don't know where to look and to register yourself as a vip or president you ahve to be on a public session but if you have a friend in an invite only session join that and it keeps your title.Oh and don't hack they don't take it lightly.

review: Very hesitant recommendation of this game. The game is 10x as fun with friends as opposed to playing by yourself. That being said if you don't have friends this game is a REAL pain. There is so much grinding in GTA Online it's insane. Playing with friends helps alleviate this somewhat by making the grinding slight more fun and faster but it's still a pain. GTA V single player is really enjoyable there's no grinding at all and I thought that the main story was really fun. I would definitely wait for this game to go on sale and if you play on playing GTA Online be prepared for a lot of grinding and lots of people trying to ruin your fun if you're trying to grind.

review: Gone from being something fun to an utter cash grab. Brand new cars with a 1 mph advantage over the previous one costs $30 to buy if bought with real cash. Rehashing and adding new game modes apprently the same game mode in 8 different locations counts as "tons of new missions". All the player made missions are either rubbish or just wall ride races around the same stretches of the city. The original missions and heists are fantastic but none more have been added since Online launched. The hacking is horrendous a few nice guys occasionally drop cash but most just grief and can actually crash your system.The game has horrendous network connectivity issues and issues with it not being hosted on servers clearly they didn't learn from GTA IV online.Overall a shame the charm humour and sociopolitical commentary of GTA games shines through but clearly the Rockstar bean counters want to wrangle cash from what could be a great game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: + Cool Singleplayer. Very enjoyable game even on a laptop. Nice Cars Clothing Weapons and Modifications are great huge Story formate many Missions Cool Details Nice Landscape Rockstargames support lacks of help with any ban related issues. Sending a support request including the issue of being banned will result in an immediate automatically generated reply by rockstargames to check the EULA. If you get banned you wont get a reason for the ban just a standart You have been suspended from GTA Online. Apparently there doesnt seem to be a way to unban someone whatsoever if he got wrongfully banned. The ban system detects external ingame GUI's (not the Steam one luckily but there are still a few). So instead of detecting fast movements or teleportation money spawn or whatsoever it will ban you for an overlay that could be totally legit.Do Not Use Ingame Overlays That Are Not Approved By RockstargamesStill a great game and I highly recommend it.

review: Story mode is amazing great characters funny screenplay cinematic as hell. All around great. Online on the other hand has potential and really was great. But it's rampant with cheaters and modders who take money out of your accounts spawn everyone in one spot and kill on repeat teleport you in the air and get you stuck to objects. Rockstar adds new free DLCs which is great but they're all so irrelevant to each other and the content is way too expensive to be afforded with Shark Cards or grinded ingame. Impossible to progress in public server missions due to everyone else trolling. It was fun and simple when it started out but now has become a total cancer project. Instead of fixing bugs DLCs modding cheaters and making aspects of the game more realistic and relevant to each other they just pump out more irrelevant DLCs and money from the public and turn down your tickets. If you want customer service call Rockstar. You'll get better service that way. It's a fun game and it's sad to see it go downhill but get it on sale enjoy the single player and if you can tolerate multiplayer it's a lot of fun to play with friends especially stunt races.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's a good game but Take Two Interactive has just effectively shut down the modding scene for this game by cease and desisting OpenIV which has been in development for 10 years and has been endorsed by Rockstar themselves. Until that changes I can not and will not recomend this game.Edit Take Two Interactive has reconsidered its decision and retracted the Cease and Desist and Rockstar is talking with OpenIV to help stop the issues the way it should have been done in the first place.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Alright.... There's a lot of contreoversy surrounding this game in terms of microtransactions and whatnot. I'm going to try and cover each common issue in this review. Now for some people these issues make the game unplayable. And honestly I really wish R* would address these things. But they don't.Hackers If I'm going to be honest it doesn't seem like R* has any sort of anticheat service other than "ban the out of everyone." It seems like every time I play I catch myself in a lobby with hackers. These guys are s. They will blow the out of you with an invincible hydra (attack plane) while you're trying to run missions. If you can get into a solo public lobby (check the guides) then it's not an issue.Banning modding This is total t. In fact it almost made me quit. I never modded the game but the lack of respect R* has for their PC fans by doing this is ridiculous. I imagine that if like I do with Skyrim that if I played mods regularly this would be a dealbreaker for me. We're not console gamers. If people are playing custom races w/o RP and cash rewards or if they're not affecting anyone else then what's the issue? They even banned it from singleplayer from what I hear. Ridiculous. But still it doesn't affect me personally.Microtransactions It's clear that these guys really really want you to buy shark cards. Pay real money get in game money. This is a pay to win model. It puts those who don't buy them at a disadvantage. On top of that a lot of the mission rewards have become pretty stingy. Either you grind or you buy shark cards. Kinda bull.Another issue I have with this game is that the game rewards you for making other players miserable. If I wanted to play competitive I would select a competitive mode. But instead I try doing co op in a lobby perhaps running cargo and a random "criminal damage challenge" pops up. It literally tells you to grief other players in game. Encouraging this sort of behavior has made the community toxic.Despite all that I still think the game is worth playing. I like combat racing the huge world and I love feeling like I'm a criminal emperor. But sometimes these issues get pretty frustrating.
title: Grand Theft Auto V
